AU01677 	12 M Routine Maint. of Grant St Vent Station Fan
AU01677 	
AU01677 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01677 	WARNINGS:
AU01677 	1. DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECKS  WHENEVER MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE
AU01677 	   OPERATIONAL
AU01677 	2. DO NOT ENTER THE AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE.
AU01677 	   TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER ANY  WORK  IS
AU01677 	   CARRIED OUT IN THIS AREA.
AU01677 	3. OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS
AU01677 	4. DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED
AU01677 	   FOR WORK IN THIS AREA.   TO CROSS THE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER
AU01677 	   MUST BE USED AT ALL TIMES
AU01677 	1. Obtain the Permit to Work for entry to the ventilation rooms
AU01677 	   and to interrupt operations.
AU01677 	2. Inform control room prior to commencing work. Maintain radio
AU01677 	   contact at all times.
AU01677 	"3. Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance"
AU01677 	   Instructions Manual(M-STG-VE-26059)
AU01677 	"4. Access to the Grant St ventilation station, on the mezzanine"
AU01677 	"   level, is via double locked doors on the stairway in Grant"
AU01677 	   St. adjacent to vent stack.  Access to substation 1 is
AU01677 	"   through the mezzanine level walkway north of the smoke duct,"
AU01677 	   then crossing over the smoke duct twice a using service
AU01677 	"   ladders to the roof of the substation, then down a service"
AU01677 	   ladder to the tunnel and then along the tunnel walkway to the
AU01677 	   substation.
AU01677 	"5. (a) On MCC in Substation No 1, switch one axial fan into"
AU01677 	"       operation, while maintenance is being carried out  on the"
AU01677 	",,   other fans.  Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to"
AU01677 	",,   the MANUAL position the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch"
AU01677 	",,   to the REMOTE position then start the fan by pressing the"
AU01677 	",,   START pushbutton.   [_ _]"
AU01677 	   (b) Isolate ALL non-operational axial fans by switching the
AU01677 	",,   AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switches to the OFF position and"
AU01677 	",,   then carrying out electrical isolation procedures as set"
AU01677 	",,   out in Work Instruction TMI -3012 OP - 0103,  Low Voltage"
AU01677 	",,   Isolation Procedures."
AU01677 	6. Electrical checks in Substation No 1
AU01677 	   (a) Measure and record the insulation resistance on stator
AU01677 	",,   windings in """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]"
AU01677 	   (b) Check ammeter and record the reading for each phase in
AU01677 	",,   the work done area of the Job Sheet."
AU01677 	   (b) Inspect the control panel both internally and externally
AU01677 	",,   for damage, corrosion, evidence of moisture ingress,"
AU01677 	",,   accumulated dust and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]"
AU01677 	7. Fan Room Access
AU01677 	   (a) Enter the airlock first from the mezzanine level.   The
AU01677 	",,   airlock doors require considerable force to open due to"
AU01677 	",,   pressure differentials.  Equalize the corridor and fan"
AU01677 	",,   room pressures using the hatches in the wall before"
AU01677 	",,   entering the fan room."
AU01677 	",,   NOTE: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN IN THE"
AU01677 	",,   VENTILATION FAN ROOM"
AU01677 	   (b) Check the CO levels in the fan room through the doorway
AU01677 	",,   before entering and at regular intervals while performing"
AU01677 	",,   the fan checks."
AU01677 	   (c) WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS
AU01677 	",,   WITHIN 1 METRE OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD."
AU01677 	",,   Airflow velocity is near 35 km/h."
AU01677 	8. Static Fan Checks for each fan.
AU01677 	   (a) Confirm that the fan on which maintenance is to be
AU01677 	",,   carried out on, is electrically isolated using the local"
AU01677 	",,   push button station, by depressing the emergency STOP"
AU01677 	",,   pushbutton."
AU01677 	   (b) Remove the entry cowl safety grill hatch and enter the
AU01677 	",,   fan inlet cowl."
AU01677 	"   (c) Check the impeller for dirt, wear on blade tips or blade"
AU01677 	",,   leading edges, as well as for any mechanical damage. [_ _]"
AU01677 	"   (d) Check all cables for security of fixings, damage"
AU01677 	",,  especially at the site of any functional penetrations.[_ _]"
AU01677 	   (e) Remove the inspection hatch on the side of the motor
AU01677 	",,   housing - Check for any grease discharged from the motor"
AU01677 	",,   bearings, excessive amounts of grease as well as any"
AU01677 	",,   noticeable colour change in the discharged grease.  Check"
AU01677 	",,   that the grease nipples are clean.  [_ _]"
AU01677 	   (f ) Examine both the motor connections and the motor
AU01677 	",,   internals for evidence of overheating.   [_ _]"
AU01677 	   (g) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
AU01677 	",,   heater windings."
AU01677 	",,,,(i) Ensure fan motor is isolated."
AU01677 	",,,,(ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor"
AU01677 	",,,,  Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans have been"
AU01677 	",,,,  isolated and are to remain isolated."
AU01677 	",,,,,,(a) The motor is disconnected as above instruction."
AU01677 	",,,,,,(b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor"
AU01677 	",,,,,,,,winding terminals."
AU01677 	",,,,(iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the"
AU01677 	",,,,,,  motor windings and the winding heater bridge.  Record the result"
AU01677 	"in the """"Work Done"""" area."
AU01677 	",,,,(iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater"
AU01677 	",,,,,, connections and carry out an Insulation resistance"
AU01677 	",,,,,, test between this common bridge and earth.  Record"
AU01677 	",,,,,, the result in the """"Work Done"""" area."
AU01677 	",,,,(v) Remove all temporary connections."
AU01677 	        (vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
AU01677 	",,,,,, insulation resistance test on the motor windings,"
AU01677 	",,,,,, Between phase winding to phase winding and between"
AU01677 	",,,,,, each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the"
AU01677 	",,,,,, area of the Job sheet below"
AU01677 	",,,,(vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then"
AU01677 	",,,,,, re-instate the heater connections,otherwise leave"
AU01677 	",,,,,, the motor winding heater terminations isolated."
AU01677 	",,,,(viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion."
AU01677 	",,,,(x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than"
AU01677 	",,,,,, 2 megohm, then Record n the area of the Job Sheet"
AU01677 	",,,,,, below and raise a new job for the outstanding works."
AU01677 	",,,,,, Include the Job Number of the new job in the"
AU01677 	",,,,,, Customer Order No.field as well as in the alternate."
AU01677 	",,,,,, Notify the Team Leader or his representative of any"
AU01677 	",,,,,, outstanding works."
AU01677 	   (h) Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
AU01677 	",,   it's linkages, for the exit dampers, using the local"
AU01677 	",,   control panel switch.   [_ _]"
AU01677 	   (i) Always ensure the entry cowl safety grill to the fan is
AU01677 	",,   secured, in it's place, when the fan is unattended."
AU01677 	9. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
AU01677 	",,CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS"
AU01677 	",,REQUIRED AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR."
AU01677 	"   (a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to"
AU01677 	",,   substation 1, then remove the safety tags, in accordance"
AU01677 	",,   with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove the fan motor isolation"
AU01677 	",,   at  the MCC."
AU01677 	",,  Note:  Ensure that only one non-operational fan is isolated"
AU01677 	",,  at any one time."
AU01677 	   (b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF
AU01677 	",,   position to the MANUAL and the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector"
AU01677 	",,   switch from the REMOTE position to the LOCAL position."
AU01677 	"   (c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan, that"
AU01677 	",,   is being maintained, by releasing the local STOP"
AU01677 	",,   pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START pushbutton."
AU01677 	"   (d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan ,,"
AU01677 	  starts.
AU01677 	"   (e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the"
AU01677 	",,   bearings, only while the fan is running.  DE = 100gr,"
AU01677 	",,   NDE = 120gr."
AU01677 	"   (f) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the"
AU01677 	",,   bearings, using the retrieval system.  Examine the grease"
AU01677 	",,   for changes of colour.   [_ _]"
AU01677 	   (g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.[_ _]
AU01677 	   (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
AU01677 	  (i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01677 	"10. On completion, collect all tools and materials, to leave the"
AU01677 	",,fan room, again equalize the corridor and fan room pressures."
AU01677 	"11. (a)  In Substation No 1 remove all tags, in accordance with"
AU01677 	",,,, TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove the motor isolation for"
AU01677 	",,,, all the fans at the MCC.   Return all the"
AU01677 	",,,, MOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switches to the REMOTE position"
AU01677 	",,,, and the AUTO/OFF/MAN fan selector switches to the AUTO"
AU01677 	",,,, position."
AU01677 	",,(b)  Check that at least one fan is operational and that no"
AU01677 	",,,, alarms are present"
AU01677 	12. Record anything outside normal parameters in the area of the
AU01677 	",,,, Job Sheet below."
AU01677 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01677 	Record Readings Below
AU01677 	Results Insulation Resistance Tests
AU01677 	",,Fan ID,,,,,,|"
AU01677 	"Heater to Winding ,,|,,,,,,,,,,megohms"
AU01677 	"Winding & Heater ,,|,,,,,,,,,,megohms"
AU01677 	"Phase to Phase ,,,,|,,,,,,,,,,ohms"
AU01677 	"Phase to Earth,,,,|,,,,,,,,,,megohms"
AU01677 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01677 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01677 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01677 	Note:
AU01677 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01677 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01677 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01677 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01677 	        it's intended function.
AU01677 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01677 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01677 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01677 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01677 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01677 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01677 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01677 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01677 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01677 	        intended function.
AU01677 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01677 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01677 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU02117 	06 M clean of tunnel lighting photometers
AU02117 	
AU02117 	At the photometer **COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02117 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02117 	2. This job is to be carried out during a tunnel shut.
AU02117 	"3. Clean the external surfaces, including glass window, of"
AU02117 	   accumulated dirt and dust.  Use Rain-x and soft cloth.
AU02117 	"4. Visually inspect the mounting components for damage,"
AU02117 	   corrosion (Remove and repair any corrosion found) and
AU02117 	   security of fixings.
AU02117 	5. Visually check the cabling to the photometer for damage or
AU02117 	   any required repairs (Repairs as required).
AU02117 	6. Check the general alignment of the Photometer for accuracy.
AU02117 	Methodology for Alignment Check:
AU02117 	**The alignment point needs to be defined by taping the distance
AU02117 	"betweenthe walls of the Tunnel entrance to identify the centre, then"
AU02117 	taping from the pavement upto 1.5m above. The target needs to be
AU02117 	"this point, taking into account that the laser beam would be generated"
AU02117 	parallel to the centre of the photometer.
AU02117 	"At the photometer, a laser level needs to be placed on top of the"
AU02117 	photometer and the unit then needs to be adjusted until the beam hits
AU02117 	the target. The process must be repeated with the laser placed on each
AU02117 	"side of the unit, meaning the adjustment on the target**"
AU02117 	7. Record any outstanding works required.
AU02117 	8. Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
AU02117 	9. Notify the TCRO on completion of the Job
AU02117 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02117 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02117 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU02117 	Note:
AU02117 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02117 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02117 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02117 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02117 	        it's intended function.
AU02117 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02117 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02117 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02117 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02117 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02117 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02117 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02117 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02117 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02117 	        intended function.
AU02117 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU02117 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02117 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU02117 	..................................

AU02101 	06 M Inspect of HV RMU batteries and chargers
AU02101 	Vacuum Cleaner and Thermometer required for this task
AU02101 	
AU02101 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02101 	1.  Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02101 	2.  Refer to M Brodribb Model D5414 24V 10A DC Charger
AU02101 	    System manual M-STG-EL-24028.
AU02101 	3.  Check the RMU battery charger in the sub-station by:
AU02101 	   (a) Check general appearance and cleanliness of the battery
AU02101 	      charger area and ventilation  louvres.  Remove accumulated
AU02101 	"      dirt and debris,  Clean cabinet by vacuuming if"
AU02101 	    required.  [_ _]
AU02101 	   (b) Check charger output current and that out put voltage is
AU02101 	     present.  Record Volt and current levels in Work Done Area
AU02101 	      ofthe job sheet.  [_ _]
AU02101 	"   (c) Check batteries for cracks, bulges and or"
AU02101 	    damage.  [_ _]
AU02101 	   (d) Check the terminals and connections for tightness or
AU02101 	         corrosion. Remedy as required   [_ _]
AU02101 	   (e)  Check that the float voltage is within 27.9V to 28.8V
AU02101 	       range.  [_ _]
AU02101 	4.  Check that the Battery temperature is no more than 5 deg. C
AU02101 	     above Ambient  [__]
AU02101 	5.  Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet  any defect or
AU02101 	    outstanding works requiring further attention.  Raise a job
AU02101 	     sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team leader
AU02101 	    or his representative.  Include in the Related Jobs field to
AU02101 	"    thenew and this job, the job number of the alternate job."
AU02101 	6.  Notify the TCRO when the job is completed.

AU02103 	12 M Inspect of HV RMU batteries and chargers
AU02103 	
AU02103 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02103 	1.  Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02103 	2.  Refer to M Brodribb Model D5414 24V 10A DC Charger System
AU02103 	    manual M-STG-EL-24028.
AU02103 	3.  Carry out the following checks in co-operation with the HV
AU02103 	    sub-contractor.
AU02103 	    Check the RMU battery charger in the sub-station by:
AU02103 	"    (a) Initiate a """"Low Voltage"""" alarm and ""Charger Fail"""
AU02103 	    alarm by switching OFF the charger with full load applied to
AU02103 	    the charger.   [_ _]
AU02103 	"    (b) A ""Charger Fail"" alarm (Red LED) should occur.  [_ _]"
AU02103 	"    (c) A ""Low Voltage"" alarm should occur on.  [_ _]"
AU02103 	"    (d) Turn on the supply to the Charger, alarm should be"
AU02103 	    reset.  [_ _]
AU02103 	    (e) Check that all pc cards are tight in sockets.  [_ _]
AU02103 	"    (f) Clean and remove any accumulated dirt, debris, vermin"
AU02103 	       etc.  [_ _]
AU02103 	4.  Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet any
AU02103 	    outstanding works requiring further
AU02103 	    attention.  Raise a job sheet for any outstanding works.
AU02103 	5.  Notify the TCRO when the job is completed.
AU01845 	06 M Inspect & Clean the Tunnel air velocity and Temp sensor
AU01845 	
AU01845 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01845 	1 Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01845 	2. Reference manual Erwin Sick Operating Instructions - Flowsic 200
AU01845 	 AirVelocity of Flow
AU01845 	   Measuring Device - [M-STG-EL-24004].
AU01845 	"3. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control"
AU01845 	TMI-3012-OP- 0002 and
AU01845 	   Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 23 & 24 (or to be defined).
AU01845 	4. Tunnel Sending/Receiving sensor units.
AU01845 	    WARNING:
AU01845 	    DO NOT LOOK INTO THE LASER LIGHT USED TO ALIGN TRANSDUCERS.  THE
AU01845 	LASER
AU01845 	    LIGHT CAN CAUSE DAMAGE TO EYES.
AU01845 	    DO NOT PUT YOUR EARS INTO THE ULTRASONIC SIGNAL PATH.  ULTRASONIC
AU01845 	    SIGNALS CAN DAMAGE HEARING.  IT IS ADVISED TO WEAR HEARING
AU01845 	PROTECTION
AU01845 	    WHEN WORKING IN THE VICINITY OF THE TRANSDUCERS.
AU01845 	    CAUTION:
AU01845 	    FIT PROTECTIVE CAPS TO THE SAFETY TUBES OF THE SENDER AND RECEIVER
AU01845 	    DURING CLEANING.
AU01845 	    PROTECT THE ULTRASONIC  TRANSDUCER FROM WATER AT ALL TIMES.
AU01845 	    DO NOT TOUCH THE ULTRASONIC TRANSDUCERS EITHER BY HAND OR WITH ANY
AU01845 	    CLEANING MEDIUM.
AU01845 	    (a) Inspect both the sending and receiving for damage and or
AU01845 	corrosion.  [_ _]
AU01845 	"    (b) Using a cap, cover the safety tube that protects the transducer,"
AU01845 	then clean the external
AU01845 	"          surfaces of the Flowsic 200 with a cleaning cloth, optical"
AU01845 	cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU01845 	"    (c) Remove the safety tube cap, then clean the internal surfaces of"
AU01845 	the safety tube as well
AU01845 	           as the transducer surface using a gentle stream of air ONLY.
AU01845 	  [_ _]
AU01845 	    (d) Check that the cable connection to the sensor unit is tight and
AU01845 	that the cable is suitably
AU01845 	          supported and secure.  [_ _]
AU01845 	    (e) Check that the mounting bracket and the bolts holding the unit
AU01845 	are secure.  If any of the
AU01845 	"          bolts need to be tightened, the alignment of the sensors must"
AU01845 	be checked.  Alignment
AU01845 	          is confirmed using a laser pointer and must be within the
AU01845 	range of 1? in all planes.   [__]
AU01845 	    ( f) Check with the control room that system is functioning
AU01845 	correctly prior to leaving the
AU01845 	          unit.  [_ _]
AU01845 	"5.  Record anything outside normal parameters in the """"Work Done """" area"
AU01845 	of the job sheet.
AU01845 	"6.  Notify the Control room on completion of the job."""

AU01678 	12 M Routine Maint. of Swan St  Vent Station Fans
AU01678 	
AU01678 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01678 	WARNING:
AU01678 	1.    CHECKS SHOULD NOT BE CARRIED OUT IF MORE THAN 1 FAN IS OPERATING
AU01678 	IN THE
AU01678 	      SWAN ST SHAFT VENT STATION.
AU01678 	2.    NO PERSON SHALL ENTER THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE.
AU01678 	      TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT AT ALL TIMES WHEN WORK IS BEING
AU01678 	       CARRIED OUT IN ANY CHAMBER OF THE VENT STATION
AU01678 	3.    TAKE HEED OF NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
AU01678 	"1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 2,  the Swan Street"
AU01678 	ventilation rooms and to
AU01678 	    interrupt operations.
AU01678 	2.  Inform the control room prior to commencing work.   Maintain radio
AU01678 	contact at all times.
AU01678 	"3.  Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance"
AU01678 	Instructions Manual
AU01678 	    (M-STG-VE-26058)
AU01678 	4. Carry out the monthly checks on the PMCS in the Traffic Control Room.
AU01678 	5. Access to the ventilation fan is via ladders in the Swan Street Shaftlift
AU01678 	well and Substation 2
AU01678 	    is accessed from Swan Street.
AU01678 	"6.(a) On the MCC in Substation No 2,  select ONE axial fan to be"
AU01678 	operational while
AU01678 	         the maintenance is being carried out  on other fans.  Switch
AU01678 	the nominated
AU01678 	         AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the MANUAL position and the
AU01678 	REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
AU01678 	"         selector switch to the REMOTE postion, then press the START"
AU01678 	pushbutton.
AU01678 	"   (b) Switch ALL non-operational axial fans OFF, by switching the"
AU01678 	AUTO/OFF/MAN selector
AU01678 	         switches to the OFF position.  All electrical isolation
AU01678 	procedures are to be in
AU01678 	"         accordance to Work Instruction TMI -3012-SA -0103,  Low"
AU01678 	VoltageIsolation Procedures.
AU01678 	7. In Substation No 2
AU01678 	   (a) Measure the insulation resistance of the motor stator windings
AU01678 	"and record in the """"Work"
AU01678 	"         Done"""" section of the Job Sheet.   [_ _]"
AU01678 	   (b) Measure the current of the anti-condensation heater and compare
AU01678 	with the rated current.
AU01678 	   (c) Inspect the motor control panel both internally and externally
AU01678 	"for damage, corrosion,"
AU01678 	"         evidence of overheating,  ingress of moisture, dust and grime"
AU01678 	(clean or repair if required).
AU01678 	"8. (a) The fan rooms which are on levels 4, 5 & 6 are accessed from the"
AU01678 	         Note: HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN IN ANY
AU01678 	VENTILATION
AU01678 	                     FAN CHAMBER.
AU01678 	"    (b) Measure the CO levels in the fan rooms, through the doorway,"
AU01678 	prior to entering the fan
AU01678 	"          room, then at regular intervals during the fan checks."
AU01678 	    (c)  WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN
AU01678 	                                1 METRE OF AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD.
AU01678 	                                 Airflow velocity nears 35 km/h.
AU01678 	9. Static Fan Check.
AU01678 	    (a) Ensure that the fan selected for maintenance is electrically
AU01678 	"isolated,  press the START"
AU01678 	          pushbutton on the local push button station at Level 5.  The
AU01678 	fan should not start.
AU01678 	    (b) On level 5 open fan blade inspection hatch.
AU01678 	    (c) Examine the impeller for
AU01678 	          (i) Dirt and foreign matter on the blades (clean if required)
AU01678 	  [_ _]
AU01678 	          (ii) Wear or damage on the blade tips   [_ _]
AU01678 	          (ii) Wear or damage on the blade leading edges   [_ _]
AU01678 	          (iv) Loose bolts and or blade fixings at the hub   [_ _]
AU01678 	"    (d) Examine the electrical cable for security of fixings, damage dueto"
AU01678 	"fraying, scuffing or"
AU01678 	          similar and for damage at locations where the cables
AU01678 	penetratepanels or
AU01678 	          housings.    [_ _]
AU01678 	"    (e) Check any grease discharged from the motor bearings, since the"
AU01678 	last lubrication is not
AU01678 	           excessive.   [_ _]
AU01678 	    (f ) Examine the discharged grease for any noticable colour change.
AU01678 	 Ensure that the grease
AU01678 	          nipples are clean.  [_ _]
AU01678 	    (g)  Inspect the cable connections to the motor for evidence of
AU01678 	overheating.  [_ _]
AU01678 	    (h) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
AU01678 	windings.
AU01678 	          (i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
AU01678 	"          (ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor"
AU01678 	               Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
AU01678 	isolated and is to remain
AU01678 	               isolated.
AU01678 	               (a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
AU01678 	(where connected) and
AU01678 	                     bridge heater terminals.
AU01678 	               (b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
AU01678 	terminals.
AU01678 	         (iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
AU01678 	motorwindings and the
AU01678 	"                winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the """"Work"
AU01678 	"Done"""" area."
AU01678 	         (iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
AU01678 	connections and carry out
AU01678 	               an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
AU01678 	and earth.  Record
AU01678 	"               the result in the """"Work Done"""" area."
AU01678 	        (v) Remove all temporary connections.
AU01678 	        (vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
AU01678 	insulation resistance test
AU01678 	"              on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase"
AU01678 	winding and between
AU01678 	              each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the Work
AU01678 	Done area of the
AU01678 	             Job sheet.
AU01678 	"        (vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate"
AU01678 	"the heater connections,"
AU01678 	              otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
AU01678 	isolated.
AU01678 	        (viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
AU01678 	        (x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
AU01678 	"megohm, then Record"
AU01678 	"                 in the """"Work Done""""area of the Job Sheet and raise a"
AU01678 	new job for the outstanding
AU01678 	                 works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
AU01678 	"Related Job"""" field as well"
AU01678 	                 as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
AU01678 	representative of any
AU01678 	                 outstanding works.
AU01678 	"    (i) On leaving the fan inlet cowl grill hatch, replace the hatch"
AU01678 	cover immediately.  [_ _]
AU01678 	    (j)  Manually check the operation of the Rotork actuator and
AU01678 	associated linkages that
AU01678 	"          operate the exit dampers, use the local control panel switch."
AU01678 	    (k ) Remove any mechanical interlocks blocking the fan operation.
AU01678 	 [_ _]
AU01678 	10. Running Fan Check and Lubrication
AU01678 	    CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
AU01678 	REQUIRED
AU01678 	                         AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
AU01678 	"     (a) When the Static Fan Checks are complete, return to substation"
AU01678 	3and remove the
AU01678 	"           safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then removethe"
AU01678 	fan motor isolation
AU01678 	           at the MCC.
AU01678 	"           Note:  Ensure that all non-operational fans are isolated, in"
AU01678 	accordance
AU01678 	"                      TMI-3012-SA-0103, and that the only fan not"
AU01678 	"isolated, is the fan to be maintained."
AU01678 	     (b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
AU01678 	to the MANUAL
AU01678 	"           position, then switch the REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch"
AU01678 	from the REMOTE
AU01678 	           position to the LOCAL position.
AU01678 	"     (c) Return to the ventilation room and start the fan, that is"
AU01678 	"beingmaintained, by releasing"
AU01678 	"           the Local STOP pushbutton, then pressing the START"
AU01678 	           Note: The motor must not be started more that four times in
AU01678 	an hour.
AU01678 	     (d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
AU01678 	"     (e) Lubricate the motor bearings with fresh grease, while the motor"
AU01678 	running.
AU01678 	           DE = 100 gr / NDE - 120 gr  Use Shell Stamina RL2 grease or
AU01678 	equivalent only.
AU01678 	"     (f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the bearings"
AU01678 	using the retrieval
AU01678 	           system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.  [_ _]
AU01678 	     (g) Monitor the fan and motor for abnormal noises.      [_ _]
AU01678 	     (h) Stop the fan motor using Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01678 	     (i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01678 	"11. On completion, collect all materials and leave the fan room after"
AU01678 	equalizing the
AU01678 	       differential pressures.
AU01678 	12. In Substation No 2
AU01678 	"      (a) Remove all safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103,"
AU01678 	 then remove the
AU01678 	            motor isolation for all the fans at the MCC.  Return all
AU01678 	theREMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
AU01678 	"            selector switches to the REMOTE position,  and the"
AU01678 	 AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector
AU01678 	            switches to the AUTO position.
AU01678 	      (b) Check that one fan is operational and no alarms are present
AU01678 	13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done' sectionof
AU01678 	the Job Sheet.
AU01678 	14. Notify the control room on the completion of the job.
AU01678 	EMERGENCY OPERATION
AU01678 	In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident
AU01678 	hasoccured requiring the
AU01678 	use of fans for smoke extraction.
AU01678 	1. Immediately leave the fan chambers on Level 4 and Level 6 and ensure
AU01678 	the doors to the lift
AU01678 	   shaft are secured.
AU01678 	2. Notify TCR Operator when Level 4 and level 6 have been evacuated so
AU01678 	that smoke
AU01678 	   extraction can commence.
AU01678 	"3. If  the fan being checked is running, advise TCR that it is"
AU01678 	currentlyrunning under LOCAL
AU01678 	   control and will be returned to AUTO control.  Stop  the fan using
AU01678 	the Emergency STOP
AU01678 	   pushbutton on Level 5.
AU01678 	4. Release the STOP pushbutton and leave Level 5 ensuring that the door
AU01678 	to the lift shaft is
AU01678 	    secured
AU01678 	"5. If the fan is isolated or not running, vacate all fan chambers"
AU01678 	immediately and secure doors.
AU01678 	"6. Notify TCR when all personnel have left the fan chambers, the doors"
AU01678 	secured and all the
AU01678 	   personnel are accounted for and in the lift shaft.
AU01678 	7. Only if a fan was running and operational - In Substation 2  switch
AU01678 	the
AU01678 	"    REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to the REMOTE position, as well"
AU01678 	switch the
AU01678 	    AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch to the AUTO position.
AU01678 	8. Stop the operational fan then return the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector
AU01678 	switchto the AUTO
AU01678 	   position and restart the fan.
AU01678 	9. Notify TCR Operators that they have control.
AU01678 	Record Readings Below

AU01678 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01678 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01678 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01678 	        it's intended function.
AU01678 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01678 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01678 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01678 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01678 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01678 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01678 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01678 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01678 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01678 	        intended function.

AU01676 	12 M Routine Maint. of Burnley Vent Station Fan
AU01676 	
AU01676 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01676 	WARNINGS:
AU01676 	1. CHECKS SHOULD NOT BE CARRIED OUT IF MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE OPERATING IN
AU01676 	   THE SECONDARY VENT STATION.
AU01676 	2. NO PERSON SHALL ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM
AU01676 	    ALONE.
AU01676 	   TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT AT ALL TIMES WHEN WORK IS BEING
AU01676 	   CARRIED OUT IN THE AIRLOCK OR VENT STATION
AU01676 	3. TAKE HEED OF NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
AU01676 	"1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3,  the ventilation"
AU01676 	rooms and to interrupt
AU01676 	    operations.
AU01676 	2.  Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.  Maintain
AU01676 	radiocontact at all times.

AU01676 	Instructions Manual
AU01676 	    (M-STG-VE-26058)

AU01676 	on the
AU01676 	   stairway  adjacent to the south west corner of the Burnley vent
AU01676 	stack.
AU01676 	   Access to substation 3 is via external doors adjacent to the Burnley
AU01676 	Portal.

AU01676 	havebeen completed.

AU01676 	   Select one axial fan to be operational while the maintenance is being
AU01676 	carried out on
AU01676 	   the other fans.  The fan selected can be any fan other than the fan
AU01676 	to be maintained
AU01676 	   (preferably a fan located the furthest from the fan to be
AU01676 	maintained).

AU01676 	selected fan.

AU01676 	"record in the """"Work Done"""""

AU01676 	isapprox. 1 amp.

AU01663 	03 M Inspection of Smoke Exhaust Fans Olympic Park
AU01663 	WARNING:
AU01663 	    ELECTRIC MOTORS CAN OPERATE AT A TEMPERATURE WHICH MAY CAUSE BURNS.
AU01663 	    EXERCISE CAUTION WHEN ABOUT TO TOUCH MACHINERY WHICH MAY BE HOT.
AU01663 	
AU01663 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01663 	1. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to ventilation rooms and to
AU01663 	interrupt operations.
AU01663 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01663 	"3. Reference manual, Fantech Pty Ltd. Olympic Park Portal Centrifugal"
AU01663 	Fans.  Operations and
AU01663 	   Maintenance Manual. M-STG-VE-26200.
AU01663 	4. Check the fan outlet stacks and the protective mesh for accumulated
AU01663 	debris that may restrict
AU01663 	   outlet damper operation.  Use an extension ladder.  (3m. wall)  in
AU01663 	accordance with work    instruction TM1-3012-SA-0121 Ladders- Safe use
AU01663 	to remove any debris.  [_ _]
AU01663 	3. Fan Operation
AU01663 	     WARNING:
AU01663 	     HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
AU01663 	     CHAMBER.
AU01663 	     CAUTION:  DO NOT RUN MORE THAN 2 FANS AT ANY TIME.
AU01663 	     Request the control room to open at least four tunnel smoke inlet
AU01663 	dampers.
AU01663 	     CAUTION:  A MINIMUM OF 4 INLET DAMPERS MUST BE OPEN BEFORE
AU01663 	OPERATING
AU01663 	     THE  FANS.
AU01663 	     (a) Switch the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
AU01663 	position and start
AU01663 	           the fan using the START/STOP/RESET pushbutton.  Run the fan
AU01663 	for 30 minutes.
AU01663 	     (b) Check that the outlet damper opens fully.  [_ _]
AU01663 	"     The following checks shall be made using touch, sight and hearing."
AU01663 	 Perceived problems
AU01663 	     will be further investigated using instrumentation.
AU01663 	    (a) Check the fan bearings for uneven rumbling or hammering noise.
AU01663 	 [_ _]
AU01663 	    (b) Check the fan bearings for overheating by using hand held
AU01663 	infrared temperature sensor.              [_ _]
AU01663 	    (c) Check the fans for excessive vibration (surging or beating
AU01663 	sound) shuddering on start
AU01663 	          up or run down.   [_ _]
AU01663 	    (d) Check the safety guards and other safety features for safe
AU01663 	operating condition.  [_ _]
AU01663 	"    (e) Check the flexible connection of ducting, for leaks, tearing"
AU01663 	andfraying.  [_ _]
AU01663 	    (f ) Check the drive belts for condition.   [_ _]
AU01663 	4. Motor Operation
AU01663 	   (a) Check the motor bearings for noisy running and excessive
AU01663 	vibration.  [_ _]
AU01663 	   (b) Check the motor and the bearings for excessive heating.   [_ _]
AU01663 	   (c) Check that external ventilation airways are clear. [_ _]
AU01663 	5. On completion of all checks switch the fan OFF using the
AU01663 	START/STOP/RESET pushbutton.
AU01663 	    Check that the outlet damper closes fully on shutdown.   [_ _]
AU01663 	"6. Record """"Hours Run""""  for fan in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job"
AU01663 	Sheet.
AU01663 	7. Request the control room to close the inlet smoke dampers.  [_ _]
AU01663 	8. Ensure the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switches are set to the AUTO
AU01663 	position.  [_ _]
AU01663 	9. Ensure the fan station is clean and remove all accumulated debris andrubbish.
AU01663 	"10. Record anything outside normal parameters, in the """"Work Done"""""
AU01663 	areaof the job
AU01663 	     sheet.  [_ _]
AU01663 	11. On the completion of the job notify the control room.  [_ _]
AU01663 	"12. On completion of the job, the """"Hours Run"""" detail, for each fan is"
AU01663 	to be entered into the
AU01663 	"     hours run table in Plant Item.  Select the Plant Item,  then right"
AU01663 	"mouse click, select"
AU01663 	"  """"Open"""" and then select  """"Meter Readings"""".  Select edit mode and"
AU01663 	enter reading.

AU01663 	Hours Run  [         ]
AU01663 	Bearing Temp.    [         ] deg. C.
AU01664 	12 M Insp of Smoke Exhaust Fans Olympic Park
AU01664 	
AU01664 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01664 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01664 	"2. Reference Manual, Fantech Pty Ltd. Olympic Park portal Centrifugal"
AU01664 	Fans . Operations and
AU01664 	   Maintenance manual.  M STG-VE-26200.
AU01664 	   WARNING:
AU01664 	   HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
AU01664 	   ENCLOSURE.
AU01664 	3. Check fan outlet stacks and protective mesh for build up of debris
AU01664 	that will inhibit outlet
AU01664 	    damper operation use an extension ladder.  (3m wall) in accordance
AU01664 	with work instruction           TM1-3012-SA-0121 Ladders- Saf e inspect
AU01664 	and to clear any debris.  [_ _]
AU01664 	4. Static Fan checks
AU01664 	"   Switch the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL switch to the OFF position, lock the"
AU01664 	"switch and tag, in"
AU01664 	"   accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, before proceeding with the"
AU01664 	inspection.
AU01664 	   (a) Check the safety guards and other safety features for safe
AU01664 	operating condition.  [_ _]
AU01664 	"   (b) Check the flexible connection of the ducting  for leaks, tearing"
AU01664 	and fraying.  [_ _]
AU01664 	"   (c) Check the grease in the fan bearings for quality, apply Shell"
AU01664 	Stamina RL2 (or equivalent)
AU01664 	         with a  grease gun if required. Greasing can be safely
AU01664 	performed with fan either static or
AU01664 	         running. Apply grease until new clean grease is exhausted from
AU01664 	the bearing.     [_ _]
AU01664 	   (d) Check the fan belts for wear and correct tension as per the O
AU01664 	&M Manual
AU01664 	         M-STG-VE-26200.    [_ _]
AU01664 	   (e) Check the belt pulley for wear and alignment.  Adjust if
AU01664 	required.   [_ _]
AU01664 	   (f ) Check that all fixings are secure.   [_ _]
AU01664 	   (g) Check for corrosion or deterioration in surface coatings.  [_ _]
AU01664 	   (h) Remove inspection covers and check fan internals for debris and
AU01664 	ingress of moisture.
AU01664 	         Clean if necessary.   [_ _]
AU01664 	5. Static Motor Checks.
AU01664 	"    Lock out the motor controls at switchboard, and tag, in accordance"
AU01664 	with TMI-3012-SA-0103.
AU01664 	    (a) Check that the motor is clear of accumulated dust on external
AU01664 	surfaces and that the
AU01664 	          external ventilation airways are clear. [_ _]
AU01664 	    (b) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and heater
AU01664 	windings.
AU01664 	          (i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
AU01664 	"          (ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor"
AU01664 	               Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
AU01664 	isolated and is to remain
AU01664 	               isolated.
AU01664 	               (a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
AU01664 	(where connected) and
AU01664 	                     bridge heater terminals.
AU01664 	               (b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
AU01664 	terminals.
AU01664 	         (iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the motor
AU01664 	windings and the
AU01664 	"                winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the """"Work"
AU01664 	"Done"""" area."
AU01664 	         (iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
AU01664 	connections and carry out
AU01664 	               an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
AU01664 	and earth.  Record
AU01664 	"               the result in the """"Work Done"""" area."
AU01664 	        (v) Remove all temporary connections.
AU01664 	        (vi) Remove supply lines to the motor and carry out an
AU01664 	insulation resistance test
AU01664 	"              on the motor windings, Between phase winding to phase"
AU01664 	winding and between
AU01664 	              each phase winding and earth.  Record results in the Work
AU01664 	Done area of the
AU01664 	             Job sheet.
AU01664 	"        (vii) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate"
AU01664 	"the heater connections,"
AU01664 	              otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
AU01664 	isolated.
AU01664 	        (viii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
AU01664 	        (x)  Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
AU01664 	"megohm, then Record"
AU01664 	"                 in the """"Work Done""""area of the Job Sheet and raise a"
AU01664 	new job for the outstanding
AU01664 	                 works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
AU01664 	"Related Job"""" field as well"
AU01664 	                 as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
AU01664 	representative of any
AU01664 	                 outstanding works.
AU01664 	           CAUTION:   DO NOT PERFORM AN INSULATION RESISTANCE TEST ON
AU01664 	                                  MOTOR THERMAL PROTECTION DEVICES
AU01664 	"    (c) Check the motor starter, contacts and terminals where"
AU01664 	          appropriate.   [_ _]
AU01664 	    (d) Check the lubrication of motor bearings and apply Shell Stamina
AU01664 	RL2 grease with a
AU01664 	           grease gun if required.    Greasing can be safely performed
AU01664 	with the motor either static
AU01664 	           or running.  Apply the grease until new clean grease is
AU01664 	extruded from the
AU01664 	           bearing.     [_ _]
AU01664 	6.  Fan Operation
AU01664 	    CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
AU01664 	REQUIRED
AU01664 	                         AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
AU01664 	    CAUTION:  DO NOT RUN MORE THAN 2 FANS AT ANY TIME.
AU01664 	    CAUTION:  A MINIMUM OF 4 INLET DAMPERS MUST BE OPEN BEFORE RUNNING
AU01664 	FANS.
AU01664 	    (a) Notify the control room to open the tunnel smoke inlet dampers.
AU01664 	    (b) Ensure all safety guards and inspection opening covers are in
AU01664 	place.  [_ _]
AU01664 	"    (c) Remove tags and locks, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103,  andremove"
AU01664 	the
AU01664 	          motor isolation.   [_ _]
AU01664 	    (d) Switch AUTO/OFF/MANUAL to MANUAL position and start each fan
AU01664 	using the
AU01664 	          START/STOP/RESET pushbutton. Run each fan for 30 minutes.
AU01664 	    (e) Check that the outlet damper opens fully.  [_ _]
AU01664 	"           NOTE: The following checks shall be made using touch, sight"
AU01664 	and hearing only.
AU01664 	                        Perceived problems will be referred for further
AU01664 	checks using instrumentation.
AU01664 	    (f ) Check the fan bearings for uneven rumbling or hammering noise.
AU01664 	 [_ _]
AU01664 	    (g) Check fan bearings for overheating by holding hand on bearing
AU01664 	for 5 -10seconds.  [_ _]
AU01664 	    (h) Check fans for excessive vibration (surging or beating sound)
AU01664 	orshuddering on start
AU01664 	          up or run down.   [_ _]
AU01664 	    (i) Check the ducting  flexible connections are not overstressed due
AU01664 	to fan movement.  [_ _]
AU01664 	    (j) Check that the seismic mounts have free movement and are secure.
AU01664 	7. Motor checks
AU01664 	   (a) Check the motor for noisy running and excessive vibration.  [_ _]
AU01664 	   (b) Check for excessive heating by holding hand on motor in bearing
AU01664 	areas for 5-10
AU01664 	           seconds.   [_ _]
AU01664 	   (c) Measure and compare the motor current with the rated current.
AU01664 	  FLC 125A
AU01664 	8. (a) On completion of checks switch the fan OFF using the
AU01664 	START/STOP/RESET pushbutton.
AU01664 	   (b) Check that the outlet damper closes fully on shutdown.   [_ _]
AU01664 	   (c) Request the control room to close inlet smoke dampers.  [_ _]
AU01664 	9. Reset the fan AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO position.
AU01664 	10. Ensure the fan station is clean and all accumulated debris and
AU01664 	rubbish is removed.  [_ _]
AU01664 	"11. Record any corrective action required, in the """"Work Done"""" area of"
AU01664 	the job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01664 	12. On completion of the job notify the control room.  [_ _]

AU01664 	Run     |

AU01664 	             |

AU01664 	                         |

AU01664 	 5B EFW 08    |                       |                       |

AU01664 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01664 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01664 	Note:
AU01664 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01664 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01664 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01664 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01664 	        it's intended function.
AU01664 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01664 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01664 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01664 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01664 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01664 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01664 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01664 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01664 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01664 	        intended function.

AU01745 	4.5. Inspect refrigeration system for correct operating
AU01745 	     pressures.   [_ _]

AU01745 	     plate reading.  [_ _]

AU01745 	     and noise.  [_ _]

AU01812 	        it's intended function.

AU01812 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01812 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01812 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01812 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01812 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01812 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01812 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01812 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01812 	        intended function.
AU01812 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01812 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01812 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01598 	12 M Major inspection of ADS
AU01598 	
AU01598 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01598 	1. Notify the control room prior to accessing the advisory sign
AU01598 	   and the controller box.
AU01598 	2. Access to ADS is by  Extension ladder access to both the
AU01598 	   controller and the sign.
AU01598 	3. Caution when working close to traffic ensure equipment and or
AU01598 	   tools do not fall on passing vehicles.
AU01598 	4. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
AU01598 	"   cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,"
AU01598 	"   mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect"
AU01598 	   infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
AU01598 	"   breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive"
AU01598 	   heat.   [_ _]
AU01598 	"5. Visually check for looseor missing nuts and bolts, and for"
AU01598 	"   rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush"
AU01598 	   and spray with Cold Gal or  equivalent. This shold be
AU01598 	   done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
AU01598 	6. Carry out preventative maintenance as per Cegelec  Securite &
AU01598 	"   Signalisation O & M manual Volume 4 Maintenance Manual,"
AU01598 	"   ED/BC/MCC/O&M/04, Section 8 [M-MCL-TM-1551]."
AU01598 	   (a) Carry out Luminance test. Traffic Control Room assistance
AU01598 	       required (Section  8.2.4.2.)  [_ _]
AU01598 	   (b) Test interior lights   (Section  8.2.5.)    [_ _]
AU01598 	   (c) Check  pilot light   (Section  8.2.7.)    [_ _]
AU01598 	   (d) Test heater  (Section  8.2.8.)    [_ _]
AU01598 	   (e) Test ground fault circuit breaker (Section  8.2.9.) [_ _]
AU01598 	   (f)  Check lightning arrestor fuses
AU01598 	       (Section   8.2.10.) [_ _]
AU01598 	   (g) Clean CD501/CD502 board transformers with brush or
AU01598 	       portable vacuum/blower [_ _]
AU01598 	   (h) Test AC voltages   (Section  8.2.11.)  [_ _]
AU01598 	   (i) Clean controller cabinet with vacuum/ blower.   [_ _]
AU01598 	   (j) Clean external window  with Windex or equivalent and
AU01598 	       clean rags. Inspect internal window of lens of dust and
AU01598 	       clean if required.    [_ _]
AU01598 	  (k) Test (push button) character board and check if all pixel
AU01598 	      arrays are  operational.  [_ _]
AU01598 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01598 	   parameters in the Work Done section of the Job Sheet and
AU01598 	   raise corrective Job Sheet if required.
AU01598 	"9. Notify control room prior to departure."""

AU01597 	   Windex or equivalent and clean  rags if required.[_ _]

AU01941 	   (a) Carry out Luminance test. Traffic Control Room assistance
AU01941 	   required (Section  8.2.4.2.)  [_ _]
AU01941 	   (b) Test interior lights   (Section  8.2.5.)    [_ _]
AU01941 	   (c) Check  pilot light   (Section  8.2.7.)    [_ _]
AU01941 	   (d) Test heater  (Section  8.2.8.)    [_ _]
AU01941 	   (e) Test ground fault circuit breaker (Section  8.2.9.) [_ _]
AU01941 	   (f)  Check lightning arrestor fuses   (Section   8.2.10.)
AU01941 	   [_ _]
AU01941 	   (g) Clean CD501/CD502 board transformers  with brush or
AU01941 	        portable vacuum/blower [_ _]
AU01941 	   (h) Test AC voltages   (Section  8.2.11.)  [_ _]
AU01941 	   (i) Clean controller cabinet with vacuum/ blower.   [_ _]
AU01941 	   (j) Clean external window  with Windex or equivalent and
AU01941 	       clean rags.  Inspect internal window of lens of dust and
AU01941 	       clean if required.    [_ _]
AU01941 	   (k) Test (push button) caharacter board and check if all
AU01941 	       pixel arrays are  operational.  [_ _]
AU01941 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01941 	   parameters in the Work Done section of the Job Sheet and
AU01941 	   raise corrective Job Sheet if required.

AU01940 	12 M ADS minor inspection using EWP on VicRoads sites
AU01940 	
AU01940 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01940 	1. Obtain approval for work from the Road Services and Traffic
AU01940 	   Manager or representitive 48 hours prior to commencement of
AU01940 	   work.
AU01940 	2. Notify the control room prior to accessing the advisory sign
AU01940 	   and the controller box.
AU01940 	3. Access to ADS is by  use of EWP vehicle and closure of Vic
AU01940 	   roads traffic lanes (and tramway lines if required).
AU01940 	"4. Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01940 	"   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,PR-RS-IR-059 using"
AU01940 	   the appropriate plan:
AU01940 	      ADS 02 use Plan 111
AU01940 	      ADS 03 use Plan 112
AU01940 	      ADS 13 use plan 113
AU01940 	      ADS 14 use Plan 114
AU01940 	      ADS 17 use Plan 115
AU01940 	      ADS 12 use Plan 116
AU01940 	      ADS 20 use Plan 121
AU01940 	5. Use Caution when working close to traffic ensure equipment
AU01940 	   and or tools do not fall on passing  vehicles
AU01940 	4. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
AU01940 	"   cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,"
AU01940 	"   mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect"
AU01940 	   infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
AU01940 	"   breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive"
AU01940 	   heat.   [_ _]
AU01940 	"5. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for"
AU01940 	"   rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush"
AU01940 	   and spray with Cold Gal or  equivalent. This shold be
AU01940 	   done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
AU01940 	6. Inspect the external window  for dirt and clean with
AU01940 	   Windex or equivalent and clean rags if required.[_ _]
AU01940 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01940 	"   parameters in the """"Work Done"""" section of the Job Sheet and"
AU01940 	   raise corrective Job Sheet if required.
AU01940 	9. Notify control room prior to departure.
AU01940 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01940 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01940 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01940 	Note:
AU01940 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01940 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01940 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01940 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01940 	        it's intended function.
AU01940 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01940 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01940 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01940 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01940 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01940 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01940 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01940 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01940 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01940 	        intended function.
AU01940 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01940 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01940 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01798 	
AU01798 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01798 	1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
AU01798 	   lane.
AU01798 	2. Access to this camera group is:
AU01798 	   (a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
AU01798 	   (b) Position 0 and 1.
AU01798 	   (c) Lane closure: Emergency lane and LHL.
AU01798 	   (d) Electrical cabinet location:
AU01798 	"       WL Tollway - Exceptions AIDs 525 (in landscaped area),"
AU01798 	       527 & 543 are behind the noise wall.
AU01798 	       SL Tollway: - Exceptions AIDs 916 & 918 are behind the
AU01798 	       noise wall.
AU01798 	"3. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01798 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01798 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12, 13, 14, 142, 143, 145, 146."
AU01798 	"4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,"
AU01798 	   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
AU01798 	5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
AU01798 	"   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage,  corrosion, ingress of"
AU01798 	"       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if"
AU01798 	       necessary.  [_ _]
AU01798 	   (b) Inspect the cabinet and check that the equipment mounted
AU01798 	       in the cabinet is secure. [_ _]
AU01798 	   (c) Check the cables and terminations for signs of
AU01798 	"       degradation, re-terminate if necessary."
AU01798 	   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and securely fastened
AU01798 	"       to the PT140 and the LED is green, if the LED is red"
AU01798 	       there is no signal from the camera.
AU01798 	       WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF THE FIBRE
AU01798 	"       OPTIC CABLE, AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.  [_ _]"
AU01798 	   (e) Check that the surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is
AU01798 	"       lit, if not record the fact, for later replacement. [_ _]"
AU01798 	   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
AU01798 	       the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
AU01798 	       (Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the
AU01798 	       camera).
AU01798 	       Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT140
AU01798 	       module and is secure.  [_ _]
AU01798 	6. Isolate the 240V power supply to the camera heaters.
AU01798 	7. Camera and Camera Housing;
AU01798 	"   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, external"
AU01798 	       evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface
AU01798 	       insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the housing
AU01798 	       exterior but must not be applied to the interior of the
AU01798 	       housing or to the housing glass.
AU01798 	"       If there is evidence of insect infestation or moisture,"
AU01798 	       then open camera housing and carry out steps 7. (d)
AU01798 	       and (e)  [_ _]
AU01798 	   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
AU01798 	       mounts.   [_ _]
AU01798 	   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
AU01798 	       Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU01798 	8. Re-instate the 240V power supply to the camera heaters. [_ _]
AU01798 	9. Check with the control centre that the AID camera is
AU01798 	   functioning correctly and that the mask is aligned.   [_ _]
AU01798 	10.On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01798 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01798 	11.Notify the control room on completion.
AU01798 	   Record Details below
AU01798 	   Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01798 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01798 	   Plan _____.
AU01798 	   1. Any deviations from the plan:
AU01798 	   2. Lane closure start time:
AU01798 	   3. Lane closure finish time:
AU01798 	   4. Weather conditions:

AU01798 	[ 2 ] - Good.

AU01808 	
AU01808 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01808 	1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the lane to
AU01808 	   service the camera..
AU01808 	2.  Access to this camera group is:
AU01808 	   (a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
AU01808 	   (b) Position 0 and 1.
AU01808 	   (c) Lane closure: LHS & RHS Lanes.
AU01808 	   (d) Electrical cabinet location: Tollway.
AU01808 	"3. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01808 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01808 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plans 1, 2, 3."
AU01808 	"4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,"
AU01808 	   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
AU01808 	5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
AU01808 	"   (a) Check for vandalism, damage,  corrosion, ingress of"
AU01808 	"       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if"
AU01808 	       necessary.   [_ _]
AU01808 	   (b) Inspect the cabinet and check that the equipment mounted
AU01808 	       in the cabinet is secure. [_ _]
AU01808 	   (c) Check the cables and terminations for signs of
AU01808 	"       degradation, re-terminate if necessary."
AU01808 	   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and securely fastened
AU01808 	"       to the PT140 and the LED is green, if the LED is red"
AU01808 	       there is no signal from the camera.
AU01808 	   WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF THE FIBRE OPTIC
AU01808 	"   CABLE, AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.  [_ _]"
AU01808 	   (e) Check that the surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is
AU01808 	"       lit, if not record the fact, for later"
AU01808 	       replacement.  [_ _]
AU01808 	   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
AU01808 	       the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
AU01808 	      (Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the camera)
AU01808 	   .  Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT140
AU01808 	      module and is secure.  [_ _]
AU01808 	6. Isolate the 240V power supply to the camera heaters.
AU01808 	7. Camera and Camera Housing;
AU01808 	"   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, external"
AU01808 	       evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface
AU01808 	       insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the housing
AU01808 	       exterior but must not be applied to the interior of the
AU01808 	       housing or to the housing glass.
AU01808 	"       If there is evidence of insect infestation or moisture,"
AU01808 	       then open camera housing and carry out steps 7. (d) and
AU01808 	      (e)  [_ _]
AU01808 	   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
AU01808 	       mounts.   [_ _]
AU01808 	   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
AU01808 	       Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU01808 	"   (d) Check that the camera heaters are operational, ie warm."
AU01808 	  WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.  [_ _].
AU01808 	   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Jell pack and replace
AU01808 	       with a new uncontaminated Silica Jell pack.
AU01808 	8. Re-instate the 240V power supply to the camera
AU01808 	   heaters.  [_ _]
AU01808 	9. Check with the control centre that the AID camera is
AU01808 	   functioning correctly and that the MASK is aligned.   [_ _]
AU01808 	10. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01808 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01808 	11. Notify the control room on completion.
AU01808 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01808 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01808 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01808 	Note:
AU01808 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01808 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01808 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01808 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01808 	        it's intended function.
AU01808 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01808 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01808 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01808 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01808 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01808 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01808 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01808 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01808 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01808 	        intended function.
AU01808 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01808 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01808 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01692 	"Cameras, AID Junction Boxes Aid Equipment boxes whilst a 2 lane"
AU01692 	LHL closure of the tunnel is in place.
AU01692 	
AU01692 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01692 	1. Work shall be carried out within designated times approved by
AU01692 	   the TCRO.
AU01692 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
AU01692 	3. Access to this camera group is:
AU01692 	"   (a) AID 700, 702, 704, 706, 708, 710, 712, 714, 716, 718,"
AU01692 	"      720, 722, 724, 726, 728, 730,732, 734, 736, 738, 740, 742,"
AU01692 	"      744, 748, 750, 752, 754, 756, 758"
AU01692 	   (b) Access Vehicle: EWP.
AU01692 	   (c) Lane Closure: LHL
AU01692 	   (d) AID Camera Equipment  Box Location:
AU01692 	       Refer to Device Location Guide Ver 5.01 for locations.
AU01692 	"4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01692 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01692 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24, 26 27 (40kmh), 39 (60kmh)."
AU01692 	"5. Reference Manual, Traffic Management Systems - CCTV & AID"
AU01692 	"   Systems - Operators and Maintenance Manual,  (M-MCL-TM-1 511)"
AU01692 	6. If it is necessary to isolate the camera power supply (24Vac)
AU01692 	   can be switched off at a GPO mounted in the junction box that
AU01692 	   services up to four AID cameras mounted locally to the
AU01692 	   cameras.
AU01692 	7. Camera and Camera Housing;
AU01692 	"   (a) Visually inspect for vandalism, damage, corrosion,"
AU01692 	       external evidence of moisture and any insect infestation.
AU01692 	       Surface insect spray  may be applied if necessary to the
AU01692 	       housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
AU01692 	       of the housing or to the housing glass.
AU01692 	   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to
AU01692 	       mounts.   [_ _]
AU01692 	   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
AU01692 	       Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU01692 	   (e) Only If there is evidence of moisture and or insect
AU01692 	"       infestation within the camera housing, then open the AID"
AU01692 	       camera housing.   Remove any moisture or insect
AU01692 	       infestation and discard the previously used Silica Jell
AU01692 	       packs and replace with a new uncontaminated Silica Jell
AU01692 	       packs.    [_ _]
AU01692 	       Only if it has been necessary to remove the camera
AU01692 	       housing cover visually inspect the condition of cables
AU01692 	"       and connections and clean, if required, within the camera"
AU01692 	       enclosure    [_ _]
AU01692 	       Carefully replace the cover and ensuring the enclosure
AU01692 	       seal is effective.   [_ _]
AU01692 	"8. If the power has been isolated, re-instate the 24V power"
AU01692 	   supply to the camera.  [_ _]
AU01692 	9. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
AU01692 	   functioning correctly and that the MASK is correctly
AU01692 	   aligned.    [_ _]
AU01692 	"10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU01692 	"    Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU01692 	    public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU01692 	    equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU01692 	    (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
AU01692 	        Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
AU01692 	        attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
AU01692 	        representative.  [_ _]
AU01692 	"11. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that"
AU01692 	    require further corrective works in the Work Done area of
AU01692 	"    the job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding"
AU01692 	    works as required.
AU01692 	12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU02086 	"   Systems - Operators and Maintenance Manual,  (M-MCL-TM-1 511)"
AU02086 	6. AID Camera Equipment Box
AU02086 	  WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF THE FIBRE OPTIC
AU02086 	"  CABLE, AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.  [_ _]"
AU02086 	"   (a) Check for vandalism, damage,  corrosion, ingress of"
AU02086 	"       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if"
AU02086 	       necessary.    [_ _]
AU02086 	   (b) Inspect the cabinet and check that the equipment mounted
AU02086 	       in the cabinet is secure.    [_ _]
AU02086 	"   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,"
AU02086 	       re-terminate if necessary.    [_ _]
AU02086 	   (d) Inspect terminals for evidence of heating and or
AU02086 	       degradation.    [_ _]
AU02086 	   (e) Inspect fibre patch leads (between MUX and OSD 383) for
AU02086 	       damage.    [_ _]
AU02086 	"   (f) If required, remove any buildup of debris and clean the"
AU02086 	"       interior and exterior of the equipment box, if"
AU02086 	       required.    [_ _]
AU02086 	"   (g) Inspect the LED on the OSD 383, that it is green, if the"
AU02086 	       LED is red there is no signal from the camera.   [_ _]
AU02086 	7. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
AU02086 	   functioning correctly.   [_ _]
AU02086 	"8. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU02086 	"   Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU02086 	   public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU02086 	   equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU02086 	   (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
AU02086 	       Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
AU02086 	       attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
AU02086 	       representative.  [_ _]
AU02086 	"9. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that"
AU02086 	   requires further corrective works in the Work Done area of
AU02086 	"   the job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding works"
AU02086 	   as required.
AU02086 	10. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU02086 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02086 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02086 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU02086 	Note:
AU02086 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02086 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02086 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02086 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02086 	        it's intended function.
AU02086 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02086 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02086 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02086 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02086 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02086 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02086 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02086 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02086 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02086 	        intended function.
AU02086 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU02086 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02086 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU02085 	"       not record the fact, for later replacement.   [_ _]"
AU02085 	   (e) Check cable glands for correct fitment.   [_ _]
AU02085 	"   (f) If required, remove any buildup of debris and clean the"
AU02085 	"       interior and exterior of the junction box, if"
AU02085 	       required.   [_ _]
AU02085 	7. Check with the Traffic Control Room that the AID camera is
AU02085 	   functioning correctly.   [_ _]
AU02085 	"8. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU02085 	"   Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU02085 	   public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU02085 	   equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU02085 	   (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
AU02085 	       Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
AU02085 	       attention of the Electrical Supervisor or his
AU02085 	       representative.  [_ _]
AU02085 	"9. On completion of job, record any outstanding works that"
AU02085 	   require further corrective works in the Work Done area of the
AU02085 	"   job sheet, raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding works"
AU02085 	   as required.

AU02085 	Note:
AU02085 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02085 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02085 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02085 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02085 	        it's intended function.
AU02085 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02085 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02085 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02085 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02085 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02085 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02085 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02085 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02085 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02085 	        intended function.

AU01785 	03 M Inspect test BT Emerg Egress Tunnel Supply Air Fans

AU01785 	1. Obtain a Permit to work for entry to the Emergency Egress Tunnel.

AU01785 	Tunnel Axial Fans
AU01785 	"   & Associated  Attenuators Maintenance Manual"""" M-EET-VE-26250."

AU01785 	structure 20m
AU01785 	    south-west of the Burnley Vent Station and down the stairwell to
AU01785 	Emergency Egress
AU01785 	   Tunnel entry door.  SF-EET-001 (CPF P11) is accessed via a hatch in
AU01785 	the stairwell wall.

AU01785 	debris that would restrict the

AU01785 	switchinside the doorway.

AU01785 	              the stairwell.

AU01785 	   aerofoil attachments are secure.  [_ _]

AU01785 	"             at a minimum of 50 Pa.  Record the result in the """"Work"
AU01785 	"Done"""" area of the Job sheet"
AU01785 	             if the reading is less than 50 Pa.  Compare the traffic
AU01785 	control room reading too.   [_ _]

AU01785 	ground level) to be
AU01785 	"              non-functioning then using a spring balance, measure the"

AU01785 	"              the door.  Record the result in the """"Work Done"""" area of"

AU01785 	              requiring repair.   [_ _]

AU01785 	        it's intended function1.
AU01785 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01785 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01785 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01785 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01785 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01785 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01785 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01785 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01785 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01785 	        intended function.
AU01785 	CONDITION RATING SCORE
AU01785 	",,,,SF-EET-001,,,,,,[_ _]"

AU01786 	   MANUAL position and the ON/OFF control to the ON position to start

AU01786 	"the motor, to start"
AU01786 	   motor.  Leave motor isolator in the ON position and use the
AU01786 	EquipmentRoom switchboard
AU01786 	   ON/OFF switch for motor starting and stopping

AU01786 	"   TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]"

AU01786 	securityand re-tension
AU01786 	   where required. [_ _]

AU01786 	housingand alignment.  [_ _]

AU01786 	specifications set  out in
AU01786 	             AS 3000.   [_ _]

AU01786 	anti-condensation heater.  Record
AU01786 	"             any results in the """"Work Done """" area of the job sheet"
AU01786 	that does not meet specifications
AU01786 	             set  out in AS 3000.   [_ _]

AU01786 	      position and the AUTO/MANUAL/OFF control switch to the AUTO
AU01786 	position to return control
AU01786 	      of the fans to the TCR.  [_ _]

AU01786 	emergesfrom the grease
AU01786 	     relief port. [_ _]

AU01786 	bearings and cannot be

AU01856 	03 M Check operation of the Tnl Emergency Paging System
AU01856 	This job is to be performed in conjunction with the testing of
AU01856 	the Fire Telephones at the Tunnel Fire Cabinets.
AU01856 	"The manual announcement should be ""The following is a Citylink test."
AU01856 	"One, Two, Three, Four,Five, Six, Seven, Eight, Nine, Ten."""
AU01856 	The message should last about ten seconds.
AU01856 	
AU01856 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01856 	1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01856 	2. Reference Manual: Australian Sound Service - Emergency Paging
AU01856 	   System Manual - M-MCL-CU-20001.
AU01856 	3. Use vehicle arrow board and short term lane stoppage
AU01856 	"   Translink Procedure , PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20, 22, 23."
AU01856 	4. This job involves whilst visiting all the odd numbered fire
AU01856 	   cabinets to:
AU01856 	  (a) listen to manual announcements over the emergency loud
AU01856 	      speakers as well as
AU01856 	  (b) at fire cabinet B23  listen to an automatic announcement
AU01856 	      and
AU01856 	  (c) at fire cabinet B45  listen to an ALL announcement.
AU01856 	"  (d) listen to the announcement, in each case, and evaluate"
AU01856 	      for:-
AU01856 	      (i) Clarity - e.g. message should be clear and
AU01856 	          understandable
AU01856 	"     (ii) Volume - e.g. Clearly hear message, hear above ambient"
AU01856 	          noise.  A suitable volume should be QUITE loud in the
AU01856 	          tunnel.
AU01856 	    (iii) Listen and be aware for non-functioning loud speakers
AU01856 	          and loud speakers with degraded output.  The speakers
AU01856 	          are mounted at 30m intervals throughout the tunnel
AU01856 	     Record the result of  your evaluation on form TUNNEL
AU01856 	     EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - BURNLEY TUNNEL PA LOUD SPEAKER
AU01856 	     TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0365
AU01856 	"5. On completion of the Job, return  the Job sheet and Form"
AU01856 	   TUNNEL EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - BURNLEY TUNNEL PA LOUD
AU01856 	   SPEAKER TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0365 to the Electrical/Electronics
AU01856 	   Supervisor or his representative for evaluation.
AU01856 	6. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the Job.
