AU01964 	12 M Routine Maint. of Tunnel Smoke Duct damper actuator
AU01964 	
AU01964 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01964 	1. Approximately 10% of smoke dampers in the tunnel are to be
AU01964 	   inspected annually.
AU01964 	   The Team Leader Electrical shall obtain the previous year
AU01964 	   check sheet TMF-3012-OP-0260 and use to allocate dampers to
AU01964 	   be inspected with this job sheet.
AU01964 	2. Obtain Permit to Work for operation of smoke damper by TCRO.
AU01964 	3. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01964 	4. Reference Manual: TROX Technik - Melbourne City Link Tunnel
AU01964 	"   Project, Operating & Maintenance Instructions Manual"
AU01964 	   M-STG-VE-26100.
AU01964 	"5. Access to the tunnel shall be as per Work Instruction,"
AU01964 	"   Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01964 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 23,24,25, and 26.  Use the Plan best suited"
AU01964 	   to the smoke dampers circled for inspection on check sheet
AU01964 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF
AU01964 	"   BURNLEY TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"""" TMF-3012-OP-0260"
AU01964 	6. Carry out inspection of smoke dampers circled on check sheet
AU01964 	   using the elevated work platform in B mode.
AU01964 	   Note that  either the LHS or the RHS or both sides of a
AU01964 	   nominated damper may require inspection.
AU01964 	7. Request the TCRO to open and then close the smoke dampers
AU01964 	   that are to be inspected.
AU01964 	8. Observe the damper blades for non-standard operation such as
AU01964 	  (a) dampers that open or close sluggishly
AU01964 	  (b) dampers that  fail to open or close completely
AU01964 	  (c) dampers that move sluggishly.
AU01964 	  (d) Record an OK or FAIL result on check sheet  BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01964 	     SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01964 	     SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION TMF-3012-OP-0260
AU01964 	9.  Repeat step 8 for all dampers to be inspected.
AU01964 	10. Note the Condition Rating for the dampers tested.
AU01964 	11. Record in Work done area of Job sheet any dampers that have
AU01964 	    failed operation and raise new job sheet for repair.
AU01964 	    Priority High P1.
AU01964 	12. Notify the TCR on completion of the job.
AU01964 	"13. On completion of the job, forward check sheet BURNLEY TUNNEL"
AU01964 	    SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01964 	    SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION TMF-3012-OP-0260   to the Team Leader
AU01964 	    Electrical or representative for sign off.
AU01964 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01964 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01964 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01964 	Note:
AU01964 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01964 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01964 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01964 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01964 	        it's intended function.
AU01964 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01964 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01964 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01964 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01964 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01964 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01964 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01964 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01964 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01964 	        intended function.

AU02154 	03 M Inspect and clean Refuges
AU02154 	
AU02154 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02154 	Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
AU02154 	"and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving"
AU02154 	"the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for"
AU02154 	"fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,"
AU02154 	"Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,"
AU02154 	Rodent bait station.
AU02154 	This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
AU02154 	installations and cleaning of the Refuge areas.
AU02154 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU02154 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02154 	2. This description describes the inspection and cleaning
AU02154 	"   of Refuges 1, 2 and 3."
AU02154 	"3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,"
AU02154 	"   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any"
AU02154 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU02154 	B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU02154 	1. Check the interior and external lighting (e.g. strobe etc)
AU02154 	"   for operation, including the operational tube within EXIT"
AU02154 	"   signs, replace or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]"
AU02154 	2. Visually inspect the fire alarm panel external surfaces for
AU02154 	   general operation.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02154 	   actions and notify the Electrical Electrical team leader or
AU02154 	   his representative of any outstanding works required.  [_ _]
AU02154 	3. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
AU02154 	   lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
AU02154 	4. Check operation of phone and clean of accumulated dust.
AU02154 	   Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job
AU02154 	   Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative
AU02154 	   of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU02154 	5. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
AU02154 	   operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control Room
AU02154 	   Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair faulty
AU02154 	   of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding defects
AU02154 	   in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
AU02154 	6. Check and clean cable trays for accumulated debris. Record
AU02154 	   anything  abnormal in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02154 	   Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of
AU02154 	   outstanding actions.  Include in the Related Job field of
AU02154 	"   the new and this job, the job number of the alternate"
AU02154 	   job.  [_ _]
AU02154 	"C  Refuge Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU02154 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
AU02154 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02154 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
AU02154 	   Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02154 	2. Check that all area(s) of the refuges are not obstructed by
AU02154 	   furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
AU02154 	   obstruction.  [_ _]
AU02154 	"3. Check the doors for damage and operation, lubricate and"
AU02154 	   repair as required and record in the Work Done area of the
AU02154 	   Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
AU02154 	   of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
AU02154 	4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
AU02154 	"5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and"
AU02154 	   ceilings.  [_ _]
AU02154 	6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
AU02154 	7. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces as well as
AU02154 	   stairways.  [_ _]
AU02154 	8. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
AU02154 	9. Visually inspect the metal upstands (external aids assisting
AU02154 	   access from tunnel to platform) for damage or corrosion.
AU02154 	   Repair and or remove corrosion and clean then cover with Cold
AU02154 	   Gal.  [_ _]
AU02154 	10. Prior to leaving the refuge arrange with the traffic Control
AU02154 	    room to ensure:
AU02154 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
AU02154 	"        e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"
AU02154 	    (b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]  and ensure
AU02154 	    (c) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]

AU02215 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]

AU02215 	1. Check the interior and external lighting (e.g. strobe etc)
AU02215 	"   for operation, including the operational tube within EXIT"
AU02215 	"   signs, replace or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]"
AU02215 	2. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
AU02215 	   lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
AU02215 	3. Check operation of phone and clean of accumulated dust.
AU02215 	   Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job
AU02215 	   Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative
AU02215 	   of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU02215 	4. Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
AU02215 	   operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control Room
AU02215 	   Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair faulty
AU02215 	   of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding defects
AU02215 	   in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]

AU02215 	   anything  abnormal in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02215 	   Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of
AU02215 	   outstanding actions.  Include in the Related Job field of
AU02215 	"   the new and this job, the job number of the alternate"
AU02215 	   job.  [_ _]
AU02215 	"C  Refuge Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU02215 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
AU02215 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02215 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
AU02215 	   Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02215 	2. Check that all area(s) of the refuges are not obstructed by
AU02215 	   furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
AU02215 	   obstruction.  [_ _]
AU02215 	"3. Check the doors for damage and operation, lubricate and"
AU02215 	   repair as required and record in the Work Done area of the
AU02215 	   Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
AU02215 	   of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
AU02215 	4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
AU02215 	"5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and"
AU02215 	   ceilings.  [_ _]
AU02215 	6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
AU02215 	7. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces as well as
AU02215 	   stairways.  [_ _]
AU02215 	8. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
AU02215 	9. Visually inspect the metal upstands (external aids assisting
AU02215 	   access from tunnel to platform) for damage or corrosion.
AU02215 	   Repair and or remove corrosion and clean then cover with Cold
AU02215 	   Gal.  [_ _]
AU02215 	10. Prior to leaving the refuge arrange with the traffic Control
AU02215 	    room to ensure:
AU02215 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
AU02215 	"        e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"
AU02215 	    (b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]  and ensure
AU02215 	    (c) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU02215 	11. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
AU01673 	01 M Check of  Burnley Vent Station Primary Axial Fans
AU01673 	
AU01673 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01673 	1. Works to carried out at non-peak times.
AU01673 	"2. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3, the"
AU01673 	   ventilation rooms and to interrupt operations.
AU01673 	3. Inform the control room prior to commencing the work and
AU01673 	   brief TCRO's on interruptions and expected alarms.  Maintain
AU01673 	   radio contact at all times.
AU01673 	"4. Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance"
AU01673 	   Instructions Manual (M-STG-VE-26058)
AU01673 	5. At the PMCS in the control room.
AU01673 	   (a) Check the motor balance vibration readings on the PMCS
AU01673 	"       for all fans.  If any reading is in excess of 6.5mm/s<(>,<)>"
AU01673 	"       record the result in the ""Work Done"" area of the job"
AU01673 	       sheet for further action.   [_ _]
AU01673 	"   (b) Check the trend log for the last month, looking for"
AU01673 	       abnormal events.   Any events and or trends that are
AU01673 	       abnormal are to be recorded in the work done area of the
AU01673 	       Jobsheets and a new job sheet raised to investigate and
AU01673 	       correct the abnormality.  [_ _]
AU01673 	"   (c) Check the running current and record in the ""Work Done"""
AU01673 	       area if greater than Primary fans FLC 349A    Secondary
AU01673 	       fans FLC 310A.
AU01673 	   (d) Check the drive and non drive end bearing temperatures
AU01673 	       for the operating fan motor.  Record the details for
AU01673 	       those bearings with a temperature greater then 80?C in
AU01673 	"       the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet for further"
AU01673 	       action   [_ _]
AU01673 	    (e) Record Hours run in Work Done.  [_ _]
AU01673 	6. Access to the  Burnley ventilation station is through the
AU01673 	   locked airlock on stairway adjacent to the south west corner
AU01673 	   of the Burnley vent stack.  Access to substation 3 is via
AU01673 	   external doors adjacent to the Burnley Portal.
AU01673 	WARNING:
AU01673 	    DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECK WHENEVER MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE
AU01673 	    OPERATIONAL
AU01673 	    DO NOT ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM
AU01673 	    ALONE.  TWO OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER WORK IS
AU01673 	    BEING CARRIED OUT IN THIS AREA.  OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE
AU01673 	    AIRLOCK DOORS.
AU01673 	7. In substation 3;
AU01673 	   (a) Switch the Main Isolator for EFE 01 OFF.  (NOTE:- The
AU01673 	       order of fan selection is dependant on fan requirements.
AU01673 	       A minimum of one fan must be running at any time).  Open
AU01673 	       the starter cubicle & inspect the cubicle & wiring
AU01673 	"       connections.  Upon completion close the door, and return"
AU01673 	       the Main Isolator to the ON position.  [_ _]
AU01673 	   (b) Switch the Main Isolators for all the other non
AU01673 	"       operational axial fans, one at a time EFE 02 thru to"
AU01673 	"       EFE10 to the OFF position, then inspect the starter"
AU01673 	"       cubicles.  Once the inspections are complete, ensure the"
AU01673 	       cabinet doors are closed and the isolators are returned
AU01673 	       to the ON positions.  [_ _]
AU01673 	8.1 Fan Room Access
AU01673 	   (a)  Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after
AU01673 	        equalizing differential pressure in the airlock.
AU01673 	HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
AU01673 	CHAMBER.
AU01673 	DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1 METRE OF
AU01673 	"AN OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD, AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX"
AU01673 	35kmh .
AU01673 	8.2 Static Checks
AU01673 	   (a) Press the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton adjacent to the
AU01673 	       motor.
AU01673 	   (b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and
AU01673 	"       ensure that the rubber bushing is moved freely, adjust if"
AU01673 	       required.  [_ _]
AU01673 	   (c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from the
AU01673 	       motor bearings for any noticeable colour changes.  [_ _]
AU01673 	"   (d) Open the local electrical junction box, inspect the"
AU01673 	"       electrical wiring and connections, inspect all glands for"
AU01673 	       tightness.  [_ _]
AU01673 	"   (e) Visually inspect the motor for evidence of condensation<(>,<)>"
AU01673 	"       white powder or similar.  Record in the ""Work Done"" area"
AU01673 	"       of the Job Sheet any evidence of condensation, powder and"
AU01673 	       the like and notify the Team Leader or his
AU01673 	       representative.  [_ _]
AU01673 	   (f) Carry out the following insulation/resistance test of the
AU01673 	       motor and heater windings.
AU01673 	      (i)  Ensure fan motor is isolated.
AU01673 	"      (ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor"
AU01673 	           Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has
AU01673 	           been isolated and is to remain isolated.
AU01673 	          (a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
AU01673 	             (where connected) and bridge heater terminals.
AU01673 	          (b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
AU01673 	              terminals.
AU01673 	     (iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
AU01673 	           motor windings and the winding heater bridge.  Record
AU01673 	"           the result in the """"Work Done"""" area."
AU01673 	     (iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
AU01673 	          connections and carry out an Insulation resistance
AU01673 	          test between this common bridge and earth.  Record
AU01673 	"          the result in the ""Work Done"" area."
AU01673 	     (v) Remove all temporary connections.
AU01673 	"     (vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then"
AU01673 	"          re-instate the heater connections, otherwise leave the"
AU01673 	          motor winding heater terminations isolated.
AU01673 	     (vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
AU01673 	     (viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than
AU01673 	"            2 megohm, then Record in the ""Work Done""area of the"
AU01673 	            Job Sheet and raise a new job for the outstanding
AU01673 	            works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
AU01673 	"           ""Related Job"" field as well as in the alternate."
AU01673 	            Notify the Team Leader or his representative of any
AU01673 	            outstanding works.
AU01673 	8.3  Running Checks.
AU01673 	   (a) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton and contact the TCR
AU01673 	       to start the fan.  [_ _]
AU01673 	   (b) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
AU01673 	       starts.
AU01673 	   (c) Check the fan for any abnormal noise or vibrations.  _ _]
AU01673 	   (d) Check the flexible connections for wear and leakage of
AU01673 	       air.  [_ _]
AU01673 	   (e) Check anti-vibration mountings for operation and
AU01673 	       structural soundness [_ _]
AU01673 	   (f ) Check the operation of the local vibration
AU01673 	        monitor.   [_ _]
AU01673 	"   (g) Record any abnormalities in the ""Work Done"" area of the"
AU01673 	       Job Sheet for further action.  [_ _]
AU01673 	   (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the Local EMERGENCY STOP
AU01673 	       pushbutton.
AU01673 	   (i) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01673 	8.4 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
AU01673 	   CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
AU01673 	   REQUIRED AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
AU01673 	"    (a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to"
AU01673 	"        substation 3, then remove the safety tags, in accordance"
AU01673 	"        with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove the fan motor"
AU01673 	        isolation at the MCC.
AU01673 	       Note: Ensure that only one non-operational fan is
AU01673 	             isolated at any one time.
AU01673 	    (b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF
AU01673 	        position to the MANUAL and the  REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
AU01673 	        selector switch from the REMOTE position to the LOCAL
AU01673 	        position.
AU01673 	"    (c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan<(>,<)>"
AU01673 	"        that is being maintained, by releasing the local STOP"
AU01673 	        pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START
AU01673 	        pushbutton.
AU01673 	    (d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
AU01673 	        starts.
AU01673 	"    (e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the"
AU01673 	"        bearings, only while the fan is running.  Ten pumps per"
AU01673 	        bearing.
AU01673 	"    (f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the"
AU01673 	"         bearings, using the retrieval system.  Examine the"
AU01673 	         grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
AU01673 	    (g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or
AU01673 	        vibrations.     [_ _]
AU01673 	    (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
AU01673 	    (i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01673 	9. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 02.  [_ _]
AU01673 	10. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 03.  [_ _]
AU01673 	11. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 04.  [_ _]
AU01673 	12. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 05.  [_ _]
AU01673 	13. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 06.  [_ _]
AU01673 	14. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 07.  [_ _]
AU01673 	15. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 08.  [_ _]
AU01673 	16. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 09.  [_ _]
AU01673 	17. Repeat step 8 for fan EFE 10.  [_ _]
AU01673 	18. (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are
AU01673 	       disengaged.  [_ _]
AU01673 	"    (b) Collect all tools and materials, leave the fan room<(>,<)>"
AU01673 	        again equalise the corridor and the fan room pressures.
AU01673 	19. (a) Check the lighting within the fan chamber for
AU01673 	        operation.  [_ _]
AU01673 	    (b) Repair any light found to be not operating or raise a
AU01673 	        new jobsheet for the repair of the fan chamber lighting.
AU01673 	20. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done'
AU01673 	    section of the Job Sheet.
AU01673 	21. Notify the control room on completion of work.
AU01673 	22. Return to the control room and ensure all fans are
AU01673 	    operational.
AU01673 	EMERGENCY OPERATION
AU01673 	In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident has
AU01673 	occurred requiring the
AU01673 	use of fans for smoke extraction.
AU01673 	"Note:  Depending on the position of an event, Substation 1 may be"
AU01673 	inaccessible.
AU01673 	1. If Substation 3 is not accessible
AU01673 	"   (a). If a fan that is being checked is running,  advise the"
AU01673 	        traffic control room that the fan  is running under
AU01673 	"        LOCAL control. Unless advice is received, from the"
AU01673 	"        control room,  that fan should remain under LOCAL"
AU01673 	        control.
AU01673 	"   (b). Vacate the ventilation fan chamber, ensuring the sliding"
AU01673 	        door to the airlock is closed and sealed.
AU01673 	   (c). Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are
AU01673 	        in or have left the air lock.
AU01673 	2. Substation 3 is accessible
AU01673 	   (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged
AU01673 	   (b) Return to substation 3 and switch all the fan
AU01673 	       REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switches to the REMOTE position
AU01673 	       and switch all the fan  AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switches to
AU01673 	       the AUTO position.
AU01673 	   (c) Notify the traffic control room operators that they have
AU01673 	       control of the fans.

AU01684 	06 M Check of Vent Station Smoke Damper Actuators
AU01684 	These checks are carried out to verify the operability of the
AU01684 	Ventilation Station smoke duct damper actuators for each
AU01684 	Ventilation Station.
AU01684 	
AU01684 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01684 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01684 	2. In conjunction with Traffic Control Room Operators set TCR
AU01684 	   PMCS system smoke damper actuator controls for manual
AU01684 	   operation
AU01684 	3. Open a minimum of 4 smoke duct dampers upstream of the
AU01684 	   ventilation station to prevent negative pressure being
AU01684 	"   generated in the smoke duct, from the normal ventilation"
AU01684 	"   system, when smoke dampers are opened."
AU01684 	4. Open and close each damper at least  twice and observe the
AU01684 	   panel for indications of non- standard operation such as
AU01684 	"   dampers that open or close sluggishly, or fail to open or"
AU01684 	   close completely.
AU01684 	5. Close the Ventilation station smoke duct dampers.
AU01684 	6. Close tunnel smoke duct dampers.
AU01684 	7. Record in Work Done area of the Job Sheet those dampers that
AU01684 	   have suspect operation.
AU01684 	8. Notify the control room om completion of the job.
AU01687 	12 M Check of Burnley Vent Station Damper Actuators
AU01687 	These checks are carried out  in conjunction with other checks
AU01687 	on Burnley Ventilation Station damper actuators.
AU01687 	
AU01687 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01687 	"1. Obtain Permit to Work for entry to ventilation rooms, the"
AU01687 	   smoke ducts and to interrupt operations.
AU01687 	   Note: Work shall not be carried out when more than 2 fans are
AU01687 	   operating.
AU01687 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01687 	3. Reference manual: TROX Technik - Melbourne City Link Tunnel
AU01687 	"   Project, Operating & Maintenance Instructions Manual"
AU01687 	4. Inform control room prior to commencing work.  Maintain
AU01687 	   radio contact at all times.
AU01687 	5. Access to Burnley  Ventilation Stations is through the locked
AU01687 	   airlock (Key  2-LV)   ) on the stairway adjacent to the
AU01687 	   Burnley vent stack and then down to the fan rooms.
AU01687 	6. The traffic Control Room operator will operate the actuators
AU01687 	   with the Maintenance personnel observing the operation in the
AU01687 	   smoke duct.  Maintain radio contact at all times.
AU01687 	7. Dampers are situated in the floor the fan room and at smoke
AU01687 	   duct entry point to the Primary Fan Room.
AU01687 	  Note: The Secondary fan room does not have floor mounted smoke
AU01687 	  dampers.
AU01687 	8. Request the traffic control room operator to open and close
AU01687 	   damper several times.
AU01687 	"9. Observe damper blades that open or close sluggishly, open"
AU01687 	"   partially, fail to open or close too tightly.  [_ _]"
AU01687 	10. Repeat steps 8 to 10 with all dampers in the Primary Fan
AU01687 	    room and the smoke duct.
AU01687 	    MDB 01 [_ _]
AU01687 	    MDB 02 [_ _]
AU01687 	    MDB 03 [_ _]
AU01687 	    MDB 04 [_ _]
AU01687 	    MDB 05 [_ _]
AU01687 	    MDB 06 [_ _]
AU01687 	    MDB 07 [_ _]
AU01687 	11. Record in Work Done area of the Job Sheet any dampers that
AU01687 	    have suspect operation.
AU01687 	12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01687 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01687 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01687 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01687 	Note:
AU01687 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01687 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01687 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01687 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01687 	        it's intended function.
AU01687 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01687 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01687 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01687 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01687 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01687 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01687 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01687 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01687 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01687 	        intended function.
AU01687 	OVERALL CONDITION RATING SCORE FOR THE DAMPERS
AU01687 	",,"
AU01687 	",,,,   SCORE,,"
AU01687 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01687 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01687 	"Note and comment below any items requiring immediate TSL ,,attention."
AU01708 	01 M Inspection of the ERTs in the BT Left Hand Lane
AU01708 	
AU01708 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01708 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01708 	2. Use Vehicle arrow board and short term emergency lane
AU01708 	"   stoppage as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01708 	"   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059"
AU01708 	"   Plan 21, 24 or 26."
AU01708 	3. For the Burnley Tunnel left hand lane and at each Emergency
AU01708 	   Roadside Telephone:
AU01708 	"   (a) Visually inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and"
AU01708 	       or insect infestation.
AU01708 	"   (b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on"
AU01708 	       Nifty and a clean cloth.
AU01708 	   (c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
AU01708 	"       room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact"
AU01708 	       the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
AU01708 	       phone communication then have the control room call back
AU01708 	       to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
AU01708 	4. For each ERT
AU01708 	   (a) record the result of the inspection
AU01708 	   (b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
AU01708 	   (c) the result of the communication test
AU01708 	   for each telephone on the attached form METS Inspection
AU01708 	   (Monthly) - Southern Link Burnley Tunnel  (Lane 1) Form
AU01708 	   No. TMF-3012-OP-0073.
AU01708 	5. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
AU01708 	   required in the comments area of the form.
AU01708 	6. Notify the control room on the completion of the Job.
AU01708 	7. Return the completed job sheet as well as the form METS
AU01708 	   (Inspection (Monthly) - Southern Link Burnley Tunnel
AU01708 	   (Lane 1) Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0073 to the Electrical /
AU01708 	   Electronics Team Leader or his representative.
AU01708 	8. The Electrical ./ Electronics Team leader or his
AU01708 	   representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU01708 	   actions required.
AU01967 	"01 M Check, Replace blown lamps in the Burnley Tunnel."""
AU01967 	
AU01967 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01967 	1. Replace blown lamps in the Burnley Tunnel.  Sodium Lamps
AU01967 	"   required are 1070665 (TF000377) (150W), 1070666 (TF000378)"
AU01967 	"   (250W), 1070664 (TF000376) (400W) and fluorescent lamps are"
AU01967 	   1070720 (TF000372) (35W).
AU01967 	   (a) Priority given to replace lamps if the lamps in three
AU01967 	       consecutive light fittings are not operational.
AU01967 	   (b) If a tunnel closure is planned for the month that the job
AU01967 	"       sheet is issued, priority is to be given to replacing"
AU01967 	       portal and ramp lighting.
AU01967 	"   (c) Light fitting diffuser cleaning, where possible, shall be"
AU01967 	       carried out during the planned tunnel closures at six
AU01967 	"       monthly intervals, in May and November approximately."
AU01967 	2. Notify TCRO prior to commencing work.
AU01967 	3. Set up lane closure as per Work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
AU01967 	"   and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 plan 27,"
AU01967 	"   28 or 122 . (27 for LHL and Centre Lane, 28 for RHL and"
AU01967 	"   centre lane, and 122 for tunnel closure)."
AU01967 	4. Use the EWP in the 'B' mode.
AU01967 	5. Before replacing faulty lamps either unplug from power box or
AU01967 	   remove the fuse for isolation.
AU01967 	6. If one fluro is faulty in a fitting replace both as they have
AU01967 	   both ran the same amount of hours.
AU01967 	"7. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU01967 	"   Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU01967 	   public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU01967 	   equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU01967 	   (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the Work
AU01967 	       Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention of
AU01967 	       the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
AU01967 	8. Notify the TCR on completion of the work.

AU02123 	   or 28.

AU02123 	   fittings.

AU02123 	   area of the Job Sheet.

AU02111 	"12 M Inspect, test and clean Burnley Tunnel LUS signs"
AU02111 	
AU02111 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02111 	1. Inform Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work.
AU02111 	2. The LUS signs are to be serviced using either a left hand and
AU02111 	   centre lane closure or a right hand and centre lane closure.
AU02111 	   Set up the lane closure as per work instruction Traffic
AU02111 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU02111 	   Plans 39 or 40.
AU02111 	3. Reference Manual
AU02111 	4. At each LUS sign:
AU02111 	   (a) Inspect the sign interior for dislodged relays
AU02111 	   (b) Check that all components are securely mounted
AU02111 	   (c) Check wiring connections for looseness and evidence of
AU02111 	       overheating
AU02111 	   (d) Check globes for secure mounting and replace faulty
AU02111 	       globes
AU02111 	"   (e) Check the enclosure for insect infestations, remove and"
AU02111 	       clean any infestation found
AU02111 	   (f) Check and clean the enclosure of any accumulated debris
AU02111 	   (g) Check the cable glands to enclosure connections for
AU02111 	"       tightness, tighten if loose."
AU02111 	   (h) Check the door fittings and closing mechanisms for
AU02111 	       operation
AU02111 	   (i) Check the cabinet and mounting brackets for security and
AU02111 	       or damage.
AU02111 	   (j) Clean the front fascia of sign to remove all accumulated
AU02111 	       dirt and debris using Windex and a soft cloth.
AU02111 	"   (k) At the LUS signs with the LED arrays, (Check the supply"
AU02111 	"       voltage level to the LED array, ensure the voltage is"
AU02111 	       within the limits of 10.5 +/- 0.1V).
AU02111 	"5. Ensure the control room can change the sign status, confirm"
AU02111 	   the sign operation back to the operator.
AU02111 	6. Record successfull clean and inspection of the sign by
AU02111 	   ticking on form Burnley Tunnel Lane Use Sign Inspection
AU02111 	   TMF-3012-OP-0370.  Indicate with a tick on form Burnley
AU02111 	   Tunnel Lane Use Sign Inspection TMF-3012-OP-0370 only when
AU02111 	   further comment is required and record comments in comment
AU02111 	   area of form Burnley Tunnel Lane Use Sign Inspection
AU02111 	   TMF-3012-OP-0370
AU02111 	7. On completion of the job record any outstanding corrective
AU02111 	   actions required in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02111 	   Notify the Electrical Supervisor or his representative of
AU02111 	   any outstanding corrective work required.  Raise a new job
AU02111 	   sheet for any corrective work required.
AU02111 	8. Notify the control room on completion of work.

AU01791 	12 M Test operation of Burnley Tunnel TIMS & FES analysers
AU01791 	
AU01791 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01791 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01791 	2. Access to the equipment rooms in the Burnley and Domain
AU01791 	"   tunnels shall be as per Work Instruction, traffic control,"
AU01791 	"   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059,"
AU01791 	   Plan  20.
AU01791 	"3. Refer to Symon Services Operation, Training & Maintenance"
AU01791 	"   Manual for TIMS, VSLS & FES, M-STG-TM-29943B, Section 11.0"
AU01791 	   Yearly Maintenance.
AU01791 	4. Inspect the TIMS and FES analysers for evidence of burnt or
AU01791 	   damaged components.  Record any damaged items in the Work
AU01791 	   Done area of the job sheet and raise a job sheet for any
AU01791 	   outstanding work.
AU01791 	5. Clean the cabinet interiors of any accumulated dirt or dust.
AU01791 	6. Press the TEST button on the analysers and monitor sign test
AU01791 	   function.  Note any faulty components and record in the
AU01791 	   Work Done area of  the job sheet.  Raise a work order for
AU01791 	   any maintenance work found.
AU01791 	7. Contact the TCR to reload message for TIMS and or operate the
AU01791 	   FES though and OFF/ON cycle to ensure the control room can
AU01791 	"   control the sign, as well receive feedback from the sign."
AU01791 	8. Record details and comments on the form TMF-3012-OP-0202 -
AU01791 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL TIMS AND FES SYSTEMS -12 MONTHLY INSPECTION
AU01791 	   AND TEST.
AU01791 	"9. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01791 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01791 	10. Notify the control room on completion of the work.
AU01730 	"12 M Inspect, test and clean Tunnel TIMS & FES"
AU01730 	
AU01730 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01730 	1. Inform Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work.
AU01730 	2. The TIMS and FES over the centre and RHS lanes should be
AU01730 	"   serviced together using RHS and Centre Lane closure, LHS TIMS"
AU01730 	   and FES should be serviced using a LHS lane closure.  This
AU01730 	   excludes the Sign Message Operation and the Sign Test Result
AU01730 	"   which are carried out on the three signs, LHS, RHS and centre"
AU01730 	   simultaneously from the equipment room analyser.
AU01730 	"3. Reference Manual Symon Services Operation, Training &"
AU01730 	"    Maintenance Manual for TIMS, VSLS & FES  M-STG-TM-29943"
AU01730 	4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01730 	    Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure
AU01730 	"    PR-RS-IR-059 Plans 27, 28"
AU01730 	5. Equipment Room Analysers
AU01730 	   (a) Inspect the TIMS and FES analysers for evidence of burnt
AU01730 	"       or damaged connections on plugs, electronic cards and"
AU01730 	       wiring.
AU01730 	   (b) Clean the analyser cabinet interiors of any accumulated
AU01730 	       dirt or dust.
AU01730 	   (c) Press the TEST button on the analyser and monitor the
AU01730 	       sign test routine.  Record the result (OK or Fail) in
AU01730 	       Sign Test Result column on the form.
AU01730 	"   (d) Inspect the cabinet for damage, ensuring the door closes"
AU01730 	       and locks securely.
AU01730 	6. TIMS Signs
AU01730 	   (a) Isolate sign power at  the sign circuit breaker within
AU01730 	       the TIMS sign enclosure.
AU01730 	   (b) Check the electronic component boards for evidence of
AU01730 	       burning or arcing.
AU01730 	"   (c) Clean the front fascia of the sign, using Windex and a"
AU01730 	       soft cloth.
AU01730 	   (d) Turn the sign circuit breaker to ON and check the pixel
AU01730 	       operation.  Record in the comments column if more than
AU01730 	       10% of the pixels have failed.
AU01730 	   (e) Check the output of the 12VDC power supply and the inputs
AU01730 	"       to the various drivers and controllers, the voltage"
AU01730 	"       measured, in each case should fall within the range of"
AU01730 	       10.2V and 11V . Record result ( OK or Fail) in the Sign
AU01730 	       inspection column of the form.
AU01730 	   (f) Check the operation and alignment of the Light Dependant
AU01730 	"       Resistor (LDR) by covering the LDR, then by monitoring"
AU01730 	"       the LEDs on the lighting luminosity board for change, to"
AU01730 	       determine LDR operation.
AU01730 	"   (g) Ensure the front fascia, in the area of the LDR, is clean"
AU01730 	       and completely free of all dirt and grime.
AU01730 	7. FES Signs
AU01730 	   (a) Clean the fitting and perspex of all dirt and grime.
AU01730 	   (b) Check the sign lighting for operation and replace faulty
AU01730 	"       components. (Lighting comprises a selection of 18W, 30W &"
AU01730 	       36W Cool White Fluorescent Tubes.)
AU01730 	   (c) Check with the TCR and confirm TCR operation of sign
AU01730 	       control.
AU01730 	8. Ensure the control room can control the sign via a TEST
AU01730 	"   message change, confirm the sign operation back to the"
AU01730 	   operator.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in the sign message
AU01730 	   operation column of the form.
AU01730 	9. Record the results of the TIMS inspections and any comments
AU01730 	   on form TIMS SYSTEM INSPECTION - BURNLEY TUNNEL TIMS SIGNS
AU01730 	"   AND ANALYSERS TMF-3012-OP-0287, and record the result of the"
AU01730 	   FES inspections and any comments on form FES SYSTEM
AU01730 	   INSPECTION - BURNLEY TUNNEL FES SIGNS AND ANALYSERS
AU01730 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0302, for any test that FAILs, record the details"
AU01730 	   in the comments column of the appropriate form.
AU01730 	"10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU01730 	"    Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipe work,"
AU01730 	    public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU01730 	    equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU01730 	    (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the Work
AU01730 	        Done area of the Job Sheet .
AU01730 	11. On completion of the job record anything outside normal
AU01730 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.  Raise a
AU01730 	    new job sheet for any corrective work required.
AU01730 	12. Notify the control room on completion of work.
AU02002 	"12 M Inspect, test and clean Burnley Tunnel VSLS signs"
AU02002 	
AU02002 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02002 	1. Inform Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work.
AU02002 	2. The VSLS on the RHL wall should be serviced using a RHL Lane
AU02002 	"   closure, VSLS units on the LHL wall should be serviced using"
AU02002 	   a LHS lane closure.  This excludes the VSLS Sign Message
AU02002 	   Operation and the Sign Test Result which are carried out on
AU02002 	"   the two signs, LHS and RHS simultaneously from the equipment"
AU02002 	   room analyser.
AU02002 	"3. Reference Manual Symon Services Operation, Training &"
AU02002 	"   Maintenance Manual for TIMS, VSLS & FES  M-STG-TM-29943"
AU02002 	4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU02002 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU02002 	"   Plans 20, 23, 24, 25, 26 and 29."
AU02002 	5. Equipment Room Analysers
AU02002 	   (a) Inspect the VSLS analyser for evidence of burnt or
AU02002 	"       damaged connections on plugs, electronic cards and"
AU02002 	       wiring.
AU02002 	   (b) Clean the cabinet interior of any accumulated dirt or
AU02002 	       dust.
AU02002 	   (c) Press the TEST button on the analyser and monitor the
AU02002 	       sign test routine.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in
AU02002 	       Sign Test Result column on the form.
AU02002 	"   (d) Inspect the cabinet for damage, ensuring the door closes"
AU02002 	       and locks securely.
AU02002 	6. VSLS Signs
AU02002 	"   Note: As at 10-05-04 the large VSLS units at Power St,"
AU02002 	         Kingsway On ramp and Westgate Freeway have been
AU02002 	         replaced with new generation VSLS units.  Voltage Test
AU02002 	         levels are different on the old and new generation
AU02002 	         units.
AU02002 	   (a) Isolate sign power at  the sign circuit breaker within
AU02002 	       the VSLS sign enclosure.
AU02002 	   (b) Check the electronic component boards for evidence of
AU02002 	       burning or arcing.
AU02002 	"   (c) Clean the front facia of the sign, using Windex and a"
AU02002 	       soft cloth.
AU02002 	   (d) Turn the sign circuit breaker to ON and check the pixel
AU02002 	       operation.  Record in the comments column of the form
AU02002 	       VSLS Systems Inspections Burnley Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0299
AU02002 	       if more than 10% of the pixels have failed.
AU02002 	   (e) (i) Check and adjust the output of the 12VDC power supply
AU02002 	           and the inputs to the various drivers and
AU02002 	"           controllers, the voltage measured, in each case must"
AU02002 	           fall within the range of (10.2V and 11V old VSLS
AU02002 	           units) and (12.5 to 13VDC and 6.5 to 6.7V for new
AU02002 	           VSLS units) . Record result ( OK or Fail) in the Sign
AU02002 	           inspection column of the form VSLS Systems
AU02002 	           Inspections Burnley Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0299.
AU02002 	"      (ii) On the small VSLS signs (within the tunnel), check"
AU02002 	           and adjust the output of the 24VDC power supply and
AU02002 	"           the inputs to the various drivers and controllers,"
AU02002 	"           the voltage measured, in each case must fall within"
AU02002 	           the range of 23.2V and 24V. Record result ( OK or
AU02002 	           Fail) in the Sign inspection column of the form VSLS
AU02002 	           Systems Inspections Burnley Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0299.
AU02002 	"     (iii) On the LARGE VSLS signs (outside the tunnel), check"
AU02002 	           the range of 12.0 to 12.1 V and 6.5 to 6.7V.
AU02002 	           Record result ( OK or Fail) in the Sign inspection
AU02002 	           column of the form VSLS Systems Inspections Burnley
AU02002 	           Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0299.
AU02002 	"           The 12 V power supply, supplies the VSLS sign Red"
AU02002 	"           LEDs, while the 24V power supply, supplies the White"
AU02002 	           LEDs.  The Small VSLS signs have 4 LEDs per pixel
AU02002 	           while the Large VSLS signs have 3 Leds per  pixel.
AU02002 	   (f) Check the operation and alignment of the Light Dependant
AU02002 	       Resistor (LDR) by
AU02002 	      (i) covering the LDR will cause the display intensity to
AU02002 	          reduce
AU02002 	     (ii) shining a torch onto the LDR will cause the display
AU02002 	          intensity to increase.  (This function cannot be
AU02002 	          tested with the present configuration).
AU02002 	7. Ensure the control room can control the sign via a TEST
AU02002 	"   message change, confirm the sign operation back to the"
AU02002 	   operator.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in the sign message
AU02002 	   operation column of the form  VSLS Systems Inspections
AU02002 	   Burnley Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0299.
AU02002 	8. Results of inspections and comments are recorded on form
AU02002 	   VSLS Systems Inspections Burnley Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0299 for
AU02002 	"   tests that FAIL, record details in the comments column of the"
AU02002 	   form.
AU02002 	9. On completion of the job record any outstanding corrective
AU02002 	   actions required in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02002 	   Raise a new job sheet for any corrective work required.
AU02002 	10. Notify the control room on completion of work.
AU02002 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02002 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02002 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU02002 	Note:
AU02002 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02002 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02002 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02002 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02002 	        it's intended function.
AU02002 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02002 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02002 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02002 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02002 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02002 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02002 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02002 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention

AU02020 	Item 15.1
AU02020 	(a) Inspect the interior of the beam structure at ground level
AU02020 	    for evidence of the entry of water or moisture.
AU02020 	(b) Travel the length of the beam and visually examine the full
AU02020 	"    extent of each joint, looking for evidence of water ingress."
AU02020 	(c) At the junction of each cross-member and the lower face of
AU02020 	"    the beam, visually inspect for evidence of accumulated water"
AU02020 	    and or recent moisture.
AU02020 	"(d) Whilst carrying out the above inspections, record any"
AU02020 	    evidence of corrosion and or any degradation of internal
AU02020 	    surfaces.

AU02020 	    level for evidence of moisture and or recent wetness.

AU02020 	    any evidence of corrosion.
AU02020 	"(c) Record details of any water residues, corrosion and or"
AU02020 	Item 15.3
AU02020 	"(a).Visually inspect, from the ground, all external surfaces"
AU02020 	    and joints of the beam using binoculars.
AU02020 	    Examine for the integrity of the paint coating on the
AU02020 	"    various faces, examine for peeling paint, blisters and"
AU02020 	    evidence of corrosion.
AU02020 	    Record details of any outstanding works for surface coating
AU02020 	"    damage, corrosion and or damage on form ANNUAL BEAM"
AU02020 	    INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0351.  Raise a new jobsheet for any
AU02020 	    outstanding works.
AU02020 	Item 15.4
AU02020 	(a) Visually inspect the Beam to foundation connections
AU02020 	"   (foundation studs) for signs of degradation or corrosion,"
AU02020 	    inspect the protective coatings (Coverings and coatings)
AU02020 	    for integrity and degradation.
AU02020 	"(b) Visually inspect grouting and paintwork for cracks,"
AU02020 	"    blistering, peeling and damage and any corrosion."
AU02020 	    Record details of any outstanding works required to correct
AU02020 	"    cracks, chips or damage to the protective coatings on form"
AU02020 	    ANNUAL BEAM INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0351.
AU02020 	    Raise a new job for outstanding works.
AU02020 	Item 15.5

AU02020 	    Remove and clean all debris and materials from the moat.
AU02020 	    Ensure the moat drains effectively.
AU02020 	    Record details of outstanding works required to correct any
AU02020 	    water residues and or corrosion and or damage on form
AU02020 	    Raise a new jobsheet for outstanding works.

AU02020 	"    vandalism, impact or movement."

AU02020 	    ensure it is intact and has a full complement of setscrews.

AU02020 	    TMF-3012-OP-0351.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding

AU01800 	   lane.

AU01800 	   (b) Lane Closure: Emergency lane.

AU01800 	"3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01800 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01800 	   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12.
AU01800 	"4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,"
AU01800 	   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
AU01800 	5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
AU01800 	"   (a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of"
AU01800 	"       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if necessary."
AU01800 	       [_ _]
AU01800 	   (b) Inspect the cabinet and check that  the equipment mounted
AU01800 	       in the cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
AU01800 	"   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,"
AU01800 	       re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
AU01800 	   (d) Check the fibre patch leads for damage and that they are
AU01800 	       securely fastened to the PT300.
AU01800 	       WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
AU01800 	       CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
AU01800 	"   (e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if"
AU01800 	"       not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]"
AU01800 	   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
AU01800 	       the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
AU01800 	       (Connect the WFM90 directly to the lead from the camera).
AU01800 	       Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
AU01800 	       module and is secure. [_ _]
AU01800 	6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
AU01800 	   (unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
AU01800 	   inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
AU01800 	   of the PTZ .  [_ _]
AU01800 	7. Camera and Camera Housing;
AU01800 	   WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
AU01800 	   ALIVE.
AU01800 	"   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of"
AU01800 	       moisture and any insect infestation. Surface insect spray
AU01800 	       may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
AU01800 	       but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
AU01800 	       to the housing glass. If ingress of moisture or insect
AU01800 	       infestation is evident then carry out steps (d) and
AU01800 	       (e).  [_ _]
AU01800 	   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
AU01800 	       mounts. [_ _]
AU01800 	   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
AU01800 	       Rain-X cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU01800 	"   (d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm."
AU01800 	       WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
AU01800 	"       If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater"
AU01800 	"       thermostat (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the"
AU01800 	       operation of the heater. [_ _]
AU01800 	   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
AU01800 	       with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
AU01800 	8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
AU01800 	   re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ controller.
AU01800 	   [_ _]
AU01800 	9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
AU01800 	   full movement and pre-programmed positions. If camera fails
AU01800 	   to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
AU01800 	   minutes then check again.  [_ _]

AU01800 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.

AU01800 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01800 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01800 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01800 	Note:
AU01800 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01800 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01800 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01800 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01800 	        it's intended function.
AU01800 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01800 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01800 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01800 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01800 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01800 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01800 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01800 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01800 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01800 	        intended function.

AU01797 	"3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01797 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,"
AU01797 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12, 13, 14, 143."
AU01797 	"4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,"
AU01797 	   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
AU01797 	5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
AU01797 	"   (a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of"
AU01797 	"       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if"
AU01797 	       necessary.   [_ _]
AU01797 	   (b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
AU01797 	       cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
AU01797 	"   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,"
AU01797 	       re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
AU01797 	   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
AU01797 	       fastened to the PT300.
AU01797 	       WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
AU01797 	       CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
AU01797 	"   (e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if"
AU01797 	"       not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]"
AU01797 	   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
AU01797 	       the signal from the camera using the WFM 90 meter.
AU01797 	       (Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the
AU01797 	       camera).
AU01797 	       Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
AU01797 	       module and is secure.  [_ _]
AU01797 	6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
AU01797 	   (unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
AU01797 	   inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
AU01797 	   of the PTZ .  [_ _]
AU01797 	7. Camera and Camera Housing;
AU01797 	   WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
AU01797 	   ALIVE.
AU01797 	"   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of"
AU01797 	       moisture and any insect infestation.
AU01797 	       Surface insect spray may be applied if necessary to the
AU01797 	       housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
AU01797 	       of the housing or to the housing glass.  If ingress of
AU01797 	       moisture or insect infestation is evident then carry out
AU01797 	       steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
AU01797 	   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
AU01797 	       mounts. [_ _]
AU01797 	   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
AU01797 	       Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU01797 	"   (d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm."
AU01797 	       WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
AU01797 	"       If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater"
AU01797 	"       thermostat (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the"
AU01797 	       operation of the heater. [_ _]
AU01797 	   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
AU01797 	       with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
AU01797 	8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
AU01797 	   re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
AU01797 	   controller.   [_ _]
AU01797 	9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
AU01797 	   full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
AU01797 	   to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
AU01797 	   minutes then check again.  [_ _]
AU01797 	10.On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01797 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01797 	   Record Details as Below
AU01797 	   Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01797 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01797 	   Plan  _____.
AU01797 	   1. Any deviations from the plan:
AU01797 	   2. Lane closure start time:
AU01797 	   3. Lane closure finish time:
AU01797 	   4. Weather conditions:
AU01797 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01797 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01797 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01797 	Note:
AU01797 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01797 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01797 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01797 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01797 	        it's intended function.
AU01797 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01797 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01797 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01797 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01797 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01797 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01797 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01797 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01797 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01797 	        intended function.
AU01797 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01797 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01797 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01999 	10. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
AU01999 	    full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
AU01999 	    to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
AU01999 	    minutes then check again.  [_ _]
AU01999 	"11. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU01999 	"    Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU01999 	    public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU01999 	    equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU01999 	    (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
AU01999 	        Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
AU01999 	        attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
AU01999 	        representative.
AU01999 	12. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01999 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01999 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01999 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01999 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01999 	Note:
AU01999 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01999 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01999 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01999 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01999 	        it's intended function.
AU01999 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01999 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01999 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01999 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01999 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01999 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01999 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01999 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01999 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01999 	        intended function.

AU01806 	"       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if"
AU01806 	       necessary.   [_ _]
AU01806 	   (b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
AU01806 	       cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
AU01806 	"   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,"
AU01806 	       re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
AU01806 	   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
AU01806 	       fastened to the PT300.
AU01806 	    WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
AU01806 	    CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
AU01806 	"   (e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if"
AU01806 	"       not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]"
AU01806 	   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
AU01806 	       the signal from the camera using the WFM  90 meter.
AU01806 	      (Connect the WFM90 directly to the lead from the camera).
AU01806 	      Ensure the co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
AU01806 	      module and is secure.  [_ _]
AU01806 	7. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
AU01806 	   (unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
AU01806 	   inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
AU01806 	   of the PTZ .  [_ _]
AU01806 	8. Camera and Camera Housing;
AU01806 	   WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
AU01806 	   ALIVE.
AU01806 	"   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of"
AU01806 	       moisture and any insect infestation.  Surface insect
AU01806 	       spray may be applied if necessary to the housing exterior
AU01806 	       but must not be applied to the interior of the housing or
AU01806 	       to the housing glass.  If ingress of moisture or insect
AU01806 	       infestation is evident then carry out steps (d)
AU01806 	       and (e).  [_ _]
AU01806 	   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
AU01806 	       mounts. [_ _]
AU01806 	   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
AU01806 	       Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU01806 	"   (d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm."
AU01806 	       WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
AU01806 	"       If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater thermostat"
AU01806 	"      (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the operation of"
AU01806 	       the heater. [_ _]
AU01806 	   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
AU01806 	       with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.

AU01806 	   re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
AU01806 	   controller.  [_ _]

AU01806 	    full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
AU01806 	    to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait
AU01806 	    2 minutes then check again.  [_ _]

AU01860 	03 M Inspect and maintain Crosspassage 2 fans
AU01860 	
AU01860 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01860 	1. Obtain a lane closure approval for the appropriate tunnel.  [_ _]
AU01860 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job as well as
AU01860 	entering the cross passage.
AU01860 	"3. Refer to Maintenance Manual, """"Operating and Maintenance Manual for"
AU01860 	Mechanical
AU01860 	"    Services - MCL Tunnels"""" M-STG-ME-27400."
AU01860 	4. Refer to AS 1668.1 - 1991 Appendix A for detail and methodology of
AU01860 	Stair Pressurisation
AU01860 	   Commissioning Tests.
AU01860 	"5. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01860 	TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
AU01860 	"    Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20 or 22."
AU01860 	WARNING:
AU01860 	HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE WORKING IN THE
AU01860 	VICINITY OF AN OPERATING FAN.
AU01860 	"6. (a) Check that both the supply air grill and the fire damper, over"
AU01860 	"the cross passage door,"
AU01860 	          are clear of any debris that could restrict the airflow.  (Usea
AU01860 	torch from the duct
AU01860 	          hatch) [_ _]
AU01860 	"    (b) Check the fire damper for damage, corrosion and that it has not"
AU01860 	operated
AU01860 	          prematurely.  [_ _]
AU01860 	7. Work plan confirming the operation of SF-TCP-02 (1B CPF P12 adjacent
AU01860 	to ERW 04)
AU01860 	"   (a)  Ensure the doors, from the cross passage to both the Burnley and"
AU01860 	the Domain
AU01860 	          tunnels are closed.
AU01860 	"   (b) Request the TCR operator to start the fan, ensure the air flow"
AU01860 	isinto the cross
AU01860 	         passage.  [_ _]
AU01860 	   (c) Note: The alarm to be raised will not call the fire brigade. It
AU01860 	will register on the local FIP
AU01860 	         and CCCS as a local alarm.
AU01860 	"         Remove the access cover over the smoke detector, direct 'test"
AU01860 	"smoke"""" from a smoke"
AU01860 	"         generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke"
AU01860 	detector (on the ducting).
AU01860 	         Check  that an alarm actuates on the local fire panel.   (The
AU01860 	fan will not stop due to a
AU01860 	         time delay)  [_ _]
AU01860 	  (d) Request the traffic control room operator to start the fan.
AU01860 	  (e) Remove the relay mounted in the rear compartment of the fire
AU01860 	indicator panel.  The
AU01860 	         relays are labelled
AU01860 	"         """"Cross Passage 2E Fan Relay"""" for the Burnley tunnel end, and"
AU01860 	"         """"Cross Passage 2W Fan Relay"""" for the Domain tunnel end."
AU01860 	 Check that the fan stops
AU01860 	          after approx.  two and a half minutes.   [_ _]
AU01860 	   (f ) Replace the relay and request the traffic control room operator
AU01860 	to start the fan
AU01860 	         again.   [_ _]
AU01860 	8. Check the operation of controls and alarms.
AU01860 	   (a) Open the cross-passage door farthest from the fan.  Confirm an
AU01860 	alarm at the TCR
AU01860 	         workstation.   [_ _]
AU01860 	"   (b) Check the door for damage, as well check the roller, runners,"
AU01860 	"handles, stops,"
AU01860 	"         counter-weight ropes, tube and counter-weights for efficient"
AU01860 	operation.   [_ _]
AU01860 	   (c) Chock open the door (at the farthest end of cross passage to the
AU01860 	"fan), then using an"
AU01860 	"         using an anemometer, measure the velocity of air out of the"
AU01860 	open door.  The reading
AU01860 	         is to be with the door fully open and with no obstructions.
AU01860 	 Record results in Work
AU01860 	         Done Area of the job sheet if less than 1 metre per second and
AU01860 	advise the maintenance
AU01860 	         superintendent for further investigation.  [_ _]
AU01860 	"   (d) Arrange the door catch to be non-functioning, then using a"
AU01860 	springbalance measure the
AU01860 	"         force required to open the door.  Record results in the """"Work"
AU01860 	"Done"""" area of the job sheet"
AU01860 	         if a force greater than 11kg is required.  Raise a new job
AU01860 	sheet  for any outstanding
AU01860 	         corrective actions that are required.   [_ _]
AU01860 	"   (e) With the cross passage to tunnel doors closed, check the"
AU01860 	differential pressure at the
AU01860 	         door farthest  from the fan.  Record readings of less than 50Pa
AU01860 	"in the """"Work Done"""""
AU01860 	         area of the jobsheet.  Raise a new job sheet  for any
AU01860 	outstanding corrective actions
AU01860 	         that are required.  Record traffic control room reading also.
AU01860 	  [_ _]

AU01860 	passage air pressure to return
AU01860 	"         its static level.  Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job"
AU01860 	sheet if the time is greater
AU01860 	         than 2  minutes.   Raise a new job sheet  for any outstanding
AU01860 	corrective actions that are
AU01860 	        required.  [_ _]

AU01860 	         and closes correctly.  Confirm with the Traffic Control room

AU01860 	tension. [_ _]

AU01860 	      housing  and alignment.  [_ _]

AU01860 	sweeping
AU01860 	      into the drain  [___]

AU01860 	             leaks

AU01860 	             door damage
AU01860 	             evidence of drain blockage
AU01860 	"        evidence of structural damage to stairs and handrails etc,  in"
AU01860 	"the """"Work Done"""""
AU01860 	       section of the job sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
AU01860 	representative and
AU01860 	       raise a new job for any repairs.

AU01852 	1. Obtain a lane closure approval for the appropriate tunnel.  [_ _]
AU01852 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job as well as
AU01852 	entering the cross passage.
AU01852 	"3. Refer to Maintenance Manual, """"Operating and Maintenance Manual for"
AU01852 	Mechanical
AU01852 	"    Services - MCL Tunnels"""" M-STG-ME-27400."
AU01852 	4. Refer to AS 1668.1 - 1991 Appendix A for detail and methodology of
AU01852 	Stair Pressurisation
AU01852 	   Commissioning Tests.
AU01852 	"5. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01852 	TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
AU01852 	"    Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20 or 22."
AU01852 	WARNING:
AU01852 	HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE WORKING IN THE
AU01852 	VICINITY OF AN OPERATING FAN.
AU01852 	"6. (a) Check that both the supply air grill and the fire damper, over"
AU01852 	"the cross passage door,"
AU01852 	         are clear any debris that could restrict the airflow.  (use a
AU01852 	torch from the duct
AU01852 	         hatch)   [_ _]
AU01852 	"    (b) Check the fire damper for damage, corrosion and that it has not"
AU01852 	operated
AU01852 	          prematurely.  [_ _]
AU01852 	7. Work plan confirming the operation of SF-TCP-04 (4A CPF P11 adjacent
AU01852 	to ERW 03)
AU01852 	"   (a)  Ensure the doors, from the cross passage to both the Burnley and"
AU01852 	the Domain
AU01852 	          tunnels are closed.
AU01852 	"    (b) Request the TCR operator to start the fan, ensure the air flow"
AU01852 	is into the cross
AU01852 	          passage.    [_ _]
AU01852 	   (c) NOTE: The alarm to be raised will not call the fire brigade.  It
AU01852 	will register on the local FIP
AU01852 	          and CCCS as a local alarm.
AU01852 	"           Remove the access cover over the smoke detector, direct"
AU01852 	"test smoke"""" from a smoke"
AU01852 	"           generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke"
AU01852 	detector (on the duct). Check
AU01852 	           that an alarm actuates on the local fire panel.  (The fan
AU01852 	will not stop due to a time
AU01852 	           delay)  [_ _]
AU01852 	   (d) Request the traffic control room operator to start the fan (if
AU01852 	stopped) .
AU01852 	   (e) Remove the relay which is mounted in the rear compartment of the
AU01852 	fire indicator panel.
AU01852 	         The relay is labelled
AU01852 	"          """"Cross Passage 3E Fan Relay"""" for the Burnley tunnel end, and"
AU01852 	"          """"Cross Passage 3W Fan Relay"""" for the Domain tunnel end."
AU01852 	 Check that the fan stops
AU01852 	           after approx. two and a half minutes.   [_ _]
AU01852 	    (f ) Replace the relay and request the traffic control room
AU01852 	operatorto start the fan
AU01852 	          again.   [_ _]
AU01852 	8. Check the operation of controls and alarms.
AU01852 	   (a) Open the cross-passage door farthest from the fan.  Confirm an
AU01852 	alarm at the TCR
AU01852 	         workstation.   [_ _]
AU01852 	"   (b) Check the door for damage, as well check the rollers, runners,"
AU01852 	"handles, stops,"
AU01852 	"         counter-weight ropes, tube and counter weights for efficient"
AU01852 	operation.  [_ _]
AU01852 	   (c) Chock open the door (at the farthest end of cross passage to the
AU01852 	"fan), then using an"
AU01852 	"         anemometer, measure the velocity of the air out of the open"
AU01852 	door.  The reading is to be
AU01852 	         with the door fully open and with no obstructions.  Record
AU01852 	results in Work Done Area
AU01852 	         of the job sheet if less then 1 metre per second and advise themaintenance
AU01852 	         superintendent for further investigation.   [_ _]
AU01852 	"   (d)  Arrange the door catches to be non-functioning, then using a"
AU01852 	"spring balance, measure"
AU01852 	         the force required to open the door.  Record results in Work
AU01852 	Done Area of the job
AU01852 	         sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required .   Raise a new
AU01852 	job sheet  for any
AU01852 	          outstanding corrective actions that are required..   [_ _]
AU01852 	"   (e) With the cross passage to tunnel door closed, measure the cross"
AU01852 	passage air
AU01852 	         pressure.
AU01852 	"         Record readings of less than 50Pa in the """"Work Done area of"
AU01852 	the job sheet.  Advise
AU01852 	         the superintendent for further investigation. Record the
AU01852 	traffic control room
AU01852 	         reading also.   [_ _]

AU01852 	passage air pressure to return

AU01774 	Mechanical
AU01774 	"   Services - MCL Tunnels"""" M-STG-ME-27400."
AU01774 	"4. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01774 	TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
AU01774 	"   Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan  20 or 22."
AU01774 	WARNING:
AU01774 	HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN WORKING IN THE VICINITY
AU01774 	OF AN OPERATING FAN.
AU01774 	5. Carry out the three Monthly inspection and checks. [_ _]
AU01774 	6. Work plan for SF-TCP-01 (adjacent to ERW 04)
AU01774 	"   (a)  At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan"
AU01774 	AUTO/MANUAL/OFF selector switch
AU01774 	          to the MANUAL position and the ON/OFF selector switch to the
AU01774 	ON position to operate
AU01774 	          the  fan.    [_ _]
AU01774 	"    (b) Operate the fan for at least 30 minutes, monitor the fan motor"
AU01774 	in operation and check
AU01774 	           the bearings for undue noise.   [_ _]
AU01774 	    (c) Monitor the fan and motor in operation for any undue noises and
AU01774 	or vibrations.  [_ _]
AU01774 	    (d) Open the door from the cross passage tunnel to the Burnley
AU01774 	Tunnel (for SF-TCP-01) and
AU01774 	          monitor the fan motor speed to confirm it maintains a positive
AU01774 	pressure differential.  [_ _]
AU01774 	"    (e) At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan"
AU01774 	OFF position.  Isolate the
AU01774 	"          fan in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety"
AU01774 	Work Instruction.     [_ _]
AU01774 	     (f) Remove the access panels and clean the interior of the unit of
AU01774 	accumulated dirt and
AU01774 	           debris.  [_ _]
AU01774 	     (g) Clean the motor exterior of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
AU01774 	"     (h) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, lost or missing"
AU01774 	fixings etc.  repair if
AU01774 	            required.   [_ _]
AU01774 	      (i ) Check the unit mounts for security and tension.   [_ _]
AU01774 	      (j ) Check the duct for damage and corrosion.   [_ _]
AU01774 	"      (k) At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan the ON/OFF"
AU01774 	selector switch to the
AU01774 	           ON position to operate and  the  fan AUTO/MANUAL/OFF
AU01774 	selectorswitch  to the AUTO
AU01774 	           position.    [_ _]
AU01774 	     (l ) Lubricate the motor bearings with Shell Alvania R3 grease.
AU01774 	 Apply the grease while the
AU01774 	"           fan is rotating, continue until all the old grease is purged"
AU01774 	from the grease relief
AU01774 	           port. [_ _]
AU01774 	      (m) Notify the traffic control room that the control has been
AU01774 	returned to Auto Operation.
AU01774 	7. Repeat step 7 for the SF-TCP-03 (adjacent to ERE 04).
AU01774 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal parameters"
AU01774 	"in the """"Work Done"""""
AU01774 	   area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
AU01774 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
