AU01720 	01 M Inspection of the ERTs in the DT
AU01720 	
AU01720 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01720 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01720 	2. Use Vehicle arrow board and short term emergency lane
AU01720 	"   stoppage as per Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24"
AU01720 	   or 26.
AU01720 	3. For the Domain Tunnel left hand lane and at each Emergency
AU01720 	   Roadside Telephone:
AU01720 	"   (a) Visually inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and"
AU01720 	       or insect infestation.
AU01720 	"   (b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on"
AU01720 	       Nifty and a clean cloth.
AU01720 	   (c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
AU01720 	"       room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact"
AU01720 	       the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
AU01720 	       phone communication then have the control room call back
AU01720 	       to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
AU01720 	4. For each ERT
AU01720 	   (a) record the result of the inspection
AU01720 	   (b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
AU01720 	   (c) the result of the communication test for each telephone
AU01720 	       on the attached form METS Inspection (Monthly) - Southern
AU01720 	       Link Domain Tunnel  (Lane 3) Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0070.
AU01720 	5. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
AU01720 	   required in the comments area of the form.
AU01720 	6. Notify the control room on the completion of the Job.
AU01720 	7. Return the completed job sheet as well as the form METS
AU01720 	   Inspection (Monthly) - Southern Link Domain Tunnel  (Lane 3)
AU01720 	   Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0070. to the Electrical / Electronics
AU01720 	   Team Leader or his representative.
AU01720 	8. The Electrical ./ Electronics Team leader or his
AU01720 	   representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU01720 	   actions required.
AU01966 	"01 M Check, Replace blown lamps in the Domain Tunnel."
AU01966 	
AU01966 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01966 	1. Replace blown lamps in the Domain Tunnel.  Sodium Lamps
AU01966 	"   required are TF000377(150W),  TF000378  (250W), TF000376"
AU01966 	   (400W) and Fluorescent Tubes TF000372 (36W).
AU01966 	   (a) Priority given to replace lamps if the lamps in three
AU01966 	       consecutive light fittings are not operational.
AU01966 	   (b) If a tunnel closure is planned for the month that the job
AU01966 	"       sheet is issued, priority is to be given to replacing"
AU01966 	       portal and ramp lighting.
AU01966 	"   (c) Light fitting diffuser cleaning, where possible, shall be"
AU01966 	       carried out during the planned tunnel closures at six
AU01966 	"       monthly intervals, in May and November approximately."
AU01966 	2. Notify TCRO prior to commencing work.
AU01966 	3. Set up lane closure as per Work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
AU01966 	   and Translink Operations Procedure     PR-RS-OP-IR-020 plan
AU01966 	"   27, 28 or 123 . (27 for LHL and Centre Lane, 28 for RHL and"
AU01966 	"   centre lane, and 123 for tunnel closure)."
AU01966 	4. Use the EWP in the 'B' mode.
AU01966 	5. Before replacing faulty lamps either unplug from power box or
AU01966 	   remove the fuse for isolation.
AU01966 	6. If one fluro is faulty in a fitting replace both as they have
AU01966 	   both ran the same amount of hours.
AU01966 	"7. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU01966 	"   Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU01966 	   public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU01966 	   equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU01966 	   (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
AU01966 	       Work Done area of the Job Sheet and bring to the
AU01966 	       attention of the Team Leader Electrical or his
AU01966 	       representative.
AU01966 	8. Notify the TCR on completion of the work.
AU02112 	"12 M Inspect, test and clean Domain Tunnel LUS signs"
AU02112 	
AU02112 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02112 	1. Inform Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work.
AU02112 	2. The LUS signs are to be serviced using either a left hand and
AU02112 	   centre lane closure or a right hand and centre lane closure.
AU02112 	   Set up the lane closure as per work instruction Traffic
AU02112 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU02112 	   Plans 39 or 40.
AU02112 	3. Reference Manual
AU02112 	4. At each LUS sign:
AU02112 	   (a) Inspect the sign interior for dislodged relays
AU02112 	   (b) Check that all components are securely mounted
AU02112 	   (c) Check wiring connections for looseness and evidence of
AU02112 	       overheating
AU02112 	   (d) Check globes for secure mounting and replace faulty
AU02112 	       globes
AU02112 	"   (e) Check the enclosure for insect infestations, remove and"
AU02112 	       clean any infestation found
AU02112 	   (f) Check and clean the enclosure of any accumulated debris
AU02112 	   (g) Check the cable glands to enclosure connections for
AU02112 	"       tightness, tighten if loose."
AU02112 	   (h) Check the door fittings and closing mechanisms for
AU02112 	       operation
AU02112 	   (i) Check the cabinet and mounting brackets for security and
AU02112 	       or damage.
AU02112 	   (j) Clean the front facia of sign to remove all accumulated
AU02112 	       dirt and debris using Windex and a soft cloth.
AU02112 	"  (k) At the LUS signs with the LED arrays, (Check the supply"
AU02112 	"      voltage level to the LED array, ensure the voltage is"
AU02112 	      within the limits of 10.5 +/- 0.1V).
AU02112 	"5. Ensure the control room can change the sign status, confirm"
AU02112 	   the sign operation back to the operator.
AU02112 	6. Record successful clean and inspection of the sign by ticking
AU02112 	   on form Domain Tunnel Lane Use Sign Inspection
AU02112 	   TMF-3012-OP-0371.  Indicate with a tick on form Domain Tunnel
AU02112 	   Lane Use Sign Inspection TMF-3012-OP-0371 only when further
AU02112 	   comment is required and record comments in comment area of
AU02112 	   form Domain Tunnel Lane Use Sign Inspection TMF-3012-OP-0371
AU02112 	7. On completion of the job record any outstanding corrective
AU02112 	   actions required in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02112 	   Notify the Electrical Supervisor or his representative of
AU02112 	   any outstanding corrective work required.  Raise a new job
AU02112 	   sheet for any corrective work required.
AU02112 	8. Notify the control room on completion of work.

AU01721 	"       room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact"

AU01721 	   Tunnel Lane 1) Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0071 to the Electrical /

AU01721 	   actions required.

AU01969 	"12 M Inspect, test and clean Tunnel TIMS & FES"
AU01969 	
AU01969 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01969 	1. Inform Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work.
AU01969 	2. The TIMS and FES over the centre and RHS lanes should be
AU01969 	"   serviced together using RHS and Centre Lane closure, LHS"
AU01969 	   TIMS and FES should be serviced using a LHS lane closure.
AU01969 	   This excludes the Sign Message Operation and the Sign Test
AU01969 	"   Result which are carried out on the three signs, LHS, RHS and"
AU01969 	   centre simultaneously from the equipment room analyser.
AU01969 	"3. Reference Manual Symon Services Operation, Training &"
AU01969 	"   Maintenance Manual for TIMS, VSLS & FES  M-STG-TM-29943"
AU01969 	4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01969 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01969 	"   Plans 27, 28."
AU01969 	5. Equipment Room Analysers
AU01969 	   (a) Inspect the TIMS and FES analysers for evidence of burnt
AU01969 	"       or damaged connections on plugs,  electronic cards and"
AU01969 	       wiring.
AU01969 	   (b) Clean the analyser cabinet interiors of any accumulated
AU01969 	       dirt or dust.
AU01969 	   (c) Press the TEST button on the analyser and monitor the
AU01969 	       sign test routine.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in
AU01969 	       Sign Test Result column on the form.
AU01969 	"   (d) Inspect the cabinet for damage, ensuring the door closes"
AU01969 	       and locks securely.
AU01969 	6. TIMS Signs
AU01969 	   (a) Isolate sign power at  the sign circuit breaker within
AU01969 	       the TIMS sign enclosure.
AU01969 	   (b) Check the electronic component boards for evidence of
AU01969 	       burning or arcing.
AU01969 	"   (c) Clean the front fascia of the sign, using Windex and a"
AU01969 	       soft cloth.
AU01969 	   (d) Turn the sign circuit breaker to ON and check the pixel
AU01969 	       operation.  Record in the comments column if more than
AU01969 	      10% of the pixels have failed.
AU01969 	   (e) Check the output of the 12VDC power supply and the inputs
AU01969 	"       to the various drivers and controllers, the voltage"
AU01969 	"       measured, in each case should fall within the range of"
AU01969 	       11V ?0.8V. Record result ( OK or Fail) in the Sign
AU01969 	       inspection column of the form.
AU01969 	   (f) Check the operation and alignment of the Light Dependant
AU01969 	"       Resistor (LDR) by covering the LDR, then by monitoring"
AU01969 	"       the the LEDs on the lighting luminosity board for change,"
AU01969 	       to determine LDR operation.
AU01969 	"   (g) Ensure the front fascia, in the area of the LDR, is"
AU01969 	       clean and completely free of all dirt and grime.
AU01969 	7. FES Signs
AU01969 	   (a) Clean the fitting and perspex of all dirt and grime.
AU01969 	   (b) Check the sign lighting for operation and replace faulty
AU01969 	"       components. (Lighting comprises a selection of 18W, 30W &"
AU01969 	       36W Cool White Fluorescent Tubes.)
AU01969 	   (c) Check with the TCR and confirm TCR operation of sign
AU01969 	       control.
AU01969 	8. Ensure the control room can control the sign via a TEST
AU01969 	"   message change, confirm the sign operation back to the"
AU01969 	   operator.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in the sign message
AU01969 	   operation column of the form.
AU01969 	9. Record the results of TIMS inspections and any comments on
AU01969 	   form TIMS SYSTEM INSPECTION - DOMAIN TUNNEL TIMS SIGNS AND
AU01969 	"   ANALYSERS TMF-3012-OP-0288, and record the result of the FES"
AU01969 	   inspections and any comments on form FES SYSTEM INSPECTION -
AU01969 	"   DOMAIN TUNNEL FES SIGNS AND ANALYSERS TMF-3012-OP-303, for"
AU01969 	"   any test that FAILs, record the details in the comments"
AU01969 	   column of the appropriate form.
AU01969 	"10. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU01969 	"    Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU01969 	    public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU01969 	    equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU01969 	    (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
AU01969 	        Work Done area of the Job Sheet.
AU01969 	11. On completion of the job record anything outside normal
AU01969 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.  Raise a
AU01969 	    new job sheet for any corrective work required.
AU01969 	12. Notify the control room on completion of work.
AU01731 	"12 M Inspect, test and clean Domain Tunnel VSLS signs"""
AU01731 	
AU01731 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01731 	1. Inform Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work.
AU01731 	2. The VSLS on the RHL wall should be serviced using a RHL Lane
AU01731 	"   closure, VSLS units on the LHL wall should be serviced using"
AU01731 	   a LHS lane closure.  This excludes the VSLS Sign Message
AU01731 	   Operation and the Sign Test Result which are carried out on
AU01731 	"   the two signs, LHS and RHS simultaneously from the equipment"
AU01731 	   room analyser.
AU01731 	"3. Reference Manual Symon Services Operation, Training &"
AU01731 	"   Maintenance Manual for TIMS, VSLS & FES  M-STG-TM-29943"
AU01731 	4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01731 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01731 	"   Plans 20, 23, 24, 25, 26 and 29."
AU01731 	5. Equipment Room Analysers
AU01731 	   (a) Inspect the VSLS analyser for evidence of burnt or
AU01731 	"       damaged connections on plugs, electronic cards and"
AU01731 	       wiring.
AU01731 	   (b) Clean the cabinet interior of any accumulated dirt or
AU01731 	       dust.
AU01731 	   (c) Press the TEST button on the analyser and monitor the
AU01731 	       sign test routine.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in
AU01731 	       Sign Test Result column on the form  VSLS Systems
AU01731 	       Inspections Domain Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0300.
AU01731 	"   (d) Inspect the cabinet for damage, ensuring the door closes"
AU01731 	       and locks securely.
AU01731 	6. VSLS signs
AU01731 	   (a) Isolate sign power at  the sign circuit breaker within
AU01731 	       the VSLS sign enclosure.
AU01731 	   (b) Check the electronic component boards for evidence of
AU01731 	       burning or arcing.
AU01731 	"   (c) Clean the front facia of the sign, using Windex and a"
AU01731 	       soft cloth.
AU01731 	   (d) Turn the sign circuit breaker to ON and check the pixel
AU01731 	       operation.  Record in the comments column of the form
AU01731 	       VSLS Systems Inspections Domain Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0300
AU01731 	       if more than 10% of the pixels have failed.
AU01731 	   (e) (i) Check and adjust the output of the 12VDC power supply
AU01731 	           and the inputs to the various drivers and
AU01731 	"           controllers, the voltage measured, in each case must"
AU01731 	           fall within the range of 12.9VDC and 13.1VDC.  Record
AU01731 	           result ( OK or Fail) in the Sign inspection column of
AU01731 	           the form VSLS Systems Inspections Domain Tunnel
AU01731 	           TMF-3012-OP-0300.
AU01731 	"      (ii) On the small VSLS signs (in the tunnel), check and"
AU01731 	           adjust the output of the 12VDC power supply and the
AU01731 	"           inputs to the various drivers and controllers, the"
AU01731 	"           voltage measured, in each case must fall within the"
AU01731 	           range of 10.5VDC and 11VDC.  Record result ( OK or
AU01731 	           Fail) in the Sign inspection column of the form VSLS
AU01731 	           Systems Inspections Domain Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0300.
AU01731 	"     (iii) On the LARGE VSLS signs (outside the tunnels), check"
AU01731 	           and adjust the output of the 12VDC power supply and
AU01731 	"           the inputs to the various drivers and controllers,"
AU01731 	"           the voltage measured, in each case should fall within"
AU01731 	           the range of 12.9VDC and 13.1VDC.  Record the result
AU01731 	           ( OK or Fail) in the Sign inspection column of the
AU01731 	           form VSLS Systems Inspections Domain Tunnel
AU01731 	"           TMF-3012-OP-0300.  The 7.5VDC power  supply, supplies"
AU01731 	"           the VSLS sign Red leds, while the 12VDC power supply,"
AU01731 	           supplies the White Leds.  The Small VSLS signs have 4
AU01731 	           LEDs per pixel while the Large VSLS signs have 3 LEDs
AU01731 	           per pixel.
AU01731 	   (f ) Check the operation and alignment of the Light Dependant
AU01731 	        Resistor (LDR) by
AU01731 	          (i) covering the LDR will cause the display intensity
AU01731 	              to reduce
AU01731 	         (ii) shining a torch onto the LDR will cause the
AU01731 	              display intensity to increase.
AU01731 	         (This function cannot be tested with the present
AU01731 	         configuration).
AU01731 	7. Ensure the control room can control the sign via a TEST
AU01731 	"   message change, confirm the sign operation back to the"
AU01731 	   operator.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in the sign message
AU01731 	   operation column of the form  VSLS Systems Inspections Domain
AU01731 	   Tunnel TMF-3012-OP-0300.
AU01731 	8. Results of inspections and comments are recorded on form VSLS
AU01731 	   SYSTEM INSPECTION - DOMAIN TUNNEL TIMS SIGNS AND ANALYSERS
AU01731 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0300 for tests that FAIL, record details in the"
AU01731 	   comments column of the form VSLS Systems Inspections Domain
AU01731 	9. On completion of the job record any outstanding corrective
AU01731 	   actions required in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01731 	   Raise a new job sheet for any corrective work required.
AU01731 	10. Notify the control room on completion of work.
AU01731 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01731 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01731 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01731 	Note:
AU01731 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01731 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01731 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01731 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01731 	        it's intended function.
AU01731 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01731 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01731 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01731 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01731 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01731 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01731 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01731 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01731 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01731 	        intended function.
AU01731 	"FUNCTIONAL LOCATIONS,,,,,,ASSET DESCRIPTION,,,,   RATING"

AU02090 	03 M Check operation of the Tnl Emergency Paging System
AU02090 	This job is to be performed in conjunction with the testing of
AU02090 	the Fire Telephones at the Tunnel Fire Cabinets.  The manual
AU02090 	"announcement should be ""The following is a Citylink test. One,"
AU02090 	"Two, Three, Four, Five, Six, Seven, Eight, Nine, Ten."""
AU02090 	The message should last about ten seconds.
AU02090 	
AU02090 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02090 	1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing this job.
AU02090 	2. Reference Manual: Australian Sound Service - Emergency Paging System
AU02090 	Manual - M-MCL-CU-20001.
AU02090 	3. Use vehicle arrow board and short term lane stoppage and
AU02090 	"   Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20, 22, 23."
AU02090 	"4. This job involves, whilst visiting all the odd numbered fire"
AU02090 	   cabinets to:
AU02090 	   (a) listen to manual announcements over the emergency loud
AU02090 	       speakers as well as
AU02090 	   (b) at fire cabinet D11 listen to an automatic announcement
AU02090 	       and
AU02090 	   (c) at fire cabinet D17 listen to and ALL announcement
AU02090 	"   (d) listen to the announcement, in each case, and evaluate"
AU02090 	        for:-
AU02090 	       (i) Clarity - e.g. message should be clear and
AU02090 	"           understandable,"
AU02090 	"      (ii) Volume - e.g. Clearly hear message, hear above"
AU02090 	           ambient noise.  A suitable volume should be QUITE
AU02090 	           loud in the tunnel.
AU02090 	     (iii) Listen and be aware for non-functioning loud speakers
AU02090 	           and loud speakers with degraded output.  The speakers
AU02090 	           are mounted at 30m intervals throughout the tunnel
AU02090 	           Record the result of  your evaluation on form TUNNEL
AU02090 	           EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - DOMAIN TUNNEL PA LOUD
AU02090 	           SPEAKER TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0366
AU02090 	"5. On completion of the Job, return the Job sheet and Form"
AU02090 	   TUNNEL EMERGENCY PAGING SYSTEM - DOMAIN TUNNEL PA LOUD
AU02090 	   SPEAKER TEST - TMF-3012-OP-0366 to the Electrical/Electronics
AU02090 	   Supervisor or his representative for evaluation.
AU02090 	6. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the Job.

AU01689 	12 M Routine Maint. of Tunnel Smoke Duct damper actuator
AU01689 	
AU01689 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01689 	1. Approximately 10% of smoke dampers in the tunnel are to be
AU01689 	   inspected annually.
AU01689 	   The Team Leader Electrical shall obtain the previous year
AU01689 	   check sheet TMF-3012-OP-0258 and use to allocated dampers to
AU01689 	   be inspected with this job sheet.
AU01689 	2. Obtain Permit to Work for operation of smoke damper by TCRO.
AU01689 	3. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01689 	4. Reference Manual: TROX Technik - Melbourne City Link Tunnel
AU01689 	"   Project, Operating & Maintenance Instructions Manual"
AU01689 	   M-STG-VE-26100.
AU01689 	"5. Access to the tunnel shall be as per Work Instruction,"
AU01689 	"   Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01689 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 23,24,25, and 26. Use the Plan best suited"
AU01689 	   to the smoke dampers circled for inspection on check sheet
AU01689 	"   """"DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF"
AU01689 	"   DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"""" TMF-3012-OP-0258"
AU01689 	6. Carry out inspection of smoke dampers circled on check sheet
AU01689 	"   DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"""" TMF-3012-OP-0258 using"
AU01689 	   the elevated work platform in B mode.  Note that either the
AU01689 	   LHS or the RHS or both sides of a nominated damper may
AU01689 	   require inspection.
AU01689 	"7. Request the TCRO to open and then close the smoke dampers,"
AU01689 	   that are to be inspected.
AU01689 	8. Observe the damper blades for non-standard operation such as
AU01689 	   (a) dampers that open or close sluggishly
AU01689 	   (b) dampers that  fail to open or close completely
AU01689 	   (c) dampers that move sluggishly.
AU01689 	"   (d) Record an OK or FAIL result on check sheet  """"DOMAIN"
AU01689 	   TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF DOMAIN
AU01689 	"   TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"""" TMF-3012-OP-0258"
AU01689 	9.  Repeat step 8 for all dampers to be inspected.
AU01689 	10. Note the Condition Rating for the dampers tested
AU01689 	11. Record in Work done area of Job sheet any dampers that have
AU01689 	    failed operation and raise new job sheet for repair.
AU01689 	    Priority High P1.
AU01689 	12. Notify the TCR on completion of the job.
AU01689 	"13. On completion of the job, forward check sheet  """"DOMAIN"
AU01689 	    TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER INSPECTION - 12 M INSPECTION OF
AU01689 	"    DOMAIN TUNNEL SMOKE DAMPER OPERATION"""" TMF-3012-OP-0258 to"
AU01689 	"    the Team Leader Electrical or representative for sign off. """
AU01689 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01689 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01689 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01689 	Note:
AU01689 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01689 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01689 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01689 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01689 	        it's intended function.
AU01689 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01689 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01689 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01689 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01689 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01689 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01689 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01689 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01689 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01689 	        intended function.

AU02072 	   for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.

AU02072 	   Treatment Plant Ventilation Fan)
AU02072 	"   (The fan is located on Swan St Substation Building, Southern"
AU02072 	   end of Roof).
AU02072 	   At the switchboard (CITY LINK WATER MANAGEMENT PLANT CONTROL
AU02072 	"   PANEL), switch the fan selector switch (VENTILATION FAN) to"
AU02072 	   the MANUAL position.  Isolate and tag in accordance
AU02072 	"   TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety Work Instruction."
AU02072 	   Circuit breaker K10 inside the panel controls the fan [_ _]
AU02072 	"   (a) Check the inlet grill, for damage and debris that would"
AU02072 	       restrict air flow.  [_ _]
AU02072 	   (b) Check the fan fixings and mountings for
AU02072 	       security.   [_ _]
AU02072 	   (c) Check the motor and fan for any abnormal sounds.  [_ _]
AU02072 	"   (d) Inspect belts for wear, cracks and degradation and"
AU02072 	       replace if required.  [_ _]
AU02072 	"   (e) Check pulleys for alignment, adjust as required.  [_ _]"
AU02072 	   (f) Measure and record in the Work Done area of the job sheet
AU02072 	       the insulation resistance and operating current of the
AU02072 	       motor.  [_ _]
AU02072 	"   (g) Check the duct, piping for damage, corrosion and"
AU02072 	       fixings.  [_ _]
AU02072 	"   (h) Check the gatic covers, over the water treatment plant,"
AU02072 	"      for damage, seating and completeness.   [_ _]"
AU02072 	"4. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU02072 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]

AU02073 	12 M Inspect and maintain DW T'ment Plant SAF
AU02073 	
AU02073 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02073 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU02073 	"2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual"
AU02073 	   for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
AU02073 	3. Carry out the 3 monthly inspection and test the fan
AU02073 	   functionality.
AU02073 	4. Notify TCR of intention to use local control of fan for
AU02073 	   maintenance. [_ _]
AU02073 	5. Work plan for the DW T'MENT PLT SAF (Water Treatment Plant
AU02073 	   Ventilation fan)
AU02073 	   (a) At the switchboard (CITY LINK WATER MANAGEMENT PLANT
AU02073 	"       CONTROL PANEL), switch the fan selector switch"
AU02073 	      (VENTILATION FAN) to the MANUAL position.   Isolate and
AU02073 	"       tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety"
AU02073 	       Work Instruction.  Circuit breaker K10 inside the panel
AU02073 	       controls the fan [_ _]
AU02073 	   (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU02073 	       windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU02073 	       the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU02073 	       in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU02073 	   (c) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU02073 	       anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
AU02073 	       Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU02073 	       specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU02073 	"   (d) Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where"
AU02073 	       applicable.  [_ _]
AU02073 	   (e) Check the condition of any  flexible duct
AU02073 	       connections. [_ _]
AU02073 	   (f) Check the fan mounting spring support fastenings and
AU02073 	       tension. [_ _]
AU02073 	"   (g) Check the impellor for build-up of dirt, clearances from"
AU02073 	       housing and alignment.  [_ _]
AU02073 	"   (h) At the switchboard, remove the safety tags in accordance"
AU02073 	"       with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then switch the AUTO/MANUAL/OFF"
AU02073 	       selector switch to the AUTO position.
AU02073 	   (i) Run the fan for 5 minutes and monitor for any abnormal
AU02073 	       conditions.   [_ _]
AU02073 	"6. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU02073 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
AU02073 	7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU02073 	Record Readings Below
AU02073 	----------------------------------------------------------------

AU02073 	  MOTOR    |                   MOhms |                     A   |

AU02021 	current HV vicinity permit.

AU02021 	   the Waste Water Management Plant to the sewer in progress.
AU02021 	   If a discharge is in progress then disregard this job for
AU02021 	   this week.

AU02021 	       the Work Done area of the Job Sheet only if the water
AU02021 	"       level is greater than 0.5 mts.  Water level is to be ,,,,,,"
AU02021 	recorded by using the dip-stick.

AU02021 	        completion.  [_ _]

AU02021 	"       level is greater then 0.5 mts.  Water level is to be ,,,,,,"
AU02021 	"4. Check that valves V2, V5 & V6 are fully closed and that they"
AU02021 	   are locked in the closed position.  If the valves are not
AU02021 	   closed and locked then close and lock the valves.
AU02021 	5. Return the completed job sheet to the Civil Team Leader or
AU02021 	   his representative who will forward any readings greater that
AU02021 	   0.5 mts to the TLO Environmental Manager .
AU02021 	Enter Recordings Below
AU02021 	Storage Tank    ___________________  mts.
AU02021 	Batch Tank       ____________________  mts.

AU02152 	"and inspections of the Stairway and Electrics, prior to leaving"

AU02152 	"fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,"
AU02152 	"Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,"
AU02152 	"Rodent bait station, Cold Gal."

AU02152 	installations and cleaning of the stairway areas.

AU02152 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02152 	2. This Job is for the inspection and clean of the emergency
AU02152 	"   stairways e.g. External and Internal stairway to YC Pump Stn,"

AU02152 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]

AU02152 	"1. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,"
AU02152 	"   including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace or"
AU02152 	   repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]

AU02152 	   lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]

AU02152 	   anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the job sheet and

AU02152 	   actions.  [_ _]

AU02152 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
AU02152 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02152 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
AU02152 	   Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]

AU02152 	   furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
AU02152 	   obstruction.  [_ _]

AU02152 	   repair as required and record in the Work Done area of the
AU02152 	   Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
AU02152 	   of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
AU02152 	4. Clean dust and remove cobwebs from interior walls and
AU02152 	   ceilings.  [_ _]

AU02152 	   including accumulated leaves and debris at top of
AU02152 	   stairways.  [_ _]
AU02152 	6. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces and stairs.  [_ _]
AU02152 	7. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
AU02152 	9. Visually inspect all metalwork for damage or corrosion.
AU02152 	   Repair and or remove corrosion and clean then cover with
AU02152 	   Cold Gal.  [_ _]
AU02152 	10. Carry out Exterior Checks of relevant area(s) (where
AU02152 	    applicable).
AU02152 	    (a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the building
AU02152 	"        (if applicable) for damage, erosion,  graffiti,"
AU02152 	        corrosion.  [_ _]
AU02152 	"    (b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls,"
AU02152 	"        roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks and"
AU02152 	"        or blockages, remove any debris or materials that could"
AU02152 	        cause a blockage.  [_ _]
AU02152 	    (c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding the
AU02152 	"        building for erosion and damage to surfaces, fences,"
AU02152 	"        gates, pavements   [_ _]"

AU02152 	    (where appropriate).  [_ _]

AU02152 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
AU02152 	"        e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"
AU02152 	    (b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]

AU02164 	
AU02164 	"Before you start the inspection, make sure that you are carrying the"
AU02164 	"camera, so that you can take any photographs of your observations."
AU02164 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02164 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this work.
AU02164 	2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
AU02164 	3. Enter the Burnley Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel (EET) at the Burnley
AU02164 	Stairwell and
AU02164 	   carry out the following inspections over the entire length of the
AU02164 	EET.
AU02164 	4. Visually inspect the EXIT signs for operation (12 off).  Record on
AU02164 	"the form """"Emergency"
AU02164 	"   Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"""" TMF-"
AU02164 	3012-OP-0374 any  EXIT
AU02164 	   sign that is not functioning correctly.
AU02164 	5. Visually inspect the stairwell and EET lighting for operation.
AU02164 	 Record  on the form
AU02164 	"   """"Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"""""
AU02164 	TMF- 3012-OP-0374
AU02164 	   all instances of three (3) successive light fittings not functional.
AU02164 	"6. Visually inspect all signage for cleanliness, damage and or damage"
AU02164 	tofixings. Record
AU02164 	"    on the form  """"Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly"
AU02164 	"Inspection"""""
AU02164 	   TMF- 3012-OP-0374 any signage requiring further attention.
AU02164 	"7. Visually inspect walls, floors and roofs for ground water leaks."
AU02164 	 Record on the form
AU02164 	"    """"Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"""""
AU02164 	"    any leaks. Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage), LEAK TYPE"
AU02164 	"(Drip, Spray,"
AU02164 	"     Running), POSITION (Roof, North wall, South wall, Floor)."
AU02164 	"8. Visually inspect floor for Trip Hazards e.g. raised grates,"
AU02164 	"accumulated debris, deposits of"
AU02164 	"   leak sealant, water puddles etc.  Remove temporary hazards and"
AU02164 	recordall occurrences
AU02164 	"   of hazards and their location on the form  """"Emergency  Egress Tunnel"
AU02164 	Inspection Record  -
AU02164 	"   Weekly Inspection"""" TMF- 3012-OP-0374"
AU02164 	9. Visually inspect
AU02164 	   (a) and operate all emergency egress doors (e.g. Tunnel to EET - at
AU02164 	each cross passage
AU02164 	          and
AU02164 	   (b) doors within egress tunnel - for operation and or damage and
AU02164 	   (c)  ensure all doors to equipment rooms are locked.  Record on the
AU02164 	"form  """"Emergency"
AU02164 	"          Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection""""  TMF-"
AU02164 	3012-OP-0374 the
AU02164 	          door location and a description of the repairs required.
AU02164 	10. Visually inspect all drainage and pits for evidence of blockage and
AU02164 	water over the floor.
AU02164 	"      Record LOCATION (chainage, Cross passage) TYPE (Pit, Drain, Pipe)"
AU02164 	"      POSITION (North side, South side, Centre).  Record on the form"
AU02164 	" """"Emergency Egress"
AU02164 	"     Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"""" TMF- 3012-OP-0374"
AU02164 	the location and
AU02164 	      description of any blockage or flooding.
AU02164 	"11. Visually inspect all EET and Stairwell fitments for damage,"
AU02164 	"corrosion, trip hazards,"
AU02164 	     obstructions (from walls or roofs) that are apparent.  Record on
AU02164 	"the form  """"Emergency"
AU02164 	"     Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  - Weekly Inspection"""" TMF-"
AU02164 	3012-OP-0374 the location
AU02164 	    and a description of the repairs and or obstruction.
AU02164 	12. Visually inspect for evidence of rodent infestation.  Record on the
AU02164 	     of any sightings.
AU02164 	13. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
AU02164 	14. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all lights OFF.
AU02164 	"15. Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet any abnormal"
AU02164 	parameters found.
AU02164 	     Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
AU02164 	"16. Ensure the form  """"Emergency Egress Tunnel Inspection Record  -"
AU02164 	"Weekly  Inspection"""""
AU02164 	     TMF- 3012-OP-0374 is returned to the CIVIL team leader or his
AU02164 	representative for
AU02164 	      evaluation and recording of new leaks onto the Burnley Tunnel
AU02164 	Emergency Egress
AU02164 	      Tunnel Leak Repair programme.  The Civil team leader is to ensure
AU02164 	any
AU02164 	      outstanding works are scheduled.
AU02164 	"17. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work."""
AU02159 	12 M Inspect /Clean BT Emergency Egress Tunnel

AU01878 	02 M Record Extensometer Readings of the BT slabs
AU01878 	
AU01878 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01878 	1. Notify the control prior to commencing the work.
AU01878 	2. Lane closures to access the Burnley tunnel shall be as per
AU01878 	"   Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and"
AU01878 	"   Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059  * Plan 39. ( 60kph )."
AU01878 	3. Reference documents:
AU01878 	"   (a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE"
AU01878 	       TMI-3012-OP-0031.
AU01878 	"   (b) Melbourne CityLink Project, Southern Link, Operations and"
AU01878 	       Maintenance Manual Tunnel Drainage Stage 2. R-STG-EN-006
AU01878 	"       and Transfield Obayashi JV,"
AU01878 	   (c) Operations & Maintenance Tanked Tunnel Drainage Works
AU01878 	       Report PSM407.R34 December 2000 R-SDG-TU-134.
AU01878 	"   (d) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel Long"
AU01878 	       Term Monitoring of Twin Anchored Slabs. Report PSM407.R30
AU01878 	"       September 2000, R-SDG-TU-130."
AU01878 	"   (f) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel"
AU01878 	       Extensometer and Piezometer Reading Procedures. Report
AU01878 	"       PSM500.R11 June 2001, R-SDG-TU-211."
AU01878 	4. Location:
AU01878 	   Twenty-eight extensometers are located along the length of
AU01878 	   the twin anchor zone of the tanked section of the Burnley
AU01878 	"   Tunnel, roughly in the centre of the middle lane."
AU01878 	5. Purpose:
AU01878 	   The extensometers monitor any movement of the invert (floor)
AU01878 	   slab.  Small variations in the extensometer tips can be
AU01878 	   measured and assessed to indicate whether a slab has moved
AU01878 	   and whether the twin anchors have become overloaded
AU01878 	   (Ref. R-SDG-TU 130 Rev B) due to the slab movement.
AU01878 	6. Carry out Extensometer measurement.
AU01878 	6.1 (a) Clean the base of the extensometer probe with a clean
AU01878 	        rag. (Note: Ensure extra battery is in pouch) prior to
AU01878 	        performing readings.
AU01878 	    (b) Plug the lead for the extensometer probe into readout
AU01878 	"        unit, switch the extensometer on using the right button,"
AU01878 	        select channel 1 with the knob.
AU01878 	    (c) With the probe vertical and the base clear of any
AU01878 	"        obstructions, ensure the digital readout  reads approx."
AU01878 	        11.5mm.  This represents the djusted zero value.
AU01878 	    (d) Ensure the extensometer probe is kept free of grit at
AU01878 	        all times.
AU01878 	6.2 (a) Locate the cast iron cover over the extensometer tip in
AU01878 	        road surface.  Spray the bolts liberally with CRC.
AU01878 	"    (b) Using the socket, slowly and carefully remove the"
AU01878 	        stainless steel bolts.  If the bolt(s) are excessively
AU01878 	"        tight, apply more CRC and allow  sufficient time for the"
AU01878 	        CRC to penetrate down the thread.
AU01878 	    (c) Lift the cast iron cap off and place to one side.
AU01878 	6.3 (a) Remove the plastic cap covering the brass bush and pin.
AU01878 	        Do not loose the plastic cap.
AU01878 	"    (b) If the recess housing the bush or pin, contains water,"
AU01878 	        then remove the water using the wet/dry vacuum
AU01878 	        (Ensure you take a Generator & leads).
AU01878 	        Wipe the brass bush and pin surface areas are thoroughly
AU01878 	        cleaned of all dirt and grit.
AU01878 	    (c) Both the bush and pin must be clean and remain clean
AU01878 	        during reading (i.e. no grit shall be allowed to wash
AU01878 	        back onto the bush or pin surfaces).
AU01878 	6.4 (a) Place the extensometer probe over the brass pin and hold
AU01878 	        the probe perpendicular to the surface of the bush
AU01878 	        (i.e. generally  vertical).
AU01878 	    (b) Apply a firm downwards pressure to the probe and allow
AU01878 	        10 seconds for the reading to be established.
AU01878 	6.5 Record the readings on form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL - SLAB
AU01878 	"    MOVEMENT TMF-3012-OP-0259.  Compare with previous reading,"
AU01878 	"    and if the difference is 0.2mm or more, check for"
AU01878 	    cleanliness of the extensometer surface and repeat the
AU01878 	    reading.
AU01878 	"6.6 (a) Replace the plastic cap, and cast iron cover."
AU01878 	"    (b) Apply grease to thread of the bolts, and screw the bolts"
AU01878 	"        back into their holes using the socket, until they are a"
AU01878 	        snug tight fit.  Report in the Work Done area of Job
AU01878 	"        sheet any covers with bolts missing, Replace missing"
AU01878 	        bolts during inspection.
AU01878 	7. Repeat step 6 for each extensometer test point along the
AU01878 	    tunnel.
AU01878 	8. Notify the Control room on completion of the Job.
AU01878 	9. Ensure a copy of the completed form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
AU01878 	   SLAB MOVEMENT TMF-3012-OP-0259 is forwarded to the Civil Team
AU01878 	   Leader or his representative for evaluation on completion of
AU01878 	   the job.
AU01872 	02 W Record Piezometer Readings BT water table pressures
AU01872 	
AU01872 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01872 	1. Notify the control prior to commencing the work.
AU01872 	2. Lane closures to access the Burnley tunnel shall be as per
AU01872 	"   Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and"
AU01872 	"   Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 25 or 26."
AU01872 	3. Reference documents:
AU01872 	"   (a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE"
AU01872 	       TMI-3012-OP-0031.
AU01872 	"   (b) Melbourne CityLink Project, Southern Link, Operations and"
AU01872 	       Maintenance Manual Tunnel Drainage Stage 2. R-STG-EN-006
AU01872 	"       and Transfield Obayashi JV,"
AU01872 	   (c) Operations & Maintenance Tanked Tunnel Drainage Works
AU01872 	       Report PSM407.R34 December 2000 R-SDG-TU-134.
AU01872 	"   (d) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture, Burnley Tunnel Long"
AU01872 	       Term Monitoring of Twin Anchored Slabs.  Report
AU01872 	"       PSM407.R30 September 2000, R-SDG-TU-130."
AU01872 	   (e) Transfield Obayashi Joint Venture Extensometer and
AU01872 	       Piezometer Readings Procedures Report PSM500.R11  June
AU01872 	       2001   R-SDG-TU-211  Rev A.
AU01872 	4. Location:
AU01872 	   Eighty-six piezometers are located along the length of the
AU01872 	   tanked section of the Burnley Tunnel.  Forty-three are
AU01872 	"   mounted on the south side wall, and Forty-three mounted on"
AU01872 	   the north side wall.  They highest test point is located up
AU01872 	   to 3.5m above the road surface on the tunnel walls.
AU01872 	5. Purpose:
AU01872 	   The Piezometer test points are used to monitor groundwater
AU01872 	   pressures on the outside of the tunnel wall.  The pressure
AU01872 	   reading is then directly related to the groundwater head.
AU01872 	6. Carry out Piezometer readings:
AU01872 	6.1 (a) Loosen the bolt on one side of the stainless steel cover
AU01872 	        and rotate the cover to reveal the quick connect
AU01872 	        pressure coupling behind.
AU01872 	    (b) Wipe the quick connect pressure coupling clean with a
AU01872 	        rag.
AU01872 	    (c) A ladder will be required to reach the piezometers in
AU01872 	        the central section of the tunnel.  A second person may
AU01872 	        be required to hold the ladder in place.
AU01872 	"6.2 (a) Prior to each reading, Vent the Druck digital pressure"
AU01872 	        indicator using the tap on the hose of the machine to
AU01872 	        allow the pressures within the instrument to equalise.
AU01872 	    (b) Connect the Druck digital pressure indicator to the
AU01872 	        quick connect coupling.  Pull back the sleeve on the
AU01872 	        Druck digital pressure indicator connection and then
AU01872 	        push the connection of the Druck digital pressure
AU01872 	        indicator connection onto the piezometer connection.
AU01872 	6.3 (a) Press the  I/O button to switch the unit on.
AU01872 	    (b) Ensure the reading is set to Kilopascals (kpa) and set
AU01872 	        to zero.
AU01872 	"    (c) To obtain consistent readings, hold the Druck digital"
AU01872 	        pressure indicator at the same level as the piezometer
AU01872 	        tip during the reading.
AU01872 	"    (d) Allow the reading to stabilise, and record reading on"
AU01872 	        form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL - GROUNDWATER PRESSURE
AU01872 	        TMF-3012-OP-0229.
AU01872 	        Note that some of  the readings may stabilise in a few
AU01872 	"        seconds, although some other readings may require a few"
AU01872 	        minutes to stabilise.
AU01872 	    (e) Vent the Druck digital pressure indicator between
AU01872 	        readings.
AU01872 	6.4 Record the results on form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
AU01872 	"    GROUNDWATER PRESSURE"""" TMF-3012-OP-0229."
AU01872 	6.5 Replace the stainless steel cover and re-tighten the bolt.
AU01872 	7. Repeat Step 6 for the balance of the piezometer test points.
AU01872 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01872 	"   parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet & also ,,"
AU01872 	inform the Team Leader.
AU01872 	9. Notify the Control room on completion of the Job.
AU01872 	10. Ensure a copy of the completed form MONTHLY BURNLEY TUNNEL -
AU01872 	   GROUNDWATER PRESSURE TMF-3012-OP-0229 is forwarded to the
AU01872 	   Civil Team Leader or his representative for evaluation on
AU01872 	   completion of the job.  Results that are not in accordance
AU01872 	   with baseline values would indicate a change in the state of
AU01872 	   the groundwater storage.  The operation of the Groundwater
AU01872 	   recharge systems should be checked for correct operation.
AU01936 	03 M Measure & report on BT GW TNL Bay flows in drainage sys
AU01936 	
AU01936 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01936 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01936 	"2. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01936 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01936 	"   Plans 21, 22, 25, 26."
AU01936 	3. References:
AU01936 	"   (a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE"
AU01936 	       TMI-3012-OP-0031.
AU01936 	   (b) Operation & Maintenance Manual - Tunnel Drainage Stage 2
AU01936 	       Design Report R-STG-EN-006 Rev 1.
AU01936 	4. At each bay flow groundwater pit.
AU01936 	"   (a) Measure the Volume/time water flow from each agi-pipe,"
AU01936 	"       in-turn, into the pit.  Readings are carried out by"
AU01936 	"       collecting the water, from an agi-pipe, in a calibrated"
AU01936 	       measuring container for 5 to 10 seconds.
AU01936 	         e.g. 800 mls/10 secs
AU01936 	              450 mls/10 secs
AU01936 	              1 litre/8 secs
AU01936 	       The results are then measured and recorded on the form
AU01936 	       BURNLEY TUNNEL - BAY FLOW MONITORING TMF-3012-OP-0235.
AU01936 	5. (a) Carry out pit inspections on bay flow groundwater pits
AU01936 	"       201, 202, 203, 238, 239, 240, 241, 242, 243, 244, 245,"
AU01936 	"       246, 247 & 251 whilst doing the above readings and"
AU01936 	       record pit conditions on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01936 	       GROUNDWATER PIT AND PIPE INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0232.
AU01936 	       This form is supplied with the six weekly Burnley Tunnel
AU01936 	"       pit inspections, segment flow and bore level job sheet."
AU01936 	   (b) Use a torch to inspect each pipe and associated pits for
AU01936 	       cleanliness and the accumulation of calcites.
AU01936 	   (c) Record the build up of calcites in the pipes and pits in
AU01936 	       Millimetres (mm).  Cleaning and removal of calcites is
AU01936 	       required when a build up of 50mm occurs in a 200mm pipe
AU01936 	       or a 25mm in a 100mm pipe.
AU01936 	"   (d) Record a description of the calcite. e.g. slimy, milky"
AU01936 	       or hard etc.
AU01936 	   (e  Record the results on form BURNLEY TUNNEL GROUNDWATER PIT
AU01936 	       AND PIPE INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0232.
AU01936 	6. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01936 	7. Ensure the completed copy of the forms:
AU01936 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL - BAY FLOW MONITORING TMF-3012-OP-0235 and
AU01936 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL GROUNDWATER PIT AND PIPE INSPECTIONS
AU01936 	   TMF-3012-OP-0232  are forwarded to the Civil Team Leader or
AU01936 	   representative for evaluation on completion of the job and
AU01936 	   prior to the end of the shift.  Civil Team Leader or
AU01936 	   representative is to record and raise actions (job sheets)
AU01936 	   and sign off each form and raise any actions (Job sheets) for
AU01936 	   further inspections or cleaning.

AU01947 	"   Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and"
AU01947 	"   Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24, 26."
AU01947 	4. Inspect spoon drain along the LHS new Jersey Barrier for
AU01947 	"   debris, accumulated silt and or foreign materials that may"
AU01947 	   cause damming or blockages.  Remove any loose items that may
AU01947 	   cause problems in the drainage system.
AU01947 	5. Inspect transitions from spoon drains to down pipes for
AU01947 	   materials liable to cause blockages.  Remove all material
AU01947 	   from transition point.

AU01947 	"   debris and blockages, remove any loose debris from within the"
AU01947 	   drain.

AU01947 	   representitive on comp[letion of the job.

AU02003 	       Inspections  TMF-3012-OP-0301.

AU02003 	   (c) Record the buildup of calcites in the pipes and pits in
AU02003 	       millimetres (mm).  When a buildup of 20mm occurs in a
AU02003 	"       100mm pipe, cleaning is required."
AU02003 	"   (d) If readings differ markedly from previous reading, then"
AU02003 	       take measurements again to confirm results.
AU02003 	"6. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU02003 	   of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02003 	   actions required.

AU02003 	   wall and floor in the comment section of the form Burnley
AU02003 	   Tunnel Emergency Egress Tunnel - Groundwater Pit Inspections
AU02003 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0301, recording the adjacent chainage marker and"
AU02003 	   adjacent cross passages.

AU02003 	   Egress Tunnel - Groundwater Pit Inspections  TMF-3012-OP-0301
AU02003 	   is returned to the civil Team Leader or his representative to
AU02003 	"   record and sign off, and raise any actions (job sheets) for"
AU02003 	   further inspection or cleaning.
AU01874 	"06 W Meas, report on BT V-Ntch  flow, GW & DW Pits, Bore Lvl"
AU01874 	** Prior to commencement Maintenance Crew to be issued white
AU01874 	   disposable overalls to be worn  whilst carrying out Tunnel
AU01874 	   Drainage tasks.
AU01874 	
AU01874 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01874 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01874 	"2. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01874 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01874 	"   Plans 21, 22, 25, 26"
AU01874 	3. Reference:
AU01874 	"   (a) Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE"
AU01874 	       TMI-3012-OP-0031.
AU01874 	   (b) Operation & Maintenance Manual - Tunnel Drainage Stage 2
AU01874 	       Design Report R-STG-EN-006 Rev 1.
AU01874 	4. Civil Team Leader or representative is to:
AU01874 	   (a) Select groundwater and dirty water pits to be inspected
AU01874 	       on forms BURNLEY TUNNEL GROUND WATER INSPECTIONS
AU01874 	       TMF-3012-OP-0232 and
AU01874 	       BURNLEY TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTIONS
AU01874 	       TMF-3012-OP-0253 respectively.  Selection should be with
AU01874 	       the knowledge of past results and a random selection
AU01874 	       including examination of previous inspections carried out
AU01874 	       as part of the V Notch and Bay Flow inspections
AU01874 	   (b) Previous inspection forms are to be issued to the
AU01874 	       maintenance crew to compare results when carrying out
AU01874 	       inspections.
AU01874 	"   (c) V-Notch Pits 14A, 66, 204 & 237 shall be inspected on"
AU01874 	       each occasion.
AU01874 	5. (a) Inspect the groundwater pits circled on BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01874 	"       GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION""""  TMF-3012-OP-0232."
AU01874 	       (i) Use a torch to inspect each pipe and associated pits
AU01874 	           for cleanliness and the accumulation of calcites.
AU01874 	      (ii) Record the build up of calcites in the pipes and pits
AU01874 	           in Millimetres (mm).  When a build up of 50mm occurs
AU01874 	           in a 200mm pipe or a 25mm in a 100mm pipe.  Cleaning
AU01874 	           is required.
AU01874 	"     (iii) Record a description of the calcite. e.g. slimy,"
AU01874 	           milky or hard etc.
AU01874 	      (iv) Record the results on form BURNLEY TUNNEL GROUNDWATER
AU01874 	           PIT INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0232.
AU01874 	   (b) Inspect the Dirtywater pits circled on BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01874 	       DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0253. Use a torch
AU01874 	       to inspect each pipe and associated pits for cleanliness
AU01874 	       and the accumulation of debris.  Record the related
AU01874 	"       details regarding accumulation of silts, debris, and"
AU01874 	       other foreign materials within pits on the form.
AU01874 	   (c) Ensure pit covers are replaced and seated correctly after
AU01874 	       each pit inspection.
AU01874 	6. V-Notch Readings
AU01874 	    (a) Prior to taking readings of dirty water (Right hand side
AU01874 	        of tunnel) pit numbers 14A & 66 and Ground water (Left
AU01874 	"        hand side of tunnel) pit numbers 204 & 237, ensure the"
AU01874 	        V-notch  weir is clear of calcites and debris.  Clean
AU01874 	        thoroughly if required.
AU01874 	    (b) Use a measuring stick obtain the depth of the V-notch
AU01874 	        flow by
AU01874 	        (i) Place the stick in the cup
AU01874 	       (ii) Remove the stick and measure the height of the water
AU01874 	            mark on the stick.
AU01874 	    (c) Record the depth of water flowing over the V-Notch weir
AU01874 	        in mm on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT
AU01874 	"        FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & RATE OF RISE"
AU01874 	        TMF-3012-OP-0234.
AU01874 	"    (d) If readings differ markedly from previous readings, then"
AU01874 	        take measurement again to confirm results.
AU01874 	    (e) Note that inspection V-Notch pits is to be carried out
AU01874 	       as per step 5.
AU01874 	7. Swan Street Groundwater Pit Inflow Readings
AU01874 	"   (a) Once V-Notch 221has been read, then proceed to the Swan"
AU01874 	       Street Pumping Station to take the rate of inflow
AU01874 	       reading.
AU01874 	   (b) Proceed to the Pump Control centre
AU01874 	   (c) Notify the TCR that all pumps are to be switched OFF.
AU01874 	   (d) Switch OFF all pumps (Have an electrician perform this
AU01874 	       duty).
AU01874 	   (e) Return back to the sump pumping room and close all three
AU01874 	       gate valves.
AU01874 	   (f) Return to the pump control centre and start by recording
AU01874 	"       the sump level, then 10 minutes later take another"
AU01874 	       reading of the sump level.
AU01874 	"   (g) Record the sump start and finish level, in millimetres,"
AU01874 	"       on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS,"
AU01874 	       GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & RATE OF RISE TMF-3012-OP-0234.
AU01874 	   (h) Record on the inspection sheet any thing out of the
AU01874 	       ordinary.
AU01874 	   (i) Return all gate valves to their normal OPEN condition and
AU01874 	       switch the pumps back to automatic operation. Then
AU01874 	       proceed with the rest of the readings and inspections.
AU01874 	8. Burnley Tunnel Groundwater Bore Level  (located between fire
AU01874 	   cabinets B45 & B46 RHS).
AU01874 	"   (a) Remove the BT bore-hole cover, then lower a string with a"
AU01874 	       weight attached into the bore-hole until the weight
AU01874 	       touches the bottom of the bore-hole.
AU01874 	"   (b) Mark the string with a marker or pen, ensuring that the"
AU01874 	       weight is just touching the bottom and that there is no
AU01874 	       undue slack in the string.
AU01874 	   (c) Measure and record the total length of the string (Total
AU01874 	       depth of bore-hole in millimetres)
AU01874 	   (d) Measure and record the total length of the string that
AU01874 	       was submerged in the bore-hole water (Depth of
AU01874 	       groundwater in bore-hole in millimetres).
AU01874 	   (e) Record the details on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE -
AU01874 	"       SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & RATE OF RISE"
AU01874 	       TMF-3012-OP-0234.
AU01874 	   (f ) Ensure the cover is replaced and seated correctly.
AU01874 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01874 	10. Ensure a completed copy of the forms BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01874 	"    GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0232, BURNLEY"
AU01874 	    TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTIONS  TMF-3012-OP-0253 and
AU01874 	"    BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE"
AU01874 	    LEVELS & RATE OF RISE TMF-3012-OP-0234 are forwarded to the
AU01874 	    Civil Team Leader or representative on completion of the job
AU01874 	    and prior to end of shift.  Civil Team Leader or
AU01874 	    representative is to record and sign off each form and raise
AU01874 	    any actions (job sheets) for further inspection or cleaning
AU01874 	    Increases in the flows measured in groundwater pits 204 &
AU01874 	    237 should be followed up with a piezometer measurement for
AU01874 	    the Burnley Tunnel.
AU01880 	12 M Flush and clean BT EET Bay No-Fines as specified.
AU01880 	"Please Note: The water meter, mounted on the special hydrant"
AU01880 	"connection reads in litres, with each digit on the rightmost red"
AU01880 	wheel being equal to one litre.
AU01880 	"e.g. with a reading, showing all twos, the reading would"
AU01880 	"represent 22,222,222 litres."
AU01880 	
AU01880 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01880 	1. Ensure tunnel closure permits are arranged.
AU01880 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01880 	"3. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, traffic"
AU01880 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01880 	   Plans 25 & 26.
AU01880 	4. Cleaning of the no-fines is to be carried out in accordance
AU01880 	"   with procedure TMI-3012-OP-0025.   Reference Manual, Southern"
AU01880 	"   Link Operations and Maintenance Manual, Tunnel Drainage,"
AU01880 	   Stage 2  R-STG-EN-006.  Drainage bays are defined in Drawing
AU01880 	   Nos. STG-CI-2150 to 2154.  The bays are approx. 60 mts apart.
AU01880 	5. (a) Locate the two (2) injection points (approx 1 mt apart)
AU01880 	   (b) Locate and open both the upstream and downstream pits of
AU01880 	       the groundwater system.
AU01880 	   (c) Open the upstream dirty water pit and remove the cap from
AU01880 	       the 100 dia pipe and check if a flow is present.  Any
AU01880 	       flows in the upstream dirty water pit may be a sign that
AU01880 	       the no-fines is not functioning correctly.
AU01880 	6. Using the special hydrant to flushing point pipe and metering
AU01880 	"   system, connect the water from the hydrant to the injection"
AU01880 	   points and inject water at the rate and maximum pressure
AU01880 	   shown in the table below.
AU01880 	---------------------------------------------------------------
AU01880 	 Bay    | Specified Flow rate       |     Max Flow Pressure
AU01880 	        |    (litres/s)             |          kPa (psi)
AU01880 	----------------------------------------------------------------
AU01880 	 Bay 1  | 0.5   (20s for 10lt)      |         100 (15)
AU01880 	 Bay 11 | 0.5   (bucket)            |         100 (15)
AU01880 	 All other bays in |                                           |
AU01880 	 Eastbound Tunnel  | 1.2  (8s for 10lt)|      100 (15)
AU01880 	 Westbound Tunnel  | 1.2  (bucket)     |      100 (15)
AU01880 	 EET Bays          |  0.5              |      100 (15)
AU01880 	7. (a) Observe and record the flow rates (using a graduated
AU01880 	"       measuring bucket and timing) before, during and after"
AU01880 	       flushing in the pits for each bay.  Record the results on
AU01880 	       BURNLEY EE TUNNEL  NO-FINES FLUSHING DETAIL
AU01880 	       TMF-3012-OP-0238.
AU01880 	   (b) Increased flowrate and water quality should be observed
AU01880 	       for any milkyness in flushed water (which indicates
AU01880 	       removal of calcite) will indicate signs of satisfactory
AU01880 	       flushing..
AU01880 	   (c) Flushing shall be continuous for a minimum of 1 hour for
AU01880 	       each bay.
AU01880 	"8. Determine pH of water from each bay before, during and after"
AU01880 	   flushing.  Use Indicator paper and compare with colour chart
AU01880 	   for result.  Record results on form BURNLEY EE TUNNEL
AU01880 	   NO-FINES FLUSHING DETAIL TMF-3012-OP-0238.
AU01880 	"9. Replace all covers on completing each bay, prior to moving to"
AU01880 	   the next.
AU01880 	10. Ensure the completed job sheet and the attached form
AU01880 	    TMF-3012-OP-0238 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader on
AU01880 	    completion of the job.
AU01880 	"11. Record anything outside normal parameters in the Work Done"""
AU01880 	    area of the Job sheet.
AU01880 	12. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01980 	12 M Joint Leakage Drain Inspections & Cleaning
AU01980 	
AU01980 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01980 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01980 	2. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01980 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01980 	"   Plans 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26."
AU01980 	   In the work done area record:
AU01980 	   a. Any deviations from the plan.
AU01980 	   b. Lane closure start time.
AU01980 	   c. Lane closure finish time.
AU01980 	   d. Weather conditions.
AU01980 	3. Joint Leakage Drains (JLD) are located on the outside of the
AU01980 	   left and right hand lanes of the tanked section of the
AU01980 	   Burnley Tunnel.
AU01980 	"4. Inspect JLDrains for water flow, blockages, deposits and"
AU01980 	   conditions.  Record the details for each drain on form
AU01980 	   Burnley Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain  TMF-3012-OP-0275.
AU01980 	5. The JLD's are inspected via an inspection point which is a
AU01980 	   square Gatic plate with a hinged lid. This lid is held secure
AU01980 	   in position by a Philips head screw.
AU01980 	6. Access both ends of drain by unscrewing covers in both the
AU01980 	   LHL and the RHL.
AU01980 	"   (a) To inspect the drain sets, shine the torch down one open"
AU01980 	"       cover, then at the corresponding open cover, using the"
AU01980 	"       extendable mirror, look for the lighted torch."
AU01980 	   (b) Record the condition of the pipe e.g. the cleanliness
AU01980 	       and / or blockage of the drain on form Burnley Tunnel
AU01980 	       Joint Leakage Drain  TMF-3012-OP-0275.
AU01980 	   (c) Record the condition of each drain e.g. buildup of
AU01980 	"       calcite, slime, silt etc and whether or not there is a"
AU01980 	       flow of water present.
AU01980 	"     **Use Condition Words :  WET,  DRY,  CLEAR, OBSTRUCTED and"
AU01980 	       if obstructed record the action that was taken to clear
AU01980 	       the obstruction ( ie:  hydrant flushed or Jet flushed).
AU01980 	"7. If there is water flow present, then at the dirty water pit,"
AU01980 	   inspect the Dirty Water pit where the flow enters (If it does
AU01980 	   enter into a pit).  Measure and record the flow and elapsed
AU01980 	   time for on form Burnley Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain
AU01980 	   TMF-3012-OP-0275.
AU01980 	"8. Record all details on the inspection sheet, as all the"
AU01980 	   information is important.
AU01980 	9. Ensure all the pit covers and Gatic covers are closed and
AU01980 	   secured on completion of each inspection.
AU01980 	10. Ensure a completed copy of the form Burnley Tunnel Joint
AU01980 	    Leakage Drain TMF-3012-OP-0275. are forwarded to  the Civil
AU01980 	    Team Leader or representative on completion of the job and
AU01980 	    prior to end of shift.  Civil Team Leader or representative
AU01980 	    is to record and sign off each form and raise any actions
AU01980 	   (job sheets) for further inspection or cleaning
AU02013 	12 M Flushing Longitudinal Pavement Drains
AU02013 	"Please Note: The water meter, mounted on the special hydrant"
AU02013 	"connection reads in litres, with the rotation of rightmost digit"
AU02013 	(wheel) equal to 10 litres and therefore each graduation on the
AU02013 	rightmost red wheel being equal to o ne litre.
AU02013 	"e.g. with a reading, showing all twos, the reading would"
AU02013 	"represent 222,222,222 litres."
AU02013 	
AU02013 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02013 	1. Ensure tunnel closure permits are arranged.
AU02013 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU02013 	"3. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU02013 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink  Procedure
AU02013 	   PR-RS-IR-059 Plans 25 & 26.
AU02013 	4. Testing of the longitudinal drains are to be carried out in
AU02013 	   accordance with work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0036.
AU02013 	   Six drainage bays with longitudinal drainage are defined in
AU02013 	   Drawing Nos. STG-CI-2109 and 2110.  The bays are approx. 50
AU02013 	   mts long.  For layout of the testing inlet and outlet pipes
AU02013 	   refer to TMI-3012-OP-0036.
AU02013 	"5. For Bay 1, at the Dirty Water Pit 77 (Inlet) [Check Collector"
AU02013 	   Pipes]
AU02013 	"   (a) At the Clean Water Pit 243, measure the flowrate and test"
AU02013 	       the water for pH level.  Record the results on form
AU02013 	       BURNLEY TUNNEL LONGITUDINAL PAVEMENT DRAIN FLUSHING
AU02013 	       DETAIL TMF-3012-OP-0316.    [_ _]
AU02013 	   (b) Remove caps from the collector pipe inlets inlet.  [_ _]
AU02013 	   (c) Inject water into collector pipe DC and monitor for
AU02013 	"       response time, flowrate and quality.  [_ _]"
AU02013 	   (d) Inject water into collector pipe CC and monitor for
AU02013 	   (e) Inject water into collector pipe UC and monitor for
AU02013 	       Record the results on form BURNLEY TUNNEL LONGITUDINAL
AU02013 	       PAVEMENT DRAIN FLUSHING DETAIL TMF-3012-OP-0316.    [_ _]
AU02013 	"6. For Bay 1, at the Dirty Water Pit  77 (Inlet) [Check dousing"
AU02013 	   path for integrity]
AU02013 	   (a) Attach the Supply hose to injection points DD1 and
AU02013 	       DD2.  [_ _]
AU02013 	"   (b) Ensure pipes DC, CC & UC have caps fitted.  [_ _]"
AU02013 	   (c) Remove caps from Outlet pipes D1 and D2 in the Clean
AU02013 	       water pit 243.  [_ _]
AU02013 	   (d) Measure flowrate as well as take a water sample and test
AU02013 	       the pH of the water coming from the MC pipe.  Record the
AU02013 	       flowrate and pH on form BURNLEY TUNNEL LONGITUDINAL
AU02013 	"   (e) Turn on the water supply, monitor and record the response"
AU02013 	       time taken for the water to travel from the inlet pipe
AU02013 	       and to appear at the MC pipe at the CW Pit.  Record the
AU02013 	       response time on form BURNLEY TUNNEL LONGITUDINAL
AU02013 	       PAVEMENT DRAIN FLUSHING DETAIL TMF-3012-OP-0316.   [_ _]
AU02013 	   (f )  Turn off the water supply.  [_ _]
AU02013 	7. Replace caps on Outlet pipes D1 and D2 at the CW pit.  [_ _]
AU02013 	8. At the Dirty Water Pit  (Inlet) [Check drainage path for
AU02013 	    integrity]
AU02013 	   (a) Turn ON the water supply and adjust to provide 1.2l/s at
AU02013 	       100kPa and inject 1000 litres into pipes DD1 and
AU02013 	   (b) Monitor
AU02013 	      (i) the start and finish water meter readings
AU02013 	     (ii) response time for water to flow from the outlet MC
AU02013 	          pipe at the Clean Water Pit.
AU02013 	     iii) the quantity and quality of the flow and record on
AU02013 	          form BURNLEY TUNNEL LONGITUDINAL PAVEMENT DRAIN
AU02013 	          FLUSHING DETAIL TMF-3012-OP-0316.    [_ _]
AU02013 	9 Repeat step 8 for Inlet pipes CD1 and CD2.
AU02013 	10 Repeat step 8 for Inlet pipes UD1 and UD2.
AU02013 	"11 Replace the sealing caps on pipes DD1, DD2, CD1, CD2, UD1 &"
AU02013 	   UD2.  [_ _]
AU02013 	12 Replace covers on the DW and CW Pits.  [_ _]
AU02013 	13 Repeat steps 4 through to 11 for Bay 2 Inlet DW 75 outlet
AU02013 	   CW 242.
AU02013 	14 Repeat steps 4 through to 11 for Bay 3 Inlet DW 73 outlet
AU02013 	   CW 241.
AU02013 	15 Repeat steps 4 through to 11 for Bay 4 Inlet DW 71 outlet
AU02013 	   CW 240.
AU02013 	16 Repeat steps 4 through to 11 for Bay 5 Inlet DW 69 outlet
AU02013 	   CW 239.

AU02013 	   CW 238.

AU02013 	   area of the Job Sheet.

AU02048 	12 M Collect dust sample from atop Jet Fan for analysis
AU02048 	
AU02048 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02048 	1.  Collecting of dust sample should be performed in conjunction
AU02048 	"    with mid year Burnley Tunnel Jet Fan maintenance activities,"
AU02048 	    as this will ensure all necessary Traffic Management is in
AU02048 	    place.
AU02048 	"2. Refer to procedure TMI-3012-OP-0042, Tunnel Dust Sampling."
AU02048 	3. The dust sample must be taken from the top of a Jet Fan that
AU02048 	   is located between Burnley Tunnel sections B50 and B54.
AU02048 	Note: There are four Jet Fans located in this section of the Burnley
AU02048 	"Tunnel, these are JFE32 (Right Lane), JFE33 (Left Lane),"
AU02048 	"JFE34 (Right Lane), and JFE35 (Left Lane)."
AU02048 	4. Take two samples from any one of the above Jet Fans.  The two
AU02048 	   samples are to be taken with the use of an uncontaminated
AU02048 	   disposable glove by sweeping up the dust by hand.
AU02048 	   An approximate amount of two tablespoons per sample is
AU02048 	   adequate for testing.  Place the dust samples into two
AU02048 	   separate clear zip bags (sealable bags).  Eye protection
AU02048 	   and a Class P2 Dust mask should be worn whilst taking the
AU02048 	"   samples, as the dust particles may be disturbed and become"
AU02048 	   airborne.
AU02048 	"5. Label both test samples with the Jet Fan number, job number"
AU02048 	   and date.
AU02048 	"6. Forward both samples to the Maintenance Engineer, or"
AU02048 	   Supervisor Elect or his representative who will arrange for
AU02048 	   testing to be carried out by AWN Consultants
AU02048 	   (ph: 03 9758 7299).

AU02121 	   (b) any outstanding works requiring further corrective
AU02121 	       works.

AU01641 	   (a) Operate the self contained emergency lights from their battery
AU01641 	supply by turning off the
AU01641 	         normal lighting power supply.  [_ _]

AU01641 	   (c) Replace any faulty lamps.  [_ _]

AU01641 	battery charger indicator

AU01641 	          equipment. [_ _]

AU01641 	damaged and all ball
AU01641 	     bearings are in place.  [_ _]

AU01641 	      sheet [_ _]
AU01641 	16. Record any corrective actions  such as repair of vandalised
AU01641 	lightingfittings or other
AU01641 	"      works in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet. [_ _]"
AU01641 	17. Raise new job sheets to carry out any corrective works that are
AU01641 	required.  [_ _]
AU01641 	"18. Notify the control room on departure from the Bridge Tower."""

AU01776 	will register on the local FIP
AU01776 	          and the CCCS as a local alarm.
AU01776 	"    (b) Remove the access cover over the smoke detector, direct """"test"
AU01776 	"smoke"""" from a smoke"
AU01776 	"         generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke"
AU01776 	detector (on the inlet duct).

AU01776 	alarm to genrate on
AU01776 	         the CCCS.  [_ _]

AU01776 	"   (a) Check each door for damage, as well check the rollers, runners,"
AU01776 	"hinges, handles,"

AU01776 	differential air pressure within
AU01776 	         the stairwell and at substation level.  Record readings less
AU01776 	"than 50Pa in the """"Work Done'"
AU01776 	         area of the Job sheet. Notify the superintendent for further
AU01776 	investigation.  [_ _]
AU01776 	"   (e) At each of the doors, starting from the tunnel and working"
AU01776 	towards the fan.
AU01776 	"          Arrange the door catch to be non-functioning, then using a"
AU01776 	"spring balance, measure the"
AU01776 	          force required to open the door.  Record the results in the
AU01776 	"Work Done"""" area of the Job"
AU01776 	"          sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required, as well"
AU01776 	advisethe maintenance
AU01776 	          superintendent for further investigation.   [_ _]

AU01776 	static reading.  Record in the
AU01776 	"          """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet if time is greater than 2"
AU01776 	minutes. Notify the
AU01776 	          superintendent for further investigation.

AU01776 	velocity of air out of the
AU01776 	          open door.  The reading is to be with the door fully open and
AU01776 	with no obstructions.
AU01776 	"         Record the results in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job sheet"
AU01776 	if the air flow is less than
AU01776 	        1 metre /sec as well advise the maintenance superintendent for
AU01776 	further investigation.  [_ _]

AU01776 	"fixings, as well as checking"
AU01776 	          the fixings of the unit for security.  [_ _]

AU01776 	     (a) Generates an alarm at the TCR workstation.

AU01776 	stairwell.

AU01776 	           relay (mounted in the rear compartment  of the FIP) for at

AU01776 	           ensure the fan stops.  Replace the relay once the action is
AU01776 	confirmed  [_ _].  The fire
AU01776 	           brigade will not be called)

AU01755 	03 M inspect of LIEBERT AC units mounted within Mezz Lvl
AU01755 	
AU01755 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01755 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01755 	"2. Access to the Mobile telephone rooms, RRB room, ERE 00 and"
AU01755 	   ERE01 is via the Grant Street Stairwell.  The rooms are
AU01755 	   located on the mezzanine floor adjacent to ERE01.
AU01755 	   The Air Conditioners and the condensers are separate units.
AU01755 	"3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01755 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01755 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01755 	4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Unit
AU01755 	"4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any"
AU01755 	     vibration.   [_ _]
AU01755 	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
AU01755 	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
AU01755 	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
AU01755 	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
AU01755 	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the
AU01755 	        thermostat setting.   [_ _]
AU01755 	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
AU01755 	        the following steps
AU01755 	        (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
AU01755 	            displayed)
AU01755 	       (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
AU01755 	      (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
AU01755 	            setting.
AU01755 	       (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
AU01755 	        (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
AU01755 	"       (vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that"
AU01755 	            temperature shown on unit  is consistent with
AU01755 	            new setpoint and verify temperature is consistent
AU01755 	            with ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
AU01755 	            thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01755 	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
AU01755 	        original setting.   [_ _]
AU01755 	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
AU01755 	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
AU01755 	        consistent with ambient using the portable
AU01755 	        thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01755 	        NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
AU01755 	       cycle.
AU01755 	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
AU01755 	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
AU01755 	4.4. Check the filters and replace if necessary
AU01755 	     (a) RRB Room and ERE 01 - Filter type Liebert size
AU01755 	         650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
AU01755 	     (b) ERE 00 - Filter type Liebert size 500 x 450 x
AU01755 	         50mm.   [_ _]
AU01755 	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm drain line is
AU01755 	     clear.   [_ _]
AU01755 	4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
AU01755 	5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
AU01755 	5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
AU01755 	     operation.   [_ _]
AU01755 	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
AU01755 	     running.   [_ _]
AU01755 	5.3. Switch the fan OFFusing the local isolating switch.   [_ _]
AU01755 	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
AU01755 	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
AU01755 	"5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air."
AU01755 	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the fan isolating switch.   [_ _]
AU01755 	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
AU01755 	     Unit.   [_ _]
AU01755 	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
AU01755 	    thoroughfares:
AU01755 	6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01755 	    walls.   [___]
AU01755 	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
AU01755 	    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01755 	6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01755 	    enclosure.  [___]
AU01755 	6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01755 	    dust.   [___]
AU01755 	6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
AU01755 	    Clear any blockages.
AU01755 	6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01755 	7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
AU01755 	     the results on form Equipment Room Inspections
AU01755 	     TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
AU01755 	     Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
AU01755 	     Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
AU01755 	     jobsheet for any outstanding works.
AU01755 	8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01755 	    parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
AU01755 	    report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
AU01755 	    new job for any repairs.
AU01755 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
