AU01820 	   The Air Conditioners and the condensers are separate units.
AU01820 	"4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01820 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01820 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01820 	5. Check the electrical switchboard for
AU01820 	   (a) faulty indicating lamps   [_ _]
AU01820 	"   (b) connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may"
AU01820 	       be overheated.   [_ _]
AU01820 	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
AU01820 	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
AU01820 	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
AU01820 	   service:
AU01820 	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
AU01820 	       calibration.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
AU01820 	       based controls.   [_ _]
AU01820 	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01820 	   service at the compressor.
AU01820 	   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
AU01820 	       superheat.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
AU01820 	       pressures.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
AU01820 	       and stable.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (d) Check the setting and operation of the high and low
AU01820 	       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
AU01820 	   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
AU01820 	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct
AU01820 	       operation.   [_ _]
AU01820 	"   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01820 	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
AU01820 	       serviceable.   [_ _]
AU01820 	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01820 	   service at the evaporator.
AU01820 	    (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
AU01820 	    (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
AU01820 	    (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
AU01820 	        rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01820 	"    (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01820 	        found.  [_ _]
AU01820 	"    (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit"
AU01820 	        a new filter if required.   [_ _]
AU01820 	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01820 	    service at the condenser.
AU01820 	    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
AU01820 	    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
AU01820 	        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01820 	"    (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01820 	        found.   [_ _]
AU01820 	11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01820 	    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
AU01820 	   (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
AU01820 	       blockage.   [_ _]
AU01820 	   (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
AU01820 	"12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01820 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01820 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01820 	14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
AU01820 	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
AU01820 	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.
AU01820 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01820 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01820 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01820 	Note:
AU01820 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01820 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01820 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01820 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01820 	        it's intended function.
AU01820 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01820 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01820 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01820 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01820 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01820 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01820 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01820 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01820 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01820 	        intended function.
AU01820 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01820 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01820 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU02135 	"Rubbish bags, Filter"

AU02135 	equipment and
AU02135 	   components within all switchboards and distribution panels. (Opsis
AU02135 	Air monitoring
AU02135 	   equipment is not maintained by Transfield)

AU02135 	10?C should be
AU02135 	"   considered abnormal and must be noted in the """"Work Done"""" area of"
AU02135 	the Job Sheet and
AU02135 	   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU02135 	abnormality. Raise a new

AU02135 	"   anything abnormal in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet and"

AU02135 	representative is informed of
AU02135 	   the abnormality.  [_ _]

AU02135 	"contactors for chattering,"
AU02135 	    arcing etc.  [_ _]

AU02135 	seals and escutcheons

AU02135 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]

AU02135 	"looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"

AU02135 	indicate abnormal

AU02135 	"connections, screw"
AU02135 	"         connections, for security.  [_ _]"

AU02135 	security screws are not

AU02135 	modules

AU02135 	or replace filters as

AU01764 	03 M Inspect of ERW06 & ERE02 Liebert wall mounted AC unit
AU01764 	
AU01764 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01764 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01764 	2. Access to equipments rooms ERE02 and ERW06 is via the Grant
AU01764 	   Street Stairwell. The equipment rooms are located on the
AU01764 	   mezzanine floor.  The Air Conditioner and the Condenser are
AU01764 	   mounted in one integral unit.
AU01764 	"3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01764 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01764 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01764 	4. Check for unusual noise or vibration while the unit is
AU01764 	   running.   [_ _]
AU01764 	"5. Shut the unit down using the ON/OFF switch, and open the"
AU01764 	   front access panel.   [_ _]
AU01764 	6. Check the filters and replace if required.  Filter size
AU01764 	   21 x 36.25 x 2 (1 reqd)  [_ _]
AU01764 	7. Check the blower for debris and dust buildup and clean as
AU01764 	   required.  Check that the blower is tightly mounted on the
AU01764 	"   shaft, and it rotates freely without rubbing.   [_ _]"
AU01764 	8. Check the refrigeration capillaries and supports to ensure
AU01764 	   they cannot rub together through vibration.   Check for
AU01764 	   leaks.   [_ _]
AU01764 	9. Check temperature settings by lowering the thermostat setting
AU01764 	   and check equipment room temperature with a portable
AU01764 	   thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01764 	10. Condenser
AU01764 	  a. Clean the condenser coil when filter is replaced.   [_ _]
AU01764 	  b. Check lines for leaks.   [_ _]
AU01764 	  c. Check the coils for damage.   [_ _]
AU01764 	11. Switch the unit ON using the ON/OFF switch.   [_ _]
AU01764 	12. Check the condensate drain for blockage and damage.  Clear
AU01764 	    any blockages.  [_ _]
AU01764 	"13. Inspect the two fire dampers (Inlet and outlet) for damage,"
AU01764 	    corrosion or premature operation.   [_ _]   [_ _]
AU01764 	14. Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
AU01764 	    thoroughfares:
AU01764 	    (i) Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01764 	        walls.   [___]
AU01764 	   (ii) Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces
AU01764 	        that will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01764 	  (iii) Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01764 	        enclosure.  [___]
AU01764 	   (iv) Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01764 	        dust.   [___]
AU01764 	   Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
AU01764 	   Clear any blockages.  Remove from site all accumulated debris
AU01764 	   and rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01764 	15. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
AU01764 	    results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
AU01764 	    Ensure the form  Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
AU01764 	    is returned to the Electrical / Electronics Supervisor or
AU01764 	    his representative. Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01764 	    works.
AU01764 	16. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01764 	    parameters in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
AU01764 	    report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
AU01764 	    new job for any repairs.
AU01764 	17. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01818 	   service.

AU01818 	   Street Stairwell.  The equipment rooms are located on the
AU01818 	   mezzanine floor.  The Air Conditioner and the Condenser are
AU01818 	   mounted in one integral unit.
AU01818 	"4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01818 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01818 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01818 	5. Check the electrical switchboard for
AU01818 	   (a) faulty indicating lamps   [_ _]
AU01818 	"   (b) connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may"
AU01818 	       be overheated.   [_ _]
AU01818 	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
AU01818 	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
AU01818 	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
AU01818 	   service:
AU01818 	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
AU01818 	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
AU01818 	       calibration.   [_ _]
AU01818 	   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
AU01818 	       based controls.   [_ _]
AU01818 	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01818 	   service at the compressor.
AU01818 	   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
AU01818 	       superheat.   [_ _]
AU01818 	   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
AU01818 	       pressures.   [_ _]
AU01818 	   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
AU01818 	       and stable.   [_ _]
AU01818 	   (d) Check the setting and operation of the high and low
AU01818 	       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
AU01818 	   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
AU01818 	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
AU01818 	   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.   [_ _]
AU01818 	"   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01818 	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01818 	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
AU01818 	       serviceable.   [_ _]
AU01818 	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01818 	   service at the evaporator.
AU01818 	    (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
AU01818 	    (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
AU01818 	    (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
AU01818 	        rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01818 	"    (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01818 	        found.   [_ _]
AU01818 	"    (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit"
AU01818 	        a new filter if required.   [_ _]
AU01818 	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01818 	    service at the condenser.
AU01818 	     (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
AU01818 	     (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
AU01818 	         rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01818 	"     (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01818 	         found.   [_ _]
AU01818 	11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01818 	    service at the humidifier   (where fitted).
AU01818 	    (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
AU01818 	        blockage.   [_ _]
AU01818 	    (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
AU01818 	"12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01818 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01818 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01818 	14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
AU01818 	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
AU01818 	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.
AU01818 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01818 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01818 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01818 	Note:
AU01818 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01818 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01818 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01818 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01818 	        it's intended function.
AU01818 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01818 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01818 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01818 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01818 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01818 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01818 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01818 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01818 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01818 	        intended function.
AU01818 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01818 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01818 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01753 	03 M Insp of Liebert AC units accessed via the Mezzanine Lvl
AU01753 	
AU01753 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01753 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job
AU01753 	2. Access to both ERE 03 and ERW 05 is via the Grant Street
AU01753 	   stairwell.  Both equipment rooms are adjacent to Substation
AU01753 	"   1.  Access from Grant Street is via the mezzanine floor, then"
AU01753 	"   down a ladder to the Domain Tunnel Walkway and then,"
AU01753 	   10 metres along the walkway to Substation 1 entrance.
AU01753 	"   Prior to walking along the walkway, be aware of the traffic"
AU01753 	   conditions and take appropriate precautions.
AU01753 	   Use a ladder to climb over the smoke ducts.  DO NOT GO
AU01753 	   THROUGH THE SMOKE DUCTS.
AU01753 	   ACU Air Conditioning Units are located in the respective
AU01753 	"   equipment rooms, while the condenser units are mounted on the"
AU01753 	   Mezzanine level above the equipment rooms.
AU01753 	"3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01753 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
AU01753 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01753 	4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
AU01753 	"4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any"
AU01753 	     vibration.   [_ _]
AU01753 	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
AU01753 	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
AU01753 	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
AU01753 	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
AU01753 	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
AU01753 	        setting.   [_ _]
AU01753 	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
AU01753 	        the following steps
AU01753 	        (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
AU01753 	            displayed)
AU01753 	       (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
AU01753 	      (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
AU01753 	            setting.
AU01753 	       (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
AU01753 	        (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
AU01753 	"       (vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that"
AU01753 	            temperature shown on unit is consistent with new
AU01753 	            setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
AU01753 	            ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
AU01753 	            thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01753 	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
AU01753 	        original setting.   [_ _]
AU01753 	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
AU01753 	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
AU01753 	        consistent with ambient using the portable
AU01753 	        thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01753 	     NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
AU01753 	     cycle.
AU01753 	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
AU01753 	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
AU01753 	4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary   Filter type
AU01753 	     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
AU01753 	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
AU01753 	     is clear.   [_ _]
AU01753 	4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
AU01753 	5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
AU01753 	5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
AU01753 	     operation.   [_ _]
AU01753 	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
AU01753 	     running.   [_ _]
AU01753 	5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
AU01753 	     switch.   [_ _]
AU01753 	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
AU01753 	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
AU01753 	5.6. Clean the condenser coils if required using compressed
AU01753 	     air.   [_ _]
AU01753 	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
AU01753 	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
AU01753 	     Unit.   [_ _]
AU01753 	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
AU01753 	    thoroughfares:
AU01753 	6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01753 	    walls.   [___]
AU01753 	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
AU01753 	    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01753 	6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01753 	    enclosure.  [___]
AU01753 	6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01753 	   dust.   [___]
AU01753 	6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
AU01753 	    Clear any blockages.
AU01753 	6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
AU01753 	    rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01753 	7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
AU01753 	     the results on form  Equipment Room Inspections
AU01753 	     TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
AU01753 	     Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
AU01753 	     Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
AU01753 	     jobsheet for any outstanding works.
AU01753 	8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01753 	    parameters in the Work Done  section of the job sheet and
AU01753 	    report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
AU01753 	    new job for any repairs.
AU01753 	9.0 Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01751 	   adjacent to the Burnley Vent Station stack.
AU01751 	   (a) Arrange for the control room to start Supply Air fan
AU01751 	       ESFP01. ESFP01 is the Supply Air for the Emergency Egress
AU01751 	       Tunnel.
AU01751 	   (b) Arrange for the control room to switch on the Emergency
AU01751 	       Egress Tunnel lighting prior to entering the tunnel.
AU01751 	"3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01751 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne City
AU01751 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01751 	4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
AU01751 	"4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any"
AU01751 	     vibration.   [_ _]
AU01751 	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
AU01751 	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
AU01751 	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
AU01751 	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
AU01751 	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
AU01751 	        setting.   [_ _]
AU01751 	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
AU01751 	        the following steps
AU01751 	       (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
AU01751 	           displayed)
AU01751 	      (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
AU01751 	     (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
AU01751 	           setting.
AU01751 	      (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
AU01751 	       (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
AU01751 	"      (vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that temperature"
AU01751 	           shown on unit is consistent with new setpoint and
AU01751 	           verify temperature is consistent with ambient
AU01751 	          (+ or - 1 deg) using portable  thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01751 	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
AU01751 	        original setting.   [_ _]
AU01751 	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
AU01751 	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
AU01751 	        consistent with ambient using the portable
AU01751 	        thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01751 	   NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
AU01751 	   cycle.
AU01751 	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
AU01751 	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
AU01751 	4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.  Filter type
AU01751 	     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm
AU01751 	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
AU01751 	     is clear.
AU01751 	4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.
AU01751 	5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
AU01751 	5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
AU01751 	     operation.   [_ _]
AU01751 	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
AU01751 	     running.   [_ _]
AU01751 	5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
AU01751 	     switch.   [_ _]
AU01751 	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
AU01751 	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
AU01751 	"5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air."
AU01751 	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
AU01751 	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
AU01751 	     Unit.   [_ _]
AU01751 	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
AU01751 	    thoroughfares:
AU01751 	6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01751 	    walls.   [___]
AU01751 	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
AU01751 	    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01751 	6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01751 	    enclosure.  [___]
AU01751 	6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01751 	    dust.   [___]
AU01751 	6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage
AU01751 	    problems.  Clear any blockages.
AU01751 	6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
AU01751 	    rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01751 	7.0 Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record the
AU01751 	    results on form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347.
AU01751 	    Ensure the form Equipment Room Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347
AU01751 	    is returned to the Electrical Electronics Supervisor or his
AU01751 	    representative.  Raise a new job for any outstanding works.
AU01751 	8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01751 	    parameters  in the Work Done section of the job sheet and
AU01751 	    report to the Supervisor or his representative and raise a
AU01751 	    new job for any outstanding  repairs.
AU01751 	9.0 Notify the control room on completion of the job and arrange
AU01751 	    for the control room to switch off the emergeny egress
AU01751 	    tunnel lighting as well as the supply air fan.
AU01816 	12 M Inspect of Liebert AC units accessed via the EE Tunnel.
AU01816 	
AU01816 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01816 	1. The 12 month service of the air conditioner shall be carried
AU01816 	   out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the electrical
AU01816 	   electronic technician and in conjunction with the 3 monthly
AU01816 	   service.
AU01816 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01816 	3. Access is via the Emergency Egress Tunnel from the entry
AU01816 	   adjacent to the Burnley Vent Station stack.
AU01816 	   (a) Arrange for the control room to start Supply Air fan
AU01816 	       ESFP01. ESFP01 is the Supply Air for the Emergency Egress
AU01816 	       Tunnel.
AU01816 	   (b) Arrange for the control room to switch on the Emergency
AU01816 	       Egress Tunnel lighting prior to entering the tunnel.
AU01816 	"4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01816 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01816 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01816 	5. Check the electrical switchboard for
AU01816 	   (a) faulty indicating lamps   [_ _]
AU01816 	"   (b) connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may"
AU01816 	       be overheated.   [_ _]
AU01816 	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
AU01816 	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
AU01816 	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
AU01816 	   service:
AU01816 	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
AU01816 	       calibration.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
AU01816 	       based controls.   [_ _]
AU01816 	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01816 	   service at the compressor.
AU01816 	   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
AU01816 	       superheat.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
AU01816 	       pressures.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
AU01816 	       and stable.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (d) Check the setting and operation of the high and low
AU01816 	       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
AU01816 	   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
AU01816 	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.   [_ _]
AU01816 	"   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01816 	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
AU01816 	       serviceable.   [_ _]
AU01816 	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01816 	   service at the evaporator.
AU01816 	   (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
AU01816 	       rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01816 	"   (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01816 	       found.   [_ _]
AU01816 	"   (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit"
AU01816 	       a new filter if required.   [_ _]
AU01816 	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01816 	    service at the condenser.
AU01816 	   (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
AU01816 	   (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
AU01816 	       rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01816 	"   (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01816 	11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01816 	    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
AU01816 	    (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
AU01816 	        blockage.   [_ _]
AU01816 	    (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
AU01816 	"12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01816 	     parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01816 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01816 	14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
AU01816 	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
AU01816 	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.
AU01816 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01816 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01816 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01816 	Note:
AU01816 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01816 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01816 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01816 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01816 	        it's intended function.
AU01816 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01816 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01816 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01816 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01816 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01816 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01816 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01816 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01816 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01816 	        intended function.
AU01816 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01816 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01816 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01707 	01 M inspect of SL roadside ERTs
AU01707 	
AU01707 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01707 	. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
AU01707 	2. Use Vehicle arrow board and short term emergency lane
AU01707 	"   stoppage as per Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 20,"
AU01707 	   22 or 23.
AU01707 	3.  For eastbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
AU01707 	    telephone:
AU01707 	"   (a) Inspect the telephone for graffiti, damage and or insect"
AU01707 	       infestation
AU01707 	"   (b) Clean the telephone of grime and residues, use spray-on"
AU01707 	       Nifty and a clean cloth.
AU01707 	   (c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
AU01707 	       room.
AU01707 	"   Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact the Traffic"
AU01707 	   Control Room and confirm operation of the phone communication
AU01707 	   then have the control room call back to the ERT to check the
AU01707 	   reverse operation.
AU01707 	4. For westbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
AU01707 	   telephone:
AU01707 	5. For each ERT
AU01707 	   (a) record the result of the inspection
AU01707 	   (b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
AU01707 	   (c) the result of the communication test
AU01707 	   for each telephone on the attached form METS Inspection
AU01707 	   (Monthly) - Southern Link (Roadside) Form No.
AU01707 	   TMF-3012-OP-0075.
AU01707 	6. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
AU01707 	   required in the comments area of the form.
AU01707 	7. Notify the control room on the completion of inspection.
AU01707 	8. Return the completed job sheet as well as the form METS
AU01707 	   Inspection (Monthly) - Southern Link (Roadside) Form No.
AU01707 	   TMF-3012-OP-0075 to the Electrical / Electronics Team Leader
AU01707 	   or his representative.
AU01707 	9. The Electrical/Electronics Team Leader or his representative
AU01707 	   is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective actions
AU01707 	   required.

AU01596 	   (c) Test the operation of the telephone with the control
AU01596 	"       room.  Using the Emergency Roadside telephone, contact"
AU01596 	       the Traffic Control Room and confirm operation of the
AU01596 	       phone communication then have the control room call back
AU01596 	       to the ERT to check the reverse operation.
AU01596 	4. For southbound carriageway and at each emergency roadside
AU01596 	5. For each ERT
AU01596 	   (a) record the result of the inspection
AU01596 	   (b) that the ERT has been cleaned and
AU01596 	   (c) the result of the communication test
AU01596 	   for each telephone on the attached form METS Inspection
AU01596 	   (Monthly) - Western Link Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0036.
AU01596 	6. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
AU01596 	   required in the comments area of the form.
AU01596 	7. Notify the control room on the completion of inspection.
AU01596 	8. Return the completed job sheet as well as the form METS
AU01596 	   Inspection (Monthly) - Western Link Form No. TMF-3012-OP-0036
AU01596 	   to the Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
AU01596 	   representative.
AU01596 	9. The Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
AU01596 	   representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU01596 	   actions required.

AU01749 	03 M Inspection of ERW02 (adjacent to Sub 4) Liebert A/C
AU01749 	
AU01749 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01749 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01749 	2. Access to ERW02 is via the stairwell in Alexandra Avenue.
AU01749 	   The equipment room is adjacent to Substation 4.
AU01749 	  NOTE: Parking restrictions may apply between 7.00am and
AU01749 	   5.30pm.
AU01749 	   The airconditioning unit is located in equipment room ERW02
AU01749 	"   and the condenser unit is located in the riser, adjacent to"
AU01749 	   Substation 4.  Access for detailed inspection of the
AU01749 	   condenser unit is restricted.
AU01749 	"3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01749 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01749 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01749 	4. Work plan for ACU-ERW2-1  - Air Conditioning Unit
AU01749 	"4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any"
AU01749 	     vibration.   [_ _]
AU01749 	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
AU01749 	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
AU01749 	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
AU01749 	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
AU01749 	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
AU01749 	        setting.   [_ _]
AU01749 	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
AU01749 	        the following steps
AU01749 	        (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
AU01749 	            displayed)
AU01749 	       (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
AU01749 	      (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
AU01749 	            setting.
AU01749 	       (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
AU01749 	        (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
AU01749 	"       (vi) Wait until unit cuts out, and verify that"
AU01749 	            temperature shown on unit  is consistent with new
AU01749 	            setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
AU01749 	            ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
AU01749 	            thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01749 	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
AU01749 	        original setting.   [_ _]
AU01749 	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
AU01749 	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
AU01749 	        consistent with ambient using the portable
AU01749 	        thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01749 	    NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
AU01749 	    cycle.
AU01749 	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
AU01749 	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
AU01749 	4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary   Filter type
AU01749 	     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
AU01749 	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
AU01749 	     is clear.   [_ _]
AU01749 	4.6. Restart unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
AU01749 	5. The work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
AU01749 	5.1. Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
AU01749 	     operation.   [_ _]
AU01749 	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
AU01749 	     running.   [_ _]
AU01749 	5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local isolating
AU01749 	     switch.   [_ _]
AU01749 	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
AU01749 	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
AU01749 	"5.6. Clean condenser coils, if required using compressed air."
AU01749 	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local isolator.   [_ _]
AU01749 	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
AU01749 	     Unit.   [_ _]
AU01749 	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
AU01749 	     thoroughfares:
AU01749 	6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01749 	     walls.   [___]
AU01749 	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
AU01749 	    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01749 	6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01749 	    enclosure.  [___]
AU01749 	6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01749 	    dust.   [___]
AU01749 	6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
AU01749 	    Clear any blockages.
AU01749 	6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and
AU01749 	    rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01749 	7.0. Carry out an inspection of the equipment room and record
AU01749 	     the results on form  Equipment Room Inspections
AU01749 	     TMF-3012-OP-0347.  Ensure the form Equipment Room
AU01749 	     Inspections TMF-3012-OP-0347 is returned to the Electrical
AU01749 	     Electronics Supervisor or his representative.  Raise a new
AU01749 	     jobsheet for any outstanding works.
AU01749 	8.0 On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01749 	    parameters in the Work Done  section of the job sheet and
AU01749 	    report to the Team Leader or his representative and raise a
AU01749 	    new job for any repairs.
AU01749 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01819 	3. Access to ERW02 is via the stairwell in Alexandra Avenue. The
AU01819 	   equipment  room is adjacent to Substation 4.
AU01819 	  NOTE: Parking restrictions may apply between 7.00am and
AU01819 	  5.30pm.
AU01819 	  The airconditioning unit is located in equipment room ERW02
AU01819 	"  and the condenser unit is located in the riser, adjacent to"
AU01819 	  Substation 4.  Access for detailed inspection of the condenser
AU01819 	  unit is restricted.
AU01819 	"4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01819 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01819 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01819 	5. Check the electrical switchboard for
AU01819 	   (a) faulty indicating lamps   [_ _]
AU01819 	"   (b) connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may"
AU01819 	       be overheated.   [_ _]
AU01819 	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
AU01819 	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
AU01819 	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
AU01819 	   service:
AU01819 	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
AU01819 	       calibration.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
AU01819 	       based controls.   [_ _]
AU01819 	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01819 	   service at the compressor.
AU01819 	   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
AU01819 	       superheat.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
AU01819 	       pressures.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
AU01819 	       and stable.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (d) Check the setting and operation of the high and low
AU01819 	       pressure cut out switches. [_ _]
AU01819 	   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
AU01819 	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.   [_ _]
AU01819 	"   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01819 	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
AU01819 	       serviceable.   [_ _]
AU01819 	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01819 	   service at the evaporator.
AU01819 	   (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
AU01819 	   (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
AU01819 	       rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01819 	"   (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01819 	       found.   [_ _]
AU01819 	"   (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit"
AU01819 	       a new filter if required.   [_ _]
AU01819 	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01819 	    service at the condenser.
AU01819 	    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
AU01819 	    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
AU01819 	        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01819 	"    (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01819 	        found.   [_ _]
AU01819 	11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01819 	    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
AU01819 	    (a) Check the humidifier inlet water strainer for
AU01819 	        blockage.   [_ _]
AU01819 	    (b) Check the humidifier operation.   [_ _]
AU01819 	"12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01819 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01819 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01819 	14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
AU01819 	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
AU01819 	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.
AU01819 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01819 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01819 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01819 	Note:
AU01819 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01819 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01819 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01819 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01819 	        it's intended function.
AU01819 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01819 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01819 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01819 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01819 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01819 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01819 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01819 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01819 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01819 	        intended function.
AU01819 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01819 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01819 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01649 	06 M Inspect of Feature Lighting distribution boards
AU01649

AU01649 	   required.

AU01649 	   (M-MCL-OM-526)

AU01649 	   (a) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of
AU01649 	"       distribution board for damage, evidence of insect"
AU01649 	"       infestation, ingress of moisture, dust and grime"
AU01649 	       (clean as required).
AU01649 	"   (b) Check cable connections for tightness, signs of"
AU01649 	       overheating and inspect control and distribution
AU01649 	       equipment.
AU01649 	   (c) Clean and check operation of PE sensor.
AU01649 	   (d) Check for correct  operation of cabinet lamp.

AU01649 	"   Board on attached form TMF-3012-OP-0042 """"Electrical"
AU01649 	"   Inspection for Architectural Feature Lighting LDB""""."

AU01649 	   area of  the Job Sheet.

AU01951 	   operation.

AU01951 	"   shall be as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01951 	"   TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059"
AU01951 	"   Plan 22, 23, 25."

AU01951 	"   AS 1851, part 1, levels 1 and 2."

AU01951 	   levels 1 and 2.

AU01951 	"   accordance with AS 1851,  part 4, levels 1 and 2.  The"
AU01951 	   presence of water must be confirmed at each of the 59
AU01951 	   hydrants.
AU01951 	7. Check the operation of the fire cabinet door alarm with the
AU01951 	   Traffic Control Room i.e. alarm received on the PMCS.

AU01983 	   shall be carried out by the sub-contractor in the presence of
AU01983 	   a civil worker.
AU01983 	3. The sub-contractor shall inspect and test the backflow
AU01983 	"   preventer in accordance with AS3500.1-1992, Section 4 - Cross"
AU01983 	   Connection Control and backflow Prevention.
AU01983 	4. There are two backflow preventers controlling the tunnel
AU01983 	   deluge systems and are:
AU01983 	   (a) Watts 200mm Model 770Aus Serial number 01055 located in
AU01983 	       service tunnel.  Enter through pit in footpath Cnr Grant
AU01983 	       Street and Grant Streets South Melbourne. Confined
AU01983 	"       space permit and barriers required, as well, an attach"
AU01983 	       harness is required.

AU01983 	       above entrance to Burnley Tunnel end of Rooney Street
AU01983 	      (Parks Victoria) Lock 2GA

AU01983 	   a maintenance report to the Civil Team Leader detailing
AU01983 	"   backflow preventer size, serial number, model, location,"
AU01983 	"   result of test, along with any other outstanding works that"
AU01983 	   require attention.

AU01983 	   the job sheet.  [_ _]

AU01983 	   new jobsheet for the works.
AU01983 	8. Notify the control room on completion of this job.

AU01854 	   electronic technician.

AU01854 	3. Access to the Burnley Tunnel shall be as per Work
AU01854 	"   Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink"
AU01854 	"   Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 22, 23, 25."
AU01854 	4. (a) Inspect visually all the 130 deluge valve stations for
AU01854 	"       damage, corrosion, leaks and general condition."
AU01854 	   (b) Inspect visually all 130 Main Deluge control valves for
AU01854 	"       damage, damage to the fire blanket, corrosion, leaks and"
AU01854 	       general condition.
AU01854 	   (c) Inspect the fire blanket on each deluge valve for damage.
AU01854 	"5. Inspect visually the fire ringmain, 11 sectioning valves and"
AU01854 	"   expansion bellows for damage, corrosion, leaks and general"
AU01854 	    condition.
AU01854 	6.  Record the result of the inspection on form BURNLEY TUNNEL
AU01854 	    DELUGE SYSTEM INSPECTION - 6 M VISUAL INSPECTION OF BURNLEY
AU01854 	    TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0261.

AU01854 	   TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM INSPECTION - 6 M VISUAL INSPECTION OF
AU01854 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM  TMF-3012-OP-0261.

AU01854 	   the Job sheet and raise a new  job sheet for any required
AU01854 	   repairs. Priority High P1.
AU01854 	9. Notify the control room on completion of deluge inspection.

AU01854 	    INSPECTION - 6 M VISUAL INSPECTION OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE
AU01854 	    SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0261 to Team Leader - Electrical or his
AU01854 	    representative upon completion.
AU01855 	12 M Test & inspection of the BT deluge installation
AU01855 	
AU01855 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01855 	1. The twelve monthly deluge system inspection and test shall be
AU01855 	   carried out in conjunction with  the fire-protection
AU01855 	   sub-contractor and the Traffic Control Room Officers (TRCO).
AU01855 	2. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing the job.
AU01855 	   (a). A tunnel closure is required.  A Memorandum of Consent
AU01855 	        (MOC) and a Permit to Work approval is required from
AU01855 	"        Translink Operations, the Maintenance Manager or his"
AU01855 	        representative prior to commencing work.
AU01855 	    (b) Access to the Burnley tunnel shall be as per Work
AU01855 	"        Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and"
AU01855 	"        Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan Domain Tunnel"
AU01855 	        Portal Closure.
AU01855 	3. Reference Drawings SLG-FS- 30900 to SLG-FS-30911.
AU01855 	4. Prior to testing the deluge zone spray system:
AU01855 	   (a) Ensure that the maximum capacity is available in the
AU01855 	       dirty water sump and holding tank at the Yarra Crossing
AU01855 	       Dirty Water Pit and the Swan Street Water Treatment
AU01855 	       Plant.    [_ _]
AU01855 	   (b) Request the TCRO to close the bypass valve between the
AU01855 	       pump station dirty water and the ground water sump
AU01855 	       pits.    [_ _]
AU01855 	"   (c) Install the bungs in the TAM sensors.,,[_ _]"
AU01855 	6. Discharge the Deluge Spray Zones.
AU01855 	   (a) Request the TCRO to actuate one (1) specified deluge
AU01855 	"       spray zones, starting at the West Portal then progressing"
AU01855 	       eastward.  Spray pattern may take 30 seconds to
AU01855 	       establish.
AU01855 	   (b) Observe that the spray pattern provides coverage of the
AU01855 	       tunnel floor area and note defective sprays and faulty
AU01855 	       equipment for replacement.  Observe for 15 seconds.
AU01855 	   (c) Request the TCRO to close the one (1) specified deluge
AU01855 	       zones.
AU01855 	   (d) Functional test should take approximately one minute
AU01855 	       between activation and closing the valve.
AU01855 	   (e) Check that the deluge valve has fully closed.
AU01855 	   (f) It should take approximately 5 minutes for each zone.
AU01855 	   (g) It is important that the levels at the Yarra Crossing
AU01855 	       Dirty Water Pit and the Swan St Pit are monitored at all
AU01855 	       times by the TCRO during testing.  Testing must cease if
AU01855 	       the pit levels are high and then only resume when the pit
AU01855 	       levels have dropped sufficiently to accommodate the
AU01855 	       deluge water.
AU01855 	"7. Carry out step 6 for the remaining deluge zones, one zone at"
AU01855 	"   time.  After activating zone FSP E068, activate both zones"
AU01855 	"   FSP E068 and FSP E069 together, checking that there is no"
AU01855 	"   Low Water Pressure alarm, record results on form BURNLEY"
AU01855 	   TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (EAST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL TEST OF
AU01855 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0266
AU01855 	"8. Manually operate the six (6) sectioning valves, in the fire"
AU01855 	"   main, through a close and open cycle.  Confirm with TCRO the"
AU01855 	   operational status of the valve as it is operated.    [_ _]
AU01855 	9. Record on forms
AU01855 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (WEST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
AU01855 	   TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0262 and
AU01855 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (EAST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
AU01855 	"   TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM""""  TMF-3012-OP-0266, the"
AU01855 	   result of the tests for each deluge zone and sectioning
AU01855 	   valve.
AU01855 	10. Request the TCRO to open bypass valves between the pump
AU01855 	    station dirty water and ground water sump pits and to ensure
AU01855 	    that operation of the pumps have returned to normal.  Only
AU01855 	    ground water pump in operation and the dirty water is
AU01855 	    flowing via the triple interceptor.  Perform regular visual
AU01855 	    inspections to ensure that there is no overflow from
AU01855 	    the dirty water tundish.
AU01855 	"11. Remove the bungs in the TAM sensors once the deluge test is ,,"
AU01855 	completed  [_ _]
AU01855 	12. Record any follow up requirements in the Work Done area of
AU01855 	    the Job sheet and raise a Job Sheet for any outstanding
AU01855 	    works.   Priority High P1.
AU01855 	13. Record the sub-contractors work sheet number in the Work
AU01855 	    Done area of the job sheet and forward the sub-contractor
AU01855 	    confirmation sheet to the Team Leader - Electrical or his
AU01855 	    representative.
AU01855 	14. Notify the control room on completion of the work.
AU01855 	"15. Forward completed check form,"
AU01855 	    BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (WEST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
AU01855 	    TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0262 and
AU01855 	    BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE TEST (EAST END)  - 12 M OPERATIONAL
AU01855 	"    TEST OF BURNLEY TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM  TMF-3012-OP-0266, to"
AU01855 	    the Team Leader - Electrical or his representative upon
AU01855 	    completion of the job.

AU01737 	12 M Test & inspection of the DT deluge installation
AU01737 	
AU01737 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01737 	1. The twelve monthly deluge system inspection and test shall be
AU01737 	   carried out in conjunction with the fire-protection
AU01737 	   sub-contractor and the Traffic Control Room Officers (TRCO).
AU01737 	2. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing the job.
AU01737 	   (a). A tunnel closure is required.  A Memorandum of Consent
AU01737 	        (MOC) and a Permit to Work approval is required from
AU01737 	"        Translink Operations, the Maintenance Manager or his"
AU01737 	        representative prior to commencing work.
AU01737 	    (b) Access to the Domain tunnel shall be as per Work
AU01737 	"        Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and"
AU01737 	"        Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan Domain Tunnel"
AU01737 	        Portal Closure.
AU01737 	3. Reference Drawings SLG-FS- 30900 to SLG-FS-30911.
AU01737 	4. Prior to testing the deluge zone spray system:
AU01737 	   (a) Ensure that the maximum capacity is available in the
AU01737 	       dirty water sump and holding tank at the Yarra Crossing
AU01737 	       Dirty Water Pit and the Swan Street Water Treatment
AU01737 	       Plant.    [_ _]
AU01737 	   (b) Request the TCRO to close the bypass valve between the
AU01737 	       pump station dirty water and the ground water sump
AU01737 	       pits.   [_ _]
AU01737 	"   (c) Install the bungs in the TAM sensors.,,[_ _]"
AU01737 	6. Discharge the Deluge Spray Zones.
AU01737 	   (a) Request the TCRO to actuate one (1) specified deluge
AU01737 	"       spray zones, starting at the East Portal then progressing"
AU01737 	       westward.  Spray pattern may take 30 seconds to
AU01737 	       establish.
AU01737 	   (b) Observe that the spray pattern provides coverage of the
AU01737 	       tunnel floor area and note defective sprays and faulty
AU01737 	       equipment for replacement.  Observe for 15 seconds.
AU01737 	   (c) Request the TCRO to close the one (1) specified deluge
AU01737 	       zones.
AU01737 	   (d) Functional test should take approximately one minute
AU01737 	       between activation and closing the valve.
AU01737 	   (e) Check that the deluge valve has fully closed.
AU01737 	   (f) It should take approximately 5 minutes for each zone.
AU01737 	   (g) It is important that the levels at the Yarra Crossing
AU01737 	       Dirty Water Pit and the Swan St Pit are monitored at all
AU01737 	       times by the TRCO during testing.  Testing must cease if
AU01737 	       the pit levels are high and only resumed when the pit
AU01737 	       levels have dropped sufficiently to accommodate the
AU01737 	       deluge water.
AU01737 	"7. Carry out step 6 for the remaining deluge zones, one zone at"
AU01737 	"   a time.  After activating zone FSP W016, activate both zones"
AU01737 	"   FSP W016 and zone FSP W017 together, checking that there is"
AU01737 	"   no Low Water Pressure alarm, record results on form DOMAIN"
AU01737 	   TUNNEL DELUGE TEST - 12 M OPERATIONAL TEST OF DOMAIN TUNNEL
AU01737 	   DELUGE SYSTEM TMF-3012-OP-0256
AU01737 	"8. Manually operate the six (6) sectioning valves, in the fire"
AU01737 	"   main, through a close and open cycle.  Confirm with TCRO the"
AU01737 	   operational status of the valve as it is operated.    [_ _]
AU01737 	9. Record on form DOMAIN TUNNEL DELUGE TEST - 12 M OPERATIONAL
AU01737 	"   TEST OF DOMAIN TUNNEL DELUGE SYSTEM  TMF-3012-OP-0256, the"
AU01737 	   result of the tests for each deluge zone and sectioning
AU01737 	   valve.
AU01737 	10. Request the TCRO to open bypass valves between the pumps
AU01737 	    station dirty water and ground water sump pits and to ensure
AU01737 	    that operation of the pumps have returned to normal.  Only
AU01737 	    ground water pump in operation and the dirty water is
AU01737 	    flowing via the triple interceptor.   Perform regular visual
AU01737 	    inspections to ensure that there is no overflow from
AU01737 	    the dirty water tundish.
AU01737 	"11. Remove the bungs in the TAM sensors once the deluge test is ,,"
AU01737 	completed  [_ _]
AU01737 	12. Record any follow up requirements in the Work Done area of
AU01737 	    the Job sheet and raisea  Job Sheet for any outstanding
AU01737 	    works.   Priority High P1.
AU01737 	13. Record the sub-contractors work sheet number in the Work
AU01737 	    Done area of the job sheet and forward the sub-contractor
AU01737 	    confirmation sheet to the Team Leader - Electrical or his
AU01737 	    representative.
AU01737 	14. Notify the control room on completion of the work.
AU01737 	15. Forward completed check form DOMAIN TUNNEL DELUGE TEST -

AU01987 	12 M Inspect Tunnel environs fire door operation
AU01987 	
AU01987 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01987 	1. This inspection is to be performed by a sub-contractor or a
AU01987 	   suitably qualified civil worker.
AU01987 	2. The location of fire doors are listed on forms Southern
AU01987 	   Link Tunnel Fire Doors Substation No. 1 and Mezzanine Level
AU01987 	    Fire Doors  - TMF-3012-OP-0280
AU01987 	   Substation No. 2 Swan Street Shaft and Refuge 3
AU01987 	   TMF-3012-OP-0281
AU01987 	   Substation No. 3 & Burnley Fan Chamber  TMF-3012-OP-0282
AU01987 	   Substation No. 4 & Yarra Crossing   TMF-3012-OP-0283
AU01987 	   Substation No. 5 ERW 01 & Olympic Park Pump Station
AU01987 	   TMF -3012-OP-0284
AU01987 	   Burnley Tunnel Fire Doors  TMF-3012-OP-285
AU01987 	   Domain Tunnel Fire Doors  TMF-3012-OP-0264.
AU01987 	3. Inspect each door for it's identifying label and that it is
AU01987 	   attached.
AU01987 	4. Visually inspect each fire door and its associated hardware
AU01987 	"   e.g. latches, handles, hinges, closers, surfaces and door"
AU01987 	   frame for damage or degraded operation or fit.  Any abnormal
AU01987 	   condition found is to be recorded in the Work Done area
AU01987 	   of the job sheet and a new job raised to have the door
AU01987 	   manufacturer repair any fault.   [_ _]
AU01987 	5. Inspect each hinge and apply a suitable spray lubricant
AU01987 	   (WD40) to the hinge.   [_ _]
AU01987 	6. Ensure the door closer for each door is effective and that
AU01987 	   the door is not held open by wedges or similar.   Remove any
AU01987 	   objects found that are used in this way.   [_ _]
AU01987 	"7. Before a fire doors is removed for corrective repairs, the"
AU01987 	   fire fighting authorities should be notified if the door
AU01987 	   cannot be re-installed within 3 hours.
AU01987 	8. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet any
AU01987 	   abnormal conditions found.  Raise a job sheet for any
AU01987 	   corrective repairs required on any fire door. P1 - High
AU01987 	   Priority.
AU01672 	01 M Inspection of  Grant St. Vent Station Axial Fans
AU01672 	
AU01672 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01672 	1. Works to be carried out between 21:00 & 05:00. Three day notice of
AU01672 	pending works to
AU01672 	    be given verbally to TLO Maintenance Manager.
AU01672 	2. Obtain the Permit to Work for entry to the ventilation rooms and to
AU01672 	interrupt  operations.
AU01672 	   TLO Maintenance Manager to sign Work Permit and works to be carried
AU01672 	only within times
AU01672 	   approved on the Work Permit.
AU01672 	3. Inform the control room prior to commencing the work and brief
AU01672 	TCRO'son interruptions
AU01672 	   and expected alarms.
AU01672 	"4. Reference Manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance"
AU01672 	Instructions Manual
AU01672 	   (M-STG-VE-26059).
AU01672 	5. At the PMCS in the control room
AU01672 	   (a) Check the motor balance vibration reading on the PMCS for all
AU01672 	fans.  If any  reading is in
AU01672 	"         excess of 6.5mm/s record the result in the """"Work Done"""" area"
AU01672 	of the job sheet  for further
AU01672 	         action.    [_ _]
AU01672 	"   (b) Check the trend log for the last month, looking for abnormal"
AU01672 	events. Record any
AU01672 	"         abnormalities in the"""" Work Done"""" area of Job Sheet.  Report"
AU01672 	any events and or trends to
AU01672 	         the Maintenance Superintendent  that may suggest some abnormal
AU01672 	function.  [_ _]
AU01672 	"   (c) Check  the running current and record in the """"Work Done"""" area"
AU01672 	if greater than
AU01672 	         FLC 349A for further action.[__]
AU01672 	   (d) Check the drive and non drive end bearing temperatures for the
AU01672 	operating fan motor.
AU01672 	         Record the details for those bearings with a temperature
AU01672 	greater than 80?C in  the
AU01672 	"         """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet  for further action.  [_ _]"
AU01672 	   (e) Check the CO levels in the tunnels and the Grant Street Stack on
AU01672 	PMCS screen in the
AU01672 	         control room and ensure less than 30ppm prior to commencing
AU01672 	work.  [_ _]
AU01672 	"6. Access to the Grant St ventilation station, on the mezzanine level,"
AU01672 	 is via the Grant St.
AU01672 	   stairwell adjacent to the vent stack.  Access to substation 1 is
AU01672 	through the mezzanine
AU01672 	"   level walkway, north of the smoke duct, then crossing over the smoke"
AU01672 	 duct twice using
AU01672 	"  the service ladders to the roof of the substation, then down a"
AU01672 	serviceladder  to the tunnel
AU01672 	  and then along the tunnel walkway to the substation.
AU01672 	   WARNINGS:
AU01672 	   DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECKS  WHENEVER THERE ARE MORE THAN 2 FANS
AU01672 	  ARE OPERATIONAL.
AU01672 	   DO NOT ENTER THE AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE. TWO OR
AU01672 	   MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER ANY  WORK  IS CARRIED OUT IN
AU01672 	   THIS AREA.  OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS
AU01672 	   DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED FOR
AU01672 	   WORK  IN THIS AREA.  TO CROSS THE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER MUST BE USED
AU01672 	   AT ALL TIMES
AU01672 	"7. Prior to entering the Grant St Stairwell, contact the TCR and requestthey"
AU01672 	select manual
AU01672 	   control for all Grant St fans and to lock in fan EFW 01 for
AU01672 	continuing operation.
AU01672 	   (NOTE: There must be at least one fan operation at all times).
AU01672 	8. Fan Chamber  Access
AU01672 	"      (a) Enter the fan room airlock from the mezzanine floor, not the"
AU01672 	smoke duct.  To open the
AU01672 	            airlock doors will require considerable force.  Equalise
AU01672 	thepressure in the air lock
AU01672 	            and the fan room using the hatches in the wall before
AU01672 	entering the fan room.   [_ _]
AU01672 	     WARNING:
AU01672 	"    HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN, WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN"
AU01672 	    CHAMBER.
AU01672 	    DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1  METRE OF AN
AU01672 	"    OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD,  AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX  35 kph"
AU01672 	9. Work plan for fan EFW 02.
AU01672 	9.1 Fan Room Static Checks
AU01672 	      (a) Engage the EMERGENCY STOP button adjacent to the motor.  [_ _]
AU01672 	      (b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and ensure
AU01672 	that the rubber bushing
AU01672 	"            is moved freely, adjust if required.  [_ _]"
AU01672 	      (c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from motor
AU01672 	bearings for any noticeable
AU01672 	           colour change.   [_ _]
AU01672 	      (d) Open local electrical junction box e.g. : 1A EFW 02 JB-2
AU01672 	Inspect electrical wiring and
AU01672 	"            connections, inspect all glands for tightness.  [_ _]"
AU01672 	"      (e) Visually inspect the motor for evidence of condensation, white"
AU01672 	powder or similar.
AU01672 	"            Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet any"
AU01672 	"evidence of condensation,"
AU01672 	            powder and the like and notify the Team Leader or his
AU01672 	representative.  [_ _]
AU01672 	      (f) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
AU01672 	heater windings.
AU01672 	          (i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
AU01672 	"          (ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor"
AU01672 	               Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
AU01672 	isolated and is to remain
AU01672 	               isolated.
AU01672 	               (a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
AU01672 	(where connected) and
AU01672 	                     bridge heater terminals.
AU01672 	               (b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
AU01672 	terminals.
AU01672 	         (iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
AU01672 	motorwindings and the
AU01672 	"                winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the """"Work"
AU01672 	"Done"""" area."
AU01672 	         (iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
AU01672 	connections and carry out
AU01672 	               an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
AU01672 	and earth.  Record
AU01672 	"               the result in the """"Work Done"""" area."
AU01672 	        (v) Remove all temporary connections.
AU01672 	"        (vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate"
AU01672 	"theheater connections,"
AU01672 	              otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
AU01672 	isolated.
AU01672 	        (vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
AU01672 	        (viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
AU01672 	"megohm, then Record"
AU01672 	"                 in the """"Work Done""""area of the Job Sheet and raise a"
AU01672 	new job for the outstanding
AU01672 	                 works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
AU01672 	"Related Job"""" field as well"
AU01672 	                 as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
AU01672 	representative of any
AU01672 	                 outstanding works.
AU01672 	9.2 Running Checks.
AU01672 	      (a) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton and contact the TCR to
AU01672 	start the
AU01672 	            fan.  [_ _]
AU01672 	      (b) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
AU01672 	   [_  _]
AU01672 	      (c) Check the fan for abnormal noise.    [_ _]
AU01672 	      (d) Check the flexible connections for wear and leakage.    [_ _]
AU01672 	      (e) Check the anti-vibration mountings for operation and
AU01672 	structural soundness.    [_ _]
AU01672 	      (f ) Check the operation of the local monitor.    [_ _]
AU01672 	"      (g) Record any abnormalities in the """"'Work Done"""" area of Job"
AU01672 	Sheet for further
AU01672 	            action.    [_ _]
AU01672 	      (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the Local EMERGENCY STOP
AU01672 	pushbutton.
AU01672 	      (f  ) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01672 	9.3 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
AU01672 	    CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
AU01672 	REQUIRED
AU01672 	                         AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
AU01672 	"       (a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to"
AU01672 	"substation1, then remove the"
AU01672 	"         safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove"
AU01672 	the fan motor isolation
AU01672 	         at  the MCC.
AU01672 	         Note:  Ensure that only one non-operational fan is isolated at
AU01672 	any one time.
AU01672 	       (b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF position
AU01672 	to the MANUAL and
AU01672 	         the  REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch from the REMOTE position
AU01672 	to the LOCAL
AU01672 	         position.
AU01672 	"       (c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan, that is"
AU01672 	"being maintained,  by                     releasing the lo cal STOP"
AU01672 	pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START pushbutton.
AU01672 	       (d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
AU01672 	starts.
AU01672 	"       (e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the bearings,"
AU01672 	only while the fan is
AU01672 	        running.  Ten pumps per bearing.
AU01672 	"       (f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the"
AU01672 	"bearings, using the retrieval"
AU01672 	        system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
AU01672 	       (g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.     [_
AU01672 	_]
AU01672 	       (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
AU01672 	       (i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01672 	10. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 03.   [_ _]
AU01672 	11. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 04.   [_ _]
AU01672 	12. Repeat step 9  for fan EFW 05.   [_ _]
AU01672 	14. Contact the TCR and request they start fan EFW 05.  [_ _]
AU01672 	13. Repeat step 9 for fan EFW 01.   [_ _]
AU01672 	15. (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged.    [_ _]
AU01672 	"      (b) Collect all tools and materials, leave the fan room, again"
AU01672 	equalise the corridor and the
AU01672 	            fan room pressures.  [_ _]
AU01672 	"16. At Sub 1, inspect the fan starter cabinet for loose connections, hot"
AU01672 	"connections, accumulated"
AU01672 	      debris and any abnormal conditions.  [_ _]
AU01672 	17. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 02.   [_ _]
AU01672 	18. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 03.   [_ _]
AU01672 	19. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 04.   [_ _]
AU01672 	20. Contact the TCR and request the TCR to start an additional fan from
AU01672 	EFW 01 to
AU01672 	      EFW 04.  [_ _]
AU01672 	"21. Once the additional fan has started, request the TCR to stop EFW 05."
AU01672 	[_ _]
AU01672 	22. Repeat step 16 for fan EFW 05.   [_ _]
AU01672 	23. (a) Check the lighting within the fan chamber for operation.  [_ _]
AU01672 	      (b) Repair any light found to be not operating or raise a new
AU01672 	jobsheet for the repair of
AU01672 	            the fan chamber lighting.
AU01672 	24. Notify the control room on completion of the work and advise that
AU01672 	the fan control has been
AU01672 	      returned to the TCR and that automatic operation can be resumed.
AU01672 	  [_ _]
AU01672 	25.  Return to control room and ensure all fans are operational.

AU01672 	requiring the

AU01672 	available for

AU01672 	operationof any fan.  [_ _]

AU01672 	air lock.

AU01686 	12 M Check of  Grant St  Vent Station Damper Actuators
AU01686 	(PRELIMINARY)
AU01686 	These checks are carried out  in conjunction with other checks on Grant
AU01686 	Street Ventilation Station damper actuators.
AU01686 	
AU01686 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01686 	1.  Obtain Permit to Work for entry to ventilation rooms and to
AU01686 	    interrupt operations.
AU01686 	2.  Reference manual: TROX Technik - Melbourne City Link Tunnel
AU01686 	"    Project, Operating & Maintenance Instructions Manual"
AU01686 	3.  Traffic Control Room Operator will operate actuators with
AU01686 	    maintenance personnel observing operation in smoke duct.
AU01686 	    Maintain radio contact at all times.
AU01686 	4.  Access to Grant St  ventilation station and smoke duct is
AU01686 	    through double locked doors
AU01686 	    on stairway in Grant St. adjacent to vent stack down to
AU01686 	    mezzanine floor.
AU01686 	"    Dampers are situated in western wall of mezzanine floor, in"
AU01686 	    floor of smoke duct and at smoke duct and tunnel air entry
AU01686 	    to Fan Room.
AU01686 	5.  Inform control room when in position at western end of
AU01686 	    mezzanine floor dampers to commence checks.
AU01686 	6.  TCR Operator to open and close damper MDG 01several times.
AU01686 	7.  Observe damper blades for non- standard operation such as
AU01686 	"    dampers that open or close sluggishly, open partially, fail"
AU01686 	    to open or close tightly.   [_ _]
AU01686 	8.  Repeat steps 5 to 7 for damper MDG 02 in Ventilation
AU01686 	    Station.   [_ _]
AU01686 	9.  Repeat steps 5 to 7 for damper MDG 03 in Ventilation
AU01686 	10. Repeat steps 5 to 7 for damper MDG 04 in Ventilation
AU01686 	11. Repeat steps 5 to 7 for damper MDG 05 in Ventilation
AU01686 	12. Repeat steps 5 to 7 for damper MDG 06 in Ventilation
AU01686 	13. Repeat steps 5 to 7 for damper MDG 07 in Ventilation
AU01686 	14. Record in Work Done area of Job Sheet any dampers that have
AU01686 	    suspect operation.
AU01686 	15. Notify the control room when all the checks are complete.
AU01686 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01686 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01686 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01686 	Note:
AU01686 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01686 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01686 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01686 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01686 	        it's intended function.
AU01686 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01686 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01686 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01686 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01686 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01686 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01686 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01686 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01686 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01686 	        intended function.

AU01849 	"03 M Discuss, explain HV syst state & procedures with TCRO's"
AU01849 	
AU01849 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01849 	1. A High Voltage Electrical Operator is to discuss with each
AU01849 	"   TCRO, the status and the TLO Procedures High Voltage"
AU01849 	   Switching Sequences - Reference M-STG-EL-500 dated the 28th
AU01849 	   February 2000.
AU01849 	   The aim is to create an environment that will allow the
AU01849 	   TCRO's:
AU01849 	    (a) to maintain a ongoing awareness for the High Voltage
AU01849 	        system
AU01849 	    (b) have a working understanding of the High Voltage System
AU01849 	    (c) and the TCRO's can receive answers to any questions they
AU01849 	        may have regarding the operation and or configuration of
AU01849 	        the High Voltage network.
AU01849 	2. The TCRO's must be familiar with and understand the present
AU01849 	   state of the HV network as per the PMCS Electrical
AU01849 	   Distribution Screen.
AU01849 	3. The TCRO's must be familiar with the various conditions
AU01849 	   covered in the  TLO Procedures High Voltage Switching
AU01849 	   Sequences - Reference M-STG-EL-500 dated the 28th February
AU01849 	2000
AU01849 	"4. Complete the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, following"
AU01849 	   discussion wiith each TCRO.
AU01849 	   Record Details Below
AU01849 	===========================================================
AU01849 	"  TCRO Name    |  Date  ,,,,| Discussion |  Network Status"
AU01849 	"               |        ,,,,| Complete   |  Normal  | Abnormal"

AU01963 	   equipment.

AU01963 	   on-going basis.

AU01963 	   recipients.

AU01963 	   ELECTRICAL APPARATUS is completed.
AU01670 	03 M Check of  Burnley Tunnel Jet Fans Vibration & Temps
AU01670 	Vibration (Out of Balance) checks are to be done on the PMCS in
AU01670 	Traffic Control Room.
AU01670 	
AU01670 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01670 	1. Fan Vibration
AU01670 	   Check motor bearing out of balance measurement on PMCS system
AU01670 	   in control room is operational and reading is less than
AU01670 	   maximum level of 4.5 mm/s.  If the reading is greater than
AU01670 	"   4.5mm/s, record the reading in the comments section of form"
AU01670 	   BURNLEY TUNNEL JET FANS - Monthly Check Sheet -
AU01670 	   TMF-3012-OP-0109.    [_ _]
AU01670 	2. Check and record hours run from meter in Eastbound Tunnel
AU01670 	   Equipment Rooms on check sheet.  [_ _]
AU01670 	  Note: There are no Jet Fans supplied from ERE 12.
AU01670 	"3. Check the trend log of recorded data, for each fan for the"
AU01670 	"   last month, looking for readings suggesting an out of balance"
AU01670 	   occurance or similar.  If the graphs indicate a trend
AU01670 	"   developing or shows an extraordinary event,  record in the"
AU01670 	   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and notify the Superintendant
AU01670 	   for further analysis.   [_ _]
AU01670 	NOTE:  If there is a trending increase in Jet Fan vibration
AU01670 	"levels, from previous readings, refer to Job Templates. TUNNEL"
AU01670 	JET FANS and or JET FAN DEFECT INSPECTION
