AU01617 	06 M Jet Fan maintenance and lubrication.
AU01617 	
AU01617 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01617 	1.  Works to be carried out on one jet fan at a time so as to
AU01617 	    not affect the operation of total tunnel ventilation
AU01617 	2.  Notify control room prior to commencing work.
AU01617 	3.  Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
AU01617 	    and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
AU01617 	    or 28.
AU01617 	"4.  Reference Manual;  Witt & Sohn, Operations and Maintenance"
AU01617 	"    Manual , Certificate 18. (M-STG-VE-29047 )"
AU01617 	5.  In associated equipment room switch jet fan AUTO/OFF/MAN
AU01617 	    selector switch to MAN and REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL switch to LOCAL
AU01617 	    to enable control adjacent to jet fan.  [_ _]
AU01617 	6.  Running visual inspection
AU01617 	      WARNING:  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF BODY IN INLET OR OUTLET
AU01617 	      AIR STREAM WHEN FAN IS RUNNING.
AU01617 	      HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN.
AU01617 	   (a) Start fan locally by pressing the START button on the
AU01617 	    panel adjacent to the fan.   [_ _]
AU01617 	   (b) Check for any abnormal noise or movement from the
AU01617 	    fan.  [_ _]
AU01617 	   (c) Check the fan unit vibration mountings and safety rods
AU01617 	    for loose nuts and bolts.  [_ _]
AU01617 	   (d) Stop fan locally with the EMERGENCY STOP button.  [_ _]
AU01617 	"   (e) If any non-conforming items are found, investigate"
AU01617 	    further in the static fan inspection.  [_ _]
AU01617 	7.  Static fan inspection
AU01617 	   (a) Ensure the local  EMERGENCY STOP button is engaged. [_ _]
AU01617 	   (b) Conduct a thorough visual inspection for damage and
AU01617 	"    corrosion of the silencers, impeller, inlet cone, cable"
AU01617 	"    connections, mounting frame and vibration attenuators."
AU01617 	         Any cracks identified in the vicinity must be noted in
AU01617 	"         the ""Work done"" area of the job sheet for"
AU01617 	         further investigation.   [_ _] Photo of Cracks found
AU01617 	         will be required.
AU01617 	"         Any damage, especially to surface protection, must be"
AU01617 	"         noted in the ""Work done"" area of the job sheet for"
AU01617 	         further investigation.   [_ _]
AU01617 	   (c) Carry out careful inspection of all supporting hardware
AU01617 	"    and screw connections, including the eight vibration bracket"
AU01617 	    installations and the four safety rod brackets.  Using a
AU01617 	"    torque wrench, ensure that the accessible supporting screw"
AU01617 	    connections are secured and fixed with the correct torque
AU01617 	    settings.  [_ _]
AU01617 	         NOTE: Torque Settings
AU01617 	                       M10 = 37Nm
AU01617 	                       M12 = 65Nm
AU01617 	                       M16 = 150Nm
AU01617 	                       M20 = 300Nm      as per reference manual
AU01617 	                                        in step 4
AU01617 	    Bolts with Nylon washers should only be checked for
AU01617 	    tightness. Do not torque as nylon washer get damaged
AU01617 	    Do not torque anchor bolts in tunnel roof. Check for
AU01617 	    tightness only.
AU01617 	"   (d) If any non-conforming items are found, record in the"
AU01617 	"    ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet and rectify immediately"
AU01617 	"    where possible to the requirements of the Witt & Sohn ,"
AU01617 	"    Operations and Maintenance Manual , Certificate 18."
AU01617 	    (M-STG-VE-29047).   This inspection is carried out
AU01617 	    externally via the inlet and exhaust ends using a
AU01617 	    torch.  [_ _]
AU01617 	   (e) Remove cover to motor junction box and check the cable
AU01617 	    connections visually for tightness and evidence of
AU01617 	    overheating.
AU01617 	8.  Lubrication
AU01617 	"   (a) Release the key operated EMERGENCY STOP button, restart"
AU01617 	    fan  locally.
AU01617 	   (b) Regrease bearings using grease gun on nipples onside of
AU01617 	"    fan with  Mobilith SHC220 (TF000021) grease, 10 pumps of"
AU01617 	    hand grease gun per grease nipple.
AU01617 	"         Note:  Lubrication should be carried out between 3,000"
AU01617 	"         and 4,000 hours running time when access is available."
AU01617 	         Do not over grease.    [_ _]
AU01617 	   (c) Stop fan using local EMERGENCY STOP button
AU01617 	   (d) Release the EMERGENCY STOP button using a Key.  (Remove
AU01617 	    the key)   [_ _]
AU01617 	9.  Equipment Room Control Panel.
AU01617 	   (a) Switch fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch to REMOTE to
AU01617 	    enable control at panel
AU01617 	   (b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
AU01617 	"    control panel for damage evidence of insect infestation,"
AU01617 	"    ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as"
AU01617 	    required).  [_ _]
AU01617 	   (c) Check cable connections visually for tightness and signs
AU01617 	    of overheating and inspect electrical control
AU01617 	    equipment [_ _]
AU01617 	   (d) Start fan with START pushbutton on panel and leave
AU01617 	    running for approximately 5 minutes
AU01617 	   (e) Check ammeter at electrical panel to verify fan is
AU01617 	    operating within current limits FLC 100A.  [_ _]
AU01617 	   (f ) Using an infra red thermometer check the temperature of
AU01617 	    the connections and power cables to the motor.   Record in
AU01617 	"    the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet if the temperature"
AU01617 	    recorded is more that 10? to 15? C above ambient.   [_ _]
AU01617 	"   (g) Record the ""hours run"" from the Jet Fan hour run meter"
AU01617 	"    on the panel door in the ""Work Done"""" area of the job"
AU01617 	    sheet.   [_ _]
AU01617 	       Note:  Hour run meters are on the control panels for
AU01617 	              non-reversing fans only.
AU01617 	              Reversing fans hour run readings are obtainable
AU01617 	              from the PMCS screens in the control room
AU01617 	10. Return the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE switch to the OFF position and
AU01617 	    the AUTO/OFF/MAN  fan selector switch to the AUTO
AU01617 	    position.   [_ _]
AU01617 	11. Advise the Traffic control room operator that control of the
AU01617 	    fan is returned to the control room.    [_ _]
AU01617 	"12. If carrying out maintenance duties adjacent to the AM Cable,"
AU01617 	"    Leaky  Co-axial cable, Fibrolazer cable, deluge pipework,"
AU01617 	    public address loud speakers and cables and any other
AU01617 	    equipment mounted on tunnel upper walls and roof.
AU01617 	   (a) Check for any abnormal conditions and record in the
AU01617 	"    ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and bring to the attention"
AU01617 	    of the Team Leader Electrical or his representative.
AU01617 	13. Notify control room on completion of work.
AU01617 	14. Enter the hours run for the jet fan into the Plant item
AU01617 	"    screen, then select the usage tab."
AU01617 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01617 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01617 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01617 	Note:
AU01617 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01617 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01617 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01617 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01617 	        it's intended function.
AU01617 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01617 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01617 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01617 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01617 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01617 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01617 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01617 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01617 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01617 	        intended function.
AU01617 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01617 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01617 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01851 	    parameter found when in the substations.

AU02183 	12 M Change of North Stick lighting filters for autumn
AU02183 	
AU02183 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02183 	1. Notify the TCR prior to commencing this job
AU02183 	"2. Refer to and read TMI-3012-SA-0122 """"Floating Elevated Work"
AU02183 	"   Platform"""" procedure prior to commencing job for safety"
AU02183 	   procedures to be followed whilst carrying out this job.
AU02183 	3. Whilst Inspecting the lighting fittings:-
AU02183 	   (a) Change the lamps
AU02183 	"   (b) Check flexible hose connections for damage etc, repair"
AU02183 	       any damage found.
AU02183 	"   (c) Check all seals for damage and leaks, replace any seals"
AU02183 	       found to be faulty
AU02183 	   (d) Check the lighting control gear and connections for
AU02183 	"       damage, overheating and operation, repair and or"
AU02183 	       replace faulty components.
AU02183 	   (e) Check the light fitting for damage and or corrosion.
AU02183 	       Repair damaged or faulty light fittings and components
AU02183 	"       that are damaged.  Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of"
AU02183 	"       the Job Sheet the number of lamps replaced, as well"
AU02183 	       indicate on form TMF-3012-OP-0221 Architectural Feature
AU02183 	       Lighting - Red Stick (North) the postion of fittings
AU02183 	       changed.
AU02183 	   (f) Inspect glass lens for damage replace as required and
AU02183 	"       clean the glass lens of all dirt, dust and or grime."
AU02183 	   (g) Remove any debris accumualted within the light fitting.
AU02183 	   (h) Apply anti-seize to all threads replaced in light
AU02183 	       fitting.
AU02183 	"4. Remove and return to store the Red filters (300000688) , and"
AU02183 	   install yellow filters (300000686) on the light fittings.
AU02183 	5. Repair any damaged Red filters (300000688) and record
AU02183 	"   details in """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet and report"
AU02183 	   any damage to the Team leader or his representitive.
AU02183 	6. Notify the TCRO on completion of the job.
AU02183 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02183 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02183 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU02183 	Note:
AU02183 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02183 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02183 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02183 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02183 	        it's intended function.
AU02183 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02183 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02183 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02183 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02183 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02183 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02183 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02183 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02183 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02183 	        intended function.
AU02183 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU02183 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02183 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU02185 	
AU02185 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02185 	1. Notify the TCR prior to commencing this job
AU02185 	"2. Refer to and read TMI-3012-SA-0122 """"Floating Elevated Work"
AU02185 	"   Platform"""" procedure prior to commencing job for safety"
AU02185 	   procedures to be followed whilst carrying out this job.
AU02185 	"3. Visually inspect the light fitting, flexible hose, glass"
AU02185 	   lens for damage and or corrosion. Repair and or replace
AU02185 	   components that are damaged.
AU02185 	   (a) Replace and or repair any lamp that has failed.  Repair
AU02185 	       damaged or faulty light fittings and components that
AU02185 	"       are damaged.  Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of the"
AU02185 	"       job sheet the number of lamps replaced, as well"
AU02185 	       indicate on form TMF-3012-OP-0221 Architectural Feature
AU02185 	       Lighting - Red Sticks (North) the position of fittings
AU02185 	       changed.
AU02185 	   (b) Inspect glass lens for damage replace as required and
AU02185 	       clean the external surface of the glass lens of all
AU02185 	"       dirt, dust and or grime."
AU02185 	   (c) Apply anti-seize to all threads replaced in light
AU02185 	       fitting.
AU02185 	"4. Remove, clean and return to store the Purple/Lavender"
AU02185 	"   filters (300000687), and install Blue/Green filters"
AU02185 	   (300000689) on the light fittings.

AU02185 	"   record details in """"Work Done"""" area of the Job sheet and"
AU02185 	   report any damage to the Team Leader or his representative
AU02185 	6. Notify the TCRO on completion of the job.

AU02060 	05 Y Inspect the welds of the North Sticks
AU02060 	
AU02060 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02060 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job.
AU02060 	2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - The Stick Wall Periodic
AU02060 	   Non-Destructive Testing - Scope. Report No. 4199/002 Provided
AU02060 	   by Intico.
AU02060 	3. Refer to Report No. 4199/007
AU02060 	Item 1.1
AU02060 	External
AU02060 	    Examine the external features from the stick to foundation
AU02060 	    interface up to a minimum of 2 metres above the baseplate
AU02060 	    for evidence of metal and or paint cracking as well as
AU02060 	    evidence of corrosion setting in.
AU02060 	(a) Visually examine the welds connecting the vertical
AU02060 	    stiffeners to the skin plates.
AU02060 	(b) Visually examine the welds connecting the upper base plate
AU02060 	    to the vertical elements (Stiffeners and skin plates).
AU02060 	Internal
AU02060 	"    Examine the all internal features, using the access door,"
AU02060 	    from the upper base plate up to a minimum height of 500 mm
AU02060 	    evidence of corrosion setting in.  A torch and mirror is
AU02060 	    required.
AU02060 	(c) Visually examine the welds connecting the vertical
AU02060 	    stiffeners to the skin plates
AU02060 	(d) Visually examine the welds connecting the upper base plate
AU02060 	(e) Examine the general internal cavity for visible degradation
AU02060 	    as well as any evidence of moisture of water deposits.
AU02060 	(f) Record all details of any cracks in the metal or welds or
AU02060 	    paint surfaces along with any evidence of water residues as
AU02060 	    well as any corrosion and or degradation.  Raise a new
AU02060 	    jobsheet for any outstanding works.
AU02060 	Item 1.2
AU02060 	"(a) Visually examine the protective ""Denso Tape"" wrap on each"
AU02060 	    of the fixing nuts.  Examine for signs of deterioration and
AU02060 	    for any evidence of corrosion of the nut or stud.
AU02060 	(b) Record details of any deterioration of the protective wrap
AU02060 	    and or corrosion.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02060 	    works.
AU02060 	Item 1.3
AU02060 	(a) Visually inspect the external surface of the welds joining
AU02060 	"    the two box sections of the stick, at splice level."
AU02060 	    Particular attention should be paid to detecting paint
AU02060 	    cracking that may occur at the joint line.  Use an elevated
AU02060 	"    work platform to access and inspect the joint in each face,"
AU02060 	    where EWP access is not possible use binoculars.
AU02060 	(b) Visually inspect the external faces for visible degradation
AU02060 	    and or corrosion.
AU02060 	(c) Record details of any evidence of cracks in paint or the
AU02060 	    metal (welds) as well as any surface degradation.  Raise a
AU02060 	    new jobsheet for any outstanding works.
AU02060 	Item 2.1
AU02060 	"(a) Carry out a NDT Test on the ""vertical stiffener to skin"
AU02060 	"    plate welds"" and the ""upper base plate to skin plate and"
AU02060 	"    stiffener welds"".  Test all welds up to a height of +500mm"
AU02060 	    from the upper base plate
AU02060 	(b) Provide a written report of the result of each test.
AU02060 	Item 4.1  (First Inspection in 2008)
AU02060 	"(a) Carry out a NDT examination of the ""Upper base plate -"
AU02060 	    underside surfaces in the upper baseplate to lower baseplate
AU02060 	"    stiffener welds"".  Carry out the examination via the access"
AU02060 	    door.  Examine all accessible areas for discontinuity of the
AU02060 	    plate-weld joint and for crack indications in the upper
AU02060 	    baseplate.
AU02060 	4. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.
AU02062 	05 Y NDT Test of hold down studs
AU02062 	
AU02062 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02062 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job.
AU02062 	2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - The Stick Wall Periodic
AU02062 	   Non-Destructive Testing - Scope.
AU02062 	   Report No. 4199/002 Provided by Bureau Veritas.
AU02062 	3. The NDT testing shall be carried by the sub-contractor in the
AU02062 	   presence of the Civil worker.
AU02062 	"4. Refer to ""Red Stick Wall  Inspections - Report No 4199/002""."
AU02062 	Item 4.2  (Initial Inspection 2008)
AU02062 	(a) Carry out a NDT examination of the hold-down studs.  Examine
AU02062 	"    at least 400mm of the stud, from the free end, for cracking."
AU02062 	(b) Provide a written report of the result of each test.
AU02062 	Item 4.3  (Initial Inspection 2008 - Future inspections to be
AU02062 	determined)
AU02062 	(a) Tension check.
AU02062 	"    Sample tension on hold down studs to 500kN on Sticks N1, N6,"
AU02062 	"    N11, N16, N21."
AU02062 	(b) Provide a written report of the results from the tests.
AU02062 	(c) Recommend future frequency of tests.
AU02062 	5. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.
AU02058 	12 M Inspect the North Sticks
AU02058 	
AU02058 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02058 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job.
AU02058 	2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - The Stick Wall Periodic
AU02058 	   Non-Destructive Testing - Scope.
AU02058 	   Report No. 4199/002 Provided by Intico.
AU02058 	"3. Refer to ""Red Stick Wall  Inspections - Stick Inspectional"
AU02058 	"   Location Details"" TMF-3012-OP-0356 for the location of the"
AU02058 	   various components and structural items for inspection.
AU02058 	Item 3.1
AU02058 	"(a) Visually inspect, from the access door, the base and"
AU02058 	    interior of each stick looking for water pooling in the
AU02058 	"    base, evidence of moisture and or corrosion."
AU02058 	(b) Visually inspect the seal of the access door for damage
AU02058 	(c) Examine stick interior for evidence of the source of any
AU02058 	    possible leak e.g. Top cover or access door.
AU02058 	(d) Estimate the depth and quantity of any water residue and
AU02058 	    record.
AU02058 	"(d) Record details of any water residues (along with source),"
AU02058 	"    corrosion and or damage on form ""ANNUAL NORTH STICK"
AU02058 	"    INSPECTION""  TMF-3012-OP-0352.  Raise a new jobsheet for any"
AU02058 	    outstanding works.
AU02058 	Item 3.2
AU02058 	"(a) Visually inspect, from the ground and using binoculars, all"
AU02058 	"    faces of each stick, examining the protective coating for"
AU02058 	"    cracks, peeling, blisters and evidence of corrosion."
AU02058 	(b) Record details of any degradation of protective coating and
AU02058 	"    or corrosion on form""ANNUAL NORTH STICK INSPECTION"""
AU02058 	    TMF-3012-OP-0352.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02058 	    works.
AU02058 	Item 3.3
AU02058 	(a) Visually inspect the Foundation to Stick seal.  Examine for
AU02058 	    the effectiveness of the elastic seal between the steelwork
AU02058 	    and the concrete foundation.  Seal may separate from the
AU02058 	    surfaces or may be missing.
AU02058 	(b) Record details of any degradation of the seal material and
AU02058 	"    or any damaged or missing material on form ""ANNUAL NORTH"
AU02058 	"    STICK INSPECTION"" TMF-3012-OP-0352.  Raise a new jobsheet"
AU02058 	    for any outstanding works.
AU02058 	Item 3.4
AU02058 	(a) Visually examine each stick for signs of structural damage.
AU02058 	"    This would include vandalism, impact and or displacement."
AU02058 	 Examine the linearity of each stick against the remainder of
AU02058 	 the group. .
AU02058 	"(b) Inspect the access door, at the base, for damage and a full"
AU02058 	     complement of setscrews.
AU02058 	(c) Record details of any structural damage along with all other
AU02058 	"    visible damage on form ""ANNUAL NORTH STICK INSPECTION"""
AU02058 	4. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.
AU02065 	12 M Test of Stick TMD function
AU02065 	
AU02065 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02065 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job
AU02065 	"2. Reference Vipac Report ""Tuned Mass Damper Maintenance -"
AU02065 	"   Western link Stick Wall"""
AU02065 	   Report Nos. 303562-1 (May 02) & 303699-1(August 02)
AU02065 	3. This Tuned Mass Damper testing is to be carried out by the
AU02065 	   sub-contractor in the presence of the Civil Worker.
AU02065 	"4. Where the job is scheduled at the following times, use the"
AU02065 	   following list to determine the choice of sticks to perform
AU02065 	   the tests on.
AU02065 	Feb-2004 (1) Jan-2005 (2) Jan-2006 (3)
AU02065 	Jan-2007 (1) Jan-2008 (2) Jan-2009(3)
AU02065 	Jan-2010 (1) Jan-2011 (2) etc
AU02065 	    Where the (n) is 1; then
AU02065 	"    N1, N2, N6, N11, N16, N17, N21, S12, S13, S14, S15, S16, S17"
AU02065 	    & S18
AU02065 	    Where the (n) is 2 ; then
AU02065 	"    N3, N4, N5, N13, N14, N19,N20, S6, S7, S8, S9, S10 & S11"
AU02065 	    Where the (n) is 3; then
AU02065 	"    N7, N8, N9, N10, N12, N15, N18, S1, S2, S3, S4, S5 & S6,"
AU02065 	"    On the occasion of February 2004 (only), perform tests on"
AU02065 	"    Stick N13, N15, N16, N20 & N21 to confirm the on-going"
AU02065 	    integrity of previous repairs (N16 & N20 are included the
AU02065 	    selected population).
AU02065 	4. Use an Elevated Work Platform to access the top of the stick
AU02065 	5. Attach an accelerometer (set up so that it outputs
AU02065 	   displacement) near the middle of the top edge of the stick
AU02065 	6. Excite the stick by hand to get it swaying at its natural
AU02065 	   frequency in a North South direction.
AU02065 	7. Keep exciting the stick until a higher displacement cannot be
AU02065 	   achieved.
AU02065 	8. Let go of the stick and allow the movement to decay
AU02065 	9. Capture the initial part of the decay curve on an FFT
AU02065 	   analyser
AU02065 	"10. Download the data, use successive peaks and troughs to"
AU02065 	    calculate the natural frequency and the displacement at
AU02065 	    which tuned damping ceases and natural damping takes over.
AU02065 	"11. Repeat steps 6 to 10, exciting the stick in an East West"
AU02065 	    direction.
AU02065 	12. The sub-contractor is to supply a report setting out the
AU02065 	    result of the tests as well as a detailed listing of minor
AU02065 	    repairs carried out along with any works still outstanding.
AU02065 	13. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.
AU01599 	03 M Inspection of the OHVD System
AU01599 	
AU01599 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01599 	1. Notify the Control room prior to accessing the OHVD
AU01599 	"   system,  [___]"
AU01599 	2. Reference Manual is Securite & Signalisation Preventative
AU01599 	   Maintenance ED/RH/TRAIN/04.  This manual or section can be
AU01599 	   found in Alstom - VMS/ADS/LUS/OHVD Contract Manuals
AU01599 	   M-MCL-TM-1569.
AU01599 	"3. Set up lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01599 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01599 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12,13 & 14  [_ _]"
AU01599 	"4. Clean, inspect and check alignment of the OHVD Receivers and"
AU01599 	   Transmitters.   [_ _]
AU01599 	5. Check the operation of the detectors by breaking the detector
AU01599 	   paths in the correct sequence.   The correct sequence is that
AU01599 	   the two beams must be broken in the direction of the traffic
AU01599 	   flow and the second beam must be broken within two seconds
AU01599 	   of the first being broken.  Visually check that the sign
AU01599 	   operates correctly and that the TCR receive an alarm  [___]
AU01599 	6. Inspect the cabinet at the height detector for damage and
AU01599 	   corrosion and insect infestation.  [___]
AU01599 	7. Check the equipment within the cabinet for loose connections
AU01599 	   and evidence of burnt components.  [_ _]
AU01599 	8. Clean the front panel and inspect the OHVD message sign for
AU01599 	   damage & corrosion.  [_ _]
AU01599 	9. Inspect the cabinet and equipment within at the OHVD message
AU01599 	"   sign for damage, loose connections, evidence of burnt"
AU01599 	   components and insect infestation.  [_ _]
AU01599 	10. Check operation of the sign by pressing the test pushbutton
AU01599 	    on the CD501 boards.   [___]
AU01599 	11. Check the local controller cabinet for any sign of damage &
AU01599 	    corrosion.  [___]
AU01599 	12. Check the components in the local controller cabinet for
AU01599 	"    burnt components, insect infestation and loose"
AU01599 	    connections  [___]
AU01599 	"13. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01599 	    parameters in the Work Done section of the Job Sheet.  Raise
AU01599 	    a new jobsheet for any corrective works that are
AU01599 	    outstanding.
AU01599 	14. Notify the control room prior to leaving OHVD site.
AU01599 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01599 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01599 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01599 	Note:
AU01599 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01599 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01599 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01599 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01599 	        it's intended function.
AU01599 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01599 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01599 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01599 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01599 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01599 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01599 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01599 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01599 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01599 	        intended function.
AU01599 	CONDITION RATING SCORE
AU01599 	",,1.,,Detector,,,,,,[,,]"
AU01599 	",,2.,,Controller,,,,[,,],,"
AU01599 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01599 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01600 	12 M Inspection of OHVD System
AU01600 	
AU01600 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01600 	1. Notify the Control room prior to accessing the OHVD
AU01600 	"   system,  [___]"
AU01600 	2. Reference Manual is Securite & Signalisation Preventative
AU01600 	   Maintenance ED/RH/TRAIN/04.  This manual or section can be
AU01600 	   found in Alstom - VMS/ADS/LUS/OHVD Contract Manuals
AU01600 	   M-MCL-TM-1569.
AU01600 	"3. Set up lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01600 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01600 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12,13 & 14  [_ _]"
AU01600 	4. At the control cabinets serving the OHVD Sensors
AU01600 	   (a) check the output voltage of the low voltage power
AU01600 	       supplies for level.  Output voltages should be within
AU01600 	       plus/minus 10% of the rated output.  [___]
AU01600 	   (b) Clean the cabinet internally and ensure ventilation
AU01600 	       louvers are clean.   [___]
AU01600 	   (c) Apply a suitable grease or oil to all hinges.  [___]
AU01600 	5. At the local controller
AU01600 	   (a) Check the operation of the ELCB by pressing the test
AU01600 	       button to trip the circuit breaker.   [___]
AU01600 	   (b) Check the battery terminal for cleanliness.  If dirty or
AU01600 	       corroded clean and check the connections.   [___]
AU01600 	   (c) Clean the cabinet internally and check ventilation
AU01600 	       louvers for blockages and foreign objects.  Clean if any
AU01600 	       blockages are present.   [___]
AU01600 	   (d) Check the cabinet heater for correct on/off
AU01600 	       operation.  [___}
AU01600 	   (e) Apply a suitable grease or oil to all hinges.  [___]
AU01600 	6. At the OHVD sign cabinet
AU01600 	   (a) Clean the cabinet internally and ensure the ventilation
AU01600 	       louvers are clean.  [___]
AU01600 	   (b)  Apply a suitable grease or oil to all hinges.  [___]
AU01600 	7. Check with the TCR that an alarm is received any time a
AU01600 	   control cabinet door is opened.   [___]
AU01600 	"9. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01600 	   parameters in the Work Done section of the Job Sheet.  Raise
AU01600 	   a new jobsheet for any corrective works that are
AU01600 	   outstanding.
AU01600 	10. Notify the control room prior to leaving OHVD system.
AU02181 	"8. At Olympic Park only, carry out the steps 8 throught to 11."
AU02181 	   Carry out Exterior Checks of relevant area(s) (where applicable).
AU02181 	      (a)  Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the building (if
AU02181 	"applicable) for damage,"
AU02181 	"             erosion,  graffiti.  [_ _]"
AU02181 	"      (b)  Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls, roof,"
AU02181 	guttering and and downpipes
AU02181 	"             for damage, leaks and or blockages, remove any debris or"
AU02181 	materials that could cause
AU02181 	            a blockage.  [_ _]

AU02181 	building for erosion and
AU02181 	"           damage to surfaces, fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]"
AU02181 	     (d) Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
AU02181 	9. Inspect floors for moss or slime growth.  Remove moss or slime using
AU02181 	a high pressure
AU02181 	   spray (connected to fire service pipe in ERW00).  Use a concrete
AU02181 	floor cleaner
AU02181 	"   (contains acid) broomed on.  USE CORRECT PPE  EQUIPMENT E.G. GLOVES,"

AU02132 	"4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation, including theoperational"
AU02132 	tube within
AU02132 	"   EXIT signs, replace or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]"
AU02132 	5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all accessible
AU02132 	equipment and
AU02132 	   components within all switchboards and distribution panels.
AU02132 	   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor to assist visual inspection.
AU02132 	 Temperatures of ambient
AU02132 	   plus 10?C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in the
AU02132 	"Work Done"""" area of the"
AU02132 	  Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for corrective action.  Ensure thatthe
AU02132 	Team Leader or his
AU02132 	  representative is informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
AU02132 	"6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU02132 	equipment and components
AU02132 	"   for evidence of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  record"
AU02132 	anything abnormal
AU02132 	"   in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet"
AU02132 	for corrective
AU02132 	   action.     Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed
AU02132 	of the abnormality.  [_ _]
AU02132 	"7.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU02132 	"contactors for chattering,"
AU02132 	    arcing etc.  [_ _]
AU02132 	"8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either replace"
AU02132 	spent surge diverters
AU02132 	     when less than 80% or raise a new Job Sheet for works to be
AU02132 	carriedout.   [_ _]
AU02132 	"9. Inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware, gaskets, seals and"
AU02132 	escutcheons
AU02132 	"   for serviceability and general operation, lubricate as required."
AU02132 	 Carry out any required repairs
AU02132 	   or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU02132 	"10. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU02132 	"looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU02132 	11. Inspect all electrical switchboards and enclosures internally for
AU02132 	"dust, grime and             condensation, clean enclosures of any"
AU02132 	"accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU02132 	12. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.  [_ _]
AU02132 	"13. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for faulty"
AU02132 	"indicators,"
AU02132 	"      faulty meters, damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out repairsor"
AU02132 	indicator lamp
AU02132 	      replacement or raise a new job sheet for any corrective actions.
AU02132 	  [_ _]

AU02132 	"Done"""" area of the Job              Sheet and Inform the Team Le ader"
AU02132 	orhis representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]

AU02132 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture ingress.
AU02132 	 Inspect for source of
AU02132 	"   any water.  Record any details in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job"
AU02132 	sheet and inform the Team
AU02132 	   Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02132 	2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and or
AU02132 	stored items.  Remove
AU02132 	   any obstruction.  [_ _]
AU02132 	3. Check for any eveidence of insect or rodent infestation Clean the
AU02132 	affected area and record in
AU02132 	   work done area .  Inform the Team Leader or his representative if any
AU02132 	further action is
AU02132 	   required.  [_ _]
AU02132 	"4. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets, ledges,"
AU02132 	"cable trays,"
AU02132 	"    cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces,"

AU02132 	"    of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]."

AU02132 	materials.  [_ _]

AU02132 	"trays, cabinets and"
AU02132 	   ceilings.       [_ _]

AU02132 	replace

AU01960 	01 M L1 Inspect of fire doors within the OMB
AU01960 	
AU01960 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01960 	1. This work is to be carried out by suitably qualified personnel.
AU01960 	2. This work is for the OMB building.
AU01960 	3. Inspect the OMB fire doors to AS 1851.7 Type 1 inspection.  The
AU01960 	inspection shall consist of
AU01960 	    an examination of the condition of the door set and a check that it
AU01960 	is operating satisfactorily.
AU01960 	"    In particular, the following routine should be followed."
AU01960 	3.1 Inspect for any remedial work that is outstanding and unfinished andrecord
AU01960 	works to be
AU01960 	      completed in the comments field.
AU01960 	"3.2 Remove any obstructions or non-approved devices such as wedges,"
AU01960 	heavy objects or
AU01960 	     hooks that are used to hold the door open.
AU01960 	"3.3 Check that the door and all it's components, hardware and functions"
AU01960 	are correct.
AU01960 	"3.4 While the door is open, check that all screws are firm in the"
AU01960 	"hinges, latch set faceplate,"
AU01960 	     striking plate and the door closer body and bracket.
AU01960 	"3.5 Inspect that the door identification data notice, required by the"
AU01960 	regulatory authority is firmly
AU01960 	      attached.  The notice is generally mounted on the door edge and
AU01960 	onthe door frame.
AU01960 	"3.6 Check the closing and latching action (on the closing), and that"
AU01960 	thedoor stopping action
AU01960 	      (fully open limit) is functioning (on the opening).
AU01960 	"3.7 With the door closed, check that the leaf is a reasonably even fit"
AU01960 	in the frame.
AU01960 	"4. Record the result of the inspection for each door on """"Operations"
AU01960 	& Maintenance Building
AU01960 	"    Fire Door Inspection"""" form TMF-3012-OP-0279"
AU01960 	5. (a) Check the fire hydrant at the property front entrance for damage
AU01960 	",leakage.   [_ _]"
AU01960 	    (b) Trim plants and foliage to allow identification and access to
AU01960 	the hydrant.   [_ _]
AU01960 	"6. Record the details of any further works required in the """"Work"
AU01960 	"Done""""area of the Job Sheet."
AU01960 	7. Raise a new  job sheet for any corrective action that is required.
AU01960 	"  P2 - Medium Priority."""

AU01837 	12 M inspect of OMB vent fans
AU01837 	
AU01837 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01837 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01837 	"2. Reference Manual A E Smith & Sons Pty Ltd, Operating & Maintenance"
AU01837 	Manual for
AU01837 	   Mechanical Services serving Melbourne City Link Operations and
AU01837 	"Maintenance Building,"
AU01837 	   Balston Street South Melbourne. M-OMB-OM-20000.
AU01837 	3. Ensure the 3 monthly fan inspection is complete.
AU01837 	4. Work plan for roof mounted ventilation fans - SF 1 - Car Park Supply
AU01837 	Air Makeup Fan.
AU01837 	"    (a) At the switchboard, switch the fan control switch to the OFF"
AU01837 	position.  Isolate
AU01837 	"          and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety"
AU01837 	Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01837 	    (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor windings.
AU01837 	 Record any results in the
AU01837 	"          """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet that does not meet"
AU01837 	specifications set out in
AU01837 	           AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01837 	"   (c) At the switchboard, remove the safety tags in accordance with"
AU01837 	"TMI-3012-SA-0103, then"
AU01837 	        switch the fan control switch to the ON position.
AU01837 	   (d) Measure and record the motor current and compare with the rated
AU01837 	current.  Record in the
AU01837 	"        """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet, any results out of limits.."
AU01837 	  [_ _]
AU01837 	"   (f ) Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where applicable."
AU01837 	 [_ _]

AU01630 	03 M Load test of the MGE UPS
AU01630 	
AU01630 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01630 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the work.
AU01630 	2. Check with the control room if any UPS alarms are relevant.
AU01630 	"3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual"
AU01630 	"   E-679380XT/FA, M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel"
AU01630 	"   Electrical Services Training Notes, M-STG-EL-24001,"
AU01630 	   Section 9.
AU01630 	    WARNING
AU01630 	   THE UPS BATTERY POTENTIAL IS APPROXIMATELY 380 VOLTS AND IS
AU01630 	   EARTHED.  THE BATTERIES CAN DELIVER A FAULT CURRENT OF
AU01630 	   APPROXIMATELY 9000 AMPS.  EXPOSED BATTERY TERMINALS ARE
AU01630 	   DANGEROUS AND MUST NOT BE TOUCHED.  IN THE VICINITY OF THE
AU01630 	   BATTERIES USE ONLY TOOLS WHICH ARE FULLY INSULATED.
AU01630 	   SAFETY GLASSES MUST BE WORN WHEN CARRYING OUT  MEASUREMENTS
AU01630 	   ON THE BATTERIES.
AU01630 	4. Check the UPS control panel readout for alarms and or normal
AU01630 	"   status.  If an alarm is found, record the alarm in the Work"
AU01630 	   Done Area of the Job Sheet. Do Not Continue with this Job if
AU01630 	   an alarm is present.  [_ _]
AU01630 	5. Record measurements on form 03 M MGE Uninterruptible Power
AU01630 	"   Supply Battery Inspection and Test, TMF-3012-OP-0099."
AU01630 	6. Measure and record the UPS room temperature.   [_ _]
AU01630 	7. Check and record DC voltage and AC ripple voltage for each
AU01630 	   bank of batteries.  If a discrepancy is found then record in
AU01630 	   the Work Done Area of the Job Sheet.  Do Not Continue
AU01630 	   this job sheet if there is a discrepancy in the readings
AU01630 	   recorded and the readings expected.  [_ _]
AU01630 	"8. To simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the"
AU01630 	   UPS operation will change to the batteries.  [_ _]
AU01630 	"9. Operate the UPS, in this mode, for at least 10"
AU01630 	   minutes.  [_ _]
AU01630 	10. Measure and record the DC voltage for each shelf of the
AU01630 	    battery banks.
AU01630 	11. Measure and record the DC current flow in each battery bank.
AU01630 	12. Return the UPS to normal operation by closing Mains 1
AU01630 	    Isolator Q1.  [_ _]
AU01630 	13. With an Optical thermometer measure the temperature of the
AU01630 	    batteries and their inter-connections.  Temperature readings
AU01630 	    should approximate ambient room temperature.  When a
AU01630 	    connection is found to having a temperature greater than 5
AU01630 	"    degrees above room  temperature, in the Work Done Area of"
AU01630 	"    the Job Sheet, record the battery location, terminal"
AU01630 	"    identification, measured  temperature.  [_ _]"
AU01630 	14. With an Optical thermometer measure the average temperature
AU01630 	    of the two (AC & DC) capacitor banks and record the result.
AU01630 	15. With an anemometer measure and record the airflow from each
AU01630 	    of the UPS cooling fans.
AU01630 	16. With the Optical thermometer measure and record the
AU01630 	    temperature of each of the UPS cooling fans.  [_ _]
AU01630 	17. Ensure Normal operation of the UPS.  [_ _]
AU01630 	18. Sweep and clean the UPS room:
AU01630 	    Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the
AU01630 	    walls.   [___]
AU01630 	"    Sweep the control panel room floors as well, vacuum the"
AU01630 	    control panel enclosures and any surfaces that will collect
AU01630 	    dust deposits.   [___]
AU01630 	    Clean the front panel of all accumulated dirt and
AU01630 	    dust.   [___]
AU01630 	    Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01630 	19. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01630 	    parameters
AU01630 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01630 	         leaks
AU01630 	         lighting faults
AU01630 	         door damage
AU01630 	         evidence of structural damage to the UPS room and
AU01630 	"         equipment etc,  in the ""Work Done""section of the job"
AU01630 	         sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
AU01630 	         representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01630 	20. Leave a duplicate 03M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
AU01630 	    Battery Inspection and  test form in the UPS room.  Compare
AU01630 	    previously recorded data and record in the Work Done
AU01630 	    Area of the Job Sheet any data that shows any degradation.
AU01630 	"21. Notify the control room on completion of the job."""
AU01632 	12 M Inspection of  Merlin Gerin UPS system
AU01632 	
AU01632 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01632 	   Involve the Transfield Maintenance Staff  in the UPS Switching to
AU01632 	maintain UPS switching
AU01632 	   knowledge and awareness.
AU01632 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work
AU01632 	2. The Galaxy UPS system 12 monthly inspection shall be carried out by
AU01632 	the sub-contractor in
AU01632 	    the presence of the electrical / electronic technician.
AU01632 	"3. Refer to MGE UPS Systems Manual, Galaxy User Manual E-6739380XT/FA,"
AU01632 	"   M-STG-EL-24009, and Schnieder Electric Tunnel Electrical Services"
AU01632 	"Training Notes,"
AU01632 	"   M-STG-EL-24001, Section 9."
AU01632 	4. Record measurments on form 12 M MGE Uninterruptible Power Supply
AU01632 	Inspection and Test
AU01632 	   TMF-3012-OP-0200.
AU01632 	5. Check all the indicators on the hidden control panel.  Record any
AU01632 	alarm conditions in
AU01632 	"   the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet and raise a Job sheet to havethe"
AU01632 	alarm condition
AU01632 	   attended to.  [_ _]
AU01632 	"6. Inspect the UPS and the batteries cleanliness, cracks, corrosion etc."
AU01632 	[_ _]
AU01632 	7. Measure and record the DC voltage of each battery. (Use Maintenance
AU01632 	application)
AU01632 	8. Measure and record (Use Maintenance application)
AU01632 	      UPS input voltage
AU01632 	      UPS output voltage
AU01632 	      Battery voltage
AU01632 	      Check the balance of each output phase and ensure the UPS is not
AU01632 	overloaded.
AU01632 	      Check for correct UPS calibration. Maintenance Program required.
AU01632 	      Peak and RMS loading.
AU01632 	      Output current and voltage wave shapes.
AU01632 	      AC capacitor current balance.
AU01632 	9. Isolate the UPS by switching to Maintenance Bypass.  [_ _]
AU01632 	10. Measure and record the temperature of the AC and DC filter
AU01632 	capacitors.  [_ _]
AU01632 	11. Measure and record the current flowing in various branches of the
AU01632 	battery circuits.  Ensure
AU01632 	      each path is providing an equal or representitive portion of the
AU01632 	load.
AU01632 	"12. Using an optical thermometer, measure the temperature of current"
AU01632 	"carrying connections,"
AU01632 	      during or following a current carrying period.  Terminals or
AU01632 	connections found with a
AU01632 	"      temperature which is greater than """"room  temperature plus 5"
AU01632 	degrees) should be
AU01632 	      investigated.  Repair any connections found to be faulty and
AU01632 	record in the Work Done area
AU01632 	      of the Job Sheet any repairs carried out..   [_ _]
AU01632 	"13. Open the Battery Circuit Breaker and using a DC voltmeter, measure"
AU01632 	the leakage
AU01632 	      voltage between battery terminal positive and earth then between
AU01632 	battery terminal negative
AU01632 	      and earth to ensure that there is no electrical leakage from the
AU01632 	batteries to earth.
AU01632 	    THE BATTERY BANK IS ENERGISED EVEN WHEN THE RECTIFIER / CHARGER AND
AU01632 	     INVERTER HAVE BEEN STOPPED AND THE BATTERY CIRCUIT BREAKER OPENED.
AU01632 	     BATTERY MAINTENANCE SHOULD BE PERFORMED BY QUALIFIED TRADESPERSONS
AU01632 	"     IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE SAFETY REGULATIONS.  INSULATED TOOLS,"
AU01632 	     GLOVES AND SAFETY GLASSES SHOULD BE USED.   WITH THE BATTERY
AU01632 	CIRCUIT
AU01632 	"     BREAKER CLOSED, THE BATTERY TERMINALS HAVE A RELATIONSHIP TO EARTH."
AU01632 	14. Measure and record the string DC voltages.  If the voltage differs
AU01632 	by ? 5% from the
AU01632 	"      expected voltage, carry out a discharge / cycling test."
AU01632 	15. Visually check the UPS circuit boards and components for conditions
AU01632 	that will lead to
AU01632 	      failure of the UPS.
AU01632 	      e.g. Security of PCB's and Ribbon cables
AU01632 	            Cables and connections
AU01632 	"            Capacitors (Premature swelling, leakage)"
AU01632 	            Evidence of overheating.
AU01632 	            Fuses are secured
AU01632 	            General cleanliness of the UPS.
AU01632 	"    Replace or correct any fault found,  Record in the Work Done Area"
AU01632 	ofthe Job Sheet any
AU01632 	    repairs carried out
AU01632 	16. Return the UPS to normal operation.  FOLLOW THE CORRECT SWITCHING
AU01632 	SEQUENCE.
AU01632 	17. Check the UPS readout and program software for correct operation.
AU01632 	(Using Maintenance
AU01632 	      application)
AU01632 	"18. Simulate a power failure, Open Mains 1 Isolator (Q1), the UPS"
AU01632 	operation will change to
AU01632 	      the batteries.
AU01632 	19. Measure and record (Using Maintenance application) the battery
AU01632 	"voltage, at 5 sec"
AU01632 	"      intervals, for a 15 minute period.  Plot results to obtain a"
AU01632 	Discharge Characteristics Curve.
AU01632 	      Compare curve with previous curves for evidence of battery
AU01632 	failure.  Record in the
AU01632 	      Work Done Area of the Job Sheet any descrepancies and raise a Job
AU01632 	sheet for the
AU01632 	      descrepancy to be attended to.  [_ _]
AU01632 	20.  Return the UPS system to its normal operational state.  [_ _]
AU01632 	"21.  Notify the control room on completion of the job.  [_ _]"""
AU01632 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01632 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01632 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01632 	Note:
AU01632 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01632 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01632 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01632 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01632 	        it's intended function.
AU01632 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01632 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01632 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01632 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01632 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01632 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01632 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01632 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01632 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01632 	        intended function.

AU01642 	12 M Clean silt out of lake
AU01642 	
AU01642 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01642 	Coordinate the planning and completion of other jobs that can be
AU01642 	carriedout whilst the lake is empty.
AU01642 	1. Organise front end loader and tip trucks for handling and
AU01642 	   removal of silt and debris from the site.
AU01642 	2. Arrange for the collection of soil samples and the disposal
AU01642 	   of the silt and debris to a suitable waste disposal site.
AU01642 	3. Notify the Control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01642 	"4. Refer to Work Instruction ORNAMENTAL LAKE MAINTENANCE,"
AU01642 	   TMI-3012-OP-0024.
AU01642 	   WARNING: BE AWARE OF SHARPS AND OTHER HAZARDOUS MATERIALS
AU01642 	   THROUGHOUT WORK SITE.
AU01642 	"5. Check and monitor the water table level in pits 1, 2, 3 & 4"
AU01642 	   (Lake can only be drained when the water table is below
AU01642 	   200mm) over two consecutive days.  Record the results on
AU01642 	   form GROUND WATER  LEVEL MONITOR - TMF-3012-OP-0249.
AU01642 	   If the readings are over 200mm do not proceed with draining
AU01642 	"   the lake, only proceed to draining the lake when the levels"
AU01642 	   less than 200mm are obtained over two consecutive days.
AU01642 	"6. Check the weep holes, at the base of concrete batters, of"
AU01642 	   creek lining upstream of lake for indication of ground water
AU01642 	   flows.
AU01642 	7. Diversion of Creek
AU01642 	"   (a) Open flap valve, to the Ornamental Lake By-pass"
AU01642 	       Diversion (Removal of silt and debris may be required).
AU01642 	   (b) Place stop log (entry) across entry to the lake.
AU01642 	   (c) Check the water of the diversion at the diversion
AU01642 	       outflow into the Moonee Ponds Creek.  Ensure the water
AU01642 	       flow is unrestricted.
AU01642 	"   (d) Check to look at the downstream end to ensure water        ,,"
AU01642 	"  backflow considered and can be controlled. Contact ,,     ,,"
AU01642 	  Melbourne water for assistance as required.
AU01642 	8. Draining the Lake
AU01642 	   (a) Thoroughly clean the outflow area of algae prior to
AU01642 	       accessing the stop logs (Outflow).
AU01642 	   (b) Unbolt and remove the stop logs (outflow) of lake to
AU01642 	       allow the lake to drain.
AU01642 	"   (c) Allow the silt to sufficiently drain, so as to not cause"
AU01642 	       a dust problem.  During the cleaning process monitor (at
AU01642 	"       least daily) the Ground Water in Pits 1, 2, 3 & 4 for"
AU01642 	       any increase of the ground water level.  If there is any
AU01642 	"       increase in the water level, either the job should be"
AU01642 	       postponed and the lake allowed to refill or measures put
AU01642 	       in place to maintain the water level at a suitable level
AU01642 	       below 200mm.
AU01642 	9. Remove all the silt and debris using a front end loader
AU01642 	   fitted with rubber tyres.
AU01642 	10. Ensure the silt is disposed of within regulations.
AU01642 	"11. Ensure pits 1, 2, 3 & 4 are cleaned of all silt and debris."
AU01642 	12. Refill the Lake
AU01642 	"   (a) On completion of all cleaning, replace stop logs"
AU01642 	       (outflow) and bolt into position.
AU01642 	   (b) Remove stop log (entry) to allow the water to flow into
AU01642 	       the lake.
AU01642 	     (c) Close flap valve leading to the diversion pipe.
AU01642 	13. Clean all other litter and debris from around lake area.
AU01642 	14. Record anything outside normal parameters in the area of
AU01642 	   the Job Sheet below.
AU01642 	15. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01651 	"03 M Inspect, Test & Clean Burnley Pump Station"
AU01651 	
AU01651 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01651 	Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
AU01651 	"and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving"
AU01651 	"the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,"
AU01651 	"lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,"
AU01651 	"Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon"
AU01651 	"Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station"
AU01651 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU01651 	"This job is a combined job for the inspection of the pumps, Pump"
AU01651 	"station, Pump Station electrical installation as well the"
AU01651 	"cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the related controls."
AU01651 	B PUMPS AND PUMP STATION OPERATION
AU01651 	1. Notify control room before entry.
AU01651 	2. Access to wet well and valve pit is via gatic covers in the
AU01651 	   pathway on south side of Burnley Portal.
AU01651 	 WARNING:  THE WET WELL AND VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED CONFINED
AU01651 	 SPACES AND MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED SPACE
AU01651 	 CONDITIONS.
AU01651 	3. Inspect Local Control Panel
AU01651 	"   (a) Check  switchboard, situated in Sub-station 3,  for"
AU01651 	       local alarm conditions.
AU01651 	   (b) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of the
AU01651 	"       control panel for damage, evidence of insect infestation,"
AU01651 	"       ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as required)"
AU01651 	   (c) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01651 	       overheating and inspect electrical control
AU01651 	       equipment.   [_ _]
AU01651 	   (d) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet the hours
AU01651 	       run from the meter on the switchboard.     [_ _]
AU01651 	4. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
AU01651 	   (a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
AU01651 	"       valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit"
AU01651 	       for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
AU01651 	       required.   [_ _]
AU01651 	   (b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
AU01651 	       valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
AU01651 	5. Check the operation of pump PSBLYP1 (A1 Starter) by switching
AU01651 	   the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
AU01651 	   position and starting the pump by pressing the
AU01651 	   START/STOP/RESET button.
AU01651 	   (a) Measure the operating current and compare with the rated
AU01651 	       current. (FLC 22A.).  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU01651 	       job sheet if results are outside normal limits.   [_ _]
AU01651 	   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
AU01651 	       vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
AU01651 	   (c) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
AU01651 	       is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
AU01651 	       CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low
AU01651 	       level alarm point as lack of submergence may cause
AU01651 	       pumpset damage
AU01651 	6. Check non-return valve operation on shutting off pump by
AU01651 	   pressing START/ STOP/RESET button.  Full valve closure will
AU01651 	   be indicated by;
AU01651 	   (a) closing with an audible sharp metallic sound.
AU01651 	   (b) backflow through pump should cease within 30 seconds
AU01651 	       Valve closing with a duller sound or excessive backflow
AU01651 	      (longer than 30 seconds) occuring may indicate debris
AU01651 	      jammed in valve preventing full closure.  Pump should be
AU01651 	"      re-started,  run for 2 minutes and non-return valve"
AU01651 	      operation check repeated.
AU01651 	"      If faulty closure is still suspected, report for"
AU01651 	      corrective maintenance.  [_ _]
AU01651 	      Return AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to AUTO
AU01651 	      position.  [_ _]
AU01651 	7. Repeat steps 5 and 6 for pump PSBLYP2 (B1 Starter). [_ _]
AU01651 	"8. Check operation of float switches, manually tripping floats"
AU01651 	   from ground level by lifting up High/High float and Low/Low
AU01651 	   floats respectively  and checking alarms are received at O&M
AU01651 	   Control Room.  [_ _]
AU01651 	9. (a) Check operation of level controller by pumping until pump
AU01651 	       stops. Compare actual level with capacity meter on
AU01651 	       switchboard.   Wet well pump stop level is 4.6 m. below
AU01651 	       top deck which equals 31% capacity.   [_ _]
AU01651 	   (b)  Lift level controller sensor out of conduit and
AU01651 	        carefully and gently clean recess in base.
AU01651 	10. Test operation of isolating valves by partial opening and
AU01651 	    closing only.    [_ _]
AU01651 	11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01651 	    parameters
AU01651 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01651 	         leaks
AU01651 	         lighting faults
AU01651 	         door damage
AU01651 	         evidence of structural damage to the Pump stations and
AU01651 	"         equipment etc,"
AU01651 	         in the Work Done section of the job sheet and report to
AU01651 	         the Team Leader or his
AU01651 	        representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01651 	"12. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU01651 	    of the job sheet.   [_ _]
AU01651 	13. Notify control room that inspection is completed.
AU01651 	C  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU01651 	"1. On entering pump station, temporarily switch OFF ventilation"
AU01651 	"   fans, if operating.   [_ _]"
AU01651 	"2. On accessing the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,"
AU01651 	"   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any"
AU01651 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU01651 	"3. Check the interior lighting for operation, replace faulty"
AU01651 	   lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
AU01651 	4. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU01651 	   accessible equipment and components within control panels.
AU01651 	   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient
AU01651 	   plus 10?C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
AU01651 	   the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
AU01651 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the abnormality.
AU01651 	   Raise a new job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
AU01651 	"5. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU01651 	"   terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn"
AU01651 	"   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything"
AU01651 	   abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise a
AU01651 	   new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
AU01651 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU01651 	   abnormality.  [_ _]
AU01651 	"6. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU01651 	"   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU01651 	"7. Visually inspect the enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU01651 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU01651 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU01651 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01651 	   actions.  [_ _]
AU01651 	"8. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU01651 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU01651 	9. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
AU01651 	"   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any"
AU01651 	"   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU01651 	10. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
AU01651 	    Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
AU01651 	"11. Inspect systems, mounted within the control panel(s), for"
AU01651 	"    faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and"
AU01651 	"    buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp"
AU01651 	    replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
AU01651 	    actions.   [_ _]
AU01651 	12. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
AU01651 	    (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
AU01651 	        found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged
AU01651 	        in the work done area of the job sheet and a new job
AU01651 	        sheet raised to investigate and correct the
AU01651 	        error.  [_ _]
AU01651 	   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
AU01651 	"       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]"
AU01651 	   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
AU01651 	       module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
AU01651 	   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
AU01651 	       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
AU01651 	       and debris.  [_ _]
AU01651 	13. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
AU01651 	"    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation."
AU01651 	14. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU01651 	    Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
AU01651 	    or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU01651 	"D. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU01651 	1. Check the control panel interior for evidence of moisture
AU01651 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU01651 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
AU01651 	   Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU01651 	2. Check that the control panel is not obstructed by furnishings
AU01651 	   and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
AU01651 	"3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,"
AU01651 	"   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on"
AU01651 	"   all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of"
AU01651 	"   cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]."
AU01651 	4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
AU01651 	   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
AU01651 	"5. Clean dust and cobwebs from cabinets, light fittings, cable"
AU01651 	   trays.  [_ _]
AU01651 	6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
AU01651 	7. Sweep and vacuum the floor surface at the control
AU01651 	   panel.  [_ _]
AU01651 	8. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait
AU01651 	   station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
AU01651 	9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
AU01651 	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
AU01651 	   job sheet.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01651 	   corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU01651 	10. Remove any accumulated debris from the building
AU01651 	    surrounds.  [_ _]
AU01651 	11. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
AU01651 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
AU01651 	"        e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"
AU01651 	    (b) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU01651 	    (c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
AU01651 	12. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU01651 	13. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
AU01651 	Enter Recordings Below

AU01651 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01651 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01651 	Note:
AU01651 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01651 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01651 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01651 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01651 	        it's intended function.
AU01651 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01651 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01651 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01651 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01651 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01651 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01651 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01651 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01651 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01651 	        intended function.

AU01651 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01653 	"03 M Inspect, Test  & Clean Church St Pump Station Equipment"
AU01653 	
AU01653 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01653 	Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
AU01653 	"and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving"
AU01653 	"the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,"
AU01653 	"lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,"
AU01653 	"Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders"
AU01653 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01653 	"2. On accessing the pump station control panel(s), be aware of"
AU01653 	"   the atmosphere, use your senses of sight, smell and hearing"
AU01653 	   to monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU01653 	3. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
AU01653 	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
AU01653 	   the job sheet.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01653 	   corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU01653 	4. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
AU01653 	   Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
AU01653 	5. WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
AU01653 	   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
AU01653 	   SPACE CONDITIONS.
AU01653 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU01653 	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
AU01653 	6. Inspect  the Switchboard
AU01653 	"   (a) Check the switchboard, situated adjacent to the pump"
AU01653 	"       station,  for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]"
AU01653 	   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
AU01653 	"       externally the control panel for vandalism, damage,"
AU01653 	"       corrosion, insect infestation, moisture ingress, dust and"
AU01653 	       grime(clean as required).   [_ _]
AU01653 	   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and evidence of
AU01653 	       overheating and inspect the electrical control
AU01653 	       equipment.  [_ _]
AU01653 	"   (d) Record the reading of the hour run meter, for the pump,"
AU01653 	       in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01653 	7. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
AU01653 	   (a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
AU01653 	"       valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit"
AU01653 	       for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
AU01653 	       required.   [_ _]
AU01653 	   (b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
AU01653 	       valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
AU01653 	8. Switch the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
AU01653 	   position.   [_ _] CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below
AU01653 	   the Low/Low level alarm point as the lack of submergence may
AU01653 	   cause damage to the pumpset.
AU01653 	   (a) Check  the position of the counterweight for the pump
AU01653 	       non-return valve (NRV) prior to starting the
AU01653 	       pump.  [_ _]
AU01653 	   (b) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
AU01653 	       is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
AU01653 	9. Start the pump PSCH1 by pressing the START button.
AU01653 	    (a) Measure and record the operating current of the pump in
AU01653 	        the Work Donearea of the job sheet.  (FLC 75A.).
AU01653 	"    (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration"
AU01653 	        and abnormal noises.
AU01653 	"    (c) Observe the level controller readout for variations,"
AU01653 	        with respect to the operation of the pump.   [_  _]
AU01653 	    (d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check
AU01653 	"        the operation of each non-return valve (NRV), as the"
AU01653 	        water flow stops.  Indicators to the correct operation
AU01653 	"        of the NRV would be, the NRV closing with an sharp"
AU01653 	"        audible metallic sound, the counterweight returning to"
AU01653 	"        its original position or lower , as well, backflow"
AU01653 	        through the pump should cease within 30 seconds.  If a
AU01653 	"        faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be"
AU01653 	"        re-started, operated for 2 minutes and  the operation of"
AU01653 	        the NRV should then be monitored again.  If a faulty
AU01653 	"        closure is still suspected, report for corrective"
AU01653 	        maintenance.    [_ _]
AU01653 	10. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
AU01653 	   position.   [_ _]
AU01653 	11. Check the operation of the  float switches.  Manually trip
AU01653 	    the floats from the surface by lifting up the High/High
AU01653 	    float and  the Low/Low float cables respectively with a hook
AU01653 	    bar and then checking if the alarms were received at the
AU01653 	    Control Room.   [_ _]
AU01653 	"12. When this job falls in either January, February or March."
AU01653 	    Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
AU01653 	"    conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base"
AU01653 	    of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
AU01653 	13. Test the operation of the isolating valves by partially
AU01653 	    closing and then fully opening. [_ _]

AU01653 	   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
AU01653 	   and distribution panels.

AU01653 	"         panel(s)  for damage, erosion,  graffiti.  [_ _]"

AU01653 	"         the control panel for  erosion and damage to surfaces,"
AU01653 	"         fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]"

AU01653 	10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
AU01653 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g.
AU01653 	        pumps etc.  [_ _]
AU01653 	    (b) All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU01653 	    (c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]

AU01653 	    parameters e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures leaks
AU01653 	"    lighting faults, door damage, evidence of structural damage"

AU01653 	    his representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
