AU01654 	   SPACE CONDITIONS.
AU01654 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU01654 	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
AU01654 	6. At the Local Control Panel
AU01654 	"   (a) Check the switchboard, situated beside the pump station,"
AU01654 	       for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
AU01654 	   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
AU01654 	"       externally of the control panel for         vandalism,"
AU01654 	"       damage, corrosion, insect infestation, moisture ingress,"
AU01654 	       dust and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
AU01654 	   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01654 	       overheating and inspect the electrical control
AU01654 	       equipment.   [_ _]
AU01654 	   (d) Record the pump hour run meter reading in the Work
AU01654 	       Done area of the job sheet.
AU01654 	7. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
AU01654 	   (a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
AU01654 	"       valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit"
AU01654 	       for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
AU01654 	       required.   [_ _]
AU01654 	   (b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
AU01654 	       valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
AU01654 	8. Switch the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
AU01654 	   position.    [_ _]
AU01654 	   (a) Check  the position of the  pump non-return valve
AU01654 	       counterweight before starting the pump.   [_ _]
AU01654 	   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
AU01654 	       vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
AU01654 	   (c) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
AU01654 	       is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
AU01654 	   CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
AU01654 	             alarm point as lack of submergence may cause
AU01654 	             pumpset damage.
AU01654 	9. Start the pump PSCR1 by pressing the START button.
AU01654 	    (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
AU01654 	        Done area of the job sheet.  (FLC 52A.).
AU01654 	"    (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration"
AU01654 	        and abnormal noises.    [_  _]
AU01654 	"    (c) Observe the level controller readout for variations,"
AU01654 	        with respect to the operation of the pump.    [_  _]
AU01654 	    (d) Assess the pump discharge rate by observing that outflow
AU01654 	        issuing from the outlet pipe into the river.   [_ _]
AU01654 	    (e) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check
AU01654 	"        the operation of each non-return valve (NRV), as the"
AU01654 	        water flow stops.  Indicators to the correct operation
AU01654 	"        of the NRV would be, the NRV closing with an sharp"
AU01654 	"        audible metallic sound, the counterweight returning to"
AU01654 	"        its original position or lower , as well, backflow"
AU01654 	        through the pump should cease within 30 seconds.  If a
AU01654 	"        faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be"
AU01654 	"        re-started,  operated for 2 minutes and  the operation"
AU01654 	        of the NRV should then be monitored again.  If a faulty
AU01654 	"        closure is still suspected, report for corrective"
AU01654 	        maintenance.    [_ _]
AU01654 	    (f ) Visually check the operation of the flap valve on the
AU01654 	         riverbank.  The valve should operate freely and shut
AU01654 	         tight to prevent backflow of any water  from the
AU01654 	         river.   [_ _]
AU01654 	10. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
AU01654 	    position.   [_ _]
AU01654 	11. Check the operation of  the float switches in the wet well.
AU01654 	"    Manually trip the floats using hook bar from the surface,"
AU01654 	    lifting up the High/High float and Low/Low floats
AU01654 	"    respectively, then checking that the alarms were received at"
AU01654 	    the Control Room.  [_ _]
AU01654 	"12. When this job falls in either January, February or March."
AU01654 	    Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
AU01654 	"    conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base"
AU01654 	    of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
AU01654 	13.Test the operation of riverbank isolating valve by partially
AU01654 	   closing and then fully opening.  [_ _]
AU01654 	ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU01654 	"1. Check the interior lighting for operation, replace or repair"
AU01654 	   any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
AU01654 	2. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU01654 	   accessible equipment and components within the control
AU01654 	   panels.
AU01654 	   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient
AU01654 	   plus 10?C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
AU01654 	   the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
AU01654 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU01654 	   abnormality.  [_ _]
AU01654 	"3. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU01654 	"   equipment and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual"
AU01654 	   odours and overheating.  record anything abnormal in the
AU01654 	   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
AU01654 	"4. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU01654 	"   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU01654 	"5. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU01654 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU01654 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU01654 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01654 	   actions.   [_ _]
AU01654 	"6. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU01654 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU01654 	"7. Inspect the electrical enclosures internally for dust, grime"
AU01654 	"   and condensation, clean enclosures of any accumulated dust,"
AU01654 	   dirt and debris.  [_ _]
AU01654 	8. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
AU01654 	   obstructions.  [_ _]
AU01654 	"9. Visually inspect systems, mounted within the control panel,"
AU01654 	"   for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and"
AU01654 	"   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement"
AU01654 	   or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.   [_ _]
AU01654 	10. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following.
AU01654 	   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
AU01654 	       found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
AU01654 	       the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
AU01654 	       raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
AU01654 	   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
AU01654 	"       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]"
AU01654 	   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
AU01654 	       module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
AU01654 	   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
AU01654 	       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
AU01654 	       and debris.  [_ _]
AU01654 	11. Clean lighting diffusers  and lens of accumulated dust and
AU01654 	    debris.  [_ _]
AU01654 	12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
AU01654 	"    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.   Record"
AU01654 	    anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the job
AU01654 	    sheet.   Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area
AU01654 	    of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his
AU01654 	    representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU01654 	"Building (Control Panel) Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU01654 	1. Check the control panel interior for evidence of moisture
AU01654 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU01654 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
AU01654 	   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU01654 	"2. Check the doors and windows for damage, operation, lubricate"
AU01654 	   and repair as required and record in the Work Done area
AU01654 	   of the Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his
AU01654 	   representative of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
AU01654 	"3. Clean and remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of"
AU01654 	"   cabinets, ledges, cable trays, cables, etc."
AU01654 	"   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops"
AU01654 	"   of cabinets, tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter"
AU01654 	   escutcheons etc.  [_ _].
AU01654 	4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
AU01654 	"5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and"
AU01654 	   ceilings.  [_ _]
AU01654 	6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  Empty
AU01654 	   rubbish bins and replace liners.  [_ _]
AU01654 	7. Sweep and remove all accumulated dirt and dust from control
AU01654 	   panel interior.  [_ _]
AU01654 	8. Carry out Exterior Checks of control panel.
AU01654 	    (a)  Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the control
AU01654 	"         panels for damage, erosion, graffiti.  [_ _]"
AU01654 	    (b) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding the
AU01654 	"        building for erosion and damage to surfaces, fences,"
AU01654 	"        gates, pavements   [_ _]"
AU01654 	9. Remove any accumulated debris from the surrounds.  [_ _]
AU01654 	10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
AU01654 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g.
AU01654 	        pumps etc.  [_ _]
AU01654 	    (b)  All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU01654 	    (c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
AU01654 	11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01654 	    parameters
AU01654 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01654 	         leaks
AU01654 	         lighting faults
AU01654 	         door damage
AU01654 	         evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
AU01654 	"         equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job"
AU01654 	         sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
AU01654 	         representative raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01654 	"12. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU01654 	    of the job sheet.       [_ _]
AU01654 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01654 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01654 	Note:
AU01654 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01654 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01654 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01654 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01654 	        it's intended function.
AU01654 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01654 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01654 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01654 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01654 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01654 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01654 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01654 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01654 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01654 	        intended function.

AU01652 	"03 M Inspect, Test & Clean Olympic Park Pump Station"
AU01652 	
AU01652 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01652 	Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
AU01652 	"and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving"
AU01652 	"the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,"
AU01652 	"lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,"
AU01652 	"Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon"
AU01652 	"Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station"
AU01652 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU01652 	"This job is a combined job for the inspection of the Pumps,"
AU01652 	"electrical installations and Control panel as well the cleaning,"
AU01652 	inspections and maintenance of the related area.
AU01652 	B PUMP AND PUMP OPERATION
AU01652 	1. Notify the Control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01652 	2. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
AU01652 	   Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
AU01652 	3. WARNING: BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
AU01652 	   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
AU01652 	   SPACE CONDITIONS.
AU01652 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU01652 	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
AU01652 	4. Inspect the Local Control Panel
AU01652 	"   (a) Check the switchboard, located in Sub-station 5, for"
AU01652 	       local alarm conditions.
AU01652 	   (b) Carry out visual inspection both internally and
AU01652 	"       externally of the control panel for damage, corrosion,"
AU01652 	"       evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust"
AU01652 	       and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
AU01652 	   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01652 	"       overheating, inspect the electrical control"
AU01652 	       equipment.   [_ _]
AU01652 	"  (d) Record readings of the hour run meters,  for each pump, in"
AU01652 	      the Work Done area of the job sheet .   [_ _]
AU01652 	5. Inspection of pump wet well and valve pit.
AU01652 	   (a) Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the
AU01652 	"       valve pit, inspect both the wet well and the valve pit"
AU01652 	       for general cleanliness and debris.  Clean if
AU01652 	       required.   [_ _]
AU01652 	   (b) Inspect the external condition of  the pipework and
AU01652 	       valves for evidence corrosion and leaks.  [_ _]
AU01652 	6. Switch the pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the MANUAL
AU01652 	   position.
AU01652 	   (a) Measure and record the operating current and compare with
AU01652 	       the rated (80A) current.   [_ _]
AU01652 	   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
AU01652 	       vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
AU01652 	   (c) Check that the cabling to the pump for damage and that it
AU01652 	       is clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
AU01652 	  CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
AU01652 	  alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset damage.
AU01652 	7. Start pump PSOPP1 (Pump A1 starter) by pressing the START
AU01652 	   pushbutton.   [_ _]
AU01652 	"   (a) Record the operating current of the pump, in the Work"
AU01652 	       Done area of the job sheet.     [_ _]
AU01652 	"   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration"
AU01652 	       and abnormal noises.   [_ _]
AU01652 	"   (c) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with"
AU01652 	       respect to the operation of the pump.    [_  _]
AU01652 	   (d) Observe that the pump drawdown rate is sufficient to draw
AU01652 	       down the water level in the wet well.    [_ _]
AU01652 	   (e) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check the
AU01652 	"       operation of the non-return (NRV), as the water flow"
AU01652 	       stops.  The NRV should close with a sharp audible
AU01652 	"       metallic sound, as well, backflow through the pump should"
AU01652 	       cease within 30 seconds.  If a faulty closure is
AU01652 	"       suspected, the pump should be re-started, operated"
AU01652 	       for 2 minutes and the operation of the NRV should then be
AU01652 	       monitored again.  If a  faulty closure is still
AU01652 	"       suspected, record the details in the Work Done area of"
AU01652 	"       the Job sheet, and report for corrective"
AU01652 	       maintenance.    [_ _]
AU01652 	8. Repeat step 7 for PSOPP2 (Pump A2 starter).    [_ _]
AU01652 	9. Repeat step 7 for PSOPP3 (Pump B1 starter).    [_ _]
AU01652 	10. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
AU01652 	    position.      [_ _]
AU01652 	11. Check the operation of the float switches.  Manually trip
AU01652 	    the floats from the valve pit by lifting up the High/High
AU01652 	    float and the Low/Low floats respectively with a hook bar
AU01652 	    and then checking that the alarms were received at the
AU01652 	    Control Room.     [_ _]
AU01652 	"12. When this job falls in either January, February or March."
AU01652 	    Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
AU01652 	"    conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base"
AU01652 	    of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
AU01652 	13. Test the operation of the isolating valves by partially
AU01652 	    closing and the fully re-opening.     [_ _]
AU01652 	14. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01652 	    parameters
AU01652 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01652 	         leaks
AU01652 	         lighting faults
AU01652 	         door damage
AU01652 	     evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
AU01652 	"     equipment etc, in the Work Done section of the job sheet"
AU01652 	     and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
AU01652 	     raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01652 	"15. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU01652 	    of the job sheet.    [_ _]
AU01652 	16. Notify the control room that the inspection has been
AU01652 	    completed.

AU01652 	"   atmosphere, use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to"
AU01652 	   monitor any abnormal events.  [_ _]

AU01652 	"   operation, replace faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting"
AU01652 	   fixture.  [_ _]
AU01652 	3. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU01652 	   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
AU01652 	   and distribution panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature
AU01652 	   sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus 10?C should be
AU01652 	   considered abnormal and must be noted in the Work Done area
AU01652 	   of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team Leader or his
AU01652 	   representative is informed of the abnormality.  Raise a new
AU01652 	   job sheet for any corrective action   [_ _]
AU01652 	"4. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU01652 	"   terminals, equipment and components for evidence of burn"
AU01652 	"   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything"
AU01652 	   abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise a
AU01652 	   new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
AU01652 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU01652 	   abnormality.  [_ _]
AU01652 	"5.  While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU01652 	"    contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU01652 	"6. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU01652 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU01652 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU01652 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01652 	   actions.  [_ _]
AU01652 	"7. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU01652 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU01652 	8. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
AU01652 	"   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any"
AU01652 	"   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU01652 	9. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
AU01652 	   Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
AU01652 	"10. Inspect systems, mounted within the control panel(s), for"
AU01652 	"    faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and"
AU01652 	"    buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp"
AU01652 	    replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
AU01652 	    actions.   [_ _]
AU01652 	11. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
AU01652 	   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
AU01652 	       found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
AU01652 	       the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
AU01652 	       raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
AU01652 	   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
AU01652 	"       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]"
AU01652 	   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
AU01652 	       module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
AU01652 	   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
AU01652 	       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
AU01652 	       and debris.  [_ _]
AU01652 	12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
AU01652 	"    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation."
AU01652 	13. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU01652 	    Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
AU01652 	    or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]

AU01652 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any

AU01652 	   furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
AU01652 	   obstruction.  [_ _]

AU01652 	"   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on"

AU01652 	"   cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]."

AU01652 	   cleaning materials .  [_ _]

AU01652 	   station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]

AU01652 	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
AU01652 	   job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01652 	   corrective actions.  [_ _]

AU01652 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
AU01652 	"        e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"
AU01652 	    (b) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU01652 	    (c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]

AU01652 	12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.

AU01661 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU01661 	3. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
AU01661 	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
AU01661 	   the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01661 	   corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU01661 	4. Reference Manual TOJV Pump Station Operation and Maintenance
AU01661 	   Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
AU01661 	   WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
AU01661 	   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
AU01661 	   SPACE CONDITIONS.
AU01661 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU01661 	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
AU01661 	5. At the Local Control Panel
AU01661 	"   (a) Check the switchboard, situated adjacent to the pump well"
AU01661 	       for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
AU01661 	   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
AU01661 	"       externally of the control panel for damage, corrosion,"
AU01661 	"       evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust"
AU01661 	       and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
AU01661 	   (c) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01661 	       overheating and inspect electrical control
AU01661 	       equipment.   [_ _]
AU01661 	"   (d) Record readings of the hour run meters, for each pump, in"
AU01661 	       the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01661 	6. Inspect the pump wet well and the valve pit.
AU01661 	   Remove the gatic covers from both the wet well and the valve
AU01661 	"   pit, enter the well and inspect for general cleanliness and"
AU01661 	"   accumulated debris in the wet well, valve pit and the"
AU01661 	   condition of the pipework and valves and any evidence of
AU01661 	   corrosion.   [_ _]
AU01661 	7. Switch the pump  PSSBP1 AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to
AU01661 	   the MANUAL position.   [_ _]
AU01661 	   (a) Measure the operating current and compare with the rated
AU01661 	       current. ( 170A).  Record the results in the Work Done
AU01661 	       area of the job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01661 	   (b) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
AU01661 	       clear from possible damage.  [_ _]
AU01661 	   CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
AU01661 	   alarm point as the lack of submergence may cause damage to
AU01661 	   the pumpset.
AU01661 	8. Start the pump PSSBP1 by pressing the START button.
AU01661 	   (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
AU01661 	       Done area of the job sheet.  (FLC 170A.).
AU01661 	"   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration"
AU01661 	       and abnormal noises.
AU01661 	"   (c) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with"
AU01661 	       respect to the pump operations.    [_  _]
AU01661 	   (d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check the
AU01661 	"       operation of each non-return valve (NRV), as the water"
AU01661 	       flow stops.  The NRV should close with an sharp audible
AU01661 	"       metallic sound, as well, backflow through the pump should"
AU01661 	       cease within 30 seconds. If a faulty closure is
AU01661 	"       suspected, the pump should be re-started,  operated"
AU01661 	       for 2 minutes and the operation of the NRV should then be
AU01661 	       monitored again.    [_ _]
AU01661 	9. Repeat steps 7 and 8 for PSSBP2.
AU01661 	10. Repeat steps 7 and 8 for PSSBP3.
AU01661 	11. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
AU01661 	    position.   [_ _]
AU01661 	"12. Check the operation of the float switches, by removing"
AU01661 	"    circular plate in the wet well roof, then manually trip the"
AU01661 	    floats by lifting up the High/High float and Low/Low float
AU01661 	    respectively with a hook bar and checking that the alarms
AU01661 	    are received at the Control Room.    [_ _]
AU01661 	"13. When this job falls in either January, February or March."
AU01661 	    Lift the level controller sensor out of the protective
AU01661 	"    conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the sensor base"
AU01661 	    of all dirt and debris.   [_ _]
AU01661 	"14. Check the operation of each of the isolating valves, in"
AU01661 	"    turn,  by partially closing then fully opening"
AU01661 	    again.    [_ _]
AU01661 	ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU01661 	"1. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,"
AU01661 	"   including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace or"
AU01661 	   repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
AU01661 	2. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU01661 	   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
AU01661 	   and distribution panels.
AU01661 	   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of ambient
AU01661 	   plus 10?C should be considered abnormal and must be noted in
AU01661 	   the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
AU01661 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU01661 	   abnormality.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"3. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU01661 	"   equipment and components for evidence of burn marks, unusual"
AU01661 	   odours and overheating.  record anything abnormal in the
AU01661 	   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team
AU01661 	"4. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU01661 	"   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU01661 	"5. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU01661 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU01661 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU01661 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU01661 	   actions.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"6. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU01661 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU01661 	"7. Inspect all electrical enclosures internally for dust, grime"
AU01661 	"   and condensation, clean enclosures of any accumulated dust,"
AU01661 	   dirt and debris.  [_ _]
AU01661 	8. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
AU01661 	   obstructions.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"9. Visually inspect systems, mounted within the building or"
AU01661 	"   room(s), for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged"
AU01661 	"   switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp"
AU01661 	   replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
AU01661 	   actions.   [_ _]
AU01661 	10. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following.
AU01661 	   (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
AU01661 	       found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
AU01661 	       the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
AU01661 	       raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]
AU01661 	   (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
AU01661 	"       connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]"
AU01661 	   (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
AU01661 	       module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
AU01661 	   (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
AU01661 	       enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
AU01661 	       and debris.  [_ _]
AU01661 	11. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
AU01661 	    lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
AU01661 	12. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
AU01661 	"    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.   Record"
AU01661 	    anything  abnormal in the Work Done area of the job
AU01661 	    sheet.   Record anything abnormal in the Work Done area of
AU01661 	    the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his
AU01661 	    representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"Building (Control Panel) Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU01661 	1. Check the control panel interior for evidence of moisture
AU01661 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU01661 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
AU01661 	   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"2. Check the doors and windows for damage, operation, lubricate"
AU01661 	   and repair as required and record in the Work Done area
AU01661 	   of the Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his
AU01661 	   representative of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"3. Clean and remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of"
AU01661 	"   cabinets, ledges, cable trays, cables, etc."
AU01661 	"   Note: Dust will settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops"
AU01661 	"   of cabinets, tops of cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons"
AU01661 	   etc.  [_ _].
AU01661 	4. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets where necessary.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and"
AU01661 	   ceilings.  [_ _]
AU01661 	6. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  Empty
AU01661 	   rubbish bins and replace liners.  [_ _]
AU01661 	"7. Sweep, vacuum and remove all accumulated dirt and dust from"
AU01661 	   control panel interior.  [_ _]
AU01661 	8. Carry out Exterior Checks of control panel(s).
AU01661 	   (a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the control
AU01661 	"       panels for damage, erosion and graffiti.  [_ _]"
AU01661 	   (b) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding the
AU01661 	"       control panel for erosion and damage to surfaces, fences,"
AU01661 	"       gates, pavements   [_ _]"
AU01661 	9. Remove any accumulated debris from the surrounds.  [_ _]
AU01661 	10. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
AU01661 	   (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service e.g.
AU01661 	       pumps etc.  [_ _]
AU01661 	   (b) All Enclosures closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU01661 	   (c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
AU01661 	11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01661 	    parameters
AU01661 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01661 	         leaks
AU01661 	         lighting faults
AU01661 	         door damage
AU01661 	     evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
AU01661 	"     equipment etc,  in the Work Done  section of the job"
AU01661 	     sheet and report to the Team Leader or his representative
AU01661 	     and raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01661 	"12. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done"
AU01661 	    area of the job sheet.
AU01661 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01661 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01661 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01661 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01661 	Note:
AU01661 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01661 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01661 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01661 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01661 	        it's intended function.
AU01661 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01661 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01661 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01661 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01661 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01661 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01661 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01661 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01661 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01661 	        intended function.
AU01661 	CONDITION RATING SCORE
AU01661 	"CL-SLM-HY-PMPG-SIPS-PSSBP1,,[_ _]"

AU01661 	"CL-SLM-HY-PMPG-SIPS-PSSBP3,,[_ _]"
AU01661 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01661 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01954 	03 M Inspect and Test Swan St Ps pumps
AU01954 	
AU01954 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01954 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this work.
AU01954 	"2. Reference manual TOJV, Pump Station Operation and Maintenance"
AU01954 	"   Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001, Volume 3."
AU01954 	3. WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELL AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
AU01954 	   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
AU01954 	   SPACE CONDITIONS.
AU01954 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU01954 	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
AU01954 	4. At Control Panel A
AU01954 	"   (a) Check the switchboard, adjacent to the pump room, for"
AU01954 	       local alarm conditions.  [_ _]
AU01954 	   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
AU01954 	"       externally of the control panels for damage, corrosion,"
AU01954 	"       evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust"
AU01954 	      and grime (clean as required)  [_ _]
AU01954 	   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01954 	"       overheating, inspect the electrical control"
AU01954 	       equipment.  [_ _]
AU01954 	"   (d) Record in the Work Done area of job sheet, the hour-run"
AU01954 	"       meter readings for each pump, these are to be obtained"
AU01954 	       from the PMCS.  To obtain the correct results:
AU01954 	"      (i) On  the CCCS System, click on the Entities button"
AU01954 	     (ii) In the entry field of the Entities Faceplate type SW
AU01954 	    (iii) Then look for SWDW1RUN in the list.
AU01954 	"     (iv) Double click on the SWDW1RUN, then record the hours"
AU01954 	          run shown in the HOURS field.
AU01954 	      (v) Repeat steps (d) (iii) to (d) (iv) for each of
AU01954 	"          SWDW2RUN, SWDW3RUN, SWGW1RUN, SWGW2RUN in"
AU01954 	          order. [_ _]
AU01954 	5. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel B.  [_ _]
AU01954 	6. Inspect the pump wet wells and the valve pit.
AU01954 	   (a) Inspect the wet wells through the access ladder hatch for
AU01954 	"       general cleanliness and any accumulated debris, inspect"
AU01954 	       for any evidence of leakage.   [_ _]
AU01954 	   (b) Inspect the external conditions of the pipework and the
AU01954 	       valves for corrosion (Rust).  Minor corrosion (rust) is
AU01954 	       to be removed with a wire brush and the cleaned surface
AU01954 	       painted with Coldgal.   [_ _]
AU01954 	   (c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet evidence of
AU01954 	       leaks and any corrective works that are outstanding.
AU01954 	       Raise a new jobsheet for any corrective works
AU01954 	       outstanding.   [_ _]
AU01954 	"   (d) Lubricate Isolating Valves with Loctite Silver Grade Anti ,,"
AU01954 	  Seize Lubricant or Equivalent.  [_ _]
AU01954 	   (e) Operate all pump manual isolating valves through AT LEAST
AU01954 	       THREE (3) OPEN/CLOSED cycles to confirm valve
AU01954 	       operationally.  Ensure the valves are left in the fully
AU01954 	       open position on completion.  [_ _]
AU01954 	"7. Test the operation of Hydrocarbon detector, by releasing a"
AU01954 	   small amount of gas from a small LPG bottle.     [_ _]
AU01954 	"8. Work plan for the PSSWDP1, Dirty Water Pump 1"
AU01954 	   (a) Check the inlet tundish for any blockage or accumulated
AU01954 	"       debris, clean out if required.  [_ _]"
AU01954 	   (b) Check the triple interceptor trap for any evidence of oil
AU01954 	"       on the surface, turbidity and the correct operation of"
AU01954 	       the discharge valve.   [_ _]
AU01954 	   (c) Check the operation of float switches.  To test lift the
AU01954 	"       High/High float and Low/Low floats respectively, then"
AU01954 	       check that the alarms are received at the Control
AU01954 	       Room.  [_ _]
AU01954 	"   (d) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with"
AU01954 	       respect to the pump operations.   [_ _]
AU01954 	   (e) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
AU01954 	       clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
AU01954 	"   (f) When this job falls in either December, March, June or"
AU01954 	       September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
AU01954 	"       protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in"
AU01954 	       the sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
AU01954 	9. Switch the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector to the MANUAL
AU01954 	   position.   [_ _]
AU01954 	10. (a) Check and note the position of the pump non-return valve
AU01954 	       (NRV) counterweight prior to starting the pump.  [_ _]
AU01954 	    (b) Start the pump PSSWDWP1 by pressing the START push
AU01954 	        button.
AU01954 	  CAUTION: Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
AU01954 	  alarm point as the lack of submergence may cause damage to the
AU01954 	  pumpset.
AU01954 	   (c) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work Done
AU01954 	       area of the job sheet if the current reading is greater
AU01954 	       than FLC 190A.  [_ _]
AU01954 	"    (d) Observe pump operation for smooth running, vibration and"
AU01954 	        abnormal noises. [_ _]
AU01954 	    (e) Observe that the pump discharge rate is sufficient to
AU01954 	        draw down the water level in the sump.   [_ _]
AU01954 	    (f) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton. Check
AU01954 	"        the operation of the non-return valve (NRV), as the"
AU01954 	        water flow  stops.
AU01954 	       (i) The NRV should close with a sharp audible metallic
AU01954 	           sound
AU01954 	      (ii) The counterweight returning to it's pre-start
AU01954 	"           position or lower, as well"
AU01954 	     (iii) backflow through pump should cease within 30 seconds.
AU01954 	"      (iv) If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be"
AU01954 	"           re-started, operated for 2 minutes and the operation"
AU01954 	           of the NRV monitored again.    [_ _]
AU01954 	11. Repeat steps 8 through to 10 for pump PSSWDWP2.   [_ _]
AU01954 	12. Repeat steps 8 through to 10 for pump PSSWDWP3.   [_ _]
AU01954 	13. Return the  AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
AU01954 	    position.       [_ _]
AU01954 	14. Switch the ground water pump AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch
AU01954 	    to the MANUAL position
AU01954 	"   (a) Check the operation of the float switches.  To test, lift"
AU01954 	"       the High/High float and Low/Low float respectively, then"
AU01954 	       room. [_ _]
AU01954 	"   (b) Observe the level controller readout for variations, with"
AU01954 	       respect to the operation of the pump  [_ _]
AU01954 	15. Start the pump PSSWGWP1 by pressing the START push button.
AU01954 	   (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
AU01954 	       Done area of the job sheet (FLC 50A).  [_ _]
AU01954 	   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running or
AU01954 	       vibration and abnormal noises. [_ _]
AU01954 	   (c) Check that the pump discharge rate is sufficient to draw
AU01954 	       down the water level in the sump.     [_ _]
AU01954 	   (d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.  Check
AU01954 	       the operation of the NRV.  Full valve closure will be
AU01954 	       indicated by the backflow through pump ceasing within
AU01954 	       30 seconds.  Excessive backflow (longer than 30 seconds)
AU01954 	"       occurring, may indicate that debris is jammed in the"
AU01954 	       valve preventing a full closure.  The pump should be
AU01954 	"       re-started, operated for a further 2 minutes and the"
AU01954 	       operation of the NRV monitored again.  [_ _]
AU01954 	"       If a faulty closure is still suspected, report the fault"
AU01954 	       for corrective maintenance.
AU01954 	   (e) Re-grease Motor bearings and Pump main bearing using
AU01954 	       general multi purpose grease.
AU01954 	   (f) Clean bottom of pump housing where drain water is
AU01954 	       collected.
AU01954 	16. Repeat steps 14 and 15 for pump PSSWGWP2.
AU01954 	17. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
AU01954 	    position.  [_ _]
AU01954 	"18. When this job falls in either December, March, June or"
AU01954 	    September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
AU01954 	"    protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the"
AU01954 	    sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
AU01954 	19. Check that the wet well ventilation system fan is
AU01954 	    operational and moving air from the wet well.  [_ _]
AU01954 	"20. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU01954 	    of the job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01954 	21. A Confined Space Entry permit is required prior to entering
AU01954 	    the sump
AU01954 	"22. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from"
AU01954 	    Automatic Mode to Manual Mode and switch the two clean
AU01954 	    water pumps to the OFF position.
AU01954 	  DO NOT OPERATE THE PUMPS WITHOUT WATER COVERAGE.  THE PUMPS
AU01954 	  NEED TO BE SUBMERGED TO OBTAIN ADEQUATE COOLING OTHERWISE
AU01954 	  DAMAGE WILL OCCUR.
AU01954 	23. At the pump sump
AU01954 	"   (a) Inspect the triple interceptor for debris, silt"
AU01954 	"       deposits and foreign objects, remove and clean if"
AU01954 	       required.
AU01954 	"   (b) Inspect the pump sump for debris, silt deposits and"
AU01954 	"       foreign objects, remove and clean if required."
AU01954 	24. Ensure the Triple Interceptor bypass valve is OPEN.
AU01954 	25. (a) Close Valve GW1 & GW2.   Record the result of all tests
AU01954 	        on form TMF-3012-OP-0273 - Burnley Tunnel Pump
AU01954 	        Calibration
AU01954 	    (b) Open valve GW1.
AU01954 	    (c) Start Pump GW1 using the On/Off Push Buttons
AU01954 	26. (a) Record head pressure
AU01954 	    (b) Record the flow rate (Large digits of Magmeter)
AU01954 	27. Close valve GW1 and Open valve GW2.  Repeat step 28 for
AU01954 	    pump GW2.
AU01954 	28. Open valve GW1.  Repeat  step 29 for pumps GW1 & GW2.
AU01954 	"29. Once the test is complete, ensure that the valves (GW1 &"
AU01954 	    GW2) are fully open.
AU01954 	30. Close the pressure gauge isolating valve and remove the
AU01954 	    pressure gauge.
AU01954 	"31. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from"
AU01954 	    Manual mode to Automatic Mode.
AU01954 	32. Record the hours run for the pumps in the Work Done area of
AU01954 	    the jobsheet .
AU01954 	    The hour readings are obtained from the CCCs.
AU01954 	"    The entities are SWDW1RUN, SWDW2RUN, SWDW3RUN, SWGW1RUN &"
AU01954 	    SWGW2RUN
AU01954 	33. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01954 	    parameters
AU01954 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01954 	         leaks
AU01954 	         lighting faults
AU01954 	         door damage
AU01954 	    evidence of structural damage to the pump station and
AU01954 	"    equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet"
AU01954 	    and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
AU01954 	    raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01954 	34. Record in the Work Done area of the Job sheet any
AU01954 	    outstanding works that require further work.  Raise a new
AU01954 	    job sheet for any outstanding work that is required.
AU01954 	35. Notify the traffic control room on completion of the job.
AU01954 	36. Ensure the completed from TMF-3012-OP-0273 - Burnley Tunnel
AU01954 	    Groundwater Pump Calibration  is returned to the Electrical
AU01954 	    / Electronic Team leader or his representative for recording
AU01954 	    of the data.  Enter data into file at
AU01954 	    G:\TFM\Operations\Tunnel drainage\Burnley Tunnel Drainage\
AU01954 	      Swan St pump Flows.xls
AU01954 	     \ Data Entry. Print Graph and forward to Maintenance
AU01954 	     Operations Manager for information and forwarding to
AU01954 	     relevant authorities.

AU01954 	  PSSWGWP1      |              A  |                       hrs |
AU01954 	  PSSWGWP2      |              A  |                       hrs |
AU01873 	"01 W Mon, m'sure & report  Swan St pump stn flows"
AU01873 	The measure of water flowing from the Swan Street pump station
AU01873 	is a measure of all the water collected in the Burnley Tunnel
AU01873 	"drainage systems, from both dirty and Groundwater sources."
AU01873 	
AU01873 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01873 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01873 	"2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, BURNLEY TUNNEL"
AU01873 	   DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0031.
AU01873 	3. The Civil Team leader is to provide a copy of the previous
AU01873 	   WEEKLY BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0233 for
AU01873 	   detail of the previous readings.
AU01873 	"4. At the Swan Street Pump Station Motor Control Centre, record"
AU01873 	   the Time and the Total flow in kilo litres for the pump
AU01873 	   station on the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
AU01873 	   TMF-3012-OP-0233.
AU01873 	5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01873 	6. Ensure a copy of the form BURNLEY TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
AU01873 	   TMF-3012-OP-0233 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
AU01873 	   evaluation on completion  of the job.
AU01873 	   Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
AU01873 	   in excess of  0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
AU01873 	   job to investigate to check the various bay flows for the
AU01873 	   reason to the change in water flowrate.
AU02150 	03 M Inspect and Clean PS control panels and rooms
AU02150 	
AU02150 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02150 	Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
AU02150 	"and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving"
AU02150 	"the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for"
AU02150 	"fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,"
AU02150 	"Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,"
AU02150 	Rodent Bait Station
AU02150 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU02150 	This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
AU02150 	"installations of Pump Stations as well the cleaning, inspections"
AU02150 	and maintenance of the relevant areas.
AU02150 	B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU02150 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant pump station
AU02150 	   rooms.
AU02150 	"2. On entering control rooms, temporarily switch OFF ventilation"
AU02150 	"   fans, if operating.   [_ _]"
AU02150 	"3. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,"
AU02150 	"   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any"
AU02150 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU02150 	"4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,"
AU02150 	"   including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace"
AU02150 	   faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
AU02150 	5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU02150 	   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
AU02150 	   and distribution panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature
AU02150 	   sensor.  Temperatures of ambient plus 10?C should be
AU02150 	   considered abnormal and must be noted in the Work Done area
AU02150 	   of the Job Sheet and ensure the Team Leader or his
AU02150 	   representative is informed of the abnormality.  Raise a new
AU02150 	   job sheet for any corrective action [_ _]
AU02150 	"6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU02150 	"   terminals, equipment and components for evidence of burn"
AU02150 	"   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything"
AU02150 	   abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise a
AU02150 	   new jobsheet for any  corrective action. Ensure the Team
AU02150 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU02150 	   abnormality.  [_ _]
AU02150 	"7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU02150 	"   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU02150 	"8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU02150 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU02150 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU02150 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02150 	   actions.  [_ _]
AU02150 	"9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU02150 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU02150 	10. Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
AU02150 	"    dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any"
AU02150 	"    accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU02150 	11. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
AU02150 	    Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
AU02150 	"12. Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s), for"
AU02150 	"    faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and"
AU02150 	"    buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement"
AU02150 	    or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
AU02150 	    actions.   [_ _]
AU02150 	13. PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
AU02150 	    (a) Inspect the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
AU02150 	        found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged
AU02150 	        in the work done area of the job sheet and a new job
AU02150 	        sheet raised to investigate and correct the
AU02150 	        error.  [_ _]
AU02150 	    (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g. plug
AU02150 	"        connections, screw  connections, for security.  [_ _]"
AU02150 	    (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
AU02150 	        module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
AU02150 	    (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush ensure the
AU02150 	        enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
AU02150 	        dust and debris.  [_ _]
AU02150 	14. Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
AU02150 	"    accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation.  [_ _]"
AU02150 	15. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU02150 	    Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
AU02150 	    or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU02150 	"C. Control and pump room Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU02150 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
AU02150 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02150 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
AU02150 	   Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02150 	2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
AU02150 	   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
AU02150 	"4. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,"
AU02150 	"   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on"
AU02150 	"   all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of"
AU02150 	"   cabinet doors, tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]."
AU02150 	5. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
AU02150 	   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
AU02150 	"6. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light"
AU02150 	"   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]"
AU02150 	7. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
AU02150 	8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
AU02150 	9. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  Replace bait
AU02150 	   station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
AU02150 	10. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
AU02150 	    Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
AU02150 	    job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02150 	    corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU02150 	11. Remove any accumulated debris from the building
AU02150 	    surrounds.   [_ _]
AU02150 	12. Prior to leaving the site ensure:
AU02150 	    (a) All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
AU02150 	"         e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"
AU02150 	    (b) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU02150 	    (c) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
AU02150 	13. Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU02150 	14. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
AU01656 	"03 M Inspect, Test & Clean of Yarra Boulevard Pump Station"""
AU01656 	
AU01656 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01656 	Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
AU01656 	"and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving"
AU01656 	"the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for"
AU01656 	"fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,"
AU01656 	"Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,"
AU01656 	Rodent Bait Station
AU01656 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU01656 	This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
AU01656 	"installations of the Pump Station as well the cleaning,"
AU01656 	inspections and maintenance of the relevant areas.
AU01656 	B PUMP AND PUMP CONTROL OPERATION
AU01656 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01656 	"2. Reference Manual, TOJV, Pump Station Operation and"
AU01656 	   Maintenance Manuals - M-STG-ME-20001. Volume 3.
AU01656 	3. WARNING:  THE WET WELL IS DESIGNATED A CONFINED SPACE AND
AU01656 	   MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED SPACE CONDITIONS.
AU01656 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU01656 	   TMI-33012-SA-0015.  Ensure the vent fan has operated for a
AU01656 	   minimum period of 15 minutes prior to entering the dry well.
AU01656 	4. At the Local Control Panel
AU01656 	"   (a) Check the switchboard, situated adjacent to the pump well"
AU01656 	       for local alarm conditions.   [_ _]
AU01656 	   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
AU01656 	"       externally the control panel for damage, corrosion,"
AU01656 	"       evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust"
AU01656 	       and grime (clean as required).   [_ _]
AU01656 	   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01656 	       overheating and inspect the electrical control
AU01656 	       equipment.  [_ _]
AU01656 	   (d) Replace any failed panel indicator lamps.  [___]
AU01656 	   (e) Record the hours run reading in the Work Done area of
AU01656 	       the job sheet.   [_ _]
AU01656 	5. Inspect the wet well.
AU01656 	   (a) Remove the covers (gatic lifters required) from the wet
AU01656 	       well.
AU01656 	   (b) Inspect for general cleanliness and accumulated debris in
AU01656 	"       the wet well, hose down any pumpable materials and remove"
AU01656 	       any non-pumpable solids.   [_ _]
AU01656 	"6.  Inspection of the dry well, pumps and valves."
AU01656 	   (a) Inspect the dry well for general cleanliness and
AU01656 	"       accumulated debris, clean if required.   [_ _]"
AU01656 	"    (b) The pipes, valves and pumps for corrosion and evidence"
AU01656 	        of leaks.   [_ _]
AU01656 	7. Check the water level in the low level pump area.  If the
AU01656 	   water level is above the high level setting then manually
AU01656 	   operate the sump pump to drain if necessary.   Record in the
AU01656 	   Work Done of the job sheet and report for corrective
AU01656 	   maintenance.   [_ _]
AU01656 	8. Switch the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to MANUAL
AU01656 	   position.   [_ _]
AU01656 	   (a) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
AU01656 	       clear from possible damage.   [_ _]
AU01656 	9. Start the pump PSYBSWP1 by pressing the START pushbutton.
AU01656 	   (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
AU01656 	       Done area of the job sheet.   [_ _]
AU01656 	"   (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration"
AU01656 	       and that sufficient gland water flows regularly.  (One to
AU01656 	       two drops per minute)   [_ _]
AU01656 	   (c) Observe that the pump discharge is sufficient to drawdown
AU01656 	       the water level.    [_ _]
AU01656 	      CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
AU01656 	      alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset
AU01656 	      damage.
AU01656 	   (d) Stop the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton. Check the
AU01656 	"       operation of non-return valve (NRV), as the flow stops."
AU01656 	       The NRV should close with
AU01656 	      (i) a sharp audible metallic sound
AU01656 	     (ii) the counterweight returning to pre-start position or
AU01656 	"          lower, as well"
AU01656 	    (iii) backflow through the pump should cease within 30
AU01656 	          seconds.
AU01656 	"          If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be"
AU01656 	          re-started and run for 2 minutes and  the operation of
AU01656 	          the NRV monitored again.   [_ _]
AU01656 	"          If a faulty closure is still suspected, record in the"
AU01656 	          Work Done  area of the job sheet and report for
AU01656 	          corrective maintenance.  [_ _]
AU01656 	10. Repeat steps 8 and  9 for pump PSYBSWP2.   [_ _]
AU01656 	11. Repeat steps 8 and  9 for pump PSYBSWP3.   [_ _]
AU01656 	12. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the AUTO
AU01656 	    position. [_ _]
AU01656 	"13. Check the operation of the Taylor level controller, using"
AU01656 	    the wet well sight gauge situated on the wall of the dry
AU01656 	    well.   [_ _]
AU01656 	"14. Test the operation of each of the isolating valves, in turn,"
AU01656 	    by partial closing and fully opening again.    [_ _]
AU01656 	15. Check that the dry well ventilation system is functional by
AU01656 	    checking the air flow and the filters for blockages.  [_ _]
AU01656 	16. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01656 	    parameters
AU01656 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01656 	         leaks
AU01656 	         lighting faults
AU01656 	         door damage
AU01656 	         evidence of structural damage to the Pump Station and
AU01656 	"         equipment etc,  in the Work Done  section of the"
AU01656 	         job sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
AU01656 	         representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01656 	"17. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done"
AU01656 	    area of the job sheet.
AU01656 	18. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01656 	       debris or materials that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]

AU01656 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01656 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01656 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01656 	Note:
AU01656 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01656 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01656 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01656 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01656 	        it's intended function.
AU01656 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01656 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01656 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01656 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01656 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01656 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01656 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01656 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01656 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01656 	        intended function.
AU01656 	CONDITION RATING SCORE

AU01656 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01946 	03 M Inspect & Test YC Pump Station pumps
AU01946 	
AU01946 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01946 	1. Notify the Control room prior to commencing this work.
AU01946 	2. Reference manual Operation and Maintenance Manual for
AU01946 	   Melbourne Citylink Project - Yarra Crossing Groundwater
AU01946 	   Pumping Station Upgrade  R-YPS-CO-100000.
AU01946 	3. WARNING:  BOTH THE WET WELLS AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
AU01946 	   CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED
AU01946 	   SPACE CONDITIONS.
AU01946 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU01946 	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
AU01946 	4. At the Local Control Panel A1
AU01946 	"   (a) Check the switchboard, situated in switchroom above the"
AU01946 	"       pump station, for local alarm conditions.    [_ _]"
AU01946 	   (b) Carry out visual inspections both internally and
AU01946 	"       externally of the control panels for damage, corrosion,"
AU01946 	"       evidence of insect infestation, ingress of moisture, dust"
AU01946 	       and grime (clean as required).  [_ _]
AU01946 	   (c) Check the cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01946 	       overheating and inspect electrical the control equipment
AU01946 	       for evidence of overheating.    [_ _]
AU01946 	"   (d) Check control panel indicators for operation, repair as"
AU01946 	       necessary.  [_ _]
AU01946 	   (e) Check control switches are left in the Auto
AU01946 	       position.  [_ _]
AU01946 	"   (f) Record the readings of  the hour run meters, for each"
AU01946 	"       pump, in the Work Done area of  job sheet.  [_ _]"
AU01946 	5. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel A2.  [_ _]
AU01946 	6. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel A3.  [_ _]
AU01946 	7. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel B1.  [_ _]
AU01946 	8. Repeat step 4 for Control Panel B2.  [_ _]
AU01946 	9. Inspect the pump wet wells and the valve pit.
AU01946 	   (a) Inspect the wet wells through the access ladder hatch for
AU01946 	"       general cleanliness and any accumulated debris, inspect"
AU01946 	       for any evidence of leakage.   [_ _]
AU01946 	   (b) Inspect the external conditions of the pipework and the
AU01946 	       valves for corrosion (Rust).  Minor corrosion (rust) is
AU01946 	       to be removed with a wire brush and the cleaned surface
AU01946 	       painted with Coldgal.   [_ _]
AU01946 	   (c) Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet evidence of
AU01946 	       leaks and any corrective works that are outstanding.
AU01946 	       Raise a new jobsheet for any corrective works
AU01946 	       outstanding.   [_ _]
AU01946 	"   (d) Lubricate Isolating Valves with Loctite Silver Grade Anti ,,"
AU01946 	  Seize Lubricant or Equivalent.  [_ _]
AU01946 	   (e) Operate all pump manual isolating valves through AT LEAST
AU01946 	       THREE (3) OPEN/CLOSED cycles to confirm valve
AU01946 	       operationally.  Ensure the valves are left in the fully
AU01946 	       open position on completion.  [_ _]
AU01946 	"10. Test the function of the Hydrocarbon detector, to test use a"
AU01946 	    small LPG bottle and release a small amount of gas in the
AU01946 	    vicinity of the detector.  Check with the control room that
AU01946 	    an alarm was received.    [_ _]
AU01946 	11. Dirty Water Pumps
AU01946 	    (a) Check the inlet tundish for any blockage or accumulated
AU01946 	        debris.  Clean if necessary    [_ _]
AU01946 	    (b) Check the triple interceptor trap for evidence of oil on
AU01946 	"        the surface, turbidity and the correct operation of the"
AU01946 	        discharge valve.    [_ _]
AU01946 	12. Switch the pump PSYCDWP1 AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to
AU01946 	    the MANUAL position.  [_ _]
AU01946 	    (a) Check and note the position of pump non-return valve
AU01946 	        counterweight before starting the pump.   [_ _]
AU01946 	    (b) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
AU01946 	        clear from possible damage.  [_ _]
AU01946 	   CAUTION:  Do not pump the wet well below the Low/Low level
AU01946 	   alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset damage
AU01946 	13. Start the pump PSYCDWP1 by pressing the START push
AU01946 	    button.   [_ _]
AU01946 	    (a) Measure the operating current of the pump in the Work
AU01946 	        Done area of the job sheet.  If the current drawn is
AU01946 	        greater than FLC 55A then record in the Work Done
AU01946 	        area of the Jobsheet .   [_ _]
AU01946 	"    (b) Observe pump operation for smooth running, vibration and"
AU01946 	        abnormal noises.  [_ _]
AU01946 	    (c) Observe pump discharge rate is sufficient to draw down
AU01946 	        level of water in sump.   [_ _]
AU01946 	"    (d) Visually check piping for leaks, damage and corrosion,"
AU01946 	        clean corrosion and repair with Cold Gal.  If leaks or
AU01946 	"        damage is apparent, record in the Work Done area of the"
AU01946 	        job sheet and raise a new job sheet for the corrective
AU01946 	        maintenance.  Ensure the Team Leader or his
AU01946 	        representative is notified.  [_ _]
AU01946 	"    (e) Observe the level controller readout for variations,"
AU01946 	        with respect to the pump operations.    [_ _]
AU01946 	    (f) Stop the pump by pressing the  STOP pushbutton.  Check
AU01946 	"        the operation of the non-return valve (NRV), as the"
AU01946 	        water flow stops.
AU01946 	       (i) The NRV should close with a sharp audible metallic
AU01946 	"           sound,"
AU01946 	      (ii) Backflow through the pump should cease within 30
AU01946 	           seconds.
AU01946 	"     (iii) If a faulty closure is suspected, the pump should be"
AU01946 	           re-started then be monitored again.
AU01946 	"      (iv) If a faulty valve closure is still suspected, record"
AU01946 	           in the Work Done area of the job sheet and raise a
AU01946 	           new job sheet for the corrective maintenance.  [_ _]
AU01946 	14. Repeat steps 12 and 13 for PSYCDWP2.   [_ _]
AU01946 	15. Repeat steps 12 and 13 for PSYCDWP3.   [_ _]
AU01946 	16. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the  AUTO
AU01946 	    position.   [_ _]
AU01946 	17. Check the operation of the float switches by manually
AU01946 	    operating the floats.  The floats are situated in the corner
AU01946 	    of the wet well and are accessible from the ladder with the
AU01946 	    use of a special hook to reach the cables. Lift the
AU01946 	    High/High float and invert it 90 deg to trigger alarm.  Lift
AU01946 	"    the Low/Low float and invert through 90 deg, checking that"
AU01946 	    the alarms are received at the Traffic Control Room. [_ _]
AU01946 	"18. When this job falls in either December, March, June or"
AU01946 	    September.  Lift the level controller sensor out of the
AU01946 	"    protective conduit, then carefully, clean the recess in the"
AU01946 	    sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
AU01946 	"19. Check the operation of each of the isolating valves, by"
AU01946 	    partially closing then fully opening again.  [_ _]
AU01946 	20. Work plan for the Ground Water Pumps
AU01946 	21. Switch pump PSSWGWP1 AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to the
AU01946 	    MANUAL position.  [_ _]
AU01946 	    (a) Check the cabling to the pump for damage and that it is
AU01946 	    alarm point as lack of submergence may cause pumpset damage
AU01946 	22. Start the pump PSYCGWP1 by pressing the START
AU01946 	    pushbutton.  [_ _]
AU01946 	    (a) Record the operating current of the pump in the Work
AU01946 	        Done area of the job sheet if the current drawn is
AU01946 	        greater than. (FLC 40A.).   [_ _]
AU01946 	"    (b) Observe the pump operation for smooth running, vibration"
AU01946 	        and/or abnormal noises.    [_ _]
AU01946 	    (c) Observe that pump discharge rate is sufficient to draw
AU01946 	        down water level in sump  [___]
AU01946 	"    (d) Observe the level controller readout for variations,"
AU01946 	        with respect to the pump operations.   [_ _]
AU01946 	    (e) Shut off  the pump by pressing the STOP pushbutton.
AU01946 	        Check the operation of the non-return  valve (NRV). The
AU01946 	        NRV is constructed of PVC.  The NRV should close once
AU01946 	"        flow, through the pump, has ceased.  If a flow"
AU01946 	"        continues, then the pump should be re-started and run"
AU01946 	        for 2 minutes and the non-return valve monitored again.
AU01946 	"        If a faulty closure is still suspected, record in the"
AU01946 	        Work Done area of the job sheet and raise a new job
AU01946 	        sheet for the outstanding corrective works.  [_ _]
AU01946 	23. Repeat steps 20 to 22 for pump PSYCGWP2.  [_ _]
AU01946 	24. Repeat steps 20 to 22 for pump PSYCGWP3 ONLY IF A PUMP IS CONNECTED.
AU01946 	[_ _]
AU01946 	25. Return the AUTO/OFF/MANUAL selector switch to AUTO
AU01946 	    position.  [_ _]
AU01946 	26. Check the operation of the float switches by manually
AU01946 	"27. When this job falls in either January, March, June or"
AU01946 	    September.  Lift level controller sensor out of the
AU01946 	"    protective conduit, then carefully, clean recess in"
AU01946 	    the sensor base of all dirt or debris.   [_ _]
AU01946 	28. Check the operation of the isolating valves by partially
AU01946 	    closing then opening fully again.    [_ _].
AU01946 	29. Check that the wet well ventilation system fan is
AU01946 	    operational and sucking air.     [_ _]
AU01946 	"30. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU01946 	    of the job sheet.    [_ _]
AU01946 	31. A Confined Space Entry permit is required prior to entering
AU01946 	    the sump
AU01946 	"32. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from"
AU01946 	    Automatic Mode to Manual Mode.
AU01946 	   Caution DO NOT OPERATE THE PUMPS WITHOUT WATER COVERAGE.  THE
AU01946 	   PUMPS NEED TO BE SUBMERGED TO OBTAIN ADEQUATE COOLING
AU01946 	   OTHERWISE DAMAGE WILL OCCUR.
AU01946 	33. At the pump sump
AU01946 	"    (a) Inspect the triple interceptor for debris, silt deposits"
AU01946 	"        and foreign objects, remove and clean if required."
AU01946 	"    (b) Inspect the pump sump for debris, silt deposits and"
AU01946 	"        foreign objects, remove and clean if required."
AU01946 	34. Ensure the Triple Interceptor bypass valve is OPEN.
AU01946 	35. This test is to record the flow rate in litres per second
AU01946 	"    for each pump.  It is only necessary to operate the pumps,"
AU01946 	"    in each case, for a time sufficient to allow the readings to"
AU01946 	    stabilise.  Record all results on form TMF-3012-OP-0272 -
AU01946 	    Domain Tunnel Groundwater Pump Calibration.
AU01946 	     (a) Close valve Pump 2
AU01946 	     (b) Start Pump 1 using the On/Off Push Buttons
AU01946 	     (c) Allow sufficient time for readings to settle
AU01946 	     (d) Record the flow rate (Lt/Sec) from the 2 Magflow flow
AU01946 	         meters (Large digits).
AU01946 	     (e)Turn pump 1 OFF.
AU01946 	36. Close Pump 1 valve and Open Pump 2 valve.  Repeat step 35
AU01946 	    for pump 2.
AU01946 	37. Ensure the combined flowrate is between 15 and 16 litres per
AU01946 	"    second for each pump.  Adjust the flowrate, if required, by"
AU01946 	    adjusting the butterfly valve on the 100mm and 80mm
AU01946 	    lines.  [_ _]
AU01946 	"38. Once the test is complete, ensure both pump valves are fully"
AU01946 	"    open, pump isolators are switched ON and the float switches"
AU01946 	    are free to operate. [_ _]
AU01946 	"39. At the pump motor control panel, switch the pumps from"
AU01946 	    Manual mode to Automatic Mode.
AU01946 	40. Record in the Work Done area of the Job sheet any
AU01946 	    outstanding works that require further work.  Raise a new
AU01946 	    job sheet for any outstanding work that is required.
AU01946 	41. Record the hours run for each pump in the Work Done area of
AU01946 	    the Job Sheet.  The hour run meters are on the panel door.
AU01946 	42. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01946 	    parameters
AU01946 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01946 	         leaks
AU01946 	         lighting faults
AU01946 	         door damage
AU01946 	         evidence of structural damage to the pump station and
AU01946 	"         equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job"
AU01946 	         sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
AU01946 	         representative and raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01946 	43. Notify the traffic control room on completion of the job.
AU01946 	44. Ensure the completed from TMF-3012-OP-0272  Domain Tunnel
AU01946 	    Groundwater Pump Calibration is returned to the Electrical
AU01946 	    Electronic Team leader or his representative for recording
AU01946 	    of the data.  Enter data into file at
AU01946 	    G:\TFM\Operations\Tunnel drainage\Domain Tunnel drainage\
AU01946 	    Yarra Xing pump Flows.xls
AU01946 	    \ Data Entry.  Print Graph and forward to Maintenance
AU01946 	    Operations Manager for information and forwarding to
AU01946 	    relevant authorities.
AU01946 	Enter Recordings Below
AU01946 	--------------------------------------------------------------
AU01946 	  Plant Number  |  FLC Current    |  Hours Run                |
AU01946 	  PSYCDWP1  A1  |              A  |                     hrs   |
AU01946 	---------------------------------------------------------------
AU01946 	  PSYCDWP2  A2  |              A  |                     hrs   |
AU01946 	  PSYCDWP3  B1  |              A  |                     hrs   |
AU01946 	  PSYCGWP1  A3  |              A  |                     hrs   |
AU01946 	  PSYCGWP2  B2  |              A  |                     hrs   |
AU01846 	"01 W Mon, m'sure & report  YC pump stn flows"""
AU01846 	The measure of  water flowing from the Yarra Crossing pump
AU01846 	station is a measure of all the water collected in the Domain
AU01846 	"tunnel drainage systems, from both dirty and clean water"
AU01846 	sources.
AU01846 	Note: NEW CHANGES TO ITEM 4
AU01846 	
AU01846 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01846 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01846 	"2. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, DOMAIN TUNNEL"
AU01846 	   DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0025.
AU01846 	3. The Civil Team Leader is to provide a copy of the previous
AU01846 	   DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOW TMF-3012-OP-0203 for details of
AU01846 	   the previous readings.
AU01846 	4. Record the Time and the Total Flow at Magflow 1 (in K.litres)
AU01846 	"   and the Total Flow at Magflow 2 (in m3) for the pump station,"
AU01846 	   on form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS TMF-3012-OP-0203.
AU01846 	5. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01846 	6. Ensure a copy of the form  DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE FLOWS
AU01846 	   TMF-3012-OP-0203 is forwarded to the Civil Team Leader for
AU01846 	   evaluation on completion of the job.
AU01846 	   Note:  An increase or decrease in the pump station outflows
AU01846 	   in excess of 0.5 litres/s could indicate a problem.  Raise a
AU01846 	   job to investigate to check the various bay flows for
AU01846 	    the reason to the change in water flowrate.

AU02115 	   control centre distribution panels to expose components for

AU02115 	"   each component, switchboard, panel found to require further"

AU01784 	03 M inspection of Refuge 3 air handling unit
AU01784 	
AU01784 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01784 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job
AU01784 	"2. (a) Refer to Maintenance Manual, """"Operating and Maintenance manual"
AU01784 	for Mechanical
AU01784 	"         Services - MCL Tunnels"""" M-STG-ME-27400."
