AU01784 	stair pressurisation
AU01784 	         commissioning tests.
AU01784 	"3. Access Refuge 3 via substation 2, at ground level in Swan Street,"
AU01784 	then down the stairwell to
AU01784 	    the tunnel level.
AU01784 	4. Ensure supply fan SF-SS2-1 situated on roof of Substation 2 is
AU01784 	operating and normal air
AU01784 	   supply to the ventilation shaft and refuge area is being maintained.
AU01784 	"5. Check the grill, supplying air to the refuge area, in the"
AU01784 	ventilationshaft is clear of debris that
AU01784 	   will restrict air flow.   [_ _]
AU01784 	6. Ensure the door between the Burnley Tunnel and the Refuge area is
AU01784 	closed.
AU01784 	"7. Prior to entering the refuge, have the traffic control room operator"
AU01784 	check the CO and NO levels
AU01784 	"   and the temperature of the refuge.  Record in the """"Work Done"""" area"
AU01784 	of the jobsheet if the
AU01784 	   ambient conditions are within required safety standards. If the air
AU01784 	"quality is below standards, arrange for the control"
AU01784 	   room to refresh the air in the refuge by operating the fan until
AU01784 	suitable air quality is
AU01784 	   achieved.  [_ _]
AU01784 	8. Inspection and checks of the Refuge and shaft area.
AU01784 	    WARNING:
AU01784 	    HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN WORKING IN THE
AU01784 	VICINITYOF
AU01784 	    THE OPERATING FAN.
AU01784 	   (a) Check the
AU01784 	         (i) exhaust vent on the duct   [_ _]
AU01784 	         (ii) the return air grill on the fan unit    [_ _]
AU01784 	         (iii) The fire damper and motorised damper exhaust grills in
AU01784 	the access shaft to
AU01784 	                tunnel to ensure they are free of debris that would
AU01784 	restrict the free flow of
AU01784 	                air.   [___]
AU01784 	          Note: The air damper on the fan return air grill is
AU01784 	non-functional.
AU01784 	"   (b) Check the fire damper for damage, loose linkages and premature"
AU01784 	operation.    [_ _]
AU01784 	   (c) Arrange the traffic control room operator to operate the fan.
AU01784 	 Check the operation of the fan
AU01784 	         ensuring the air flow is from the duct outlet into the refuge.
AU01784 	 [_ _]
AU01784 	   (d) Note: The alarm to be raised will not call the fire brigade. It
AU01784 	will register on the local FIP
AU01784 	                    and CCCS as a local alarm.
AU01784 	"         Remove the smoke detector access cover and spray """"test"
AU01784 	"smoke"""", from a smoke"
AU01784 	"         generator, as specified on the container, onto the smoke"
AU01784 	detector (on the inlet duct).
AU01784 	         Check that an alarm actuates on the local  fire indicator
AU01784 	panel.  [_ _]
AU01784 	  (e ) With the supply air fan SA-SD3-01 operating record the
AU01784 	"differential pressure, if less than"
AU01784 	"        50Pa in the """"Work Done area of the job sheet.  Advise the"
AU01784 	superintendent for further
AU01784 	        investigation.   [_ _]
AU01784 	"  (f) Arrange the refuge door catch to be non-functioning, then using a"
AU01784 	"spring balance,"
AU01784 	       measure the force required to open the door. Record the results
AU01784 	"in the """"Work Done"""""
AU01784 	"       area of the job sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required,"
AU01784 	advise the superintendent
AU01784 	       for further investigation.   [_ _]
AU01784 	"  (g) Chock the door open, then using an anemometer, measure the"
AU01784 	velocity of air out of the
AU01784 	        open door.  The reading should be with the door fully open and
AU01784 	no obstructions.
AU01784 	"        Record the results in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet"
AU01784 	ifa velocity is less than
AU01784 	       1 metre per  sec.  Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
AU01784 	corrective actions
AU01784 	       required.   [_ _]
AU01784 	"  (h ) After closing the door, measure the time taken for the air"
AU01784 	pressure to return to the static
AU01784 	"        reading.  Record the results in the """"Work Done"""" area of the"
AU01784 	job sheet if the time taken is
AU01784 	        greater than two minutes.  Raise a new job sheet for any
AU01784 	outstanding corrective action
AU01784 	        required.   [_ _]
AU01784 	  ( i ) Check the fan and motor for undue noise and vibrations.   [_ _]
AU01784 	  ( j ) Check the fan and motor bearings for noise.   [_ _]
AU01784 	"   (k) Check the fan plenum for damage, corrosion, missing panel"
AU01784 	"fixings, as well as"
AU01784 	         checking unit fixings for security.  [_ _]
AU01784 	   ( l ) Measure the motor current and compare with the rated current.
AU01784 	  [_ _]

AU01784 	required.  ( 4 off 600x600x100mm)
AU01784 	             and ( 4 off 600x300x100mm)    [_ _]
AU01784 	9. Ensure the action of opening the Refuge door;
AU01784 	   (a) Generates an alarm at the TCR workstation.
AU01784 	   (b) Causes the fan speed to vary to maintain a positive pressure in
AU01784 	the Refuge.
AU01784 	"   (c) To replicate the action of the smoke detector, temporarily"
AU01784 	"removethe relay """"Refuge"
AU01784 	"         Supply Air Fan No 3"""" mounted in the rear compartment of the"
AU01784 	fire indicator panel.  The
AU01784 	         fan should stop after about two and a half minutes.  Replace
AU01784 	the relay on
AU01784 	         confirmation.   [_ _] (A local alarm will register on the CCCS.
AU01784 	 The fire brigade will not
AU01784 	         be called)
AU01784 	"10. Run the fan for a further 5 minutes, with the door in both the open"
AU01784 	and the closed
AU01784 	      position.
AU01784 	11. Clean the refuge:
AU01784 	     Sweep the floor and remove accumulated webs from the walls.   [___]
AU01784 	     Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01784 	12. On completion of job record anything outside normal parameters
AU01784 	      e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01784 	             leaks
AU01784 	             lighting faults
AU01784 	             door damage
AU01784 	"             evidence of structural damage to the refuge etc,  in the"
AU01784 	"Work Done"""""
AU01784 	       section of the job sheet and report to the Team Leader or his
AU01784 	representative and
AU01784 	       raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01784 	13. Request the traffic control room to shut the fan down and to turn
AU01784 	off the lighting after
AU01784 	"      leaving the Refuge, ensuring that the door to the tunnel is"
AU01784 	"14. Record anything outside normal parameters in the """"Work Done"""" area"
AU01784 	of the Job Sheet.
AU01784 	15. Ensure the door between the Refuge and the Burnley Tunnel is closed.
AU01784 	"16. Notify the Control Room on completion of the job."""

AU01783 	          the tunnel.   [_ _]

AU01783 	          levels and the temperature in the refuge.   Record in the

AU01783 	quality in the refuge is below

AU01783 	the refuge by operating the

AU01783 	          linkages.   [___]

AU01783 	operation.   [___]

AU01783 	andNO levels are

AU01783 	 operating

AU01740 	12 M Inspection of Refuge 1 & 2 air handling units
AU01740 	
AU01740 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01740 	1. Obtain a lane closure approval for the appropriate tunnel.  [_ _]
AU01740 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01740 	"3. Refer to Maintenance Manual, """"Operating and Maintenance manual for"
AU01740 	Mechanical
AU01740 	"   Services - MCL Tunnels"""" M-STG-ME-27400."
AU01740 	"4. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01740 	TMI-3012-OP-0002 and
AU01740 	"   Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan  20 or 22."
AU01740 	WARNING:
AU01740 	HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE WORKING IN THE
AU01740 	VICINITY OF THE OPERATING FAN.
AU01740 	5. Carry out the three Monthly inspection and checks. [_ _]
AU01740 	6. Work plan for Refuge 1 Supply air fan.
AU01740 	"   (a)  At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan"
AU01740 	AUTO/MANUAL/OFF selector switch
AU01740 	          to the MANUAL position and the ON/OFF selector switch to the
AU01740 	ON position to operate
AU01740 	          the  fan.    [_ _]
AU01740 	"    (b) Operate the fan for at least 30 minutes, monitor the fan motor"
AU01740 	in operation and check
AU01740 	           the bearings for undue noise.   [_ _]
AU01740 	    (c) Monitor the fan and motor in operation for any undue noises and
AU01740 	or vibrations.  [_ _]
AU01740 	    (d) Open the door from the Refuge to the Burnley Tunnel and monitor
AU01740 	the fan motor speed
AU01740 	          to confirm it varies to maintain a positive pressure
AU01740 	differential  (
AU01740 	>50Pa).  [_ _]
AU01740 	"    (e) At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan"
AU01740 	OFF position.  Isolate the
AU01740 	"          fan in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety"
AU01740 	Work  Instruction.     [_ _]
AU01740 	     (f) Remove the access panels and clean the interior of the unit of
AU01740 	accumulated dirt and
AU01740 	           debris.  [_ _]
AU01740 	     (g ) Clean the motor exterior of accumulated dust and debris.  [_
AU01740 	_]
AU01740 	"     (h) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, lost or missing"
AU01740 	fixings etc.  repair if
AU01740 	            required.   [_ _]
AU01740 	      (i ) Check the unit mounts for security and tension.   [_ _]
AU01740 	      (j ) Check the duct for damage and corrosion.   [_ _]
AU01740 	"      (k) At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan the ON/OFF"
AU01740 	selector switch to the
AU01740 	           ON position to operate and  the  fan AUTO/MANUAL/OFF selectorswitch
AU01740 	 to the AUTO
AU01740 	           position.    [_ _]
AU01740 	      (l) Lubricate the motor bearings with Shell Alvania R3 grease.
AU01740 	 Apply the grease while the
AU01740 	"             fan is rotating, continue until all the old grease is"
AU01740 	purged from the grease
AU01740 	             relief port. [_ _]
AU01740 	      (m) Notify the traffic control room that the control has been
AU01740 	returned to Auto Operation.
AU01740 	7. Repeat from step 4 for Refuge 2 Supply fan.   [_ _]
AU01740 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal parameters"
AU01740 	"in the """"Work Done"""""
AU01740 	   area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
AU01740 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01787 	the fan motor speed
AU01787 	          to confirm it varies to maintain a positive pressure
AU01787 	differential  (
AU01787 	>50Pa).  [_ _]
AU01787 	"    (e) At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan"
AU01787 	OFF position.  Isolate the
AU01787 	"          fan in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage Safety"
AU01787 	Work  Instruction.     [_ _]
AU01787 	     (f) Remove the access panels and clean the interior of the unit of
AU01787 	accumulated dirt and
AU01787 	           debris.  [_ _]
AU01787 	     (g ) Clean the motor exterior of accumulated dust and debris.  [_
AU01787 	_]
AU01787 	"     (h) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, lost or missing"
AU01787 	fixings etc.  repair if
AU01787 	            required.   [_ _]
AU01787 	      (i ) Check the unit mounts for security and tension.   [_ _]
AU01787 	      (j ) Check the duct for damage and corrosion.   [_ _]
AU01787 	"      (k) At the Equipment Room switchboard, switch the fan the ON/OFF"
AU01787 	selector switch to the
AU01787 	           ON position to operate and  the  fan AUTO/MANUAL/OFF selectorswitch
AU01787 	 to the AUTO
AU01787 	           position.    [_ _]
AU01787 	      (l) Lubricate the motor bearings with Shell Alvania R3 grease.
AU01787 	 Apply the grease while the
AU01787 	"             fan is rotating, continue until all the old grease is"
AU01787 	purged from the grease
AU01787 	              relief port. [_ _]
AU01787 	      (m) Notify the traffic control room that the control has been
AU01787 	returned to Auto Operation.
AU01787 	"7. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal parameters"
AU01787 	"in the """"Work Done"""""
AU01787 	   area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
AU01787 	8. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU02138 	03 M Electrical Inspection / Clean RRBroadcast rooms
AU02138 	
AU02138 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02138 	   Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the cleaning
AU02138 	"   and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to"
AU02138 	"   leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,"
AU02138 	"   lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,"
AU02138 	"   Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon"
AU02138 	"   Lubricant Spray, Rodent bait station,"
AU02138 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU02138 	   This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
AU02138 	"   electrical installations of Radio Rebroadcast Rooms 01, 02 &"
AU02138 	"   03 as well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the"
AU02138 	   relevant areas.
AU02138 	B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU02138 	"   ( RRB 01, 02 & 03)"
AU02138 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Radio Rebroadcast
AU02138 	   rooms.
AU02138 	"2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,"
AU02138 	"   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any"
AU02138 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU02138 	"3. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the"
AU02138 	"   operational tube within EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or"
AU02138 	   repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
AU02138 	"4. For RRB 01 only, go to Step 8."
AU02138 	5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU02138 	   accessible equipment and components within distribution
AU02138 	   panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures
AU02138 	   of ambient plus 10?C should be considered abnormal and must
AU02138 	"   be noted in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and"
AU02138 	   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
AU02138 	   the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02138 	   action [_ _]
AU02138 	"6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU02138 	"   terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn"
AU02138 	"   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything"
AU02138 	"   abnormal in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet and raise"
AU02138 	   a new jobsheet for any corrective action.  Ensure the Team
AU02138 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU02138 	   abnormality. [_ _]
AU02138 	"7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU02138 	"   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU02138 	"8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU02138 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU02138 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU02138 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02138 	   actions. [_ _]
AU02138 	"9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU02138 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU02138 	10.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
AU02138 	"   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any"
AU02138 	"   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU02138 	11.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
AU02138 	   Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
AU02138 	"12.Inspect systems, mounted within the Technical Shelters, for"
AU02138 	"   faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and"
AU02138 	"   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement"
AU02138 	   or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU02138 	13.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU02138 	   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
AU02138 	   or his representative of any corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU02138 	"C  RRB room 01, 02 & 03  Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU02138 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
AU02138 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02138 	"   details in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet and inform"
AU02138 	   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02138 	2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
AU02138 	   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
AU02138 	"3. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,"
AU02138 	"   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle on"
AU02138 	"   all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops of"
AU02138 	"   cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]."
AU02138 	4. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
AU02138 	   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
AU02138 	"5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light"
AU02138 	"   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]"
AU02138 	6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
AU02138 	"7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait, replace bait"
AU02138 	   station if bait is nearly exhausted.  [_ _]
AU02138 	8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
AU02138 	9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
AU02138 	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
AU02138 	   job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02138 	   corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU02138 	10.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
AU02138 	    (a)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU02138 	    (b)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
AU02138 	11.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU02138 	12. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
AU01743 	03 M Inspect of Liebert A/C units at Substation 2.
AU01743 	
AU01743 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01743 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01743 	2. Access to the Air Conditioning units in the Substation 2
AU01743 	   building is via external doors into the SS02 building in Swan
AU01743 	   Street. The condenser units are located on the roof of the
AU01743 	   building.
AU01743 	"3. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01743 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01743 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01743 	4. Work plan for ACU Air Conditioning Units
AU01743 	"4.1. With the unit running, Check for undue noise and any"
AU01743 	     vibration.   [_ _]
AU01743 	4.2. Check the temperature set points as follows
AU01743 	     a. Check that the temperature shown on the microprocessor
AU01743 	        LED display is consistent with the ambient temperature
AU01743 	        measured with a portable thermometer.  Ambient
AU01743 	        temperature should be within 2 degrees of the thermostat
AU01743 	        setting.   [_ _]
AU01743 	     b. Check that the system accepts changes in the setpoint by
AU01743 	        the following steps
AU01743 	       (i) Hold control SEL key down for 5 seconds (St1 will be
AU01743 	           displayed)
AU01743 	      (ii) Release key and current setpoint blinks
AU01743 	     (iii) Use down key to adjust setpoint 5 deg lower and note
AU01743 	           setting.
AU01743 	      (iv) Press SEL key to confirm setting
AU01743 	       (v) Press SEL key twice to exit setpoint mode.
AU01743 	"      (vi) Wait until unit cuts out,  and verify that"
AU01743 	           temperature shown on unit is consistent with new
AU01743 	           setpoint and verify temperature is consistent with
AU01743 	           ambient (+ or - 1 deg) using portable
AU01743 	           thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01743 	     c. Repeat the above steps to restore the setpoint to the
AU01743 	        original setting.   [_ _]
AU01743 	     d. Verify that unit cooling cycle cuts in when new set
AU01743 	        point is reached and verify that the temperature is
AU01743 	        consistent with ambient using the portable
AU01743 	        thermometer.   [_ _]
AU01743 	  NOTE:  LED display blinks in reverse mode during heating
AU01743 	  cycle.
AU01743 	4.3. Shut down unit and check that the air flow alarm operates
AU01743 	     and that the control room receives the alarm.   [_ _]
AU01743 	4.4. Check filters and replace if necessary.   Filter type
AU01743 	     Liebert size 650x590x75 mm.   [_ _]
AU01743 	4.5. Remove and clean condensate tray and confirm the drain line
AU01743 	     is clear.   [_ _]
AU01743 	4.6. Restart  unit and set for remote operation.   [_ _]
AU01743 	5. Work plan for the ACC Condenser Unit
AU01743 	5.1.  Inspect the condenser unit and check for undue cycling
AU01743 	      operation.   [_ _]
AU01743 	5.2. Check for undue noise or any vibration while the fan is
AU01743 	     running.   [_ _]
AU01743 	5.3. Switch the fan OFF using the local fan isolating
AU01743 	      switch.   [_ _]
AU01743 	5.4. Inspect  for loose connections or leaking coils.   [_ _]
AU01743 	5.5. Remove debris and dirt build up from fan and coil area
AU01743 	"5.6. Clean the condenser coils, if required using compressed"
AU01743 	     air.
AU01743 	5.7. Switch the fan ON at the local fan isolator.   [_ _]
AU01743 	5.8. Check for normal operation at the Air Conditioner
AU01743 	     Unit.   [_ _]
AU01743 	6.0 Sweep and clean the Equipment room and associated adjacent
AU01743 	    thoroughfares:
AU01743 	6.1 Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01743 	    walls.   [___]
AU01743 	6.2 Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
AU01743 	    will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01743 	6.3 Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01743 	    enclosure.  [___]
AU01743 	6.4 Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01743 	    dust.   [___]
AU01743 	6.5 Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
AU01743 	    Clear any blockages.
AU01743 	6.6 Remove from site all accumulated debris and rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01743 	7.0. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01743 	    parameters
AU01743 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01743 	         leaks
AU01743 	         lighting faults
AU01743 	         door damage
AU01743 	    evidence of structural damage to the Equipment room and
AU01743 	"    equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet"
AU01743 	    and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
AU01743 	    raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01743 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01743 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01743 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01821

AU01821 	1. The 12 month service of the air conditioner shall be carried
AU01821 	   out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the electrical
AU01821 	   electronic technician and in conjunction with the 3 monthly
AU01821 	   service.
AU01821 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01821 	3. Access to the TSH 09 Air Conditioning units in the
AU01821 	   Substation 2 building is via external doors into the SS02
AU01821 	   building in Swan Street.  The condenser units are located on
AU01821 	   the roof of the  building.
AU01821 	"4. Reference manual, Entire Mechanical Services, Operating and"
AU01821 	   Maintenance Manual for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne City
AU01821 	   Link Tunnel Project.  M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01821 	5. Check the electrical switchboard for
AU01821 	   (a) Faulty indicating lamps  [_ _]
AU01821 	"   (b) Connections, contacts, wiring and or components that may"
AU01821 	       be overheating.   [_ _]
AU01821 	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
AU01821 	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
AU01821 	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
AU01821 	   service:
AU01821 	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
AU01821 	       calibration.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (c) Check functionality and calibration of microprocessor
AU01821 	       based controls.  [_ _]
AU01821 	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01821 	   service at the compressor.
AU01821 	   (a) Accurately assess and record compressor
AU01821 	       superheat.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (b) Check and record the suction and discharge
AU01821 	       pressures.  [_ _]
AU01821 	   (c) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
AU01821 	       and stable.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (d) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
AU01821 	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
AU01821 	"   (e) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01821 	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (f) Check the crankcase heater for correct operation.  [_ _]
AU01821 	"   (g) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01821 	       fit new new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (h) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
AU01821 	       serviceable.   [_ _]
AU01821 	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01821 	   service at the evaporator.
AU01821 	   (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
AU01821 	   (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
AU01821 	       rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01821 	"   (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01821 	       found.   [_ _]
AU01821 	"   (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit"
AU01821 	       a new filter if required.   [_ _]
AU01821 	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01821 	    service at the condenser.
AU01821 	    (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
AU01821 	    (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
AU01821 	        rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01821 	"    (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01821 	        found.    [_ _]
AU01821 	11. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01821 	    service at the humidifier (where fitted).
AU01821 	    (a) Check the humidifer inlet water strainer for
AU01821 	        blockage.   [_ _]
AU01821 	    (b) Check the humifier operation.   [_ _]
AU01821 	"12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01821 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01821 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01821 	14. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
AU01821 	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an additional cost in the
AU01821 	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.
AU01821 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01821 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01821 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01821 	Note:
AU01821 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01821 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01821 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01821 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01821 	        it's intended function.
AU01821 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01821 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01821 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01821 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01821 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01821 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01821 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01821 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01821 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01821 	        intended function.
AU01821 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01821 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01821 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01655 	VISIBLE
AU01655 	"   OR  INVISIBLE, DIRECTING THE FIBRE OPTIC CABLE TOWARDS THE EYE OR"
AU01655 	LOOKING

AU01655 	  TRANSMITTERS CAN CAUSE BURNS TO THE BODY.

AU01660 	   S-STG-TL-1727 Specifications for UHF and Radio Rebroadcast Systems.

AU01660 	   M-STG-TL-1729 System manual for UHF & Radio Rebroadcast System.
AU01660 	   M-STG-TL-1730 Test Procedures for UHF & Radio Rebroadcast Systems.
AU01660 	   WARNING: THE LIGHT EMITTED FROM A FIBRE OPTIC CABLE MAY BE EITHER
AU01660 	VISIBLE
AU01660 	"   OR  INVISIBLE, DIRECTING THE FIBRE OPTIC CABLE TOWARDS THE EYE OR"
AU01660 	LOOKING
AU01660 	   DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF A FIBRE OPTIC CABLE WHICH IS EMITTING LIGHT
AU01660 	",WILL"
AU01660 	   CAUSE IRREVERSABLE  DAMAGE TO THE EYE.
AU01660 	   WARNING:  PERSONAL CONTACT WITH THE RADIO FREQUENCY OUTPUT OF RADIO
AU01660 	  TRANSMITTERS CAN CAUSE BURNS TO THE BODY.
AU01660 	5.  AM/FM Transmitter Levels
AU01660 	   (a) Measure FM Transmitter level at the east and westbound downlink
AU01660 	monitor point
AU01660 	         (A1 and A2) on the Grant Street patch panel.  Connect the
AU01660 	spectrum analyser to the RF
AU01660 	"         monitor point A1 (Burnley Tunnel), set the analyser to display"
AU01660 	the FM carriers.  Measure
AU01660 	         and record the carrier level for each station on form
AU01660 	TMF-3012-OP-0108.
AU01660 	         Repeat for the Domain Tunnel at monitor point A2.
AU01660 	   (b) Measure and record the transmit output level for each AM
AU01660 	"transmitter, located in TSH 08,"
AU01660 	         on the transmitter hybrid combiner.  Connect the spectrum
AU01660 	analyser via suitable
AU01660 	         attenuation to the hybrid combiner output monitor on the
AU01660 	Burnley Tunnel zone.  Measure
AU01660 	         and record the levels  on form TMF-3012-OP-0108.
AU01660 	         Repeat for the Domain Tunnel zone combiner.
AU01660 	6.1     UHF Base Station Levels
AU01660 	         The system will be taken out of service to perform this check
AU01660 	by removing the antenna
AU01660 	          connection from the TX 3:1 combiner.
AU01660 	   (a) Measure and record the carrier levels for the UHF Base Station
AU01660 	Tunnel Downlink
AU01660 	         Transmitters.  Connect the spectrum analyser to the downlink
AU01660 	monitor test point (A1).
AU01660 	         Locally key each base station exciter by pressing the local
AU01660 	PTTbutton.  Measure and
AU01660 	         record the result for each base station on form
AU01660 	         Repeat for the second zone (A2).
AU01660 	   (b) Check the levels of the Off-air levels of the UHF base station.
AU01660 	 Disconnect the antenna
AU01660 	         from the 3:1 TX combiner.  Connect the spectrum analyser to
AU01660 	theTX 3:1 Combiner
AU01660 	         output via suitable attenuation.  Locally key t he base
AU01660 	stationexciter by pressing the PTT
AU01660 	         button.  Measure and record the carrier level for each base
AU01660 	station on form
AU01660 	         TMF-3012-OP-0108.
AU01660 	         Return the system to service by reconnecting the antenna to
AU01660 	theTX 3:1 combiner.   [_ _]
AU01660 	6.2.     Tunnel Uplink Receiver Tests.
AU01660 	          The operation of each base station receiver will be confirmed
AU01660 	by injecting a test signal
AU01660 	          into the uplink path and observing the operation of the
AU01660 	receiver carrier squelch.
AU01660 	    (a) Connect the IFR radio test set to the Grant Street patch panel
AU01660 	connector B12
AU01660 	          (Inject uplink).  Set the IFR carrier level to -80dBm.  Injecttest
AU01660 	carriers at the frequencies
AU01660 	          shown on form TMF-3012-OP-0108.  Observe and record that the
AU01660 	carrier squelch
AU01660 	          operates for each of the carriers on form TMF-3012-OP-0108.
AU01660 	 Operation of the carrier
AU01660 	          squelch is indicated by an orange LED on the receiver front
AU01660 	panel.
AU01660 	6.3     Off-air Receiver Tests.
AU01660 	          The operation of each Off-air base station receiver will be
AU01660 	confirmed by injecting a test
AU01660 	          signal into the Off-air input receive filter.  The UHF
AU01660 	repeater downlink will be removed
AU01660 	          from service during this test by disconnecting the antenna
AU01660 	from the RX input filter.
AU01660 	         The operation of the receiver can be confirmed by observing
AU01660 	thereceiver carrier front
AU01660 	         panel orange RX squelch LED.
AU01660 	    (a) Connect the IFR radio test set to the input RX filter and set
AU01660 	the IFR carrier level to
AU01660 	          -80dbm.
AU01660 	          Inject test carriers at the frequencies shown on  form
AU01660 	TMF-3012-OP-0108.  Record the
AU01660 	          result for each of the carriers.
AU01660 	          Return the UHF downlink to service by reconnecting the
AU01660 	antennato the RX input
AU01660 	          filter   [_ _].
AU01660 	6.4     Downlink RF Level Tests
AU01660 	          The operation of the downlink is verified by measuring the
AU01660 	101.1 Mhz FM station level
AU01660 	          at each equipment room.  Measurements are made at the
AU01660 	equipment downlink amplifier
AU01660 	          VHF monitor test point.
AU01660 	    (a) Connect the spectrum analyser to the monitor point.  Measure at
AU01660 	each equipment room
AU01660 	          and record the 101.1 Mhz carrier level.
AU01660 	6.5     Uplink RF Level Tests.
AU01660 	          The operation of the Uplink is verified by injecting a test
AU01660 	signal at each equipment and
AU01660 	          measuring the level at the Grant Street patch panel uplink
AU01660 	monitor point.
AU01660 	   (a)  Set the RF signal generator to 450 Mhz -20dBm Carrier
AU01660 	unmodulated.
AU01660 	"          At each of the equipment rooms,  connect the RF signal"
AU01660 	generator into either of the
AU01660 	          uplink combiner inputs.  Measure the level at the Grant
AU01660 	StreetTSH 08 patch panel
AU01660 	          A5 - A11 and record the result on form TMF-3012-OP-0108.
AU01660 	"7. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal parameters"
AU01660 	"in the """"Work Done"""""
AU01660 	    area of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet for any works that
AU01660 	require further attention.
AU01660 	    Job priority = P1 High priority.
AU01660 	8. Notify the control room on completion of the inspection.

AU02011 	
AU02011 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02011 	1. The Traffic Control Room Officer or his representative are to
AU02011 	   check the contents of the SL Traffic Management Cabinets.
AU02011 	2. WARNING:   PERSONS CARRYING OUT INSPECTIONS MUST BE AWARE
AU02011 	   THAT POISONOUS INSECTS MAY BE WITHIN THE CABINETS.
AU02011 	"3. At each Traffic Management Cabinet, listed on form"
AU02011 	   TMF-3012-OP-0315 SL TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT CABINETS  an
AU02011 	   inspection and content count is to be carried out.:
AU02011 	   (a) Visually inspect the enclosure for damage and graffiti
AU02011 	"   (b) Visually inspect the enclosure door, hardware and gaskets"
AU02011 	       for damage.
AU02011 	   (c) Check the enclosure for insect infestation
AU02011 	       AND SPRAY WITH A SUITABLE INSECT SPRAY AS REQUIRED.
AU02011 	   (d) Clean the enclosure of accumulated dirt and debris.
AU02011 	   (e) Count and record the number of each item stored in the
AU02011 	       cabinet AND RESTOCK CABINET OF MISSING ITEMS AS REQUIRED.
AU02011 	   (f) Record the result of the visual inspections and the count
AU02011 	       of items on the form TMF-3012-OP-0315 - SL Traffic
AU02011 	       Management Cabinets.
AU02011 	4. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work.
AU02011 	5. The completed job sheet and form TMF-3012-OP-0315 SL Traffic
AU02011 	   Management Cabinets are to be returned to the Road  Service
AU02011 	   and Traffic Manager or his representative.  The Road Service
AU02011 	   and Traffic Manager is to be notified of any outstanding
AU02011 	   issues and a copy of job sheet to be forwarded to the Team
AU02011 	   Leader - Civil or his representative.

AU02006 	"   (b) Visually inspect the enclosure door, hardware and gaskets"

AU02006 	   (c) Check the enclosure for insect infestation.
AU02006 	   (d) Clean the enclosure of accumulated dirt and debris.
AU02006 	   (e) Record the result of the visual inspections on form
AU02006 	       TMF-3012-OP-0306 - Emergency Displan System
AU02006 	"   (f) (i) At each telephone, in turn, dial the Translink"
AU02006 	"           Traffic Control Room, phone number 9674 2070 and"
AU02006 	"           confirm two way communication, with the operator"
AU02006 	           using the telephone. Advise the operator of the
AU02006 	           number of the phone which is being used.
AU02006 	      (ii) The Traffic Control Room operator is to call the SIRO
AU02006 	           on the telephone number provided in 4 f(i) and once
AU02006 	           again confirm two way communication between the
AU02006 	           operator and the SIRO.
AU02006 	    (g) The result of the test is to be recorded on Form
AU02006 	        TMF-3012-OP-0306 Emergency Displan System by indicating
AU02006 	        OK or FAIL.  Any other outstanding issues are to be
AU02006 	        recorded on the form TMF-3012-OP-0306 Emergency Displan
AU02006 	        System.
AU02006 	6. Any service or operational difficulties with the emergency
AU02006 	   telephone systems are to be reported to Telstra's Corporate
AU02006 	   Faults on number  132 255 by the TCR.  The TCR is to
AU02006 	   obtain a job number from the Telstra Operator.
AU02006 	7. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work.
AU02006 	8. The completed job sheet and form TMF-3012-OP-0305 is to be
AU02006 	   returned to the Road Service and Traffic Manager or his
AU02006 	   representative and a copy be forwarded to the Team
AU02006 	   Leader - Civil or his representative.

AU01727 	   BT ERTs job is done in the Burnley Tunnel.  The fire phones
AU01727 	   are at the fire cabinets.

AU01727 	          communication.

AU01727 	          way communications.
AU01727 	    (iii) Ensure the fire cabinet door is closed correctly
AU01727 	          following inspection.

AU01727 	       evidence of damage and or leaks.

AU01726 	   Plan 20.

AU01726 	    (d) Alarm computer maintenance program to be carried out

AU02151 	installations and cleaning of the relevant areas.
AU02151 	B ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU02151 	"1. Check the lighting of the mezzanine area for operation,"
AU02151 	"   including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace or"

AU02151 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU02151 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU02151 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02151 	   actions.  [_ _]
AU02151 	"3. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU02151 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU02151 	4. Inspect all electrical enclosures (where appropriate)
AU02151 	"   internally for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures"
AU02151 	"   of any accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU02151 	5. Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
AU02151 	   obstructions.  [_ _]
AU02151 	"6. Visually inspect systems, mounted within the relevant areas"
AU02151 	"  (where appropriate), for faulty indicators, faulty meters,"
AU02151 	"   damaged switches and buttons etc, carry out repairs or"
AU02151 	   indicator lamp replacement or raise a new job sheet for any
AU02151 	   outstanding actions.   [_ _]
AU02151 	7. Clean lighting diffusers (including emergency and Exit
AU02151 	   lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]
AU02151 	"8. Check and clean cable trays for accumulated debris, evidence"
AU02151 	   of water accumulation.  Record anything  abnormal in the Work
AU02151 	   Done area of the job sheet.  Record anything abnormal in the
AU02151 	   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or
AU02151 	   his representative of outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU02151 	"Mezzanine Level Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU02151 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
AU02151 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02151 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the
AU02151 	   Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02151 	2. Check that the mezzanine area is not obstructed by
AU02151 	   furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
AU02151 	   obstruction.  [_ _]
AU02151 	"3. Check the doors and windows for damage, operation, lubricate"
AU02151 	   and repair as required and record in the Work Done area of
AU02151 	   the Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
AU02151 	   of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
AU02151 	"4. Clean and remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of"
AU02151 	"   cabinets, ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will"
AU02151 	"   settle on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets,"
AU02151 	"  tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]."
AU02151 	5. Clean exterior surfaces of cabinets as required.  [_ _]
AU02151 	"6. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets and"
AU02151 	   ceilings.  [_ _]

AU02151 	    (where appropriate).  [_ _]

AU02030 	06 M Clean of the in pavement expansion joints (SL)
AU02030 	
AU02030 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02030 	A Job Start as a minimum must be completed in consultation with
AU02030 	"all participating employees to identify, assess and control the"
AU02030 	hazards prior to work commencing.
AU02030 	The job start should take into account the following hazards as a
AU02030 	minimum:
AU02030 	           Traffic
AU02030 	           Manual Handling
AU02030 	           Sharps & other foreign objects
AU02030 	"           Slips, Trips & Falls"
AU02030 	           Noise
AU02030 	           UV radiation
AU02030 	           Inclement weather
AU02030 	Other hazards particular to the location or conditions should be
AU02030 	"identified, assessed, controlled and noted on the Job Start form prior"
AU02030 	to the work commencing.
AU02030 	1. Inspect and clean the in-pavement expansion joint systems in the
AU02030 	    following SL sectors:
AU02030 	    - W1/E5 Glenferrie Road to MacRobertson Bridge   [_ _]
AU02030 	    - W2A/E7/4 MacRobertson Bridge to Church St / Burnley Tunnel    [_
AU02030 	_]
AU02030 	    - W2B/E6B Church St to Domain Tunnel   [_ _]
AU02030 	    - W4/E1 Southbank Interchange    [_ _]
AU02030 	2. Notify control room prior to commencing work.
AU02030 	3. Use flashing amber beacon light on vehicles and wear fluorescent
AU02030 	vestwhen on foot.
AU02030 	4. Inspect the expansion joints
AU02030 	"   (a) for an accumulation of debris (Nuts, bolts and hard debris) that"
AU02030 	may cause the
AU02030 	         expansion joint to not function correctly
AU02030 	   (b) for an accumulation of debris that may cause a blockage and stop
AU02030 	any waterflow.
AU02030 	   (c) for an accumulation of debris that is greater than 20mm deep that
AU02030 	will support
AU02030 	         vegetation growth.
AU02030 	5. Clean the expansion joint of debris and blockages that have built up.
AU02030 	6. Check the expansion joints for structural damage and loose or
AU02030 	missingcomponents
AU02030 	"    including nuts, bolts and surrounds."
AU02030 	7. Record in the Work Done Area of the job sheet any outstanding
AU02030 	on-going corrective actions
AU02030 	   and the location of the expansion joint.
AU02030 	8. Raise a job sheet for any outstanding corrective actions on any
AU02030 	"expansion joints. """
AU01985 	12 M Perform pavement condition monitoring on SL
AU01985 	
AU01985 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01985 	1. Notify the Traffic Control room prior to commencing this
AU01985 	   work.
AU01985 	2  This work is to be carried by a sub-contractor under TS
AU01985 	   supervision
AU01985 	3. Traffic management as per Work Instruction Traffic Control
AU01985 	   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 11
AU01985 	   to be provided by Transfield Services.
AU01985 	   In the work done area record:
AU01985 	   a. Any deviations from the plan.
AU01985 	   b. Lane closure start time.
AU01985 	   c. Lane closure finish time.
AU01985 	   d. Weather conditions.
AU01985 	4. Carry out a roughness survey of the SL
AU01985 	5. Carry out a computerised and automated logging of visual
AU01985 	   defects and video survey of the pavement defects.
AU01985 	6. Carry out a falling weight deflectometer survey along the
AU01985 	   route length of the SL.
AU01985 	7. Provide a detailed report on the complete SL detailing the
AU01985 	   current conditions of the SL road pavement.
AU01985 	8. Manage automated pavement management database to provide an
AU01985 	   on-going and updated data related to the SL pavement and its
AU01985 	   on-going operational condition.
AU01985 	9. Record in the Work done area of the Job Sheet the job Report
AU01985 	   No. and the date.
AU01985 	10. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the job.

AU02007 	03 M SL Gate inspections
AU02007 	
AU02007 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02007 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this Job.
AU02007 	2. Inspect and check access gates as set out on the form
AU02007 	   TMF-3012-OP-0308  SL Gate Inspection.
AU02007 	3. At each gate:
AU02007 	    (a) Check the gate for damage
AU02007 	    (b) Unlock the gate and check for operation
AU02007 	    (b) Check the gate hinges for fixings and operation
AU02007 	    (c) Check the gate locking method for security and correct
AU02007 	        lock.
AU02007 	    (d) Check the area for accumulated debris and graffiti.
AU02007 	    (e) Visually check the pavement (where fitted) for damage
AU02007 	"    (f)  Using a Graphite dust puffer, apply Graphite dust to"
AU02007 	"         key entry and to shackle entries, then exercise lock"
AU02007 	         and key to distribute Graphite dust.
AU02007 	   (g)  Replace missing or damaged locks as required.  Lock to
AU02007 	        be issued by Translink Operations Traffic Control room
AU02007 	"4.  For each gate, record the result of the inspections on the"
AU02007 	    form SL Gate Inspection - TMF-3012-OP-0308.
AU02007 	5. Notify control room when inspection is complete.
AU02007 	6. Ensure the completed job sheets and the form  SL Gate and
AU02007 	   Fence Inspection - TMF-3012-OP-0308 is returned to the Civil
AU02007 	   Team Leader or his representative.
AU02007 	7. The Civil Team Leader or his representative is to raise a new
AU02007 	   jobsheet for any outstanding works that requires further
AU02007 	   attention.

AU01911 	   W4  - Southbank Interchange
AU01911 	   as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0016 (Concrete) &
AU01911 	   TMI-3012-OP-0020 (Steel).
AU01911 	2. Personnel carrying out inspection needs to be familiar with

AU01911 	   Manual.

AU01911 	   out.  Ensure vehicle is fitted with amber hazard light and
AU01911 	   personnel are wearing fluorescent / reflective vests.

AU01911 	"   of a structure, Elevated Road, Ramps, Culverts, Bridge"
AU01911 	"   Bearings,  Expansions Joints, Steel Access Stairs, Gantries,"
AU01911 	   Steel Railings.

AU01922 	   required.
AU01922 	2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
AU01922 	   shelter.

AU01922 	   at the following:
AU01922 	   TSH 10
AU01922 	   TSH 11
AU01922 	   TSH 11A and
AU01922 	"   TSH 13 in accordance with Haden, Process Cooling System for"
AU01922 	"   Technical Shelters Manual, Section 4, Maintenance Reference"
AU01922 	   [M-MCL-ME-20014]
AU01922 	4.   At TSH 10
AU01922 	"     (a) Lubricate the exhaust fan bearings, as required, using"
AU01922 	         Shell Alvania No.3.  [_ _]
AU01922 	"     (b) Lubricate the exhaust fan motor bearings, if required,"
AU01922 	         using Shell Alvania No.3.  [_ _]
AU01922 	     (c) Blow compressed air through exhaust fan motor frames
AU01922 	         and terminal boxes to remove excess dust.  [_ _]
AU01922 	     (d) Check the exhaust fan bearing and the motor bearing for
AU01922 	         undue noise.  [_ _]
AU01922 	     (e) Check the flexible connection on either side of exhaust
AU01922 	         fan for air tightness and degradation.  [_ _]
AU01922 	     (f ) Visually inspect the electrical control cabinet and
AU01922 	          the monitoring panel Direct Digital Control (DDC)
AU01922 	"          system for water ingress, condensation, dust and"
AU01922 	          electrical connections.  [_ _]
AU01922 	5.   At TSH 11
AU01922 	     (d) Check the exhaust fan bearing and the motor bearing
AU01922 	         for undue noise.  [_ _]
AU01922 	     (f) Visually inspect the electrical control cabinet and
AU01922 	         the monitoring panel Direct Digital Control (DDC)
AU01922 	"         system for water ingress, condensation, dust and"
AU01922 	         electrical connections.  [_ _]
AU01922 	6.   At TSH 11A
AU01922 	7.   At TSH 13
AU01922 	8. Fill in the HVAC service log book.
AU01922 	9. Fill in the Technical Shelter log book.
AU01922 	"10. On completion of the job, record anything outside of normal"
AU01922 	"    parameters in the ""Work Done"" area of the job sheet.  [_ _]"
AU01922 	11. Notify the Control Room on departure from the Technical
AU01922 	    Shelter.

AU01890 	12 M Inspection of  SL TSH UPS system
AU01890 	
AU01890 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01890 	1. The sub-contractor shall carry out the service in the
AU01890 	   presence of the electrical / electronic technician.
AU01890 	2. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01890 	3. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
AU01890 	   Shelter.
AU01890 	4. Refer to the reference manual Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
AU01890 	   [ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ]
AU01890 	5. The following maintenance is to be carried out on the UPS
AU01890 	   units in the following:
AU01890 	    TSH 8
AU01890 	    TSH 9
AU01890 	5. TSH 08 - UPS Unit.
AU01890 	"   (a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the"
AU01890 	"   front of the UPS Panel, unless in an extreme emergency, as"
AU01890 	   damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
AU01890 	"   (b) Check operation, settings and calibration of all"
AU01890 	   controls.  [_ _]
AU01890 	"   (c)  Record from the data display, the input, inverter, load"
AU01890 	   and battery data.   [_ _]
AU01890 	   (d)  Check for signs of over heating.  [_ _]
AU01890 	   (e)  Check system safety controls. (Bypass operations)  [_ _]
AU01890 	   (f ) Clean the inside of the UPS. (Vacuum out)  [_ _]
AU01890 	   (g)  Clean the filter on the inside of the door panel.  [_ _]
AU01890 	6. TSH 08 - Battery Panel.
AU01890 	   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
AU01890 	   Batteries.
AU01890 	   (b) Remove any metal jewellery being worn
AU01890 	   (c) Battery discharge test.  [_ _]
AU01890 	"         Using the discharge tester, measure and record the"
AU01890 	         individual standby and discharge
AU01890 	"         voltages on the """" individual battery check """"  sheet."
AU01890 	        (Cell voltage variation limit + / - 0.05% volts per cell
AU01890 	         from average of all cells in (1) one
AU01890 	         battery bank.  Any variation in excess of this limit
AU01890 	         should be investigated immediately.)
AU01890 	"         Using the """"Mains failure simulation"""" sheet, perform"
AU01890 	         test and record voltages & currents.
AU01890 	   (d) Check terminals for corrosion.  [_ _]
AU01890 	   (e) Check connections for tightness .  [_ _]
AU01890 	7. TSH 09 - UPS Unit.
AU01890 	   (f )  Clean the inside of the UPS. (Vacuum out)  [_ _]
AU01890 	8. TSH 09 - Battery Panel.
AU01890 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01890 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01890 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01890 	Note:
AU01890 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01890 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01890 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01890 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01890 	        it's intended function.
AU01890 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01890 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01890 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01890 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01890 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01890 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01890 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01890 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01890 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01890 	        intended function.
AU01890 	OVERALL CONDITION RATING SCORE FOR THE UPS SYSTEM
AU01890 	",,        ,,,,,,,,SCORE"
AU01890 	"    CL-TUM-UP-UPSS-TS08,,[_ _]"
AU01890 	"    CL-TUM-UP-UPSS-TS09,,[_ _]"

AU01890 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01890 	",,Note and comment below any items requiring immediate TSL ,,attention."

AU02197 	12 M Change of South Stick lighting filters for autumn
AU02197 	
AU02197 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02197 	1. Notify the TCR prior to commencing this job
AU02197 	"2. Refer to and read TMI-3012-SA-0122 """"Floating Elevated Work"
AU02197 	"   Platform"""" procedure prior to commencing job for safety"
AU02197 	   procedures to be followed whilst carrying out this job.
AU02197 	3. Whilst Inspecting the lighting fittings:-
AU02197 	   (a) Change the lamps
AU02197 	"   (b) Check flexible hose connections for damage etc, repair"
AU02197 	       any damage found.
AU02197 	"   (c) Check all seals for damage and leaks, replace any seals"
AU02197 	       found to be faulty
AU02197 	   (d) Check the lighting control gear and connections for
AU02197 	"       damage, overheating and operation, repair and or"
AU02197 	       replace faulty components.
AU02197 	   (e) Check the light fitting for damage and or corrosion.
AU02197 	       Repair damaged or faulty light fittings and components
AU02197 	"       that are damaged.  Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of"
AU02197 	"       the Job Sheet the number of lamps replaced, as well"
AU02197 	       indicate on form TMF-3012-OP-0220 Architectural Feature
AU02197 	       Lighting - Red Stick (South) the position of fittings
AU02197 	       changed.
AU02197 	   (f) Inspect glass lens for damage replace as required and
AU02197 	"       clean the glass lens of all dirt, dust and or grime."
AU02197 	   (g) Remove any debris accumualted within the light fitting.
AU02197 	   (h) Apply anti-seize to all threads replaced in light
AU02197 	       fitting.
AU02197 	"4. Remove and return to store the Red filters (300000688) , and"
AU02197 	   install yellow filters (300000686) on the light fittings.
AU02197 	5. Repair any damaged Red filters (300000688) and record
AU02197 	"   details in """"Work Done"""" area"
AU02197 	   of the Job Sheet and report any damage to the Team leader
AU02197 	   or his representitive.
AU02197 	6. Notify the TCRO on completion of the job.
AU02197 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02197 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02197 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU02197 	Note:
AU02197 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02197 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02197 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02197 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02197 	        it's intended function.
AU02197 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02197 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02197 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02197 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02197 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02197 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02197 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02197 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02197 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02197 	        intended function.
AU02197 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU02197 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02197 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU02061 	05 Y Inspect the welds of the South Sticks
AU02061 	
AU02061 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02061 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job.
AU02061 	2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - The Stick Wall Periodic
AU02061 	   Non-Destructive Testing - Scope.  Report No. 4199/002
AU02061 	   Provided by Intico.
AU02061 	3. Refer to Report No. 4199/007.
AU02061 	Item 1.1
AU02061 	External
AU02061 	   Examine the external features from the stick to foundation
AU02061 	   interface up to a minimum of 2 metres above the baseplate for
AU02061 	   evidence of metal and or paint cracking as well as evidence
AU02061 	   of corrosion setting in.
AU02061 	(a) Visually examine the welds connecting the vertical
AU02061 	   stiffeners to the skin plates.
AU02061 	(b) Visually examine the welds connecting the upper base plate
AU02061 	    to the vertical elements (Stiffeners and skin plates).
AU02061 	Internal
AU02061 	"   Examine the all internal features, using the access door,"
AU02061 	   from the upper base plate up to a minimum height of 500 mm
AU02061 	   for evidence of metal and or paint cracking as well as
AU02061 	   evidence of corrosion setting in.  A torch and mirror is
AU02061 	   required.
AU02061 	(c) Visually examine the welds connecting the vertical
AU02061 	    stiffeners to the skin plates
AU02061 	(d) Visually examine the welds connecting the upper base plate
AU02061 	(e) Examine the general internal cavity for visible degradation
AU02061 	    as well as any evidence of moisture of water deposits.
AU02061 	(f) Record all details of any cracks in the metal or welds or
AU02061 	    paint surfaces along with any evidence of water residues as
AU02061 	    well as any corrosion and or degradation.  Raise a new
AU02061 	    jobsheet for any outstanding works.
AU02061 	Item 1.2
AU02061 	"(a) Visually examine the protective ""Denso Tape"" wrap on each of"
AU02061 	    the fixing nuts.  Examine for signs of deterioration and for
AU02061 	    any evidence of corrosion of the nut or stud.
AU02061 	(b) Record details of any deterioration of the protective wrap
AU02061 	    and or corrosion.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02061 	    works.
AU02061 	Item 1.3
AU02061 	(a) Visually inspect the external surface of the welds joining
AU02061 	"    the two box sections of the stick, at splice level."
AU02061 	    Particular attention should be paid to detecting paint
AU02061 	    cracking that may occur at the joint line.  Use an elevated
AU02061 	"    work platform to access and inspect the joint in each face,"
AU02061 	    where EWP access is not possible use binoculars.
AU02061 	(b) Visually inspect the external faces for visible degradation
AU02061 	    and or corrosion.
AU02061 	(c) Record details of any evidence of cracks in paint or the
AU02061 	    metal (welds) as well as any surface degradation.  Raise a
AU02061 	    new jobsheet for any outstanding works.
AU02061 	Item 2.1
AU02061 	"(a) Carry out a NDT Test on the ""vertical stiffener to skin"
AU02061 	"    plate welds"" and the ""upper base plate to skin plate and"
AU02061 	"    stiffener welds"".  Test all welds up to a height of +500mm"
AU02061 	    from the upper base plate
AU02061 	(b) Provide a written report of the result of each test.
AU02061 	Item 4.1  (First Inspection 2008)
AU02061 	"(a) Carry out a NDT examination of the ""Upper base plate -"
AU02061 	    underside surfaces in the upper baseplate to lower baseplate
AU02061 	"    stiffener welds"".  Carry out the examination via the access"
AU02061 	    door.  Examine all accessible areas for discontinuity of the
AU02061 	    plate-weld joint and for crack
AU02061 	    indications in the upper baseplate.
AU02061 	4. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.
AU02059 	12 M Inspect the South Sticks
AU02059 	
AU02059 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02059 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this job.
AU02059 	2. Reference: Melbourne City Link - The Stick Wall Periodic
AU02059 	Non-Destructive Testing - Scope.
AU02059 	   Report No. 4199/002 Provided by Intico.
AU02059 	"3. Refer to ""Red Stick Wall  Inspections - Stick Inspectional"
AU02059 	"   Location Details"" TMF-3012-OP-0356 for the location of the"
AU02059 	   various components and structural items for inspection.
AU02059 	Item 3.1
AU02059 	"(a) Visually inspect, from the access door, the base and"
AU02059 	    interior of each stick looking for water pooling in the
AU02059 	"    base, evidence of moisture and or corrosion."
AU02059 	(b) Visually inspect the seal of the access door for damage
AU02059 	(c) Examine stick interior for evidence of the source of any
AU02059 	    possible leak e.g. Top cover or access door.
AU02059 	(d) Estimate the depth and quantity of any water residue and
AU02059 	    record.
AU02059 	"(d) Record details of any water residues (along with source),"
AU02059 	"    corrosion and or damage on form ""ANNUAL SOUTH STICK"
AU02059 	"    INSPECTION"" TMF-3012-OP-0353.  Raise a new jobsheet for any"
AU02059 	    outstanding works.
AU02059 	Item 3.2
AU02059 	"(a) Visually inspect, from the ground and using binoculars, all"
AU02059 	"    faces of each stick, examining the protective coating for"
AU02059 	"    cracks, peeling, blisters and evidence of corrosion."
AU02059 	(b) Record details of any degradation of protective coating and
AU02059 	"    or corrosion on form""ANNUAL SOUTH STICK INSPECTION"""
AU02059 	    TMF-3012-OP-0353.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02059 	    works.
AU02059 	Item 3.3
AU02059 	(a) Visually inspect the Foundation to Stick seal.  Examine for
AU02059 	    the effectiveness of the elastic seal between the steelwork
AU02059 	    and the concrete foundation.  Seal may separate from the
AU02059 	    surfaces or may be missing.
AU02059 	(b) Record details of any degradation of the seal material and
AU02059 	"    or any damaged or missing material on form ""ANNUAL SOUTH"
AU02059 	"    STICK INSPECTION"" TMF-3012-OP-0353.  Raise a new jobsheet"
AU02059 	    for any outstanding works.
AU02059 	Item 3.4
AU02059 	(a) Visually examine each stick for signs of structural damage.
AU02059 	"    This would include vandalism, impact and or displacement."
AU02059 	    Examine the linearity of each stick against the remainder of
AU02059 	    the group.
AU02059 	"(b) Inspect the access door, at the base, for damage and a full"
AU02059 	    complement of setscrews.
AU02059 	(c) Record details of any structural damage along with all other
AU02059 	"    visible damage on form""ANNUAL SOUTH STICK INSPECTION"""
AU02059 	4. Notify the Traffic Control room on completion of the job.

AU01842 	Done Area of the Job

AU01842 	leave rotor in a different

AU01996 	   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and

AU02173 	12 M Lev 2 Inspect of HV system for operation & Faults
AU02173 	All TS procedures in TMI-3012-SA-0102 High Voltage Safety Work
AU02173 	Instruction.
AU02173 	
AU02173 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02173 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02173 	2. The following work is to be carried by the sub-contractor
AU02173 	   under the supervision of an electrical/electronics
AU02173 	   technician.
AU02173 	3. Ensure that the Three monthly HV electric inspection has been
AU02173 	   carried out and that
AU02173 	   (a) The General Section of the above job has been completed
AU02173 	       and
AU02173 	"   (b) Inspect the earthing conductors, earthing electrodes and"
AU02173 	"       connections ensuring all cabling, connections and"
AU02173 	       installation meet the AS 3000 standard.
AU02173 	"4. (Schneider SM6 Switchboard, Circuit Breakers and Isolators)"
AU02173 	   (a) Read and record the number of operation cycles for each
AU02173 	       Circuit Breaker and Isolator.  [_ _]
AU02173 	5. (Substation Earthing Systems)
AU02173 	"    The result of all tests, inspections and observations"
AU02173 	"    including date of test, ground and weather conditions are to"
AU02173 	    be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
AU02173 	    leader or his representative.
AU02173 	"   (a) At each substation and HV switchroom, carry out an"
AU02173 	       earthing resistance test in accordance with AS3000.
AU02173 	   (b) Examine each earthing system in turn and check for
AU02173 	"       tightness of connections, and the condition of system"
AU02173 	"       components e.g. Earthing electrodes, earthing"
AU02173 	"       connections, conductors etc."
AU02173 	6. (RMU Battery Supply and Chargers)
AU02173 	"   The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to"
AU02173 	   be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
AU02173 	   leader or his representative.
AU02173 	"   (a) Inspect the battery compartment for damage, appearance"
AU02173 	       and cleanliness.
AU02173 	   (b) Check that the charger is functional.
AU02173 	   (c) Check the battery voltage on float charge.
AU02173 	   (d) Check that the battery compartment ventilation vents are
AU02173 	       clean and clear.
AU02173 	   (e) Check the external battery connections for tightness and
AU02173 	       corrosion.  Clean and tighten as required.
AU02173 	   (f) Check battery cases and or covers are not cracked or
AU02173 	       distorted.
AU02173 	   (g) Carry out a performance test of the battery bank.
AU02173 	"      (i) Discharge the batteries, via a load, over a two hour"
AU02173 	          period. Record both terminal and battery voltage and
AU02173 	          battery temperature prior to commencing the test as
AU02173 	          well as at completion of test.  Where the battery or
AU02173 	          terminal voltage at completion of test is less than
AU02173 	"          80% of nominal voltage, then the battery is"
AU02173 	          approaching the end of it's serviceable life and
AU02173 	          replacement options should be recommended.
AU02173 	   (h) Check and record the on-load charger output (Voltage and
AU02173 	       current)
AU02173 	   (i)  Check the charger electrical connections and wiring for
AU02173 	        damage etc.
AU02173 	"7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection"
AU02173 	   results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
AU02173 	   job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
AU02173 	   Leader or his representative.  Include in the Related Job
AU02173 	"   field of the new and this job, the job number of the"
AU02173 	   alternate Job.   [_ _]
AU02173 	8. At Substations fill-in the log book.   [_ _]
AU02173 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02173 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02173 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU02173 	Note:
AU02173 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02173 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02173 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02173 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02173 	        it's intended function.
AU02173 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02173 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02173 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02173 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02173 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02173 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02173 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02173 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02173 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02173 	        intended function.
AU02173 	OVERALL CONDITION RATING SCORE FOR THE HV SYSTEM
AU02173 	",,SCORE [_ _]"
AU02173 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02173 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU02173 	FOR OFFICE USE ONLY - 5.3 HV SWITCHBOARD
AU02174 	12 M Inspection of Cast Resin HV Transformers
AU02174 	
AU02174 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02174 	All work on High Voltage equipment must be carried out in
AU02174 	accordance with Transfield's procedure number TMI-3012-SA-0102
AU02174 	High Voltage Safety Work Instructions.
AU02174 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02174 	"2. (Cast Resin Dry Type Transformers 1A, 1B, 2A,2B, 3A, 3B, 4A,"
AU02174 	"   4B, 5A & 5B)"
AU02174 	"   The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to"
AU02174 	   be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
AU02174 	   leader or his representative.
AU02174 	"   (a) Examine and clean all bushings, insulators, terminals,"
AU02174 	"       cable connections, for partial discharge, ingress of"
AU02174 	       moisture or damage.
AU02174 	   (b) Inspect Operation of the Winding temperature sensor.
AU02174 	       Carry out functional testing to ensure correct Alarming
AU02174 	       and trip operation via the PMCS to the Traffic Control
AU02174 	       Room.
AU02174 	   (c) Check tightness (Torque test) of all earthing and cable
AU02174 	"       connections (MEN, Bushings and tank) and inspect for"
AU02174 	       evidence of overheating of broken strands. Tighten
AU02174 	       connections where necessary.
AU02174 	"   (d) Inspect transformer coils, core and frame, for evidence"
AU02174 	"       of corrosion, dirt, or foreign material buildup.  Clean"
AU02174 	"       coils , core and frame and treat and recoat any surface"
AU02174 	       rust spots.
AU02174 	"3. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, inspection"
AU02174 	   results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
AU02174 	   Job Sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
AU02174 	   Leader or his representative.  Include in the Releated Job
AU02174 	"   field of the new and this job, the job number of the"
AU02174 	   alternate Job.   [_ _]
AU02174 	   The following torque settings are:
AU02174 	   Connections of HV connectors - Connections tightening torque
AU02174 	   on the HV terminal and the tapping link bars
AU02174 	   Bolts             Tightening Torque Nm
AU02174 	   M8                    9.8Nm
AU02174 	   M10                  19.6Nm
AU02174 	   M12                  34.3Nm
AU02174 	   M14                  58.8Nm
AU02174 	   Connections of LV connectors - Connection tightening torque
AU02174 	   for the LV bars (Both Nut and Bolts).
AU02174 	   M8                  12.25Nm
AU02174 	   M10                 24.5Nm
AU02174 	   M12                 44.0Nm
AU02174 	   M14                 68.6Nm
AU02174 	   M16                 98.0Nm
AU02177 	24 M L2 Inspect the HV system for operation & Faults
AU02177 	All TS procedures in TMI-3012-SA-0102 High Voltage Safety Work
AU02177 	Instruction.
AU02177 	
AU02177 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02177 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02177 	2. The following work is to be carried by the sub-contractor
AU02177 	   under the supervision of an electrical/electronics
AU02177 	   technician.
AU02177 	3. Refer to Manual Merlin Gerin Masterpact Instruction Notice
AU02177 	   M-STG-EL-24030
AU02177 	4. Ensure that the Three monthly and twelve monthly HV electric
AU02177 	   inspection have been carried out.
AU02177 	"5. (Substation 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B, 5A, 5B and 6"
AU02177 	   Schneider Circuit breakers and Isolators)
AU02177 	"   The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to"
AU02177 	   be recorded and reported to the Electrical/electronics team
AU02177 	   leader or his representative.
AU02177 	"   (a) Thoroughly, visually inspect the circuit breakers and"
AU02177 	       record and report any damaged or worn parts.
AU02177 	"   (b) Inspect metal and insulating parts, remove dust and dirt"
AU02177 	       and clean in accordance with the manufacturers
AU02177 	       instructions.
AU02177 	   (e) Clean the switchgear enclosure (cubicle)
AU02177 	"   (f) Carefully examine bushings and insulators for cracks,"
AU02177 	       chips or partial discharging.
AU02177 	   (g) Visually check and ensure that control devices are free
AU02177 	       of accumulated dust deposits by carefully cleaning.
AU02177 	   (h) Check all un-insulated cable connections for correct
AU02177 	       tension.  Check and tighten un-insulated bolts on cable
AU02177 	       connections where practical to do so.
AU02177 	   (i) Check all earthing and cable connections including
AU02177 	"       control cubicle, inspecting for loose connections and"
AU02177 	       signs of broken strands.  Tighten and or repair as
AU02177 	       required.
AU02177 	"   (j) Visually inspect all auxiliary wiring, plugs and"
AU02177 	        terminations.
AU02177 	   (k) Perform millivolt drop / micro ohm test across primary
AU02177 	       contacts.
AU02177 	   (l) Check and record winding resistance of shunt trip and the
AU02177 	       close coils.  Compare with previous years findings.
AU02177 	   (m) Confirm correct operation of spring charge motors and
AU02177 	       interlock devices.
AU02177 	"   (n) Inspect, clean and lubricate all moving parts of the"
AU02177 	       switchgear operating mechanisms as described in the
AU02177 	       Manufacturer's Maintenance Instructions.
AU02177 	   (o) Clean the exterior of switchgear cubicles of dirt and
AU02177 	"       grime, record areas of damaged paintwork or areas that"
AU02177 	       are corroded.
AU02177 	"   (p) Examine and clean all control relays, contactors, fuses"
AU02177 	"       etc, confirming connections and continuity of all wiring."
AU02177 	   (q) Perform millivolt drop / micro ohm test across cubicle
AU02177 	       bus bar connections for all phases if the bus bar is
AU02177 	       available.
AU02177 	   (r) Perform insulation resistance tests with a 2500V
AU02177 	       insulation tester for one minute per test:
AU02177 	       (i) With the CB closed each phase to the other phases and
AU02177 	           earth.
AU02177 	"      (ii) With the CB open, across the open contacts"
AU02177 	           This test shall be carried out after maintenance.
AU02177 	   (s) Carry out a complete functional test on each circuit
AU02177 	"       breaker, including earth switches ,and ensure correct"
AU02177 	"       operation including devices, flags, interlocks etc."
AU02177 	   (t) Trip and close the circuit breaker at least five times.
AU02177 	   (u) Reinstall all parts and ensure all switchgear is fully
AU02177 	       operational on completion of the maintenance.
AU02177 	6. (Substation Protection)
AU02177 	  DO NOT ATTEMPT SERVICE ON CURRENT TRANSFORMERS WHILE
AU02177 	  ENERGISED.
AU02177 	   Extremely high voltages can be generated across the secondary
AU02177 	   terminal of the current transformer when OPEN circuited.
AU02177 	   Current transformers should be short-circuited during
AU02177 	   secondary injection testing.  Jumper leads should be removed
AU02177 	   when testing is complete.
AU02177 	   (a) Carry out continuity test from current transformers to
AU02177 	"       relays by primary injection, functional test of trip,"
AU02177 	       close.  Alarm and control circuits by operation of the
AU02177 	       relay and physical inspection of all relays.  ENSURE
AU02177 	       APPROPRIATE ALARMS ARE GENERATED BACK TO THE TRAFFIC
AU02177 	       CONTROL ROOM.
AU02177 	   (b) Knee point / saturation test current transformers
AU02177 	       recording five points across the magnetisation curve as
AU02177 	       well as comparing results of each phase / class and
AU02177 	       results of previous testing.
AU02177 	"   (c) Record the settings of all protections relays, verify and"
AU02177 	"       record the pick up and drop out values, IDMT trip times"
AU02177 	       for two points of trip curve via primary injection or the
AU02177 	       Nulec TTS.
AU02177 	"   (d) When testing is complete, carefully check that all"
AU02177 	       jumpers and test leads have been removed and that any
AU02177 	       connections removed for testing purposes have been
AU02177 	       reinstated.
AU02177 	7. (Cast Resin Dry Type Transformers)
AU02177 	   (a) Carry out an insulation resistance test using a 2500V
AU02177 	       insulation tester of HV-LV Frame.  Record the results on
AU02177 	       an appropriate Maintenance Provider Check Sheet.
AU02177 	8. (Insulation Resistance Testing of High Voltage Cables)
AU02177 	   (a) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on all of the
AU02177 	       insulated HV cables.  The test shall be carried out using
AU02177 	       a 2500V insulation tester and shall be tested:
AU02177 	     (i) Between each and every phase conductor
AU02177 	    (ii) Between each phase conductor and the earth conductor.
AU02177 	   (b) Inspect each cable termination and seals for mechanical
AU02177 	"       damage, overheating, tracking and or ingress of moisture."
AU02177 	       Record and report any damage.
AU02177 	"9. (Substation 1A, 1B, 2A, 2B, 3A, 3B, 4A, 4B, 5A & 5B Low"
AU02177 	   Voltage Circuit breakers and Bus Ties)
AU02177 	   (b) Record the number of operations for each circuit breaker.
AU02177 	"   (c) Inspect metal and insulating parts, remove dust and dirt"
AU02177 	   (d) Clean the switchgear enclosure (cubicle)
AU02177 	"   (e) Carefully examine LV bushings and insulators for cracks,"
AU02177 	   (f) Visually check and ensure that control devices are free
AU02177 	   (g) Check all un-insulated cable connections for correct
AU02177 	   (h) Check all earthing and cable connections including
AU02177 	"   (i) Visually inspect all auxiliary wiring, plugs and"
AU02177 	       terminations.
AU02177 	   (j) Perform millivolt drop / micro ohm test across primary
AU02177 	   (k) Check and record winding resistance of shunt trip and the
AU02177 	   (l) Confirm correct operation of spring charge motors and
AU02177 	"   (m) Inspect, clean and lubricate all moving parts of the"
AU02177 	   (n) Clean the exterior of switchgear cubicles of dirt and
AU02177 	"   (o) Examine and clean all control relays, contactors, fuses"
AU02177 	   (p) Perform millivolt drop / micro ohm test across cubicle
AU02177 	   (q) Perform insulation resistance tests with a 1000V
AU02177 	      (i) With the CB closed each phase to the other phases and
AU02177 	          earth.
AU02177 	"        (ii) With the CB open, across the open contacts"
AU02177 	       This test shall be carried out after maintenance.
AU02177 	   (r) Carry out a complete functional test on each circuit
AU02177 	"       breaker and ensure correct operation including devices,"
AU02177 	"       flags, interlocks etc."
AU02177 	   (s) Trip and close the circuit breaker at least five times.
AU02177 	   (t) Reinstall all parts and ensure all switchgear is fully
AU02177 	"10. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet, inspection"
AU02177 	    results requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new
AU02177 	    job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
AU02177 	    Leader or his representative.  Include in the Related Job
AU02177 	"    field of the new and this job, the job number of the"
AU02177 	    alternate Job.   [_ _]

AU02171 	typeoutdoor) is to be

AU02171 	"operating, to"

AU02171 	fixtures for evidence
AU02171 	        of corrosion or other environmental conditions.  [_ _]

AU02171 	or looseness of
AU02171 	       components.  [_ _]

AU02171 	degradation and
AU02171 	         damage.  [_ _]

AU02176 	"         all cabling, connections and installation meet the AS 3000"
