AU02176 	    (a) Read and record the number of operation cycles for each of the
AU02176 	circuit breakers
AU02176 	         and Isolators.  [_ _]
AU02176 	6. (Substation Earthing Systems)
AU02176 	"    The result of all tests, inspections and observations including"
AU02176 	"dateof test, ground and"
AU02176 	    weather conditions are to be recorded and reported to the
AU02176 	Electrical/electronics team
AU02176 	    leader or his representative.
AU02176 	"   (a) At each substation and HV switchroom, carry out an earthing"
AU02176 	resistance test in
AU02176 	        accordance with AS3000.
AU02176 	   (b) Examine each earthing system in turn and check for tightness of
AU02176 	"connections,"
AU02176 	         and the condition of system components e.g. Earthing
AU02176 	"electrodes, earthing"
AU02176 	"         connections, conductors etc."
AU02176 	7. (RMU Battery Supply and Chargers)
AU02176 	"     The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to be"
AU02176 	recorded and reported
AU02176 	      to the Electrical/electronics team leader or his representative.
AU02176 	"     (a) Inspect the battery compartment for damage, appearance and"
AU02176 	cleanliness.
AU02176 	     (b) Check that the charger is functional.
AU02176 	     (c) Check the battery voltage on float charge.
AU02176 	     (d) Check that the battery compartment ventilation vents are clean
AU02176 	and clear.
AU02176 	     (e) Check the external battery connections for tightness and
AU02176 	corrosion.  Clean and
AU02176 	           tighten as required.
AU02176 	      (f) Check battery cases and or covers are not cracked or
AU02176 	distorted.
AU02176 	     (g) Carry out a performance test of the battery bank.
AU02176 	"           (i) Discharge the batteries, via a load, over a two hour"
AU02176 	period. Record both terminal
AU02176 	               and battery voltage and battery temperature prior to
AU02176 	commencing the test as well
AU02176 	              as at completion of test.  Where the battery or terminal
AU02176 	voltage at completion of test
AU02176 	"              is less than 80% of nominal voltage, then the battery is"
AU02176 	approaching the end of
AU02176 	              it's serviceable life and replacement options should be
AU02176 	recommended.
AU02176 	    (h) Check and record the on-load charger output (Voltage and
AU02176 	current)
AU02176 	    (i)  Check the charger electrical connections and wiring for damage
AU02176 	etc.
AU02176 	8. (Capacitor Banks at Sub 3 (Indoor))
AU02176 	"   (a) Carry out a thorough visual inspection, record and report any"
AU02176 	damage.
AU02176 	   (b) Visually inspect the outside and inside of the enclosure for
AU02176 	signs of corrosion on
AU02176 	         capacitor cans and frames.  Clean and remove accumulated dirt
AU02176 	and dust.
AU02176 	"   (c) Visually inspect all earthing and cabling connections, check for"
AU02176 	signs of overheating
AU02176 	        or broken strands.  Check and tighten connections as required.

AU02176 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02176 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02176 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU02176 	Note:
AU02176 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02176 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02176 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02176 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02176 	        it's intended function.
AU02176 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02176 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02176 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02176 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02176 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02176 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02176 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02176 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02176 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02176 	        intended function.

AU02175 	Instruction.

AU02175 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02175 	2. The following work is to be carried by the sub-contractor under the
AU02175 	supervision of an
AU02175 	    electrical/electronics technician.
AU02175 	"3. Refer to Manual """"Merlin Gerin Masterpact Instruction Notice"""""
AU02175 	 M-STG-EL-24030
AU02175 	4. Ensure that the Three monthly HV electric inspection has been
AU02175 	carriedout and that
AU02175 	"   (a) The  """"General Section """" of the above job has been completed and"
AU02175 	"   (b) Inspect the earthing conductors, earthing electrodes and"
AU02175 	connections ensuring
AU02175 	"         all cabling, connections and installation meet the AS 3000"
AU02175 	standard.
AU02175 	"5.(Schneider SM6 Switchboard, Circuit Breakers and isolators)"
AU02175 	   (a) Read and record the number of operation cycles of the circuit
AU02175 	breakers and
AU02175 	         isolators.   [_ _]
AU02175 	6. (Sub 6 Oil Filled Transformers A & B)
AU02175 	"    The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to be"
AU02175 	recorded and reported
AU02175 	    to the Electrical/electronics team leader or his representative.
AU02175 	"   (a) Carry out Insulation resistance test, using 2500-volt insulation"
AU02175 	tester: HV-LV / Tank
AU02175 	"   (b) Examine and clean all bushings, insulators, terminals, cable"
AU02175 	"boxes, valves along"
AU02175 	"         with all fitments for oil leaks, ingress of moisture, damage."
AU02175 	   (c) Check oil levels and add fresh oil as required.  Fresh oil shall
AU02175 	be dielectric tested
AU02175 	        and compliant with AS1883.
AU02175 	   (d) Carry out a functional test of the oil temperature and
AU02175 	monitoringto ensure correct
AU02175 	         Alarming and trip operation via the PMCS to the Traffic
AU02175 	ControlRoom.
AU02175 	   (e) Check tightness (Torque test) of all earthing and cable
AU02175 	"connections (MEN,"
AU02175 	         Bushings and tank) and inspect for evidence of overheating of
AU02175 	broken strands.
AU02175 	        Tighten connections where necessary.
AU02175 	    (f) Check the operation and setting of temperature and pressure
AU02175 	alarm  / trip switches
AU02175 	        and if necessary adjust settings in accordance with the
AU02175 	manufacturers Operating
AU02175 	        and Maintenance Instructions.
AU02175 	"  (g) Inspect the transformer tank, cooling fins and fitments for"
AU02175 	"corrosion, dirt or foreign"
AU02175 	"        material buildup.  Clean tank cooling fins and fittings, treat"
AU02175 	and recoat surface rust
AU02175 	        spots.
AU02175 	  (h) Inspect and where necessary replace the crystals in the silica
AU02175 	gelbreather when
AU02175 	        fitted.
AU02175 	        Note: Blue/Pink silica gel crystals may be carcinogenic linked
AU02175 	and should only
AU02175 	        be disposed of as per the supplier's recommendations.
AU02175 	7. (Transformer Oil Testing 6A & 6B)
AU02175 	    Ensure by referring to Analytical Reports that there is no PCB's
AU02175 	present in oils be tested.
AU02175 	"    The result of the tests, inspections and observations are to be"
AU02175 	  (a) Collect a sample of the Transformer Oil for each transformer and
AU02175 	have the sample
AU02175 	        tested for dielectric strength.
AU02175 	8. (Substation Earthing Systems)
AU02175 	"    The result of all tests, inspections and observations including dateof"
AU02175 	"test, ground and"
AU02175 	    weather conditions are to be recorded and reported to the
AU02175 	Electrical/electronics team
AU02175 	    leader or his representative.
AU02175 	"   (a) At each substation and HV switchroom, carry out an earthing"
AU02175 	resistance test in
AU02175 	        accordance with AS3000.
AU02175 	   (b) Examine each earthing system in turn and check for tightness of
AU02175 	"connections,"
AU02175 	         and the condition of system components e.g. Earthing
AU02175 	"electrodes, earthing"
AU02175 	"         connections, conductors etc."
AU02175 	9. (RMU Battery Supply and Chargers)
AU02175 	"     The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to be"
AU02175 	      to the Electrical/electronics team leader or his representative.
AU02175 	"     (a) Inspect the battery compartment for damage, appearance and"
AU02175 	cleanliness.
AU02175 	     (b) Check that the charger is functional.
AU02175 	     (c) Check the battery voltage on float charge.
AU02175 	     (d) Check that the battery compartment ventilation vents are clean
AU02175 	and clear.
AU02175 	     (e) Check the external battery connections for tightness and
AU02175 	corrosion.  Clean and
AU02175 	           tighten as required.
AU02175 	      (f) Check battery cases and or covers are not cracked or
AU02175 	distorted.
AU02175 	     (g) Carry out a performance test of the battery bank.
AU02175 	"           (i) Discharge the batteries, via a load, over a two hour"
AU02175 	period. Record both terminal
AU02175 	               and battery voltage and battery temperature prior to
AU02175 	commencing the test as well
AU02175 	               as at completion of test.  Where the battery or terminal
AU02175 	voltage at completion of test
AU02175 	"               is less than 80% of nominal voltage, then the battery is"
AU02175 	approaching the end of
AU02175 	               it's serviceable life and replacement options should be
AU02175 	recommended.
AU02175 	    (h) Check and record the on-load charger output (Voltage and
AU02175 	current)
AU02175 	    (i)  Check the charger electrical connections and wiring for damage
AU02175 	etc.
AU02175 	10. (Operations and Maintenance Building Circuit breakers)
AU02175 	"    (a) Thoroughly, visually inspect the circuit breakers and record"
AU02175 	andreport any damaged
AU02175 	          or worn parts.
AU02175 	    (b) Record the number of operations for each circuit breaker.
AU02175 	"    (c) Inspect metal and insulating parts, remove dust and dirt and"
AU02175 	clean in accordance
AU02175 	          with the manufacturers instructions.
AU02175 	   (d) Clean the switchgear enclosure (cubicle)
AU02175 	"   (e) Carefully examine LV bushings and insulators for cracks, chips"
AU02175 	orpartial
AU02175 	         discharging.
AU02175 	   (f) Visually check and ensure that control devices are free of
AU02175 	accumulated dust deposits
AU02175 	        by carefully cleaning.
AU02175 	  (g)Check all un-insulated cable connections for correct tension.
AU02175 	 Check and tighten
AU02175 	       un-insulated bolts on cable connections where practical to do so.
AU02175 	  (h) Check all earthing and cable connections including control
AU02175 	"cubicle, inspecting for"
AU02175 	        loose connections and signs of broken strands.  Tighten and or
AU02175 	repair as required.
AU02175 	"  (i)  Visually inspect all auxiliary wiring, plugs and terminations."
AU02175 	  (j)  Perform millivolt drop / micro ohm test across primary contacts.
AU02175 	  (k) Check and record winding resistance of shunt trip and the close
AU02175 	coils.  Compare
AU02175 	       with previous years findings.
AU02175 	  (l) Confirm correct operation of spring charge motors and interlock
AU02175 	devices.
AU02175 	" (m) Inspect, clean and lubricate all moving parts of the switchgear"
AU02175 	operating mechanisms
AU02175 	        as described in the Manufacturer's Maintenance Instructions.
AU02175 	"  (n) Clean the exterior of switchgear cubicles of dirt and grime,"
AU02175 	record areas of damaged
AU02175 	        paintwork or areas that are corroded.
AU02175 	"  (o) Examine and clean all control relays, contactors, fuses etc,"
AU02175 	confirming connections
AU02175 	        and continuity of all wiring.
AU02175 	  (p) Perform millivolt drop / micro ohm test across cubicle bus bar
AU02175 	connections for all
AU02175 	        phases if the bus bar is available.
AU02175 	  (q) Perform insulation resistance tests with a 1000V insulation
AU02175 	testerfor one minute
AU02175 	        per test:
AU02175 	        (i) With the CB closed each phase to the other phases and earth.
AU02175 	"        (ii) With the CB open, across the open contacts"
AU02175 	        This test shall be carried out after maintenance.
AU02175 	   (r)  Carry out a complete functional test on each circuit breaker
AU02175 	andensure correct
AU02175 	"         operation including devices, flags, interlocks etc."
AU02175 	   (s) Trip and close the circuit breaker at least five times.
AU02175 	   (t)  Reinstall all parts and ensure all switchgear is fully
AU02175 	operational on completion of
AU02175 	         the maintenance.
AU02175 	11. (Capacitor Banks at Sub 6 (Outdoor))
AU02175 	"   (a) Carry out a thorough visual inspection, record and report any"
AU02175 	damage.
AU02175 	   (b) Visually inspect the outside and inside of the enclosure for
AU02175 	signs of corrosion on
AU02175 	         capacitor cans and frames.  Clean and remove accumulated dirt
AU02175 	and dust.
AU02175 	"   (c) Visually inspect all earthing and cabling connections, check for"
AU02175 	signs of overheating
AU02175 	        or broken strands.  Check and tighten connections as required.
AU02175 	"12. Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet, inspection"
AU02175 	results requiring
AU02175 	     further corrective actions.  Raise a new job sheet for any
AU02175 	outstanding works and
AU02175 	     notify the Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
AU02175 	"Related Job"""" field"
AU02175 	"     of the new and this job, the job number of  the alternate Job.   [_"
AU02175 	_]
AU02175 	13. At Substation fill-in the log book.  [_ _]
AU02175 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02175 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02175 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU02175 	Note:
AU02175 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02175 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02175 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02175 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02175 	        it's intended function.
AU02175 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02175 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02175 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02175 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02175 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02175 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02175 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02175 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02175 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02175 	        intended function.
AU02175 	OVERALL CONDITION RATING SCORE FOR THE HV SYSTEM
AU02175 	",,SCORE [_ _]"
AU02175 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02175 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU02175 	",,Note and comment below any items requiring immediate TSL ,,attention."

AU02178 	     and Isolators)

AU02178 	"cubicle, inspecting for"

AU02178 	repair as required.
AU02178 	"  (j)  Visually inspect all auxiliary wiring, plugs and terminations."
AU02178 	  (k)  Perform millivolt drop / micro ohm test across primary contacts.
AU02178 	  (l) Check and record winding resistance of shunt trip and the close
AU02178 	coils.  Compare
AU02178 	       with previous years findings.
AU02178 	  (m) Confirm correct operation of spring charge motors and interlock
AU02178 	devices.
AU02178 	" (n) Inspect, clean and lubricate all moving parts of the switchgear"
AU02178 	operating mechanisms
AU02178 	        as described in the Manufacturer's Maintenance Instructions.
AU02178 	"  (o) Clean the exterior of switchgear cubicles of dirt and grime,"

AU02178 	connections for all
AU02178 	        phases if the bus bar is available.
AU02178 	  (r) Perform insulation resistance tests with a 2500V insulation tester
AU02178 	for one minute
AU02178 	        per test:
AU02178 	        (i) With the CB closed each phase to the other phases and earth.
AU02178 	"        (ii) With the CB open, across the open contacts"
AU02178 	        This test shall be carried out after maintenance.
AU02178 	"   (s)  Carry out a complete functional test on each circuit breaker,"
AU02178 	including earth
AU02178 	"          switches ,and ensure correct operation including devices,"
AU02178 	"flags, interlocks etc."
AU02178 	   (t) Trip and close the circuit breaker at least five times.
AU02178 	   (u)  Reinstall all parts and ensure all switchgear is fully
AU02178 	operational on completion of
AU02178 	         the maintenance.
AU02178 	6. (Substation Protection)
AU02178 	    DO NOT ATTEMPT SERVICE ON CURRENT TRANSFORMERS WHILE ENERGISED.
AU02178 	    Extremely high voltages can be generated across the secondary
AU02178 	terminal of the current
AU02178 	    transformer when OPEN circuited.  Current transformers should be
AU02178 	short-circuited
AU02178 	   during secondary injection testing.  Jumper leads should be removed
AU02178 	when testing is
AU02178 	   complete.
AU02178 	  (a) Carry out continuity test from current transformers to relays by
AU02178 	"primary injection,"
AU02178 	"        functional test of trip, close. Alarm and control circuits by"
AU02178 	operation of the relay and
AU02178 	        physical inspection of all relays.  ENSURE APPROPRIATE ALARMS
AU02178 	ARE
AU02178 	        GENERATED BACK TO THE TRAFFIC CONTROL ROOM.
AU02178 	  (b) Knee point / saturation test current transformers recording five
AU02178 	points across the
AU02178 	        magnetisation curve as well as comparing results of each phase
AU02178 	/class and results
AU02178 	        of previous testing.
AU02178 	"  (c) Record the settings of all protections relays, verify and record"
AU02178 	the pick up and drop out
AU02178 	"        values, IDMT trip times for two points of trip curve via primary"
AU02178 	injection or the Nulec TTS.
AU02178 	"  (d) When testing is complete, carefully check that all jumpers and"
AU02178 	test leads have been
AU02178 	        removed and that any connections removed for testing purposes
AU02178 	have been reinstated.
AU02178 	7. (Oil Filled Transformers Sub 6)
AU02178 	"      The result of all tests, inspections and observations are to be"
AU02178 	  (a) Draw sufficient sample of oil from each transformer for the
AU02178 	following tests to be carried
AU02178 	"        out:  Diagnostic Gas Analysis, oil screening for moisture,"
AU02178 	"Resistivity, Interfacial tension"
AU02178 	        and acidity content.  Arrange for the above tests to be carried
AU02178 	out by a suitably qualified
AU02178 	        laboratory.
AU02178 	8.  (Insulation Resistance Testing of High Voltage Cables)
AU02178 	  (a) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on all of the insulated HVcables.
AU02178 	 The test
AU02178 	        shall be carried out using a 2500V insulation tester and shall
AU02178 	be tested:
AU02178 	        (i) Between each and every phase conductor
AU02178 	        (ii) Between each phase conductor and the earth conductor.
AU02178 	"   (b) Inspect each cable termination and seals for mechanical damage,"
AU02178 	"overheating,"
AU02178 	         tracking and or ingress of moisture.  Record and report any
AU02178 	damage.
AU02178 	"9. Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet, inspection resultsrequiring"
AU02178 	   further corrective actions.  Raise a new job sheet for any
AU02178 	outstanding works and
AU02178 	   notify the Team Leader or his representative.  Include in the
AU02178 	"Related Job"""" field"
AU02178 	"   of the new and this job, the job number of  the alternate Job.   [_"
AU02178 	_]
AU02178 	10. At each substation fill-in the log book.   [_ _]

AU02104 	"   and accumulated dirt.  If required, clean the area and the"
AU02104 	   UPS unit by vacuuming.  [_ _]

AU02104 	   Record any faults in the work done area of the job sheet.
AU02104 	   [_ _]
AU02104 	5. Ensure plugs on rear of UPS unit are connected correctly and
AU02104 	   not overheated.  [_ _]
AU02104 	6. Visually inspect rear ventilation grid for obstructions.
AU02104 	"   Remove obstructions if on exterior of grid, otherwise record"
AU02104 	"   details in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet if the"
AU02104 	   air path is blocked.  [_ _]
AU02104 	7. Inspect the cooling fan for operation.  Record details in the
AU02104 	"   ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet if fan is not"
AU02104 	   operational.   [ _ _]
AU02104 	"8. Manual transfer of load to ""Battery back pack"""
AU02104 	   Turn off wall mounted ups isolator to discharge batteries.
AU02104 	   Record battery voltage as follows.
AU02104 	",,(a) Prior to isolating"
AU02104 	",,(b),,Directly upon isolation."
AU02104 	",,(c),,After 10 minutes of isolation."
AU02104 	",,(d),,After 20 minutes of isolation."
AU02104 	",,(e) After 30 minutes of isolation."
AU02104 	9. Turn wall isolator back on and ensure UPS is returned to
AU02104 	        original operation.
AU02104 	"10.Record in the ""work done"" area of the job sheet any"
AU02104 	"             outstanding works, raise a new job sheet for the"
AU02104 	outstanding     works and advise the electrical team leader or his
AU02104 	              representative.

AU01857 	06 M Test of batt backed emerg and exit lights Mezz Lvl
AU01857 	
AU01857 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01857 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01857 	2. Notify the control room of the areas that will be effected
AU01857 	   during this test.
AU01857 	3. Refer to Australian Standard AS/NZS 2293.2 : 1995.  This
AU01857 	   standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
AU01857 	   and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
AU01857 	   lighting.
AU01857 	4. Ensure that no interruption to the normal supply has taken
AU01857 	   place for a period of at least 16 hours prior to conducting
AU01857 	   this discharge test.   [_ _]
AU01857 	5. Replace fluorescent lamps that exhibit excessive
AU01857 	"   end-blackening, even when the lamps still operate."
AU01857 	   Record on EMERGENCY LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - GRANT ST
AU01857 	"   MEZZANINE FLOOR LEVEL TMF-3012-OP-X241, only those fittings"
AU01857 	   in which the tubes have been replaced.
AU01857 	   FA - 2 x 36w tube
AU01857 	   FB -2 x 36w tube (Haz area)
AU01857 	   FC - 1 x 18w tube
AU01857 	   EM2 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01857 	   EM3 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01857 	   EM4 - 2 x 18w tube
AU01857 	   EX1 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01857 	   EX2 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01857 	   EX3 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01857 	   EX4 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01857 	   EX5 - 2 x 10W tube
AU01857 	   EXB1 - 1 x 10w tube.
AU01857 	6. Simulate a failure of the monitored power supply for
AU01857 	   90 minutes. Monitor the lights and record on EMERGENCY
AU01857 	   LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - GRANT ST MEZZANINE FLOOR LEVEL
AU01857 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0241, only those lights which does not provide"
AU01857 	   suitable area lighting for the required 90 minutes.
AU01857 	7. Restore the emergency lights and exit signs to normal
AU01857 	   condition and then check that the battery charger
AU01857 	   operation indicator functions correctly.  Record on EMERGENCY
AU01857 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0241, only those light fittings that the battery"
AU01857 	   charger operation indicator does not function correctly.
AU01857 	8. Remove any excess debris from within lighting diffusers.
AU01857 	"9. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01857 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the of the job sheet.
AU01857 	10. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01892 	   subsequent replacement.

AU01892 	   correct relationship to the normal lighting.
AU01892 	"10. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01892 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the of the job sheet.
AU01892 	11. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01894 	12 M Test of batt backed emerg and exit lights SUB 1
AU01894 	
AU01894 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01894 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01894 	2. Notify the control room of the areas that will be effected
AU01894 	   during this test.
AU01894 	3. Refer to Australian Standard AS/NZS 2293.2 : 1995.  This
AU01894 	   standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
AU01894 	   and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
AU01894 	   lighting.
AU01894 	4. Ensure that no interruption to the normal supply has taken
AU01894 	   place for a period of at least 16 hours prior to conducting
AU01894 	   this discharge test.   [_ _]
AU01894 	5. Replace fluorescent lamps that exhibit excessive
AU01894 	"   end-blackening, even when the lamps still operate."
AU01894 	"   Record on EMERGENCY LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUB 1, ERE 01,"
AU01894 	"   03, ERW 05 & ERW 06 TMF-3012-OP-X242, only those fittings in"
AU01894 	   which the tubes have been replaced.
AU01894 	   FA - 2 x 36w tube
AU01894 	   FB -2 x 36w tube (Haz area)
AU01894 	   FC - 1 x 18w tube
AU01894 	   EM2 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01894 	   EM3 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01894 	   EM4 - 2 x 18w tube
AU01894 	   EX1 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01894 	   EX2 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01894 	   EX3 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01894 	   EX4 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01894 	   EX5 - 2 x 10W tube
AU01894 	   EXB1 - 1 x 10w tube.
AU01894 	6. Simulate a failure of the monitored power supply for
AU01894 	   90 minutes. Monitor the lights and record on EMERGENCY
AU01894 	"   LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUB 1, ERE 01, 03, ERW 05 & ERW 06"
AU01894 	"   TMF-3012-OP-X242, only those lights which does not provide"
AU01894 	   suitable area lighting for the required 90 minutes.
AU01894 	7. Restore the emergency lights and exit signs to normal
AU01894 	   condition and then check that the battery charger operation
AU01894 	   indicator functions correctly.  Record on EMERGENCY LIGHTING
AU01894 	"   DISCHARGE TEST - SUB 1, ERE 01, 03, ERW 05 & ERW 06"
AU01894 	"   TMF-3012-OP-X242, only those light fittings that the battery"
AU01894 	   charger operation indicator does not function correctly.
AU01894 	8. Clean all light emitting and reflecting surfaces of the
AU01894 	   emergency lights and exit signs. Record any broken or damaged
AU01894 	   diffusers on the form EMERGENCY LIGHTING DISCHARGE
AU01894 	"   TEST - SUB 1, ERE 01, 03, ERW 05 & ERW 06  TMF-3012-OP-0242"
AU01894 	   for subsequent replacement.
AU01894 	9. Ensure the emergency lighting and exit signs operate in the
AU01894 	   correct relationship to the normal lighting.
AU01894 	"10. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01894 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the of the job sheet.
AU01894 	11. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01903 	   correct relationship to the normal lighting.
AU01903 	"10. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01903 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the of the job sheet.
AU01903 	11. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01902 	06 M Test batt backed emerg and exit lights SUB 5 & Environs
AU01902 	
AU01902 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01902 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01902 	2. Notify the control room of the areas that will be effected
AU01902 	   during this test.
AU01902 	3. Refer to Australian Standard AS/NZS 2293.2 : 1995.  This
AU01902 	   standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
AU01902 	   and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
AU01902 	   lighting.
AU01902 	4. Ensure that no interruption to the normal supply has taken
AU01902 	   place for a period of at least 16 hours prior to conducting
AU01902 	   this discharge test.   [_ _]
AU01902 	5. Replace fluorescent lamps that exhibit excessive
AU01902 	"   end-blackening, even when the lamps still operate. Record on"
AU01902 	   EMERGENCY LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUBSTATION 5 AND ENVIRONS
AU01902 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0247, only those fittings in which the tubes have"
AU01902 	   been replaced.
AU01902 	   FA - 2 x 36w tube
AU01902 	   FB -2 x 36w tube (Haz area)
AU01902 	   FC - 1 x 18w tube
AU01902 	   EM2 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01902 	   EM3 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01902 	   EM4 - 2 x 18w tube
AU01902 	   EX1 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01902 	   EX2 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01902 	   EX3 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01902 	   EX4 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01902 	   EX5 - 2 x 10W tube
AU01902 	   EXB1 - 1 x 10w tube.
AU01902 	6. Simulate a failure of the monitored power supply for
AU01902 	   90 minutes. Monitor the lights and record on EMERGENCY
AU01902 	   LIGHTING DISCHARGE TEST - SUBSTATION 5 AND ENVIRONS
AU01902 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0247, only those lights which does not provide"
AU01902 	   suitable area lighting for the required 90 minutes.
AU01902 	7. Restore the emergency lights and exit signs to normal
AU01902 	   condition and then check that the battery charger operation
AU01902 	   indicator functions correctly.  Record on EMERGENCY LIGHTING
AU01902 	"   DISCHARGE TEST - SUBSTATION 5 AND ENVIRONS TMF-3012-OP-0247,"
AU01902 	   only those light fittings that the battery charger operation
AU01902 	   indicator does not function correctly.
AU01902 	8. Remove any excess debris from within lighting diffusers.
AU01902 	"9. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01902 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the of the job sheet.
AU01902 	10. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01620 	06 M Inspection of shared pathway sump pits & pumps
AU01620 	
AU01620 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01620 	1. Perimeter access gate keys and access bollard padlock keys
AU01620 	   are  required..
AU01620 	2. Provide signs warning the public of restricted pathway
AU01620 	   access.
AU01620 	3. WARNING:  POSSIBLE SHARPS HAZARDS EXISTS.  Refer Work
AU01620 	   Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0005.
AU01620 	4. Inspection and Cleaning of  the Bath Tub.
AU01620 	   (a) Be aware that sump pits could constitute a confined space
AU01620 	   and appropriate safety measures should be taken.
AU01620 	"   (b) Clean out the bath tub and remove all silt, rubbish and"
AU01620 	   debris.
AU01620 	   (d) Check the pump outlet pipe is not blocked (clear blockage
AU01620 	   if necessary).
AU01620 	5. Inspect the Pump Pit
AU01620 	   (a) Electrically isolate the pump prior to its removal from
AU01620 	   the sump.
AU01620 	"   (b) Clean out the pump pit and grate, remove all silt,"
AU01620 	   rubbish and debris.
AU01620 	6. Inspect Sump Pump
AU01620 	"   (a) Check that the visible parts of the pump e.g. lead,"
AU01620 	"   enclosure, outlet pipe connection are in good condition."
AU01620 	   (b) Check that the impellor can move freely.
AU01620 	   (c) On completion of the check reinstate power supply to the
AU01620 	   pump.
AU01620 	7. Inspect Pump Local Control Panel
AU01620 	   (a) Carry out visual internal and external inspection of
AU01620 	"   control panel for damage, evidence of insect infestation,"
AU01620 	"   ingress of moisture, dust and grime (clean as required)."
AU01620 	   (b) Check cable connections for tightness and signs of
AU01620 	   overheating and inspect electrical contral equipment.
AU01620 	   (c) Check for correct operation of level switch and alarm
AU01620 	   light (Flashing Amber).
AU01620 	"8. Record any corrective action required, in the ""Work Done"""
AU01620 	   area of the job sheet.
AU01620 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01620 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01620 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01620 	Note:
AU01620 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01620 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01620 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01620 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01620 	        it's intended function.
AU01620 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01620 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01620 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01620 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01620 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01620 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01620 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01620 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01620 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01620 	        intended function.
AU01620 	OVERALL CONDITION RATING SCORE FOR THE SUMP PUMP
AU01620 	",,SCORE [_ _]"
AU01620 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01620 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01620 	",,Note and comment below any items requiring immediate TSL ,,attention."
AU01780 	03 M Inspect and maintain Swan St Shaft Stairwell Fan
AU01780 	
AU01780 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01780 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01780 	"2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance manual"
AU01780 	   for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01780 	3. Refer to AS 1668.1 - Appendix A for detail and methodology of
AU01780 	   stair pressurisation commissioning tests.
AU01780 	4. The fans are accessed via a ladder to the roof of Sub-station
AU01780 	2
AU01780 	"5. (a) Check the inlet grill, on the roof, for damage and debris"
AU01780 	       that would restrict air flow.  [_ _]
AU01780 	"   (b) Check the roof mounted ducts for damage, corrosion and"
AU01780 	       fixings.  [_ _]
AU01780 	"   (c) Check the wall mounted air supply grill, in the shaft,"
AU01780 	"       for damage, corrosion, damage and debris.  [_ _]"
AU01780 	6. Work plan confirming the operation of the Swan St Shaft
AU01780 	   stairwell pressurisation fan  (SF-SS2-7) (2A ESF P03).
AU01780 	"  (a) Ensure all doors are closed, e.g. Burnley Tunnel to"
AU01780 	"      stairwell, Refuge Area and head of stairs.  [_ _]"
AU01780 	  (b) Request the traffic control room operator to start the
AU01780 	"      fan, ensure the air flow is into the egress stairs.  [_ _]"
AU01780 	  (c) Note: The alarm to be raised will not call the fire
AU01780 	      brigade.  It will register on the local FIP and the CCCS
AU01780 	"      as an alarm.   Remove the cover over the smoke detector,"
AU01780 	"      direct test smoke from a smoke generator, as specified on"
AU01780 	"      the container, onto the smoke detector (on the ducting)."
AU01780 	      Check that an alarm actuates on the local fire panel.
AU01780 	     (The fan will not stop due to a time delay)  [_ _]
AU01780 	  (d) Request the traffic control room operator to start the
AU01780 	      fan.  [_ _]
AU01780 	  (e) Remove the relay mounted in the rear compartment of the
AU01780 	      fire indicator panel.  The relay is labelled Swan Street
AU01780 	      Escape Stair Relay.  Check that the fan stops after
AU01780 	      approx. two and a half minutes.   [_ _]
AU01780 	  (f) Replace the relay and request the traffic control room
AU01780 	      operator to start the fan again and confirm fan
AU01780 	      operation.   [_ _]
AU01780 	  (g) Request the traffic control room opertor to turn the fan
AU01780 	"      OFF, and advise the traffic control room operator that you"
AU01780 	      will be controlling it locally.   [_ _]
AU01780 	  (h) Switch the fan control switch AUTO OFF MANUAL to manual
AU01780 	      and then start the fan locally.  The speed of the fan can
AU01780 	      be controlled using the variable control on the cabinet
AU01780 	      door.  Confirm operation.   [_ _]
AU01780 	  (i) Switch the fan OFF and switch the fan control switch AUTO
AU01780 	      OFF MANUAL to the AUTO position and request the traffic
AU01780 	      control room operator to start the fan again.  [_ _]
AU01780 	7. Check the operation of controls and alarms.
AU01780 	"   (a) Open in turn, the Tunnel door, door to refuge 3, the"
AU01780 	       stairwell entry door at foot of stairwell and the exit
AU01780 	       door at the head of the stiarwell.  Confirm an alarm at
AU01780 	       the TCR workstation.   [_ _]
AU01780 	"   (b) Check the doors for damage, as well check the roller,"
AU01780 	"       runners, handles, stops, counter-weight ropes, tube and"
AU01780 	       counter-weights for efficient operation.   [_ _]
AU01780 	"   (c) In turn, chock open the each door, then using an"
AU01780 	"       anemometer, measure the velocity of air out of the open"
AU01780 	       door.  The reading is to be taken with the door fully
AU01780 	       open and with no obstructions.
AU01780 	       Record results in Work Done Area of the job sheet if less
AU01780 	       than 1 metre per  second and advise the maintenance
AU01780 	       superintendent for further investigation.  [_ _]
AU01780 	"   (d) Arrange the door catches to be non-functioning, then"
AU01780 	       using a spring balance measure the force required to open
AU01780 	       the doors.  Record results in the Work Done area of the
AU01780 	       job sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required.
AU01780 	       Advise the superintendent for further
AU01780 	       investigation.  [_ _]
AU01780 	"   (e) With all the doors to the egress stairs closed, check the"
AU01780 	       differential pressure on the Diff Press gauge.  Record
AU01780 	       readings of less than 50Pa  in the Work Done area of the
AU01780 	       jobsheet.  Advise the superintendent for further
AU01780 	       investigation.  Record traffic control room reading
AU01780 	       also.   [_ _]
AU01780 	"   (f) After closing the door, check the time taken for the"
AU01780 	       stair air pressure to return its static level.  Record in
AU01780 	       the Work Done area of the job sheet if the time is
AU01780 	       greater than 2 minutes.  Advise the superintendent for
AU01780 	       further investigation.  [_ _]
AU01780 	8. Check the fire door and its operation.
AU01780 	   (a) Remove all equipment installed to facilitate the above
AU01780 	       test.  Ensure the door functions and closes correctly.
AU01780 	       Confirm with the Traffic Control room that the door
AU01780 	       status indication in the control room is
AU01780 	       correct.   [_ _].
AU01780 	9. Run the fan for a further 5 minutes then request the traffic
AU01780 	   control room operator to shut the fan down prior to leaving
AU01780 	   the cross passage.
AU01780 	10. Check the condition of the flexible duct connections. [_ _]
AU01780 	11. Check the fan enclosure and mounts for security of
AU01780 	    fastenings and tension. [_ _]
AU01780 	"12. Check the fan impellor for build-up of dirt, clearances from"
AU01780 	    the housing and alignment.  [_ _]
AU01780 	"13. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01780 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
AU01780 	14. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01836 	03 M Inspect and maintain Swan St Pump Stn Exhaust Fan
AU01836 	"Access to the fan is via a ladder to the roof of Substation 2,"
AU01836 	other components are accessed via the lift and stairwell to the pump
AU01836 	room at the base of the shaft.
AU01836 	
AU01836 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01836 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01836 	"2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual"
AU01836 	   for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01836 	  WARNING:  THE PUMP SUMP IS CLASSIFIED AS A CONFINED SPACE AND
AU01836 	  A ZONE 1 CLASS 1 HAZARDOUS AREA.
AU01836 	"3. (a) At the roof mounted fan unit (EF-SS2-3), check the"
AU01836 	       exhaust grilles for debris that would restrict air
AU01836 	       flow.   [_ _]
AU01836 	"   (b) Check the fan unit panels and ducting for damage,"
AU01836 	       corrosion and fixings.   [_ _]
AU01836 	"4. (a) At the pump sumps, check the inlet grilles (2), for"
AU01836 	       debris or damage that would restrict air flow.    [_ _]
AU01836 	   (b) At the transfer air duct (from stair well area to sump
AU01836 	"       pump), check the grill for damage.  [_ _]"
AU01836 	   (c) Check the fire damper for damage and premature
AU01836 	       operation.   [_ _]
AU01836 	   (d) Check the outlet grill for debris and damage that would
AU01836 	       restrict air flow.   [_ _]
AU01836 	5. Work plan for the Swan St Pump Station Exhaust Fan  EF-SS2-3.
AU01836 	"   (a) At switchboard Sub2 A/C 2AMEB, switch the fan circuit"
AU01836 	       breaker OFF.  isolate and tag in accordance with
AU01836 	"       TMI-3012-SA- 0103, Low Voltage Work Instruction.  [_ _]"
AU01836 	   (b) Inspect the fan housing and roof penetration flashing for
AU01836 	       damage.  [_ _]
AU01836 	   (c) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
AU01836 	       blades.   [_ _]
AU01836 	"   (d) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in the"
AU01836 	       switchboard Sub2 A/C 2AMEB.  [_ _]
AU01836 	   (e) Check the fan for unusual noises and vibrations.  [_ _]
AU01836 	   (f) Check the motor bearings and lubricate if
AU01836 	       required.  [_ _]
AU01836 	   (g) Leave the fan switched ON.   [_ _]
AU01836 	"6. (a) At the roof mounted fan unit (EF-SS2-8), check the"
AU01836 	   (c) Check the vent in the fan room for debris and
AU01836 	       blockages.   [_ _]
AU01836 	7. Work plan for the Swan St Fan Room Vent Fan SF-SS2-8.
AU01836 	"   (a) At switchboard Sub2 A/C 2BMEB, switch the fan circuit"
AU01836 	   (b) Inspect the fan housing and roof perntration flashing for
AU01836 	       switchboard Sub2 A/C 2BMEB.  [_ _]
AU01836 	"8. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01836 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
AU01836 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01781 	12 M Inspect and maintain Swan St Shaft Stairwell Fan
AU01781 	
AU01781 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01781 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01781 	"2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual"
AU01781 	   for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01781 	3. Carry out the 3 monthly inspection and test the fan
AU01781 	   functionality.
AU01781 	4. Notify TCR of intention to use local control of fan for
AU01781 	   maintenance. [_ _]
AU01781 	5. Work plan for SF-SS2-7
AU01781 	"   (a) At the switchboard, switch the fan AUTO/MANUAL/OFF"
AU01781 	       selector switch to the MANUAL position and the
AU01781 	       LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE selector switch to the LOCAL position.
AU01781 	"       Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low"
AU01781 	       Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01781 	   (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01781 	       windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU01781 	       the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU01781 	       in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01781 	   (c) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01781 	       anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
AU01781 	       Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01781 	       specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01781 	"   (d) Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where"
AU01781 	       applicable.  [_ _]
AU01781 	   (e) Check the condition of any flexible duct
AU01781 	       connections. [_ _]
AU01781 	   (f) Check the fan mounting spring support fastenings and
AU01781 	       tension. [_ _]
AU01781 	"   (g) Check the impellor for build-up of dirt, clearances from"
AU01781 	       housing and alignment.  [_ _]
AU01781 	"   (h) At the switchboard, remove the safety tags in accordance"
AU01781 	"       with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then switch the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE"
AU01781 	       selector switch to the REMOTE position and the
AU01781 	       AUTO/MANUAL/OFF selector switch to the AUTO position.
AU01781 	       Request the Traffic Control room to start the fan.
AU01781 	   (i) Run the fan for 5 minutes then request the traffic
AU01781 	       control room operator to stop the fan.   [_ _]
AU01781 	"6. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01781 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]

AU01782 	12 M Inspect and maintain Swan St Pump Stn Exhaust Fan
AU01782 	Access to the fan is via a ladder to the roof of Substation 2
AU01782 	and to other components via the lift and stairwell to the pump
AU01782 	room at the base of the shaft.
AU01782

AU01782 	"2. Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual"
AU01782 	   for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01782 	 WARNING: THE PUMP SUMP IS CLASSIFIED AS A CONFINED SPACE AND A
AU01782 	 ZONE 1 CLASS 1 HAZARDOUS AREA.

AU01782 	       AS3000.   [_ _]

AU01782 	       anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
AU01782 	       Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01782 	       specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]

AU01782 	       housing and alignment.  [_ _]

AU01782 	       circuit breaker to ON.   [_ _]

AU01782 	       applicable.  [_ _]
AU01782 	   (g) Measure and record the motor current and compare with the
AU01782 	       rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the job
AU01782 	"       sheet, any results out of limits..    [_ _]"

AU01782 	       connections. [_ _]
AU01782 	   (i) Check the fan mounting spring support fastenings and
AU01782 	       tension. [_ _]

AU01674 	01 M Check of Swan St. Vent Station Axial Fans
AU01674 	
AU01674 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01674 	1. Works to carried out between 21:00 & 05:00. Three days notice of
AU01674 	pending works is to be
AU01674 	    given verbally to the TLO Maintenance Manager.
AU01674 	"2. Obtain a Permit to Work for entry to substation 3, the ventilation"
AU01674 	rooms and to interrupt
AU01674 	   operations. TLO Maintenance Manager to sign Work Permit and the works
AU01674 	are to be carried
AU01674 	   out only within times specified on the Work permit..
AU01674 	3. Inform the control room prior to commencing the work and brief
AU01674 	TCRO'son interruptions
AU01674 	   and expected alarms.  Maintain radio contact at all times.
AU01674 	"4. Reference manual:  ABB Installation, Operating & Maintenance"
AU01674 	Instructions Manual
AU01674 	    (M-STG-VE-26060).
AU01674 	5. At the PMCS in the control room.
AU01674 	   (a) Check the motor balance vibration readings on the PMCS for all
AU01674 	fans.  If any reading is in
AU01674 	"         excess of 6.5mm/s, record the result in the """"Work Done"""" area"
AU01674 	of the job sheet for further
AU01674 	         action.   [_ _]
AU01674 	"    (b) Check the trend log for the last month, looking for abnormal"
AU01674 	events.  Record any
AU01674 	"          abnormalities in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job sheet."
AU01674 	report any events and or trends
AU01674 	          to the Maintenance Superintendant that may suggest some
AU01674 	abnormal function.  [_ _]
AU01674 	"    (c) Check the running current and record in the """"Work Done"""" area"
AU01674 	if greater than FLC 403A.
AU01674 	    (d) Check the drive and non drive end bearing temperatures for the
AU01674 	operating fan motor.
AU01674 	          Record the details for those bearings with a temperature
AU01674 	"greater then 80?C in the """"Work"
AU01674 	"          Done"""" area of the job sheet  for further action.  [_ _]"
AU01674 	    (e) Check the CO levels in the tunnel and the Swan St Vent Stack on
AU01674 	the PMCS screen in
AU01674 	          control room and ensure less than 30 ppm prior to commencing
AU01674 	work.  [_ _]
AU01674 	6. Access to the Swan St. ventilation station is through double locked
AU01674 	doors at rear
AU01674 	   of  Substation 2 and then by a ladder down the shaft.
AU01674 	"   (a) The fan inlet is on Level 4,"
AU01674 	"   (b) The fan motor is accessed from level 5,"
AU01674 	   (c) The fan damper is accessed from level 6.
AU01674 	   (d) Substation 2 can be accessed from ground level at Swan St.
AU01674 	WARNING:
AU01674 	    DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECK WHENEVER MORE THAN 2 FANS ARE
AU01674 	    OPERATIONAL
AU01674 	    DO NOT ENTER THE ACCESS AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE.
AU01674 	TWO
AU01674 	    OR MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER WORK IS BEING CARRIED OUT IN
AU01674 	    THIS AREA.
AU01674 	    OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS.
AU01674 	    DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED FOR
AU01674 	WORKIN
AU01674 	    THIS AREA.  TO CROSS A SMOKE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER MUST BE USED AT
AU01674 	ALL
AU01674 	    TIMES.
AU01674 	7. In substation 2;
AU01674 	   (a) Switch the Main Isolator for SFE 01 OFF.  (NOTE:- The order of
AU01674 	fan selection is dependant
AU01674 	         on fan requirements.  A minimum of one fan must be running at
AU01674 	any time).  Open the
AU01674 	         starter cubicle & inspect the cubicle & wiring connections.
AU01674 	 Upon completion close the
AU01674 	"         door, and return the Main Isolator to the ON position.  [_ _]"
AU01674 	   (b) Switch the Main Isolators for all the other non operational axial
AU01674 	"fans, one at a time SFE 02"
AU01674 	"        and 03 to the OFF position, then inspect the starter cubicles."
AU01674 	 Once the inspections
AU01674 	"         are complete, ensure the cabinet doors are closed and the"
AU01674 	isolators are returned to the
AU01674 	         ON positions.  [_ _]
AU01674 	8.1 Fan Room Access
AU01674 	   (a)  Enter the fan room from the entry stairway after equalizing
AU01674 	differential pressure in
AU01674 	          the airlock.
AU01674 	HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN
AU01674 	CHAMBER.
AU01674 	DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1 METRE OF AN
AU01674 	OPERATING
AU01674 	"FAN INLET GUARD, AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX 35kmh."
AU01674 	8.2 Static Checks
AU01674 	   (a) Press the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton adjacent to the motor.
AU01674 	   (b) Check the condition of anti-vibration mountings and ensure that
AU01674 	the rubber bushing
AU01674 	"            is moved freely, adjust if required.  [_ _]"
AU01674 	   (c) Examine the grease that has been discharged from the motor
AU01674 	bearings for any noticeable
AU01674 	        colour changes.  [_ _]
AU01674 	"   (d) Open the local electrical junction box, inspect the electrical"
AU01674 	"wiring and connections,"
AU01674 	          inspect all glands for tightness.  [_ _]
AU01674 	"      (e) Visually inspect the motor for evidence of condensation,"
AU01674 	whitepowder or similar.
AU01674 	"           Record in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet any"
AU01674 	"evidence of condensation,"
AU01674 	           powder and the like and notify the Team Leader or his
AU01674 	representative.  [_ _]
AU01674 	      (f) Carry out an insulation/resistance test of the motor and
AU01674 	heater windings.
AU01674 	          (i) Ensure fan motor is isolated.
AU01674 	"          (ii) At a suitable location, for each fan motor"
AU01674 	               Note: The motor winding heater for axial fans has been
AU01674 	isolated and is to remain
AU01674 	               isolated.
AU01674 	               (a) Disconnect neutral from the motor winding heater
AU01674 	(where connected) and
AU01674 	                     bridge heater terminals.
AU01674 	               (b) Apply a reliable bridge to the three motor winding
AU01674 	terminals.
AU01674 	         (iii) Carry out an Insulation resistance test between the
AU01674 	motorwindings and the
AU01674 	"                winding heater bridge.  Record the result in the """"Work"
AU01674 	"Done"""" area."
AU01674 	         (iv) Bridge the motor windings and the winding heater
AU01674 	connections and carry out
AU01674 	               an Insulation resistance test between this common bridge
AU01674 	and earth.  Record
AU01674 	"               the result in the """"Work Done"""" area."
AU01674 	        (v) Remove all temporary connections.
AU01674 	"        (vi) If the heater was connected on arrival, then re-instate"
AU01674 	"theheater connections,"
AU01674 	              otherwise leave the motor winding heater terminations
AU01674 	isolated.
AU01674 	        (vii) Ensure fan motor is serviceable on completion.
AU01674 	        (viii) Where any insulation resistance reading is less than 2
AU01674 	"megohm, then Record"
AU01674 	"                 in the """"Work Done""""area of the Job Sheet and raise a"
AU01674 	new job for the outstanding
AU01674 	                 works.  Include the Job Number of the new job in the
AU01674 	"Related Job"""" field as well"
AU01674 	                 as in the alternate.  Notify the Team Leader or his
AU01674 	representative of any
AU01674 	                 outstanding works.
AU01674 	8.3  Running Checks.
AU01674 	  (a) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton and contact the TCR to startthe
AU01674 	fan.  [_ _]
AU01674 	  (b) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan starts.
AU01674 	  (c) Check the fan for any abnormal noise or vibrations.     [_ _]
AU01674 	  (d) Check the flexible connections for wear and leakage of air.  [_ _]
AU01674 	  (e) Check anti-vibration mountings for operation and structural
AU01674 	soundness [_ _]
AU01674 	  (f ) Check the operation of the local vibration monitor.   [_ _]
AU01674 	"  (g) Record any abnormalities in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job"
AU01674 	Sheet for further action.  [_ _]
AU01674 	  (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the Local EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01674 	  (i) Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01674 	8.4 Running Fan Check and Lubrication
AU01674 	    CAUTION:  ALLOW THE MOTOR TO COOL FOR ONE HOUR IF A START IS
AU01674 	REQUIRED
AU01674 	                         AFTER FOUR STARTS IN ONE HOUR.
AU01674 	"       (a) On completion of  the Static Fan Checks, return to"
AU01674 	"substation2, then remove the"
AU01674 	"         safety tags, in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then remove"
AU01674 	the fan motor isolation
AU01674 	         at  the MCC.
AU01674 	         Note:  Ensure that only one non-operational fan is isolated at
AU01674 	any one time.
AU01674 	       (b) Switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN selector switch from the OFF
AU01674 	positionto the MANUAL and
AU01674 	         the  REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL selector switch from the REMOTE position
AU01674 	to the LOCAL
AU01674 	         position.
AU01674 	"       (c) Return to the ventilation room; there start the fan, that is"
AU01674 	"being maintained,  by                           releasing th e local"
AU01674 	STOP pushbutton at the fan and then pressing START
AU01674 	pushbutton.
AU01674 	       (d) Check that the outlet damper opens immediately the fan
AU01674 	starts.
AU01674 	"       (e) Add Shell Stamina RL2 grease or equivalent, to the bearings,"
AU01674 	only while the fan is
AU01674 	        running.  Ten pumps per bearing.
AU01674 	"       (f ) Remove the old grease, that was discharged from the"
AU01674 	"bearings, using the retrieval"
AU01674 	        system.  Examine the grease for changes of colour.   [_ _]
AU01674 	       (g) Check the fan for any abnormal noises or vibrations.     [_
AU01674 	_]
AU01674 	       (h) Shutdown the fan motor using the local EMERGENCY STOP
AU01674 	       (i)  Release the EMERGENCY STOP pushbutton.
AU01674 	9. Repeat step 8 for fan SFE 02.  [_ _]
AU01674 	10. Repeat step 8 for fan SFE 03.  [_ _]
AU01674 	11. (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged.  [_ _]
AU01674 	"      (b) Collect all tools and materials, leave the fan room, again"
AU01674 	equalise the corridor and the
AU01674 	             fan room pressures.
AU01674 	12. (a) Check the lighting within the fan chamber for operation.  [_ _]
AU01674 	      (b) Repair any light found to be not operating or raise a new
AU01674 	jobsheet for the repair of
AU01674 	            the fan chamber lighting.
AU01674 	13. Record anything outside normal parameters in the 'Work Done'
AU01674 	sectionof the Job Sheet.
AU01674 	14. Notify the control room on completion of work.
AU01674 	15. Return to the control room and ensure all fans are operational.
AU01674 	EMERGENCY OPERATION
AU01674 	In the event of notification by TCR Operators that a tunnel incident hasoccurred
AU01674 	requiring the
AU01674 	use of fans for smoke extraction.
AU01674 	"Note:  Depending on the position of an event, Substation 1 may be"
AU01674 	inaccessible.
AU01674 	1. If Substation 2 is not accessible
AU01674 	"   (a). If a fan that is being checked is running,  advise the traffic"
AU01674 	control room that the fan  is
AU01674 	"         running under LOCAL control. Unless advice is received, from"
AU01674 	"the control room,  that fan"
AU01674 	         should remain under LOCAL control.
AU01674 	"   (b). Vacate the ventilation fan chamber, ensuring the sliding door tothe"
AU01674 	airlock is closed and
AU01674 	          sealed.
AU01674 	   (c). Advise the traffic control room when all personnel are in or
AU01674 	have left the air lock.
AU01674 	2. Substation 2 is accessible
AU01674 	   (a) Ensure all EMERGENCY STOP pushbuttons are disengaged
AU01674 	   (b) Return to substation 2 and switch all the fan REMOTE/OFF/LOCAL
AU01674 	selector switches to
AU01674 	          the  REMOTE position and switch all the fan  AUTO/OFF/MAN
AU01674 	selector switches to the
AU01674 	           AUTO   position.
AU01674 	   (c) Notify the traffic control room operators that they have control
AU01674 	of the fans.

AU01688 	12 M Check of  Swan St  Vent Station Damper Actuators
AU01688 	
AU01688 	These checks are carried out  in conjunction with other checks on the
AU01688 	Grant Street Ventilation
AU01688 	Station damper actuators.
AU01688 	NOTE: Work can only be carried out when ALL fans are shut down.
AU01688 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01688 	"1. Obtain a Permit to Work, for entry to the ventilation rooms, duct"
AU01688 	space and to interrupt
AU01688 	    operations.
AU01688 	"2. Reference manual: TROX Technik - Melbourne City Link Tunnel Project,"
AU01688 	Operating &
AU01688 	   Maintenance Instructions Manual.
AU01688 	   Refer to TMI-3012-SA-0103 - Low Voltage Safety Work Instruction.
AU01688 	3. Access to the Swan St. ventilation station is through double locked
AU01688 	doors (Key) at rear of
AU01688 	   Substation 2 and then by ladder down the shaft.   The fan dampers
AU01688 	aresituated on
AU01688 	   Level 6 of  the fan shaft.  The smoke duct  and tunnel ventilation
AU01688 	inlet dampers are in a
AU01688 	   space at the head of the stairway below Level 12 and up from Refuge
AU01688 	"3, in the tunnel."
AU01688 	   Access to the space is through a small door at the head of stairs.
AU01688 	Access to substation 2 is
AU01688 	   from an external entrance from Swan St.
AU01688 	"4. At the MCC in Substation No 2, isolate ALL fans by switching the"
AU01688 	AUTO/OFF/MAN selector
AU01688 	"   switches to the OFF position,  isolating and tagging in each case."
AU01688 	5. Arrange for the Traffic Control Room Operator to operate the
AU01688 	actuators and have the
AU01688 	   Maintenance personnel observing the operation of the damper.
AU01688 	  Maintain radio contact at
AU01688 	   all times.
AU01688 	6. Inform the control room when you are in position at the smoke
AU01688 	damperson Level 12 and are
AU01688 	   ready to commence the checks .
AU01688 	7. Arrange for the TCR Operator to open and close the dampers several
AU01688 	times.
AU01688 	8. Observe the damper blades for non-standard operation such as dampers
AU01688 	that - open or
AU01688 	   close sluggishly - open partially - fail to open or close tightly.
AU01688 	 [_ _]
AU01688 	9. Repeat steps 6 thru to 8 with all dampers in the Smoke duct space
AU01688 	above the tunnel.
AU01688 	    WARNINGS:  OPENING THE TUNNEL ROOF DAMPERS MAY RESULT IN A
AU01688 	STRONG UPDRAFT.
AU01688 	    MDS 01 [_ _]
AU01688 	    MDS 02 [_ _]
AU01688 	    MDS 03 [_ _]
AU01688 	    MDS 04 [_ _]
AU01688 	"10. At the MCC in Substation No 2, follwoing the tagging procedures,"
AU01688 	remove the tags and
AU01688 	      close the isolators to ALL fans and switch the AUTO/OFF/MAN
AU01688 	selector switches to the
AU01688 	      ON position.
AU01688 	11. Arrange for the control room operator to return the dampers to
AU01688 	theirnormal operational
AU01688 	      positions.
AU01688 	"12. Record in """"Work Done"""" area of Job Sheet any dampers that have"
AU01688 	suspect operation.
AU01688 	13. Notify Control room when all checks complete.
AU01688 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01688 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01688 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01688 	Note:
AU01688 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01688 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01688 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01688 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01688 	        it's intended function.
AU01688 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01688 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01688 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01688 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01688 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01688 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01688 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01688 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01688 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01688 	        intended function.
AU01688 	OVERALL CONDITION RATING SCORE FOR THE DAMPERS

AU01850 	       foreign substances within the filter enclosure.
AU01850 	"   (b) Reassemble filter, ensuring the filter cartridge is"
AU01850 	"       reinstated in the correct orientation, in relation to"
AU01850 	       flow.

AU01850 	   plates.

AU01912 	06 M Check Operation & repair tunnel essential lighting
AU01912 	
AU01912 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01912 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing this job.
AU01912 	2. Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002
AU01912 	   and Translink Operations Procedure PR-RS-OP-IR-020 Plan 27
AU01912 	   or 28.
AU01912 	3. Arrange for the control to ensure that the:
AU01912 	   - Directional Exit Signs
AU01912 	   - Walkway Lighting
AU01912 	   - Strobe Lighting
AU01912 	   - HPS above egress doors and the
AU01912 	   - Tunnel essential lighting are all switched on.
AU01912 	4. Proceed through the tunnel checking the operation of the
AU01912 	   - Directional Exit Signs (15W Fluoro Tubes)
AU01912 	   - Walkway Lighting (36W Fluoro tubes)
AU01912 	   - HPS fittings mounted above egress doors
AU01912 	     and the
AU01912 	     - Tunnel overhead essential lighting fittings (FH T5 Warm
AU01912 	     White) are all functioning.
AU01912 	   Repair any faulty fitting by replacing faulty components and
AU01912 	   confirming operation of the repaired fitting.
AU01912 	"5. Check the integrity of luminare mountings, replace and or"
AU01912 	   repair insecure mountings.
AU01912 	6. On completion of the job arrange for the control room to
AU01912 	   return the switching of the:
AU01912 	   - Tunnel overhead essential lighting to the normal condition.
AU01912 	7. Record anything outside normal parameters in the Work Done
AU01912 	   area of the Job Sheet.
AU01912 	8. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01913 	   or 28.

AU01913 	   - Walkway Lighting
AU01913 	   - Strobe Lighting
AU01913 	   - HPS above egress doors and the
AU01913 	   - Tunnel essential lighting are all switched on.
AU01913 	4. Proceed through the tunnel checking the operation of the
AU01913 	   - Directional Exit Signs (Dulux 18W Osram 4 pin TF000008)
AU01913 	   - Walkway Lighting (58 W tubular fluoro tube 5ft)
AU01913 	   - Strobe Lighting (define fitting ?)
AU01913 	   - HPS fittings mounted above egress doors (SON T 70W
AU01913 	     TF000006) and the - Tunnel overhead essential lighting
AU01913 	     fittings (FH T5 Warm White 100W TF000007) are all
AU01913 	     functioning.
AU01913 	   Repair any faulty fitting by replacing faulty components and
AU01913 	   confirming operation of the repaired fitting.

AU01913 	"   fittings, remove any accumulated debris and or dust."

AU01913 	   repair insecure mountings.

AU01913 	   area of the Job Sheet.

AU01962 	01 M L1 Inspect of fire doors within the Tunnel environs
AU01962 	
AU01962 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01962 	1. This work is to be carried out by suitably qualified
AU01962 	   personnel.
AU01962 	"2. This work is for the various equipment rooms, substations and"
AU01962 	   refuges throughout the tunnel complex.  Access to sub-station
AU01962 	   door shall be under the supervision of an electrical
AU01962 	   electronics technician.
AU01962 	3. Inform TCRO prior to commencing work.
AU01962 	   Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01962 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01962 	"   Plan 20, 22 or 23."
AU01962 	   In the work done area record:
AU01962 	   (a) Any deviations from the plan.
AU01962 	   (b) Lane closure start time.
AU01962 	   (c) Lane closure finish time.
AU01962 	   (d) Weather conditions.
AU01962 	4. Inspect the fire doors listed on:
AU01962 	   TMF-3012-OP-0280 Substation 1 and Mezzanine level fire doors
AU01962 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0281 Substation 2, Swan St Shaft and Refuge 3"
AU01962 	   fire doors
AU01962 	   TMF-3012-OP-0282 Substation 3 & Burnley Fan Chamber fire
AU01962 	   doors
AU01962 	   TMF-3012-OP-0283 Substation 4 & Yarra Crossing fire doors
AU01962 	"   TMF-3012-OP-0284 Substation 5, ERW 01 & Olympic Park Pump"
AU01962 	   Station
AU01962 	   TMF-3012-OP-0285 Burnley Tunnel Fire Doors
AU01962 	   TMF-3012-OP-0286 Domain Tunnel Fire Doors
AU01962 	   to AS 1851.7 Type 1 inspection.  The inspection shall consist
AU01962 	   of an examination of the condition of the doorset and a check
AU01962 	   that it is operating satisfactorily.
AU01962 	"   In particular, the following routine should be followed for"
AU01962 	   hinged fire doors.
AU01962 	5.1 Inspect for any remedial work that is outstanding and
AU01962 	    unfinished and record works to be completed in the comments
AU01962 	    field.
AU01962 	5.2 Remove any obstructions or non-approved devices such as
AU01962 	"    wedges, heavy objects or hooks that are used to hold the"
AU01962 	    door open.
AU01962 	"5.3 Check that the door and all it's components, hardware and"
AU01962 	    functions are correct.
AU01962 	"5.4 While the door is open, check that all screws are firm in"
AU01962 	"    the hinges, latchset faceplate, striking plate and door"
AU01962 	    closer body and bracket.
AU01962 	"5.5 Inspect the door identification data notice, required by the"
AU01962 	    regulatory authority is firmly attached.  The notice is
AU01962 	    mounted in the door edge and on the door frame.
AU01962 	"5.6 Check the closing and latching action (on the closing), and"
AU01962 	    that the door stopping action (fully open limit) is
AU01962 	    functioning (on the opening).
AU01962 	"5.7 The door having closed, check that the leaf is a reasonably"
AU01962 	    even fit in the frame.
AU01962 	For sliding or doors that are suspended on rollers.
AU01962 	6.1 Inspect for any remedial work that is outstanding and
AU01962 	6.2 Remove any obstructions or non-approved devices such as
AU01962 	"6.3 Check that the door and all it's components, hardware and"
AU01962 	"6.4 With the door in both the open and closed position, check"
AU01962 	"    that all screws are firm in the supports, handles, brackets,"
AU01962 	"    rollers, runners, guides and counterweights."
AU01962 	"6.5 Inspect the door identification data notice, required by the"
AU01962 	"6.6 Check the closing and latching action (on the closing), and"
AU01962 	    that the door stopping action is functioning.
AU01962 	"6.7 With the door closed, check that the door is a reasonably"
AU01962 	    even fit over the opening.
AU01962 	7. Record the inspection results and the sub-contractors Work
AU01962 	   Report No. for each fire door on the appropriate inspection
AU01962 	   forms:
AU01962 	8. Record any abnormal conditions in the Work Done area of the
AU01962 	   Job Sheet.  Raise a new job sheet for any corrective action
AU01962 	   that is required.   P2 - Medium Priority.

AU01590 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01590 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01590 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01590 	        it's intended function.

AU01590 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01590 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be

AU01591 	03 M Maint of Gantry Tolling Equipment
AU01591 	
AU01591 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01591 	1. Carry out the three monthly planned maintenance defined in
AU01591 	"   the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no."
AU01591 	   M-MCL-ET-1225.
AU01591 	2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
AU01591 	"3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment"
AU01591 	   and or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
AU01591 	   equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
AU01591 	"   instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 ""Working on Gantry Structures"
AU01591 	4. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical
AU01591 	   Shelter.
AU01591 	5. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
AU01591 	   Preventative Maintenance No.0301
AU01591 	"   When carrying out the cleaning of VDC sensors (in 0301),"
AU01591 	        inspect the area around the connectors for evidence of
AU01591 	          corrosion.
AU01591 	"   If corrosion is evident, then clean the area as described"
AU01591 	   below.
AU01591 	"   Where cleaning is to be also carried out, use extreme care"
AU01591 	   to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter any
AU01591 	   connectors.
AU01591 	   The Fibre Optic Connector is to be only removed on the
AU01591 	   12 Monthly  Cycle (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
AU01591 	"   Prior to removing any connector or cover socket, clean"
AU01591 	"   surface corrosion and deposits from around connectors,"
AU01591 	   socket covers and the surrounding surfaces use a tooth
AU01591 	   brush to assist if necessary.
AU01591 	   Remove the three socket covers (remove only if possible
AU01591 	   using fingers) and apply a light spray of silicon to
AU01591 	"   the three (3) socket covers, replacing and exercising"
AU01591 	   the threads.
AU01591 	   With all caps and plugs re-installed apply a light spray of
AU01591 	   silicon to the area around the plugs and caps.
AU01591 	   Check for silicon overspray on the VDC sensor window and
AU01591 	   clean if necessary.
AU01591 	"   Where connectors or socket covers cannot be easily removed,"
AU01591 	"   record details in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and"
AU01591 	     report the fact to the Team Leader or his representative.
AU01591 	   0301: Check image quality and
AU01591 	"   ,,,, alignment with CML Clean glass regardless of image."
AU01591 	"   ,,,, Lubrication of mounting bracket carried out on removal"
AU01591 	"   ,,,, only.  Lightly spray with lubricant."
AU01591 	   0302: Clean external glass of front and rear VR sensors.
AU01591 	         Inspect mounting brackets and lubricate as required.
AU01591 	         Ensure pins are cleaned and lubricated using silicon
AU01591 	         spray prior to installing.
AU01591 	   0303: Check VR Illuminator that there are less than 10%
AU01591 	"         defective IR LEDs,Advice CML if suspect below 10%"
AU01591 	"   0304: Clean front surface of TRX, inspect mtg bracket and"
AU01591 	         lubricate as required
AU01591 	"   0305: Clean outside of glass cover of VDC, Replace failed"
AU01591 	"         lamps, Lubricate arms as required."
AU01591 	         Inspect VDC arm locating pins and chains. Record any
AU01591 	         works required and report any equipment that needs
AU01591 	         repair.
AU01591 	"   0306: Road Markers: Inspect for clarity & Cleanliness.( High ,,"
AU01591 	",, contrast between marker & road). (If road markers need ,,,, to"
AU01591 	"be changed, inform the Team Leader.)"
AU01591 	   0307: Clean the glass of VSS sensor
AU01591 	"   0308: Inspect Distribution Cabinet for loose or damaged   ,,"
AU01591 	           cables. Clean cabinet for insects or moisture.
AU01591 	"6. Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any"
AU01591 	   outstanding works requiring further attention.  Create a
AU01591 	   new Job sheet for any outstanding works and notify the Team
AU01591 	   Leader or his representative of the outstanding works.
AU01591 	"   Record the New job number in the ""Work Done"" area of this"
AU01591 	"   job sheet and in the ""Related Job"" field of both jobs."
AU01591 	7. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
AU01591 	"   Shelter."""

AU01592 	   Structures.

AU01592 	   works.

AU01592 	"   Shelter."""
AU01593 	12 M Maint of TSH tolling equipment
AU01593 	
AU01593 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01593 	1. Carry out the twelve monthly planned maintenance defined in
AU01593 	"   the CML RSE Users Manual maintenance schedule, document no."
AU01593 	   M-MCL-ET-1225.
AU01593 	2. Perimeter access gate at technical shelter key required.
AU01593 	"3. To access the 400W VDC lamps on the right hand side, set up a"
AU01593 	   lane closure as per work instruction TMI-3012-OP-0002 and the
AU01593 	"   TLO procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 17, 18 and Plan 12 for the"
AU01593 	   left hand side access.
AU01593 	   Note: In locations where a rear gantry exists the 400W VDC
AU01593 	   lamps are located and accessed via the rear gantry structure.
AU01593 	   Note: Any changes made to the closure in Work Done area of
AU01593 	   the Job Sheet.
AU01593 	"4. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and"
AU01593 	   or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
AU01593 	   equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.
AU01593 	"   Adhere to safety instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 """"Working on"
AU01593 	"   Gantry Structures""""."
AU01593 	5. Notify Control Room prior to entering the Technical Shelter.
AU01593 	6. Complete CML RSE Maintenance Plkan PL-MCL-ET-100001.
AU01593 	   Preventative Maintenance No:
AU01593 	   1201: Inspect electrical Pump set
AU01593 	   1202: No procedure to check bolts are tightened.  Visually
AU01593 	"   check accessible bolt markings to ascertain if any movement,"
AU01593 	   inspect for corrosion.
AU01593 	"   1204: Inspect cabinets for cleanliness, corrosion , damage,"
AU01593 	"   evidence of possible electrical malfunction, Inspect for"
AU01593 	"   corrosion, ingress of moisture, insect infestation, damage"
AU01593 	   and security of all fasteners
AU01593 	   1205: Checking VDC sensors and connectors.
AU01593 	   The following Task is to be also carried out using extreme
AU01593 	   care to ensure any greases or sprays do not enter the Fibre
AU01593 	"   Optic connectors or cables, ensure sufficient fibre optic"
AU01593 	   cable is available to allow removal of the fibre optic
AU01593 	   connector (Do not damage fibre optic cable).
AU01593 	   NOTE: Ensure the fibre Optic Connector remains free of
AU01593 	   foreign matter.
AU01593 	"   Carefully remove the Fibre Optic Connector, clean the"
AU01593 	   connector body of any deposits. Take care to not touch the
AU01593 	"   Fibre Optic pins within the connector (if touched or dirty,"
AU01593 	   clean pins with Fibre Optic cleaner).
AU01593 	   Apply a light  coating of silicon spray to a cloth and wipe
AU01593 	"   onto the Fibre Optic connector body, replace and exercise the"
AU01593 	   Fibre Optic Connector release collar.
AU01593 	"   Where connectors cannot be easily removed, record details in"
AU01593 	"   the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet and report the fact"
AU01593 	   to the Team Leader or his representative.
AU01593 	   1206: Clean VR Sensor Unit Vent with brush or similar
AU01593 	7. Record in the area of the Job Sheet below any outstanding
AU01593 	   works requiring further attention.  Create a new Job sheet
AU01593 	   for any outstanding works and notify the Team Leader or his
AU01593 	   representative of the outstanding works.  Record the New job
AU01593 	"   number in the ""Work Done"" area of this job sheet and in the"
AU01593 	"   ""Related Job"" field of both jobs."
AU01593 	8. Notify Control Room prior to departing from the Technical
AU01593 	   Shelter.

AU01746 	        it's intended function.
AU01746 	[ 3 ] - Fair.

AU01746 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention

AU01746 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.

AU02046 	Workshop Duties
AU02046 	
AU02046 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02046 	Duties in and around OMB and other areas
AU02046 	1.  List completed Tasks in Work Done Section of Work Order.
AU02046 	"    Including Weekly vehicles, Clean, Vacuum & Gen Check"
AU02046 	2.  List Vehicle Cleaned by in Work Done section
AU02046 	"a.  Remove all refuse from the vehicle including cabin, rear"
AU02046 	    compartment and or rear tray.
AU02046 	b.  Check all the tyres (including spare tyre) for the correct
AU02046 	    pressure.
AU02046 	c.  Check all the tyres for uneven wear and tread depth (wear
AU02046 	    indicator).
AU02046 	d.  Tidy all gear and or equipment stored in the vehicle.
AU02046 	e.  Vacuum the interior of the vehicle.
AU02046 	f.  Wash and clean inside of windows of all built up residues
AU02046 	    and grime.
AU02046 	g.  Wash the exterior of vehicle.
AU02046 	"h.  Record in the ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet any tools"
AU02046 	"    and or equipment (e.g. Shovels, Brooms, Bollards, and the"
AU02046 	    like) that is damaged and or missing.
AU02046 	WORK DONE
AU02046 	1. Workshop Duties completed:
AU02046 	2.  Weekly Cleaning of Vehicles completed :
AU02046 	Vehicle Cleaned:                Cleaned By:
AU02046 	WRV 451  Sweeper............................

AU01611 	03 M Inspection of HVAC system in WL TSH's
AU01611

AU01611 	   required.
