AU01611 	   shelter
AU01611 	"3. Reference manual Haden, Process Cooling System for"
AU01611 	"   Technical Shelters Manual, Section 4, Maintenance Reference"
AU01611 	   [M-MCL-ME-20014]
AU01611 	"4. (a) Check and clean, if necessary, HVAC housing [_ _]"
AU01611 	   (b) Check and ensure condensate drain is not blocked [_ _]
AU01611 	"   (c) Inspect and clean, if necessary,  filters [_ _]"
AU01611 	"   (d) Measure the following air temperatures, record the"
AU01611 	"       result in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet."
AU01611 	        Supply air temperature
AU01611 	        Return air temperature
AU01611 	        Ambient ( Room) temperature
AU01611 	"5. Record the details of any outstanding works in the """"Work"
AU01611 	"   Done"""" area of the Job Sheet and raise a new Jobsheet for"
AU01611 	   this work.
AU01611 	6. Fill in the Technical Shelter log book
AU01611 	7. Notify the Control Room on departure from the Technical
AU01611 	   Shelter.  Record the appropriate air temperatures readings
AU01611 	   below.
AU01611 	        Supply air temperature (at a point approx 300mm from
AU01611 	        outlet vent)   [______] ?C
AU01611 	        Return air temperature (at a point within the return
AU01611 	        air passage to the system)  [______] ?C
AU01611 	        Ambient ( Room) temperature (at a centrally within the
AU01611 	        room)  [______] ?C
AU01613 	12 M Inspection of TSH HVAC system by sub contractor
AU01613 	
AU01613 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01613 	1. The 12 month service of the air conditioner shall be
AU01613 	   carried out by the sub-contractor in the presence of the
AU01613 	   electrical / electronic technician and in conjunction with
AU01613 	   the 1 and 6  monthly service.
AU01613 	2. Perimeter access gate and Technical Shelter keys are
AU01613 	   required.
AU01613 	3. Notify the control room prior to entering  technical
AU01613 	   shelter
AU01613 	"4. Refer to reference manual Haden, Process Cooling Systems"
AU01613 	"   Technical Shelter Manual, Section 3.2. Liebert Intercool,"
AU01613 	   User Manual Sector 4 [M-MCL-ME-20014]
AU01613 	"5. Check the electrical switchboard for connections, contacts,"
AU01613 	   wiring and or components that may be overheated.   [_ _]
AU01613 	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
AU01613 	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
AU01613 	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
AU01613 	   service:
AU01613 	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
AU01613 	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
AU01613 	       calibration.   [_ _]
AU01613 	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01613 	   service at the compressor.
AU01613 	   (a) Check and record the suction and discharge pressures
AU01613 	       [_ _]
AU01613 	   (b) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are
AU01613 	       normal and stable.   [_ _]
AU01613 	   (c) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
AU01613 	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
AU01613 	"   (d) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01613 	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01613 	   (e) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure
AU01613 	       and serviceable.   [_ _]
AU01613 	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01613 	   service at the evaporator.
AU01613 	    (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
AU01613 	    (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
AU01613 	    (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficency and
AU01613 	        rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01613 	"    (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01613 	        found.   [_ _]
AU01613 	"    (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation,"
AU01613 	        fit a new filter if required.   [_ _]
AU01613 	10 The sub-contractor shall carry out the following
AU01613 	   mechanical service at the condenser.
AU01613 	     (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
AU01613 	     (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficency and
AU01613 	         rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01613 	"     (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01613 	         found.   [_ _]
AU01613 	11 Fill in the HVAC Service Log book
AU01613 	12 Fill in Technical Shelter log book.
AU01613 	"13 On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01613 	"   parameters in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet."
AU01613 	14 Record the sub-contractors job sheet no.
AU01613 	15 Notify the control room on completion of the job in the
AU01613 	"   """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet."
AU01613 	16 If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
AU01613 	   in the Estimated Job Costs as an  additional cost in the
AU01613 	   transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside
AU01613 	   Services.
AU01613 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01613 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01613 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01613 	Note:
AU01613 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01613 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01613 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01613 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01613 	        it's intended function.
AU01613 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01613 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01613 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01613 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01613 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01613 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01613 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01613 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01613 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01613 	        intended function.
AU01613 	CONDITION RATING SCORES
AU01613 	",,Air Conditioning unit [_ _]"
AU01613 	",,Direct Digital Control Panel (DDC) [_ _]"
AU01613 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01613 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU02118 	03 M Inspect & Clean TSH Equipment and Bldgs
AU02118 	
AU02118 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02118 	   Ensure sufficient items are in hand to carry out the
AU02118 	"   cleaning and inspections of the Building and Electrics,"
AU02118 	"   prior to leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum"
AU02118 	"   Cleaner, Cloths, lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and"
AU02118 	"   external lighting, Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material,"
AU02118 	"   Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray, Rodent Bait Station"
AU02118 	   This job should be carried in conjunction with the Monthly
AU02118 	   job at the Technical Shelters
AU02118 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU02118 	   This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
AU02118 	"   electrical installations of Technical Shelters, as well the"
AU02118 	"   cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the relevant"
AU02118 	   areas.
AU02118 	B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU02118 	"   ( Technical Shelters TSH1-6, TSH10-14 )"
AU02118 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the relevant Technical
AU02118 	   shelters.
AU02118 	"2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,"
AU02118 	"   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any"
AU02118 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU02118 	"3. At Technical shelters, fill-in the log-book [_ _]"
AU02118 	"4. Check the interior and external lighting for operation,"
AU02118 	"   including the operational tube within EXIT signs, replace"
AU02118 	   faulty lamps or repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
AU02118 	5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU02118 	   accessible equipment and components within all switchboards
AU02118 	   and distribution panels.
AU02118 	   Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures of
AU02118 	   ambient plus 10?C should be considered abnormal and must be
AU02118 	"   noted in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet and"
AU02118 	   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
AU02118 	   the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02118 	   action [_ _]
AU02118 	"6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all"
AU02118 	"   cables, terminals, equipment and components  for evidence"
AU02118 	"   of burn marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record"
AU02118 	"   anything abnormal in the """"Work Done"""" area of the Job"
AU02118 	   Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective action.
AU02118 	   the abnormality.  [_ _]
AU02118 	"7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU02118 	"   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU02118 	"8. Inspect the surges diverters where applicable, and either"
AU02118 	   replace spent surge diverters when less than 80% or raise a
AU02118 	   new Job Sheet for works to be carried out.   [_ _]
AU02118 	"9. At Technical Shelters,  visually inspect external Lightning"
AU02118 	   Protection System connections for damage and or corrosion.
AU02118 	"   Record anything abnormal in the """"Work Done"""" area of the"
AU02118 	   Job Sheet and raise a new jobsheet for any corrective
AU02118 	   action.  Ensure the Team Leader or his representative is
AU02118 	   informed of the abnormality.  [_ _]
AU02118 	"10.Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU02118 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and"
AU02118 	"   general operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out"
AU02118 	   any required repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any
AU02118 	   outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU02118 	11.Inspect single line drawings for legibility.  Record
AU02118 	"   details of drawings requiring replacement in the """"Work"
AU02118 	"   Done"""" area and report to the Team leader or his"
AU02118 	   representative.
AU02118 	"12.Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU02118 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU02118 	13.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally
AU02118 	"   for dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any"
AU02118 	"   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU02118 	14.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of
AU02118 	   obstructions.  Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
AU02118 	"15.Inspect systems, mounted within the building or room(s),"
AU02118 	"   for faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and"
AU02118 	"   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp"
AU02118 	   replacement or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
AU02118 	   actions.   [_ _]
AU02118 	16.PLC Equipment shall be inspected for the following
AU02118 	    (a) Inspect  the PLC status and error indicators.
AU02118 	        Indicators found to indicate abnormal conditions are
AU02118 	"        to be logged in the """"Work Done"""" of the Job Sheet and"
AU02118 	        a new job sheet raised to invetigate and correct the
AU02118 	        error.  [_ _]
AU02118 	    (b) Inspect connections to the PLC including power e.g.
AU02118 	"        plug connections, screw connections for security."
AU02118 	        [_ _]
AU02118 	    (c) Ensure all modules are secure in their mounting and
AU02118 	        module security screws are not loose.  [_ _]
AU02118 	"    (d) Using a vacuum cleaner and a small brush, ensure the"
AU02118 	        enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated
AU02118 	        dust and debris.  [_ _]
AU02118 	17.Check and clean cable troughs (in floor ducts) for
AU02118 	"   accumulated debris, evidence of water accumulation."
AU02118 	18.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
AU02118 	   operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control
AU02118 	   Room Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair
AU02118 	   faulty of defective switches.  Record details of
AU02118 	   outstanding defects in the Work Done area of the Job
AU02118 	   Sheet.  [_ _]
AU02118 	19.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU02118 	   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team
AU02118 	   Leader or his representative of any corrective actions.
AU02118 	   Include in the Related Job field of the new and this
AU02118 	"   job, the job number number of the alternate Job.   [_ _]"
AU02118 	"C. Building Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU02118 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of
AU02118 	   moisture ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record
AU02118 	   any details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and
AU02118 	   inform the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02118 	2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings
AU02118 	   and or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]
AU02118 	3. Inspect the area of the generator in Tech Shelters and air
AU02118 	"   conditioning unit, for leaks of fuel, coolants or"
AU02118 	   lubricants.  Clean any spillage and if any leaks are
AU02118 	"   evident record in the """"Work Done """" area and raise a new"
AU02118 	   jobsheet for any corrective action required. Inform the
AU02118 	   Team Leader or his representative of  these required
AU02118 	   actions.  [_ _]
AU02118 	"5. Remove by vacuuming, dust and debris from tops of cabinets,"
AU02118 	"   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc.   Note: Dust will settle"
AU02118 	"   on all ledges and surfaces, e.g. Tops of cabinets, tops"
AU02118 	"   of cabinet doors,  tops of meter escutcheons etc.  [_ _]."
AU02118 	6. Clean all exterior surfaces of cabinets using approved
AU02118 	   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
AU02118 	"7. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light"
AU02118 	"   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]"
AU02118 	8. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
AU02118 	9. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
AU02118 	10.Carry out Exterior Checks of Technical Shelters.
AU02118 	      (a) Visually inspect the exterior surfaces of the
AU02118 	"          building (if applicable) for damage, erosion,"
AU02118 	          graffiti.  [_ _]
AU02118 	"      (b) Visually inspect the building (if applicable) walls,"
AU02118 	"          roof, guttering and and downpipes for damage, leaks"
AU02118 	"          and or blockages, remove any debris or materials"
AU02118 	          that could cause a blockage.  [_ _]
AU02118 	      (c) Inspect (if applicable) the general area surrounding
AU02118 	"          the building for erosion and damage to surfaces,"
AU02118 	"          fences, gates, pavements   [_ _]"
AU02118 	11.Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait.  replace
AU02118 	   bait station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
AU02118 	12.Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
AU02118 	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of
AU02118 	   the job sheet.   Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02118 	   corrective actions.  [_ _]
AU02118 	13.Remove any accumulated debris from the building surrounds.
AU02118 	   [_ _]
AU02118 	14.Prior to leaving the site ensure:
AU02118 	    (a)  All plant turned OFF has been returned to service
AU02118 	"         e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"
AU02118 	    (b)  All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU02118 	    (c)  All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]
AU02118 	    (d)  Generators in Tech Shelters to be left in a state of
AU02118 	         readiness for operation.  [_ _]
AU02118 	    (e)  UPS in Tech Shelters to be left in state of readiness
AU02118 	         for operation. [_ _]
AU02118 	15.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU02118 	"   """"Work Done"""" area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team"
AU02118 	"   Include in the """"Related Job"""" field of the new and this"
AU02118 	16.Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to departing.
AU01935 	12 M Inspection of WL TSH electrical systems
AU01935 	"   Usage of senses e.g. sight, hearing, touch, smell are"
AU01935 	   invaluable in determining the operational condition of plant.
AU01935 	
AU01935 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01935 	1. Access keys are required.
AU01935 	2. Notify the control room prior to commencing this work.
AU01935 	3. Check the enclosure for the electrical distribution
AU01935 	   switchboards are not obstructed by furnishings and or stored
AU01935 	   items.  Remove any obstruction.   [_ _]
AU01935 	"4. Check all electrical enclosures for dust, grime and"
AU01935 	"   condensation, remove accumulated debris and clean both"
AU01935 	   internally and externally as required.   [_ _]
AU01935 	"5. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU01935 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU01935 	   operation.  Record any damaged or missing components in the
AU01935 	"   """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet and raise a new job sheet"
AU01935 	   for any repairs required.  [_ _]
AU01935 	"6. Check for evidence of burn marks, condensation, unusual"
AU01935 	"   odours, overheated wiring or connections.  Repair damaged"
AU01935 	"   wiring and connections, as well record any works that require"
AU01935 	"   further attention in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet"
AU01935 	   and raise a new job sheet for any  repairs carried out or
AU01935 	   that require further maintenance.  [_ _]
AU01935 	7. Inspect all enclosures for evidence of rodent or insect
AU01935 	   infestation.  [_ _]
AU01935 	"8. Visually check cable terminations for tightness, distortion."
AU01935 	   [_ _]
AU01935 	9. Use an optical thermometer measure the temperature of
AU01935 	"   components and connections. Record in the 'Work Done"""" area"
AU01935 	   of the Job Sheet any temperature which is above ambient by 5
AU01935 	   to 10 degrees.   [_ _]
AU01935 	"10.Check relays and contactors for chattering, arcing etc."
AU01935 	11.Check the surge diverters were applicable for
AU01935 	   serviceability.   [_ _]
AU01935 	12.On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01935 	"   parameters in the """"Work Done"""" section of the job sheet."
AU01935 	13.Fill in the Log Book.
AU01935 	14.Notify the control room prior to departing the Restricted
AU01935 	   Area.

AU01602 	01 M Inspection & test running of the WL TSH generators
AU01602 	
AU01602 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01602 	1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01602 	2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
AU01602 	   shelter.
AU01602 	3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
AU01602 	   Supply to ensure it is operating in the normal
AU01602 	   standby-back-up mode.   [_ _]
AU01602 	   DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
AU01602 	   MODE.
AU01602 	4. Refer to reference manual Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
AU01602 	   960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
AU01602 	"5.   (a) Check that the generator was left in  ""AUTO"" [_ _]"
AU01602 	"     (b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuel and water.   [_ _]"
AU01602 	     (c) Check oil level.   [_ _]
AU01602 	     (d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
AU01602 	     (e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).   [_ _]
AU01602 	     (f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
AU01602 	         between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts   [_ _]
AU01602 	"     (g) Record the battery voltage in the ""Work Done"" area"
AU01602 	         of the job sheet. [_ _]
AU01602 	     (h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
AU01602 	"         Physically open the cap, as the gauge could be"
AU01602 	         misleading.  [_ _]
AU01602 	"     (j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours"
AU01602 	         with the last entry.  [_ _]
AU01602 	"6. Reference manual, Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP"
AU01602 	   Electrical Pty Ltd Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI
AU01602 	   [M-MCL-ME-20016]
AU01602 	7.  (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
AU01602 	"    (b) Turn the """" RUN / OFF / AUTO """" Switch on the generator"
AU01602 	"        DC panel to """" RUN """" let the engine run for at least 5"
AU01602 	"        minutes, then turn the """" RUN / OFF / AUTO """" Switch"
AU01602 	"        back to """" AUTO """""
AU01602 	    (c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
AU01602 	"        from """" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"""" to """"EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST"
AU01602 	"        """" run the generator for 10 minutes."
AU01602 	"    (d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,"
AU01602 	        and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
AU01602 	        [_ _]
AU01602 	"    (e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,"
AU01602 	        water temperature.   [_ _]
AU01602 	    (f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
AU01602 	"        to "" AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" the generator will continue to"
AU01602 	        run for about 8 minutes before stopping.   [_ _]
AU01602 	"    (g) Record the hours run, from the hours run meter,  in the"
AU01602 	"        ""Work Done"" area of the Job Sheet."
AU01602 	8.  (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
AU01602 	        any unusual noises.  [_ _]
AU01602 	    (b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
AU01602 	"        general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant"
AU01602 	        leakages  [_ _]
AU01602 	    (c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
AU01602 	"        job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a"
AU01602 	        corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01602 	9. Fill in the Generator Log Book and record anything outside
AU01602 	"   normal parameters in the ""Work Done"" area of the job"
AU01602 	   sheet.  Raise a new job for any works requiring further
AU01602 	   repairs.  Priority High P1.
AU01602 	10.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
AU01602 	11.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
AU01602 	"12.Record the Hours run in Mainpac under ""Plant"" use RH mouse"
AU01602 	"   click then select ""Open""      then select ""Meter"
AU01602 	"   Readings"" in edit mode add the Meter Reading for the"
AU01602 	   appropriate TSH Generator.
AU01961 	12 M Perform full load test of generator
AU01961 	
AU01961 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01961 	1. Notify the traffic control prior to commencing this work.
AU01961 	2. This job is to carried out in conjunction with the twelve
AU01961 	"   month type A service of the technical shelter generators, and"
AU01961 	   is to carried out by the sub-contractor under the supervision
AU01961 	   of an electrical/electronics technician.
AU01961 	3. Perimeter access gate & technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01961 	4.  (a) The contractor is to carry out a full load test of the
AU01961 	        generator for one hour.
AU01961 	"    (b) Monitor and record on the Cummins report, the volts,"
AU01961 	"        frequency, amperes, coolant temperature, oil temperature"
AU01961 	        and the engine blow by oil PSI every 15 minutes.
AU01961 	    (c) Supply a written report to the Electrical / electronics
AU01961 	        technician on completion of the job.
AU01961 	5. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet the
AU01961 	   sub-contractors report No.
AU01961 	6. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet the hours
AU01961 	   run reading of the generator from the hour run meter.  Record
AU01961 	   the latest hours run reading in the Mainpac Plant item under
AU01961 	   the Usage Tab.
AU01605 	12 M Minor inspection & test run of each WL TSH generator
AU01605 	
AU01605 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01605 	"1. The generator minor service """"TYPE A"""", as set out in the"
AU01605 	"   Cummins Maintenace report, shall be carried out by the"
AU01605 	   sub-contractor on the WL technical shelter generators access
AU01605 	   gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01605 	2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
AU01605 	   shelter.
AU01605 	"3. Minor Service """"TYPE A"""" Reference: Cummins Onan Operator's"
AU01605 	   Manual 960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012].
AU01605 	   The sub-contractor shall carry out the service as per items
AU01605 	"   listed on the maintenance report column """"A"""" and test as per"
AU01605 	   par 5.
AU01605 	4. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
AU01605 	   Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
AU01605 	    (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
AU01605 	"    (b) Turn the """"RUN / OFF / AUTO"""" Switch on the generator DC"
AU01605 	"        panel to """"RUN"""" let the engine run for at least 5"
AU01605 	"        minutes, then turn the """"RUN / OFF / AUTO"""" Switch"
AU01605 	"        back to """"AUTO"""""
AU01605 	    (c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
AU01605 	"        from """"AUTOMATIC CONTROL"""" to """"EMERGENCY SUPPLY &"
AU01605 	"        TEST"""" run the generator for 10 minutes."
AU01605 	"    (d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,"
AU01605 	        and that there are no unusual noises or vibrations.
AU01605 	        [_ _]
AU01605 	"    (e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,"
AU01605 	        water temperature    [_ _]
AU01605 	    (f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switch board back
AU01605 	"        to """"AUTOMATIC CONTROL"""" the generator will continune to"
AU01605 	        run for about 8 minutes before stopping.  [_ _]
AU01605 	5. Fill in the Generator Log Book
AU01605 	6. Record the
AU01605 	    (a) Sub-contractors Maintenance Report No   [____________]
AU01605 	    (b) Sub-contractors  Field Report No    [__________]
AU01605 	    (c) Generator Hours run ( from the hour run meter )
AU01605 	        [__________].  Enter the Reading of the hours run meter
AU01605 	        into the meter readings screen on the Plant usage Tab.
AU01605 	7. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
AU01605 	8. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
AU01606 	12 M Major inspection & test run of the WL TSH generators
AU01606

AU01606 	"   Cummins Maintenance report, shall be carried out on the TSH"
AU01606 	   generator  by the sub-contractor in the presence of the
AU01606 	   electrical / electronic technician.

AU01606 	3. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
AU01606 	   shelter.

AU01606 	   Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
AU01606 	    (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
AU01606 	"    (b) Turn the """"RUN / OFF / AUTO"""" Switch on the generator DC"
AU01606 	"        panel to """"RUN""""  let the engine run for at least 5"
AU01606 	"        minutes, then turn the """"RUN / OFF / AUTO"""" Switch back"
AU01606 	"        to """"AUTO""""."
AU01606 	    (c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
AU01606 	"        from """"AUTOMATIC CONTROL"""" to """"EMERGENCY SUPPLY &"
AU01606 	"        TEST"""" run the generator for 10 minutes."
AU01606 	"    (d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared,"
AU01606 	        and that there are no abnormal noises or vibrations.
AU01606 	        [_ _]

AU01606 	        water temperature.    [_ _]
AU01606 	    (f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back
AU01606 	"        to """"AUTOMATIC CONTROL"""" the generator will continue to"
AU01606 	        run for about 8 minutes before stopping.     [_ _]

AU01606 	   to be done.

AU01606 	"   Done"""" area of the job sheet."

AU01606 	[ 2 ] - Good.

AU01606 	        it's intended function.

AU01606 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01606 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01606 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01606 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01606 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01606 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01606 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01606 	        intended function.
AU01606 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01606 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01606 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01614 	03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in WL TSH's
AU01614 	
AU01614 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01614 	1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01614 	2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
AU01614 	   Shelter.
AU01614 	3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
AU01614 	   [ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
AU01614 	"4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being"
AU01614 	   charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
AU01614 	   Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
AU01614 	   [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
AU01614 	    and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
AU01614 	    a battery fault. ]
AU01614 	5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
AU01614 	"   (a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to"
AU01614 	       transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
AU01614 	   (b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
AU01614 	"   (c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,"
AU01614 	"       to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries."
AU01614 	"   (d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to"
AU01614 	       switch OFF the UPS unit.
AU01614 	   (e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
AU01614 	       UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
AU01614 	       by-passed.
AU01614 	"   WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS"
AU01614 	   SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
AU01614 	   (f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
AU01614 	       position.
AU01614 	"   (g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS"
AU01614 	       start is initiated.
AU01614 	   (h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
AU01614 	"   (i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,"
AU01614 	       to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
AU01614 	   (j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
AU01614 	"       the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is"
AU01614 	       on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
AU01614 	       noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
AU01614 	6. UPS Unit.
AU01614 	"   (a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the"
AU01614 	"       front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as"
AU01614 	       damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
AU01614 	   (b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
AU01614 	       [_ _]
AU01614 	"   (c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace"
AU01614 	       air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
AU01614 	   (d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
AU01614 	       ( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
AU01614 	   (e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
AU01614 	"   (f) Switch OFF the """"MAIN UPS"""" electrical supply.  The load"
AU01614 	"       should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the"
AU01614 	       batteries.
AU01614 	"   (g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current"
AU01614 	       (max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
AU01614 	       UPS).
AU01614 	"   (h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being"
AU01614 	       discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
AU01614 	       Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
AU01614 	       [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
AU01614 	       and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
AU01614 	       a battery fault. ]
AU01614 	   (i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
AU01614 	   (j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
AU01614 	       position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
AU01614 	       supply.
AU01614 	7. Battery Panel.
AU01614 	   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
AU01614 	"   (b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel"
AU01614 	"       Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped."
AU01614 	   (c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
AU01614 	       CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
AU01614 	"8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the """" Work"
AU01614 	"   Done """" area of the job sheet."
AU01614 	9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
AU01614 	10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

AU02134 	"   and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to"
AU02134 	"   leaving the workshop, e.g. CRC, Rags, Vacuum Cleaner, Cloths,"
AU02134 	"   lamps for fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting,"
AU02134 	"   Brooms, Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon"
AU02134 	"   Lubricant Spray, Rodent bait station,"
AU02134 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU02134 	   This job is a combined job for the inspection of the
AU02134 	   electrical installations of Technical Shelters 8 and 9 as
AU02134 	"   well the cleaning, inspections and maintenance of the"
AU02134 	   relevant areas.
AU02134 	B  ELECTRICAL INSPECTIONS and MAINTENANCE
AU02134 	   (Technical Shelters TSH 8 & 9)
AU02134 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to entering the Technical shelters.
AU02134 	"2. On entering the relevant area, be aware of the atmosphere,"
AU02134 	"   use your senses of sight, smell and hearing to monitor any"
AU02134 	   abnormal events.  [_ _]
AU02134 	"3. Check the interior lighting for operation, including the"
AU02134 	"   operational tube within EXIT signs, replace faulty lamps or"
AU02134 	   repair any faulty lighting fixture.  [_ _]
AU02134 	"4. For TSH 09 only, go to Step 8."
AU02134 	5. Check the temperature of cables and connections on all
AU02134 	   accessible equipment and components within distribution
AU02134 	   panels.  Use an Infra-red temperature sensor.  Temperatures
AU02134 	   of ambient plus 10?C should be considered abnormal and must
AU02134 	   be noted in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and
AU02134 	   ensure the Team Leader or his representative is informed of
AU02134 	   the abnormality. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02134 	   action [_ _]
AU02134 	"6. While carrying out the temperature check, Inspect all cables,"
AU02134 	"   terminals, equipment and components  for evidence of burn"
AU02134 	"   marks, unusual odours and overheating.  Record anything"
AU02134 	   abnormal in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet and raise
AU02134 	   a new jobsheet for any corrective action. Ensure the Team
AU02134 	   Leader or his representative is informed of the
AU02134 	   abnormality.  [_ _]
AU02134 	"7. While carrying out the temperature check, Check relays and"
AU02134 	"   contactors for chattering, arcing etc.  [_ _]"
AU02134 	"8. Visually inspect all enclosure doors, hinges, hardware,"
AU02134 	"   gaskets, seals and escutcheons for serviceability and general"
AU02134 	"   operation, lubricate as required.  Carry out any required"
AU02134 	   repairs or raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02134 	   actions.  [_ _]
AU02134 	"9. Check cable and glandings at enclosure entries for heating,"
AU02134 	"   looseness, and damage.  [_ _]"
AU02134 	10.Inspect all electrical switchboard enclosures internally for
AU02134 	"   dust, grime and condensation, clean enclosures of any"
AU02134 	"   accumulated dust, dirt and debris.  [_ _]"
AU02134 	11.Ensure cabinets ventilation paths are clear of obstructions.
AU02134 	   Clean or replace filters as required.  [_ _]
AU02134 	"12.Inspect systems, mounted within the Technical Shelters, for"
AU02134 	"   faulty indicators, faulty meters, damaged switches and"
AU02134 	"   buttons etc, carry out repairs or indicator lamp replacement"
AU02134 	   or raise a new job sheet for any outstanding actions.  [_ _]
AU02134 	13.Inspect the door alarm switches at all external doors for
AU02134 	   operation and security.  Check with the Traffic Control Room
AU02134 	   Operator to confirm the receipt of an alarm.  Repair faulty
AU02134 	   of defective switches.  Record details of outstanding defects
AU02134 	   in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]
AU02134 	14.Record anything abnormal from the above inspections in the
AU02134 	   Work Done area of the Job Sheet and Inform the Team Leader
AU02134 	   or his representative of any corrective actions.  Include in
AU02134 	"   the Related Job field of the new and this job, the job"
AU02134 	   number of the alternate job. [_ _]
AU02134 	"C  TSH 8 & 9 Inspections, Cleaning and Maintenance"
AU02134 	1. Check the interior walls and floors for evidence of moisture
AU02134 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02134 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform
AU02134 	   the Team Leader or his representative.  [_ _]
AU02134 	2. Check that the room(s) are not obstructed by furnishings and
AU02134 	   or stored items.  Remove any obstruction.  [_ _]

AU02134 	"   ledges, cable trays, cables, etc."

AU02134 	"   of cabinets, tops of cabinet doors,  tops of meter"
AU02134 	   escutcheons etc.  [_ _].

AU02134 	   cleaning materials .  [_ _]
AU02134 	"5. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls, cabinets, light"
AU02134 	"   fittings, cable trays and ceilings.  [_ _]"
AU02134 	6. Remove any accumulated rubbish and debris. [_ _]
AU02134 	7. Visually inspect rodent bait station for bait. replace bait
AU02134 	   station if bait is near exhausted.  [_ _]
AU02134 	8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces.  [_ _]
AU02134 	9. Be aware for any evidence of insect or rodent infestation.
AU02134 	   Record any abnormal parameter in the Work Done area of the
AU02134 	   job sheet.  Raise a new jobsheet for any outstanding
AU02134 	   corrective actions.  [_ _]

AU02134 	    (a) All Enclosures are closed and locked.  [_ _]
AU02134 	    (b) All Lighting turned OFF  [_ _]

AU02134 	        for operation. [_ _]

AU01921 	   infestation.  [_ _]

AU01921 	   Area.

AU01921 	Note:
AU01921 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01921 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01921 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01921 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01921 	        it's intended function.
AU01921 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01921 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01921 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01921 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01921 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.

AU01921 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01921 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01921 	        intended function.

AU01978

AU01978 	1. Notify the control room prior to entering each Technical
AU01978 	   Shelter.
AU01978 	2. Three Month Service Plan Reference :  Fenton Users
AU01978 	"   Manual - Uninterruptible Power Supplies""""  On-Line Series"
AU01978 	"   UME V. 5.2 4kVA, 6kVA, 8kVA, 10kVA."
AU01978 	"3. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being"
AU01978 	   charged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
AU01978 	   Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
AU01978 	   [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 13.5
AU01978 	    and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will
AU01978 	    indicate a battery fault. ]
AU01978 	"4. (a) Press the """"Control"""" button on the UPS, followed by the"
AU01978 	"   ""Down Arrow"""" button until the message  CONTROL BYPASS MODE"
AU01978 	   appears.
AU01978 	"   (b) Press the ""Control"" button and ""Enter"" button"
AU01978 	"       simultaneously, the UPS will transfer into the bypass"
AU01978 	       mode.
AU01978 	",,   **If at anytime during load transfer the UPS ,,,,,,"
AU01978 	"          malfunctions, notify TCR prior to continuing.**"
AU01978 	    c) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.  The
AU01978 	"       ""Bypass O/P"" indicator should be illuminated.   [_ _]"
AU01978 	    (d) Contact the Traffic Control Room to confirm receipt of
AU01978 	        alarm condition.   [_ _]
AU01978 	"    (e) Scroll through menu using the ""Display"" button followed"
AU01978 	"        by the ""Down Arrow"""
AU01978 	    (f) Remove side covers from the UPS.   WARNING THE UPS IS
AU01978 	        STILL ALIVE.
AU01978 	    (g) Visually inspect the interior of the UPS for accumulated
AU01978 	"        dust, connections or other components that may show"
AU01978 	        obvious distress.   [_ _]
AU01978 	    (h) Check that both the front and rear fans are operating
AU01978 	       (The front fan is thermostatically controlled).    [_ _]
AU01978 	"    (i) Press the ""Control"" button, then press the ""Down Arrow"""
AU01978 	"        until the message ""CONTROL INVERTOR MODE"" appears. [_ _]"
AU01978 	"     (j) Press the ""Control"" button and the ""Enter"" button"
AU01978 	"         simultaneously, wait approx 10 seconds  until the UPS"
AU01978 	         reverts back to its normal operation.   [_ _]
AU01978 	5. (a) Contact TCR prior to isolating.
AU01978 	",,   Switch to the OFF position the wall mounted isolator or"
AU01978 	"       CB1, on the rear  of the UPS to transfer the load to the"
AU01978 	       batteries. Check with TCR once load has been transferred
AU01978 	        to batteries that a power failure has not occurred.
AU01978 	",,   **Do not turn isolator back on for 20 seconds as this may"
AU01978 	        cause damage to the equipment.**
AU01978 	   NOTE: Ensure that the Circuit breaker (C/B2) on the rear of
AU01978 	         the UPS is not accidentally turned off at  this stage
AU01978 	         as CB2 isolates the batteries.
AU01978 	   (b) Continue with the UPS supplying the load from the
AU01978 	       batteries for at least 10 minutes.
AU01978 	"   (c) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being"
AU01978 	       discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
AU01978 	       Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
AU01978 	      [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 13.5
AU01978 	        and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will
AU01978 	        indicate a battery fault. ]
AU01978 	   (d) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.  The
AU01978 	"     ""On Battery "" indicator should be illuminated.    [_ _]"
AU01978 	"   (e) Scroll through menu using the ""Display"" button followed"
AU01978 	"       by the ""Down Arrow"".  Record the voltage and current"
AU01978 	       details on form UPS Battery Test Sheet
AU01978 	       TMF-3012-OP-0037   [_ _].
AU01978 	   (f) Switch to the ON position the wall mounted isolator or
AU01978 	       normal supply.
AU01978 	6. Battery Panel.
AU01978 	   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
AU01978 	       Batteries.
AU01978 	"   (b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on side"
AU01978 	"       panel door, is in the upright position and is not"
AU01978 	       tripped.  [_ _]

AU01978 	       CB ( nominally 217V. )    [_ _]

AU01978 	"   Done "" area of the job sheet."

AU01928 	12 M Inspection of HVAC system within TSHs
AU01928 	
AU01928 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01928 	1. The 12 month service of the SL TSH  air conditioners shall be
AU01928 	   carried out on the air conditioners by the sub-contractor in
AU01928 	   the presence of the electrical / electronic technician and in
AU01928 	   conjunction with the 1 and 6  monthly service.
AU01928 	2. Perimeter access gate and Technical Shelter keys are
AU01928 	   required.
AU01928 	3. Notify the control room prior to entering  technical shelter
AU01928 	4. Carry out Annual Service of Process Cooling Unit as per
AU01928 	"   Liebert Corp. Manual Reference Haden, Process Cooling Systems"
AU01928 	"   Technical Shelter Manual, Section 3.2. Liebert Intercool,"
AU01928 	   User Manual Sector 4 [M-MCL-ME-20014]
AU01928 	"5. Check the electrical switchboard for connections, contacts,"
AU01928 	   wiring and or components that may be overheated.   [_ _]
AU01928 	6. Compare the meter readings of the motor current with the
AU01928 	   nameplate ratings.   [_ _]
AU01928 	7. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following electrical
AU01928 	   service:
AU01928 	   (a) Check switchboard for overload settings.   [_ _]
AU01928 	   (b) Check all electrical control equipment operations and
AU01928 	       calibration.   [_ _]
AU01928 	8. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01928 	   service at the compressor.
AU01928 	   (a) Check and record the suction and discharge
AU01928 	       pressures.   [_ _]
AU01928 	   (b) Check that the suction and discharge pressures are normal
AU01928 	       and stable.   [_ _]
AU01928 	   (c) Confirm that the refrigerant charge is correct and that
AU01928 	       there are no leaks.   [_ _]
AU01928 	"   (d) Confirm that the refrigerant is dry (use sight glass),"
AU01928 	       fit a new dryer if required.   [_ _]
AU01928 	   (e) Check that the compressor mounting rubbers are secure and
AU01928 	       serviceable.   [_ _]
AU01928 	9. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01928 	   service at the evaporator.
AU01928 	    (a) Check the efficiency of the evaporator.   [_ _]
AU01928 	    (b) Check the evaporator air flow.   [_ _]
AU01928 	    (c) Check the evaporator fan operation for efficiency and
AU01928 	        rectify any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01928 	"    (d) Check the evaporator for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01928 	        found.    [_ _]
AU01928 	"    (e) Check the filter media for efficiency and operation, fit"
AU01928 	        a new filter if required.   [_ _]
AU01928 	10. The sub-contractor shall carry out the following mechanical
AU01928 	    service at the condenser.
AU01928 	     (a) Check the condenser air flow.   [_ _]
AU01928 	     (b) Check the cooling fan(s) operation for efficiency and
AU01928 	         rectifying any degraded operation.   [_ _]
AU01928 	"     (c) Check the condenser for leaks, repair any faults"
AU01928 	         found.   [_ _]
AU01928 	11. Fill in the HVAC Service Log book
AU01928 	12. Fill in Technical Shelter log book.
AU01928 	13. Record the sub-contractors job report No. in the work done
AU01928 	    area of the job sheet.
AU01928 	"14. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01928 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01928 	15. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01928 	16. If sub contractor costs are unknown use the amount entered
AU01928 	    in the Estimated Job Costs as an  additional cost in the
AU01928 	    transactions.  Use Sub-contractor Costs - Outside Services.

AU01928 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01928 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01928 	Note:
AU01928 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01928 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01928 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01928 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01928 	        it's intended function.
AU01928 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01928 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01928 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01928 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01928 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01928 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01928 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01928 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01928 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01928 	        intended function.

AU01802 	03 M Inspection & test of the Standby elect supply
AU01802 	
AU01802 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01802 	1. Technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01802 	2. Notify the control room prior to entering each technical
AU01802 	   shelter.
AU01802 	3. Carry out this job on the UPS to exercise the system and
AU01802 	   confirm UPS system operation.
AU01802 	4. Check the operational condition of the Technical Shelter 10
AU01802 	   Uninterruptable Power Supply to ensure it is operating in the
AU01802 	   normal standby-back-up mode and there are no alarms.  [_ _]
AU01802 	   DO NOT CARRY OUT THE ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TEST IF THE UPS IS IN
AU01802 	   THE BYPASS MODE.
AU01802 	5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
AU01802 	   Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
AU01802 	     (a) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
AU01802 	"         from the ""AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" position to the ""EMERGENCY"
AU01802 	"         SUPPLY + TEST "" position.  A changeover will occur and"
AU01802 	         the technical shelter load will be supplied from the
AU01802 	         emergency power supply.  Operate the system in this
AU01802 	         mode for 10 minutes.
AU01802 	     (b) Measure the voltage and load current per phase.   [_ _]
AU01802 	"     (c) Using an optical thermometer, measure the temperature"
AU01802 	         of the terminals in the emergency power supply circuit.
AU01802 	         Record in the Work Done any terminal whose temperature
AU01802 	         increases unduly during this operation.   [_ _]
AU01802 	     (d) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
AU01802 	"         back to the ""AUTOMATIC CONTROL"" position.  The"
AU01802 	         technical shelter load will revert to the main power
AU01802 	         supply after a time delay has confirmed the normal
AU01802 	         supply is healthy.   [_ _]
AU01802 	6. (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
AU01802 	       any unusual noises.  [_ _]
AU01802 	   (b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
AU01802 	"       general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant"
AU01802 	       leakages  [_ _]
AU01802 	    (c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
AU01802 	"        job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a"
AU01802 	        corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01802 	7. Record anything outside normal parameters in the  Work Done
AU01802 	   area of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet if there is
AU01802 	   work requiring further attention.  Priority P1.
AU01802 	8. Fill in the Log Book in the Technical Shelter.
AU01802 	9. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

AU01972 	  (a) Remove the old Memory backup battery and install a fresh
AU01972 	      memory backup battery.  [_ _]
AU01972 	  (b) Check the PLC status and error indicators.  Indicators
AU01972 	      found to indicate abnormal conditions are to be logged in
AU01972 	      the work done area of the job sheet and a new job sheet
AU01972 	      raised to investigate and correct the error.  [_ _]

AU01972 	"      connections, screw connections, for security.  [_ _]"

AU01972 	      security screws are not loose.  [_ _]

AU01972 	      enclosure and PLC modules are cleaned of accumulated dust
AU01972 	      and debris.  [_ _]

AU01889 	03 M Insp Thytec UPS System SL TSH's
AU01889 	
AU01889 	03 M Inspection of Thytec UPS system in SL TSH's
AU01889 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01889 	1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01889 	2. Notify the control room prior to entering the Technical
AU01889 	   Shelter.
AU01889 	3. Refer to Manual: Thytec 30KVA UPS 12 Pulse
AU01889 	   [ M-MCL-ME20000/20011 ] Manual.
AU01889 	"4. Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being"
AU01889 	   charged ) record results in the UPS Battery
AU01889 	   Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
AU01889 	   [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
AU01889 	    and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
AU01889 	    a battery fault. ]
AU01889 	5. At By-pass Switch (Wall Mounted)
AU01889 	"   (a) Press the TRANSFER button, on the UPS control panel, to"
AU01889 	       transfer the UPS  to the by-pass mode.
AU01889 	   (b) Wait until the amber By-Pass led is illuminated.
AU01889 	"   (c) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,"
AU01889 	"       to the OFF position, to isolate the batteries."
AU01889 	"   (d) Press the OFF button, on the UPS control panel,  to"
AU01889 	       switch OFF the UPS unit.
AU01889 	   (e) Switch the EXTERNAL BY-PASS switch (wall mounted above
AU01889 	       UPS) to the BY-PASS position.  The UPS unit is now
AU01889 	       by-passed.
AU01889 	"   WARNING: DO NOT USE THE INTERNAL BY-PASS SWITCH, AS THIS"
AU01889 	   SWITCH IS NOT INTERLOCKED.
AU01889 	   (f) Switch the EXTERNAL by-pass switch to the NORMAL
AU01889 	       position.
AU01889 	"   (g) Press the ON button, on the UPS control panel.  An UPS"
AU01889 	       start is initiated.
AU01889 	   (h) Wait for INV. ON green led to illuminate.
AU01889 	"   (i) Turn the battery circuit breaker, on the battery cabinet,"
AU01889 	       to the ON position to connect the batteries to the UPS.
AU01889 	   (j) After about 30 secconds the BYPASS led will go OFF and
AU01889 	"       the INVERTER led will illuminate, indicating the load is"
AU01889 	       on the inverter.  A noticeable change in the operating
AU01889 	       noise of the UPS will also indicate the change of load.
AU01889 	6. UPS Unit.
AU01889 	"   (a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the"
AU01889 	"       front of the UPS Panel, unless in extreme emergency, as"
AU01889 	       damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
AU01889 	   (b) Check the front LCD panel for any alarm conditions.
AU01889 	       [_ _]
AU01889 	"   (c) Remove the air filter, clean and re-install, ( replace"
AU01889 	       air filter if necessary )   [_ _]
AU01889 	   (d) Check for air flow above grills on top of the panel.
AU01889 	       ( with fan in operation )   [_ _]
AU01889 	   (e) Visual Inspection of capacitors for any oil leaks.  [_ _]
AU01889 	"   (f) Switch OFF the """"MAIN UPS"""" electrical supply.  The load"
AU01889 	"       should then transfer to the UPS, supplying from the"
AU01889 	       batteries.
AU01889 	"   (g) Check and monitor, on the UPS display, the load current"
AU01889 	       (max. 42A per phase 30kVA UPS or max 55A per phase 40kVA
AU01889 	       UPS).
AU01889 	"   (h) Measure the voltage across each battery, ( whilst being"
AU01889 	       discharged ) record results in the in the UPS Battery
AU01889 	       Test Sheet TMF-3012-OP-0037.  [_ _]
AU01889 	       [ Each battery should have a nominal charge between 12.0
AU01889 	       and 13.6 volts:  A voltage above 13.8 volts will indicate
AU01889 	       a battery fault. ]
AU01889 	   (i) Leave the UPS supply the load for at least ten minutes.
AU01889 	   (j) Switch the Normal electricity supply isolator to the ON
AU01889 	       position.  The load will revert to the Normal power
AU01889 	       supply.
AU01889 	7. Battery Panel.
AU01889 	   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
AU01889 	"   (b) Ensure the Circuit Breaker operating handle, on Panel"
AU01889 	"       Door, is in the upright position and is not tripped."
AU01889 	   (c) Measure and record the overall charge voltage across the
AU01889 	       CB ( nominally 270V. )    [_ _]
AU01889 	"8. Record any result outside normal parameters, in the """" Work"
AU01889 	"   Done """" area of the job sheet."
AU01889 	9.Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
AU01889 	10.Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.
AU01917 	01 M Inspection & test running of the generator
AU01917 	
AU01917 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01917 	1. Perimeter access gate & Technical Shelter keys are required.
AU01917 	2. Notify the control room prior to entering the technical
AU01917 	   shelter.
AU01917 	3. Check the operating condition of the Uninterruptible Power
AU01917 	   Supply  to ensure it is operating in the normal
AU01917 	   standby-back-up mode.  [_ _]
AU01917 	   DO NOT CARRY OUT THE GENERATOR TEST IF THE UPS IS IN BYPASS
AU01917 	   MODE.
AU01917 	4. General inspection. Reference: Cummins Onan Operator's Manual
AU01917 	   960-01707B 10-98 [M-MCL-ME-20012]
AU01917 	"   (a) Check that the generator was left in  """" AUTO """"  [_ _]"
AU01917 	"   (b) Check for any leaks of oils, fuels and water.  [_ _]"
AU01917 	   (c) Check oil level.  [_ _]
AU01917 	   (d) Check battery electrolyte is above the plates.  [_ _]
AU01917 	   (e) Check engine block heaters ( engine is warm ).  [_ _]
AU01917 	   (f) Check battery voltage on Battery Charger Meter is
AU01917 	       between 12.5 and 13.5 Volts  [_  _]
AU01917 	   (g) Record the battery voltage in the Work Done area of the
AU01917 	       job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01917 	   (h) Check coolant level & fuel level in generator tank.
AU01917 	"       Physically open the cap,as gauge could be"
AU01917 	       misleading.  [_ _]
AU01917 	"   (j) Fill in the Generator Log Book, compare engine hours"
AU01917 	       with the last entry.  [_ _]
AU01917 	5. Simulated test operation. Reference: MGP Electrical Pty Ltd
AU01917 	   Main Switchboard O&M Manual Section PI [M-MCL-ME-20016]
AU01917 	   (a) Hearing and eye protection to be worn.
AU01917 	   (b) Turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch on the generator DC
AU01917 	"       panel to RUN let the engine run for at least 5 minutes,"
AU01917 	       then turn the RUN / OFF / AUTO Switch back to AUTO
AU01917 	   (c) Turn the Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard
AU01917 	       from AUTOMATIC CONTROL to EMERGENCY SUPPLY & TEST run the
AU01917 	       generator for 10 minutes.
AU01917 	"   (d) Check while running no alarms or leaks have appeared, and"
AU01917 	       that there are no unusual noises or vibrations. [_ _]
AU01917 	"   (e) Check voltage, load per phase, frequency, oil pressure,"
AU01917 	       water temperature. [_ _]
AU01917 	   (f) Turn Mode Selector Switch on the Main Switchboard back to
AU01917 	"       AUTOMATIC CONTROL, the generator will continune to run"
AU01917 	       for about 8 minutes before stopping. [_ _]
AU01917 	6.  Record the hours run for the generator (from the hour run
AU01917 	    meter) and update the Plant Usage in Mainpac from Plant
AU01917 	    RHMouse click select Open then Meter Readings in edit mode
AU01917 	    add Usage   [_________hrs].
AU01917 	7. (a) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
AU01917 	       any unusual noises.  [_ _]
AU01917 	   (b) Check the air conditioning unit and ventilation fans for
AU01917 	"       general operation, any oil deposits from refrigerant"
AU01917 	       leakages  [_ _]
AU01917 	   (c) Report any abnormalities in the Work Done area of the
AU01917 	"       job sheet, inform the Team Leader and/or raise a"
AU01917 	       corrective job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01917 	8. Fill in the Generator Log Book  and record anything outside
AU01917 	   normal parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01917 	   Raise a new job for any works requiring further repairs.
AU01917 	   Priority High P1.
AU01917 	9. Fill in the Technical Shelter Log Book.
AU01917 	10. Notify control room on departure from the Technical Shelter.

AU01738 	26. Repeat step 4 for the controller in ERW 05.   [_ _]
AU01738 	27. Repeat step 4 for the controller in ERW 06.   [_ _]
AU01738 	28. Repeat step 4 for the controller in ERW 00.   [_ _]
AU01738 	"29. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01738 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.
AU01738 	30. Notify the traffic control room on completion of the work.
AU01738 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01738 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01738 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01738 	Note:
AU01738 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01738 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01738 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01738 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01738 	        it's intended function.
AU01738 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01738 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01738 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01738 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01738 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01738 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01738 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01738 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01738 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01738 	        intended function.

AU02067 	01 M Testing of the Maintenance telephones
AU02067 	
AU02067 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02067 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02067 	2. Carry out this job in conjunction with monthly fire panel
AU02067 	   tests.
AU02067 	"3. At each phone location in the tunnel, either dial the duty"
AU02067 	   Traffic Control Room Officer to ensure the operation of the
AU02067 	"   phone, and then arrange for the TCRO to return the call to"
AU02067 	   confirm the reverse operation. An alternative to dialling the
AU02067 	"   TCRO is to pick up the handset and not dial, the phone system"
AU02067 	   should automatically connect to the TCR.
AU02067 	4. Inspect the phone for damage.
AU02067 	5. Record the result of the test on the form Southern Link
AU02067 	"   Maintenance Telephone Test TMF-3012-OP-0360, Record in the"
AU02067 	   Work Done area of the Jobsheet any outstanding corrective
AU02067 	   works that may be required.
AU02067 	6. Record the details of any further corrective actions that are
AU02067 	   required in the comments area area of the form.
AU02067 	7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU02067 	8. Return the completed Job Sheet as well as the form Fire
AU02067 	   Telephone Trunk Test - Burnley Tunnel - TMF-3012-OP-0360 to
AU02067 	   the Electrical / Electronics team Leader or his
AU02067 	   representative.
AU02067 	9. The Electrical / Electronics Team Leader or his
AU02067 	   representative is to raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02067 	   actions required.
AU01990 	"06 M Inspect, repair and clean Egress tunnel lighting"
AU01990 	
AU01990 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01990 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this
AU01990 	   work.
AU01990 	2. Have the Traffic Control Room turn all lights on.
AU01990 	3. Check emergency egress tunnel lighting and the lighting of
AU01990 	"   the escape stairway for operation, repair any  faulty lights"
AU01990 	   found.
AU01990 	4. Check emergency egress tunnel emergency lighting and the
AU01990 	"   emergency lighting for the escape stairway for operation,"
AU01990 	   repair any faulty lights found.
AU01990 	5. Refer to Australian Standard AS/NZS 2293.2 : 1995.  This
AU01990 	   standard sets out the procedure to be adopted when testing
AU01990 	   and proving the operation of battery backed emergency
AU01990 	   lighting.
AU01990 	6. Ensure that no interruption to the normal supply has taken
AU01990 	   place for a period of at least 16 hours prior to conducting
AU01990 	   this discharge test.   [_ _]
AU01990 	7. Replace fluorescent lamps that exhibit excessive
AU01990 	"   end-blackening, even when the lamps still operate.   Record"
AU01990 	"   in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet, only those fittings"
AU01990 	   in which the tubes have been replaced.
AU01990 	   FA - 2 x 36w tube
AU01990 	   FB -2 x 36w tube (Haz area)
AU01990 	   FC - 1 x 18w tube
AU01990 	   EM2 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01990 	   EM3 - 2 x 36w tube
AU01990 	   EM4 - 2 x 18w tube
AU01990 	   EX1 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01990 	   EX2 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01990 	   EX3 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01990 	   EX4 - 2 x 10w tube
AU01990 	   EX5 - 2 x 10W tube
AU01990 	   EXB1 - 1 x 10w tube.
AU01990 	8. Simulate a failure of the monitored power supply for
AU01990 	   90 minutes.  Monitor the lights and record in the Work Done
AU01990 	   Area of the Job Sheet only those lights which does not
AU01990 	   provide suitable area lighting for the required 90 minutes.
AU01990 	9. Restore the emergency lights and exit signs to normal
AU01990 	   condition and then check that the battery charger operation
AU01990 	   indicator functions correctly.  Record in the Work Done Area
AU01990 	   of the Job Sheet only those light fittings that the battery
AU01990 	   charger operation indicator does not function correctly.
AU01990 	10. Repair the emergency light fittings to full operation.
AU01990 	11. Remove accumulated debris from light fittings and clean
AU01990 	    diffusers of accumulated dirt.
AU01990 	12. Remove all accumulated debris from the egress tunnel.
AU01990 	13. On completion have the Traffic Control Room switch all
AU01990 	    lights OFF.
AU01990 	14. Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
AU01990 	    parameters found.  Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding
AU01990 	    works.
AU01990 	15. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the work.
AU02092 	"05 Y Inspect, change batteries in Fan Chamber rotork units"""
AU02092 	
AU02092 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02092 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work
AU02092 	"2. (a) Access to the Grant St ventilation fan chamber, on the mezzanine"
AU02092 	"level,  is via the Grant St."
AU02092 	         stairwell adjacent to the vent stack.
AU02092 	"   (b) Access to the Swan Street ventilation fan chamber, within the"
AU02092 	"shaft, is via the Swan St"
AU02092 	        shaft and
AU02092 	   (c) Access to the remaining dampers are via the Burnley stack
AU02092 	ventilation station at the western
AU02092 	        end of the Burnley Tunnel.
AU02092 	   WARNINGS:
AU02092 	   DO NOT CARRY OUT THESE CHECKS  WHENEVER THERE ARE MORE THAN 2 FANS
AU02092 	   OPERATIONAL.
AU02092 	   DO NOT ENTER THE AIRLOCK TO THE VENTILATION FAN ROOM ALONE. TWO OR
AU02092 	   MORE PEOPLE MUST BE PRESENT WHENEVER ANY  WORK  IS CARRIED OUT IN
AU02092 	   THIS AREA.  OBSERVE ALL NOTICES ON THE AIRLOCK DOORS
AU02092 	   DO NOT ENTER A SMOKE DUCT UNLESS A PERMIT HAS BEEN OBTAINED FOR
AU02092 	   WORK  IN THIS AREA.  TO CROSS THE DUCT A SERVICE LADDER MUST BE USED
AU02092 	   AT ALL TIMES
AU02092 	"3. Prior to entering any of the fan chambers, arrange with the TCRO for"
AU02092 	minimal fan operation
AU02092 	   during any presence in the fan chamber.
AU02092 	"   (NOTE: At Grant St, There must be at least one fan in operation at"
AU02092 	all times).
AU02092 	4. Fan Chamber  Access
AU02092 	"      (a) Prior to entering the fan chambers,  To open the airlock doors"
AU02092 	will require considerable
AU02092 	            force.  Equalise the pressure in the air lock and the fan
AU02092 	room using the hatches in the
AU02092 	             wall before entering the fan room.   [_ _]
AU02092 	     WARNING:
AU02092 	"    HEARING AND EYE PROTECTION MUST BE WORN, WHEN YOU ARE IN THE FAN"
AU02092 	    CHAMBER.
AU02092 	    DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY OR MATERIALS WITHIN 1  METRE OF AN
AU02092 	"    OPERATING FAN INLET GUARD,  AS THE AIR IS FLOWING AT APPROX  35 kph"
AU02092 	5. At the damper Rotork unit:-
AU02092 	  (a) Remove fire blanket and access the battery and refit new battery.
AU02092 	  [_ _]
AU02092 	  (b) Visually inspect components for damage and for evidence of
AU02092 	extra-ordinary conditions.  [_ _]
AU02092 	  (c) Reassemble rotork unit.  [_ _]
AU02092 	"  (d) Have TCRO operate the damper, observe and confirm correct damper"
AU02092 	operation .  [_ _]
AU02092 	  (e) Visually observe drive mechanics for possible damage or
AU02092 	obstructions.  Repair where
AU02092 	        possible and or record details on form TUNNEL FAN CHAMBER DAMPER
AU02092 	BATTERY
AU02092 	        PROGRAM - TMF-3012-OP-0368
AU02092 	"  (f ) Refit fire blanket to Rotork unit, ensuring that the fire rating"
AU02092 	for the Rotork drive unit is
AU02092 	        reinstated.  [_ _]
AU02092 	6.  Record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet any abnormal
AU02092 	parameters relating to
AU02092 	    the controllers or components that require further investigation.
AU02092 	 Raise a new job sheet for
AU02092 	    any corrective actions required.   Priority High P1.
AU02092 	7. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of the job.
AU01739 	01 M Inspection of Substation 1 Supply Exhaust fans
AU01739 	
AU01739 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01739 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work and entering
AU01739 	   the substations.
AU01739 	"2. Refer to the reference manual, Operating and Maintenance"
AU01739 	   Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne Citylink Tunnels.
AU01739 	   M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01739 	"3. Access is via the Grant Street Stairwell, the mezzanine"
AU01739 	"   floor, then down a ladder to the Domain Tunnel walkway then,"
AU01739 	   10 metres along the walkway to Substation 1 entrance.
AU01739 	"   Prior to walking along the walkway, be aware of the traffic"
AU01739 	   conditions and take appropriate precautions.  Use ladders to
AU01739 	   climb over the smoke ducts on the mezzanine level.
AU01739 	   DO NOT GO THROUGH THE SMOKE DUCTS.
AU01739 	   The supply fan units are mounted on the mezzanine level above
AU01739 	   the Substation.
AU01739 	4. Use the special key adjacent to air handling unit door to
AU01739 	   obtain access to the fan unit.
AU01739 	   The plenum light switch is on the outside of the cabinet.
AU01739 	  WARNING.  THE ISOLATION SWITCH FOR THE FAN IS INSIDE THE
AU01739 	  CABINET.  THE DOOR IS OPENED UNDER NEGATIVE PRESSURE.  USE THE
AU01739 	  HANDLES PROVIDED TO PULL THE DOOR OPEN.  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART
AU01739 	  OF THE BODY BETWEEN THE DOOR AND THE DOOR FRAME.
AU01739 	5. Work plan for SF-SS1-1
AU01739 	  Note: The fan duty is changed weekly by the DDC. The procedure
AU01739 	  below assumes SF-SS1-1 is the duty fan.
AU01739 	"   (a) At the switchboard, switch the fan OFF using the circuit"
AU01739 	       breaker in control panel (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB) or (SUB1 A/C
AU01739 	       1B MEB).  Isolate and tag in accordance
AU01739 	"       TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage Safety Work"
AU01739 	       Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01739 	"   (b) Inspect the fan housing, ducting and roof penetration"
AU01739 	       flashing for damage.    [_ _]
AU01739 	"   (c) Check the fan panels and fixings for damage, corrosion"
AU01739 	       and fixings that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (d) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the
AU01739 	       passage of air.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (e) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
AU01739 	       blade.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (f) Check the fan belts and pulleys for serviceability and
AU01739 	       tension.  Adjust or replace as necessary.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (g) Check the fan and motor mountings for security.  [_ _]
AU01739 	   (h) Check and replace filters as required.
AU01739 	      (9 off Air-Guard CP9-4-610x610x555mm and
AU01739 	       9 off Air-Guard DP2-610x610x100mm)
AU01739 	"   (i) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in control"
AU01739 	       panel (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB)
AU01739 	          or (SUB1 A/C 1B MEB).   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (j) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (k) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
AU01739 	       vibrations.   [_ _]
AU01739 	"   (l) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"
AU01739 	SF-SS1-2
AU01739 	   (m) Switch OFF the circuit breaker for the fan SF-SS1-2 and
AU01739 	"       tagout in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage"
AU01739 	       Safety Work Instruction.
AU01739 	"   (n) Inspect the fan housing, ducting and roof penetration"
AU01739 	"   (o) Check the fan panels and fixings for damage, corrosion"
AU01739 	   (n) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the
AU01739 	   (p) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
AU01739 	   (q) Check the fan belts and pulleys for serviceability and
AU01739 	       tension.  Adjust or replace as necessary.     [_ _]
AU01739 	  NOTE:  Belts must be replaced as matched set. Replaced all
AU01739 	  belts if any belt needs replacement
AU01739 	   (r) Check the fan and motor mountings for security.  [_ _]
AU01739 	   (s) Check and replace filters as required.
AU01739 	"   (t) Switch the fan SF-SS1-2 ON, using the circuit breaker in"
AU01739 	       control panel (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB) or (SUB1 A/C 1B
AU01739 	       MEB).   [_ _]
AU01739 	"   (u) While fan SF-SS1-1 is running, operate the TRIP switch"
AU01739 	"       mechanism, on the front of the circuit breaker, fan"
AU01739 	       SF-SS1-1 will go off and SF-SS1-2 will start.
AU01739 	   (v) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (w) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
AU01739 	"   (x) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"
AU01739 	"   (y) Switch circuit breaker for fan SF-SS1-1 ON, fan SF-SS1-2"
AU01739 	       will go OFF and SF-SS1-1 will start.
AU01739 	6. Repeat step 5 for SF-SS1-3 and -4.
AU01739 	7. Work plan for EF-SS1-1
AU01739 	"   (a) Switch the fan EF-SS1-1 OFF, using the circuit breaker in"
AU01739 	       control panel (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB) or (SUB1 A/C 1B MEB).
AU01739 	"       Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low"
AU01739 	       Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (b) Inspect the fan housing and wall penetration flashing for
AU01739 	       damage.    [_ _]
AU01739 	   (d) Check the fan cowls for debris blocking the passage of
AU01739 	       air.   [_ _]
AU01739 	        blade.   [_ _]
AU01739 	"   (f) Switch the fan EF-SS1-1 ON, using the circuit breaker in"
AU01739 	   (g) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
AU01739 	   (h) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
AU01739 	"   (i) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"
