AU01739 	   (a) Check the inlet grill fire dampers at each wall
AU01739 	       penetrations (2) (UPS Rm 1A and 1B) and at each exhaust
AU01739 	       fans EF-SS1-1 & -2 (2 off ) for premature
AU01739 	"       operation,.  [_ _]"
AU01739 	   (b) Check the fire dampers in the inlet grilles (into
AU01739 	       substations 1a and 1b) for premature operation.   [_ _]
AU01739 	    (c) Check the inlet grilles for debris that will block the
AU01739 	        inflow of air.   [_ _]
AU01739 	10 Sweep and clean the Substation room(s) and associated
AU01739 	   switchrooms :
AU01739 	   (i) Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01739 	       walls.   [___]
AU01739 	  (ii) Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
AU01739 	       will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01739 	 (iii) Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01739 	       enclosure.  [___]
AU01739 	  (iv) Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01739 	      dust.   [___]
AU01739 	  Note and record any evidence of water or drainage problems.
AU01739 	  Clear any blockages.
AU01739 	   (v) Remove from site all accumulated debris and
AU01739 	       rubbish.   [_ _]
AU01739 	11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01739 	    parameters
AU01739 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01739 	         leaks
AU01739 	         lighting faults
AU01739 	         door damage
AU01739 	    evidence of structural damage to the Substation rooms and
AU01739 	"    equipment etc, in the Work Done  section of the job sheet"
AU01739 	    and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
AU01739 	    raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01739 	"12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01739 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
AU01739 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01830 	12 M Inspection of Substation 1 Supply Exhaust Fans
AU01830 	
AU01830 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01830 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01830 	"2. Refer to the reference manual, Operating and Maintenance"
AU01830 	   Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne Citylink Tunnels.
AU01830 	   M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01830 	"3. Access is via the Grant Street Stairwell, the mezzanine"
AU01830 	"   floor, then down a ladder to the Domain Tunnel walkway then,"
AU01830 	   10 metres along the walkway to Substation 1 entrance.  Prior
AU01830 	"   to walking along the walkway, be aware of the traffic"
AU01830 	   conditions and take appropriate precautions.
AU01830 	   Use ladders to climb over the smoke ducts on the mezzanine
AU01830 	   level.  DO NOT GO THROUGH THE SMOKE DUCTS.
AU01830 	   The supply air fan units are mounted on the mezzanine level
AU01830 	   above the Substation.
AU01830 	4. Use the special key adjacent to air handling unit door to
AU01830 	   obtain access to the fan unit.
AU01830 	   The plenum light switch is on the outside of the cabinet.
AU01830 	  WARNING.  THE ISOLATION SWITCH FOR THE FAN IS INSIDE THE
AU01830 	  CABINET.  THE DOOR IS OPENED UNDER NEGATIVE PRESSURE.  USE THE
AU01830 	  HANDLES PROVIDED TO PULL THE DOOR OPEN.   DO NOT PLACE ANY
AU01830 	  PART OF THE BODY BETWEEN THE DOOR AND THE DOOR FRAME.
AU01830 	5. Ensure the 3 monthly fan inspection is complete.
AU01830 	6. At the control cabinet (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB OR SUB1 A/C 1B MEB)
AU01830 	"   switch the fan circuit breakers to OFF (SF-SS1-1,-2, -3 &"
AU01830 	"   -4).  Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low"
AU01830 	   Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01830 	7. Work plan for SF-SS1-1
AU01830 	   (a) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01830 	       windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU01830 	       the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU01830 	       in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01830 	    (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01830 	       anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
AU01830 	       Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01830 	       specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01830 	8. Repeat step 7 for SF-SS1-2  [_ _]
AU01830 	9. Repeat step 7 for SF-SS1-3  [_ _]
AU01830 	10. Repeat step 7 for SF-SS1-4  [_ _]
AU01830 	11. At the fan control cabinet (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB OR SUB1 A/C 1B
AU01830 	    MEB) remove the safety tags in accordance with
AU01830 	"    TMI-3012-SA-0103, then switch the fan circuit breakers to ON"
AU01830 	"   (SF-SS1-1,-2, -3 & -4). The duty fan will start."
AU01830 	"12. Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where"
AU01830 	    applicable.  [_ _]
AU01830 	13. (a) Measure and record the motor current and compare with
AU01830 	        the rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU01830 	"        job sheet, any results out of limits.    [_ _]"
AU01830 	"    (b) To check the standby fan, manually trip the test trip"
AU01830 	        mounted on the front of the duty fan circuit breaker.
AU01830 	        The standby fan will start.
AU01830 	"14. Reset the circuit breaker for the duty fan, the duty fan"
AU01830 	    will resume operation.
AU01830 	15. At the control cabinet (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB OR SUB1 A/C 1B MEB)
AU01830 	    switch the fan circuit breakers to OFF (EF-SS1-1 & 2).
AU01830 	"    Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage"
AU01830 	    Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01830 	16. Work plan for EF-SS1-1
AU01830 	    (a) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01830 	        windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU01830 	        the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU01830 	        in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01830 	        anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the
AU01830 	        Work Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01830 	        specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01830 	17. Repeat step 16 for EF-SS1-2  [_ _]
AU01830 	18. At the fan control cabinet (SUB1 A/C 1A MEB OR SUB1 A/C 1B
AU01830 	   (EF-SS1-1 & 2). The duty fan will start.
AU01830 	"19. Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where"
AU01830 	20. (a) Measure and record the motor current and compare with
AU01830 	"21. Reset the circuit breaker for the duty fan, the duty fan"
AU01830 	"22. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01830 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.
AU01830 	23. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01709 	       Instruction.   [_ _]

AU01709 	       flashing for damage.    [_ _]
AU01709 	"   (c) Check the fan panels and fixtures for damage, corrosion"
AU01709 	       and fixtures that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]
AU01709 	   (d) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the
AU01709 	       passage of air.   [_ _]
AU01709 	   (e) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
AU01709 	       blade.   [_ _]
AU01709 	   (f) Check the fan and motor mountings are secure.  [_ _]
AU01709 	"   (g) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in control"
AU01709 	       panel (SUB2 A/C 2A MEB)
AU01709 	          or (SUB2 A/C 2B MEB).   [_ _]
AU01709 	   (h) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
AU01709 	   (i) Check  fan and motor for unusual noises and
AU01709 	       vibrations.   [_ _]
AU01709 	"   (j) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"
AU01709 	SF-SS2-2
AU01709 	   (k) Switch OFF the circuit breaker for the fan SF-SS2-2 and
AU01709 	"       tagout in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage"
AU01709 	       Safety Work Instruction.

AU01709 	       control panel (SUB2 A/C 2A MEB)
AU01709 	       or (SUB2 A/C 2B MEB).   [_ _]

AU01709 	"       mechanism, on the front of the circuit breaker, fan"
AU01709 	       SF-SS2-1 will go off and SF-SS2-3 will start.

AU01709 	"   (u) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"

AU01709 	      SF-SS2-2 will go off and SF-SS2-3 will start.

AU01709 	"  (ag) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"

AU01709 	"       ON, fan SF-SS2-3 will go OFF and SF-SS2-1 will start."

AU01709 	"   (i) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"

AU01709 	"       operation,.  [_ _]"

AU01709 	   switchrooms:
AU01709 	   (i) Sweep the floor and remove accumulated cob webs from the
AU01709 	       walls.   [___]
AU01709 	  (ii) Vacuum the control panel enclosures and any surfaces that
AU01709 	       will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01709 	 (iii) Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01709 	       enclosure.  [___]
AU01709 	  (iv) Clean the front panels of all accumulated dirt and
AU01709 	       dust.   [___]

AU01709 	  Clear any blockages.

AU01709 	    parameters
AU01709 	    e.g. Damaged equipment enclosures
AU01709 	         leaks
AU01709 	         lighting faults
AU01709 	         door damage
AU01709 	    evidence of structural damage to the Substation rooms and
AU01709 	"    equipment etc,  in the Work Done section of the job sheet"
AU01709 	    and report to the Team Leader or his representative and
AU01709 	    raise a new job for any repairs.
AU01709 	"16. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01709 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
AU01709 	17. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01831 	12 M Sub 02 Air Handling System Inspection
AU01831 	
AU01831 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01831 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01831 	"2. Refer to the reference manual, Operating and Maintenance"
AU01831 	   Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne Citylink Tunnels.
AU01831 	   M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01831 	3. Inspect fan housing and roof penetration flashing for
AU01831 	   potential leakage areas that would enable water ingress to
AU01831 	   substation below.
AU01831 	4. Ensure the 3 monthly fan inspection is complete.
AU01831 	5. At the control cabinet (SUB2 A/C 2A MEB or SUB2 A/C 2B MEB)
AU01831 	"   switch the fan circuit breakers to OFF (SF-SS2-1,-2, -3, -4,"
AU01831 	"   -5 & 6).  Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103,"
AU01831 	   Low Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01831 	"6. Work plan for SF-SS2-1, -2 & 3"
AU01831 	   (a) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01831 	       windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU01831 	       the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU01831 	       in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01831 	   (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01831 	       anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
AU01831 	       Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01831 	       specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01831 	7. Repeat step 6 for SF-SS2-2  [_ _]
AU01831 	8. Repeat step 6 for SF-SS2-3  [_ _]
AU01831 	9. Repeat step 6 for SF-SS2-4  [_ _]
AU01831 	10. Repeat step 6 for SF-SS2-5  [_ _]
AU01831 	11. Repeat step 7 for SF-SS2-6  [_ _]
AU01831 	12. At the fan control cabinet (SUB2 A/C 2A MEB or SUB2 A/C 2B
AU01831 	    MEB) remove the safety tags in accordance with
AU01831 	"    TMI-3012-SA-0103, then switch the fan circuit breakers to ON"
AU01831 	"   (SF-SS2-1,-2, -3, -4, -5 & 6). The duty fans will start."
AU01831 	"13. Check the fan and motor bearings (for each fan), lubricate"
AU01831 	    where applicable.  [_ _]
AU01831 	14. (a) Measure and record the motor current and compare with
AU01831 	        the rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU01831 	"        job sheet, any results out of limits.    [_ _]"
AU01831 	"    (b) To check the standby fans, manually trip the test trip"
AU01831 	        mounted on the front of the operating fan circuit
AU01831 	        breaker.  The standby fan will start.
AU01831 	"15. Reset all the circuit breakers, the duty fan will resume"
AU01831 	    operation.
AU01831 	16. At the control cabinet (SUB2 A/C 2A MEB or SUB2 A/C 2B MEB)
AU01831 	    switch the fan circuit breakers to OFF (EF-SS2-1 & 2).
AU01831 	"    Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low Voltage"
AU01831 	    Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01831 	17. Work plan for EF-SS2-1
AU01831 	    (a) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01831 	        windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU01831 	        the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU01831 	        in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01831 	    (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01831 	        anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the
AU01831 	        Work Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01831 	        specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01831 	18. Repeat step 17 for EF-SS2-2  [_ _]
AU01831 	19. At the fan control cabinet (SUB2 A/C 2A MEB or SUB2 A/C 2B
AU01831 	"    TMI-3012-SA-0103, then switch the fan circuit breakers to"
AU01831 	    ON(EF-SS2-1 & 2). The duty fan will start.
AU01831 	"20. Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where"
AU01831 	    applicable.  [_ _]
AU01831 	21. (a) Measure and record the motor current and compare with
AU01831 	"    (b) To check the standby fan, manually trip the test trip"
AU01831 	        mounted on the front of the duty fan circuit breaker.
AU01831 	        The standby fan will start.
AU01831 	"22. Reset the circuit breaker for the duty fan, the duty fan"
AU01831 	    will resume operation.
AU01831 	"23. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01831 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.
AU01831 	24. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01831 	Record readings Below
AU01831 	----------------------------------------------------------------
AU01831 	  PLANT   |  INSULATION/RESISTANCE |     CURRENT               |
AU01831 	          |           m Ohm        |                    Amp    |
AU01831 	          |  MOTOR   |  HEATER     |  MOTOR   |  HEATER        |
AU01831 	 SF-SS2-1 |          |             |          |                |
AU01831 	 SF-SS2-2 |          |             |          |                |
AU01831 	 SF-SS2-3 |          |             |          |                |
AU01831 	 SF-SS2-4 |          |             |          |                |
AU01831 	 SF-SS2-5 |          |             |          |                |
AU01831 	 SF-SS2-6 |          |             |          |                |
AU01831 	 EF-SS2-1 |          |             |          |                |
AU01831 	 EF-SS2-2 |          |             |          |                |

AU01828 	   reach the roof.

AU01828 	"   -5 & 6).  Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103,"

AU01828 	       in AS3000.   [_ _]

AU01828 	"    switch the fan circuit breakers to ON (SF-SS3-1,-2, -3, -4,"
AU01828 	    -5 & 6).

AU01828 	    with the rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU01828 	"    job sheet, any results out of limits..    [_ _]"

AU01828 	"    switch the fan circuit breakers to OFF (EF-SS3-1,-2, -3, -4"
AU01828 	"    & 5).  Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low"
AU01828 	    Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]

AU01828 	   (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01828 	       anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the Work
AU01828 	       Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01828 	       specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]

AU01828 	15. Repeat step 13 for EF-SS3-3 .   [_ _]

AU01828 	17. Repeat step 13 for EF-SS3-5 .   [_ _]

AU01828 	"    switch the fan circuit breakers to ON (EF-SS3-1,-2, -3, -4"
AU01828 	    & -5).

AU01828 	    restrict air flow.    [_ _]

AU01828 	    all the fans.   [_ _[

AU01829 	  Note: The fan duty is changed weekly by the DDC. The procedure
AU01829 	  below assumes SF-SS4-1 is the duty fan.

AU01829 	       breaker in control panel (SUB4 A/C 4A MEB) or (SUB4 A/C
AU01829 	       4B MEB).  Isolate and tag in accordance
AU01829 	"       TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage Safety Work"
AU01829 	       Instruction.   [_ _]

AU01829 	       damage.    [_ _]

AU01829 	       and any fixtures that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]

AU01829 	       passage of air.   [_ _]

AU01829 	       blade.   [_ _]

AU01829 	   (h) Check fan and motor for unusual noises and
AU01829 	       vibrations.   [_ _]

AU01829 	"       mechanism, on the front of the circuit breaker, fan"
AU01829 	       SF-SS4-1 will go off and SF-SS4-2 will start.

AU01829 	"   (t) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"

AU01829 	       will go OFF and SF-SS4-1 will start.

AU01829 	    enclosure.  [___]

AU01829 	    dust.   [___]

AU01829 	    parameters

AU01829 	    raise a new job for any repairs.

AU01803 	03 M Inspection of substation 5 air handling unit
AU01803 	
AU01803 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01803 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01803 	"2. Refer to reference manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual"
AU01803 	   for Mechanical Services at Melbourne Citylink Tunnels
AU01803 	   M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01803 	3. Work plan for SF-SS5-1.
AU01803 	" (a) Access the fan from from ERW 00, above Olympic Park portal"
AU01803 	 (b) Switch the fan OFF using the circuit breaker in cabinet
AU01803 	    (SUB 5 A/C 5B MEB).   [_ _]
AU01803 	" (c) Open the fan enclosure door, ensuring it is safely secured"
AU01803 	     in the open position.
AU01803 	 WARNING:  IF THE FAN IS RUNNING THE DOOR IS OPENED UNDER
AU01803 	 NEGATIVE PRESSURE.  USE THE HANDLES PROVIDED TO PULL THE DOOR
AU01803 	 OPEN.  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY BETWEEN THE DOOR AND
AU01803 	 THE DOOR FRAME.
AU01803 	  (d) WHEN REPLACING THE FILTERS ROAD TRANSPORTS PASS CLOSE BY
AU01803 	      OUTSIDE.
AU01803 	    It is advised to use full face protection.
AU01803 	    Replace the filters.   [_ _]
AU01803 	  (e) Check that the inlet mesh is clear of debris and not
AU01803 	      damaged.   [_ _]
AU01803 	"  (f) Using a torch and a mirror, through the inlet cone,"
AU01803 	      inspect the fan and the attenuator for damage or
AU01803 	      blockages.   [_ _]
AU01803 	  (g) Switch the fan ON using the circuit breaker in cabinet
AU01803 	      (SUB 5 A/C 5B MEB).   [_ _]
AU01803 	  (h) Check the fan for unusual noises or any vibration while it
AU01803 	      is running.   [_ _]
AU01803 	  (i) Check the fan motor bearings and lubricate if
AU01803 	      required.   [_ _]
AU01803 	  (j) Switch the fan OFF using the circuit breaker in cabinet
AU01803 	     (SUB 5 A/C 5B MEB).   [_ _]
AU01803 	  (k) Close and latch the fan chamber door.
AU01803 	  (l) Switch the fan ON using the circuit breaker in cabinet
AU01803 	 WARNING: THE DOOR WILL CLOSE WITH GREAT FORCE UNDER HIGH
AU01803 	 SUCTION PRESSURE IF THE FAN IS OPERATING.  TAKE CARE NOT TO
AU01803 	 HAVE ANY PORTION OF THE BODY BETWEEN THE DOOR AND THE DOOR
AU01803 	 FRAME WHEN CLOSING THE DOOR.
AU01803 	4. Check that the outlet grills in lower substation 5A and 5B
AU01803 	   are clear
AU01803 	5. Work plan for EF-SS5-1.
AU01803 	   (a) Switch the fan OFF using the circuit breaker in cabinet
AU01803 	       SUB 5 A/C 5A MEB.   [_ _]
AU01803 	   (b) Check that the exhaust grilles in each UPS room are clear
AU01803 	       of debris and not damaged.   [_ _]
AU01803 	   (c) Check the air supply grilles in each room are clear of
AU01803 	       debris and are not damaged.   [_ _]
AU01803 	   (d) Switch the fan ON using the circuit breaker in cabinet
AU01803 	   (e) Check the fan for unusual noises or any vibration while
AU01803 	       it is running.   [_ _]
AU01803 	   (f) Check the fan motor bearings and lubricate if
AU01803 	       required.  [_ _]
AU01803 	6. Repeat step 5 for EF-SS5-2.   [_ _]
AU01803 	"7. (a) Using a torch, in the UPS rooms, check the fire dampers"
AU01803 	      (2 in each UPS rm) in each inlet and exhaust grill for
AU01803 	      damage or premature operation.  [_ _]

AU01803 	       dampers (1 in each substation) in the supply air inlet

AU01803 	       operation.  [_ _]

AU01803 	        that will collect dust deposits.   [___]
AU01803 	  (iii) Vacuum interiors of any wall mounted control
AU01803 	        enclosure.  [___]

AU01803 	        dust.   [___]
AU01803 	    (v) Note and record any evidence of water or drainage
AU01803 	        problems.  Clear any blockages.

AU01866 	03 M Inspect and maintain Substation 5 Escape Stair Fan
AU01866 	
AU01866 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01866 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job as well
AU01866 	   as prior to entering the stairwell.
AU01866 	"2. (a) Refer to Maintenance Manual, Operating and Maintenance"
AU01866 	       manual for Mechanical Services - MCL Tunnels
AU01866 	       M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01866 	   (b) Refer to AS 1668.1 - Appendix A for detail and
AU01866 	       methodology of stair pressurisation commissioning tests.
AU01866 	3. Check the exhaust grill in the wall of the stairwell to
AU01866 	   ensure it is free of debris that would restrict the flow of
AU01866 	   air.   [_ _]
AU01866 	4. Ensure that the door between the Domain Tunnel and the
AU01866 	   stairwell is closed.
AU01866 	5. Request the traffic control operator to start the
AU01866 	   Olympic Park supply fan SF-SS5-2  (ESP P04) from the TCR.
AU01866 	   Ensure the fan starts. Check that the airflow direction is
AU01866 	   into the stairwell. [_ _]
AU01866 	6. Check and inspect the Stairwell area.
AU01866 	   (a) Ensure that the door between the Domain Tunnel and the
AU01866 	       stairwell area is closed.
AU01866 	"   (b) Check each door for damage, as well check the rollers,"
AU01866 	"       runners, hinges, handles, catches and counter-weights"
AU01866 	       for efficient operation.  [_ _]
AU01866 	"   (c) With the supply air fan (SS-SS5-2) operating, record the"
AU01866 	       differential air pressure within the stairwell.  Record
AU01866 	       readings less than 50Pa in the Work Done area of the Job
AU01866 	       sheet. Raise a new job sheet for repairs that require
AU01866 	       further action.  [_ _]
AU01866 	"   (d) At each door, starting from the tunnel and then the door"
AU01866 	       at the head of the stairs.
AU01866 	"       Arrange the door catch to be non-functioning, then using"
AU01866 	"       a spring balance, measure the force required to open the"
AU01866 	       door.  Record the results in the Work Done area of the
AU01866 	"       Job sheet if a force greater than 11kg is required, as"
AU01866 	       well advise the maintenance superintendent for further
AU01866 	       investigation.   [_ _]
AU01866 	   (e) Check the time taken for the air pressure to return to
AU01866 	       the static reading.  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU01866 	       job sheet if time is greater than 2 minutes. Notify the
AU01866 	       superintendent for further investigation.
AU01866 	"   (f) Chock each door open, then using an anemometer, measure"
AU01866 	       the velocity of air out of the open door.  The reading is
AU01866 	       to be with the door fully open and with no obstructions.
AU01866 	       Record the results in the Work Done area of the Job sheet
AU01866 	       if the air flow is less than 1 meter /sec.  Raise a new
AU01866 	       job sheet for repairs that require further action.  [_ _]
AU01866 	   (g) Check the fan and motor for undue noise and
AU01866 	       vibrations.   [_ _]
AU01866 	   (h) Check the fan bearings for noise.   [_ _]
AU01866 	"      (i ) Check the fan unit for damage, corrosion, missing"
AU01866 	"           panel fixings, as well as checking the fixings of the"
AU01866 	           unit for security.  [_ _]
AU01866 	7. Ensure the action of opening a stairwell door;
AU01866 	     (a) Generates an alarm at the TCR workstation.
AU01866 	     (b) Causes the fan speed to vary to maintain a positive
AU01866 	         pressure in the stairwell.
AU01866 	"8. Run the fan for a further 5 minutes, with the door in both"
AU01866 	   the open and the closed position then advise the traffic
AU01866 	   control room to shut the fan down and to turn OFF the
AU01866 	"   lighting after leaving the stairwell, ensuring that the door"
AU01866 	   to the tunnel is closed.
AU01866 	9. Ensure the stairwell is clean and all rubbish and debris is
AU01866 	   removed from the stairwell.  [_ _]
AU01866 	10. Ensure the door between the stairwell and the Domain Tunnel
AU01866 	    is closed.
AU01866 	11. Notify the Control Room on completion of the job.
AU01866 	12. Raise a new job sheet for repairs that require further
AU01866 	    action.
AU01833 	12 M Inspection of substation 5 air handling unit
AU01833 	
AU01833 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01833 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01833 	"2. Refer to reference manual, Operating and Maintenance Manual"
AU01833 	   for Mechanical Services at  Melbourne Citylink Tunnels
AU01833 	   M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01833 	 WARNING:  IF THE FAN IS RUNNING THE DOOR IS OPENED UNDER
AU01833 	 NEGATIVE PRESSURE.   USE THE HANDLES PROVIDED TO PULL THE DOOR
AU01833 	 OPEN.  DO NOT PLACE ANY PART OF THE BODY BETWEEN THE DOOR AND
AU01833 	 THE DOOR FRAME.
AU01833 	3. Ensure the 3 monthly fan inspection is complete.
AU01833 	4.  At the control cabinet (SUB5 A/C 5A MEB or SUB5 A/C 5B MEB)
AU01833 	    switch the fan circuit breaker to OFF (SF-SS5-1).  Isolate
AU01833 	"    and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103,  Low Voltage Safety"
AU01833 	    Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01833 	5. Work plan for SF-SS5-1
AU01833 	   (a) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01833 	       windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU01833 	       the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU01833 	       in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01833 	6. At the control cabinet (SUB5 A/C 5A MEB or SUB5 A/C 5B MEB)
AU01833 	   switch the fan circuit breaker to ON (SF-SS5-1).
AU01833 	7. Measure and record the current of each motor and compare with
AU01833 	   the rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the job
AU01833 	"   sheet, any results out of limits..    [_ _]"
AU01833 	8. At the control cabinet (SUB5 A/C 5A MEB or SUB5 A/C 5B MEB)
AU01833 	   switch the fan circuit breakers to OFF (EF-SS5-1 & 2).
AU01833 	"   Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103,  Low Voltage"
AU01833 	   Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01833 	9. Work plan for EF-SS5-1 & 2
AU01833 	10. At the control cabinet (SUB5 A/C 5A MEB or SUB5 A/C 5B MEB)
AU01833 	    switch the fan circuit breakers to ON (EF-SS5-1 & 2).
AU01833 	11. Measure and record the current of each motor and compare
AU01833 	    with the rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU01833 	"    job sheet, any results out of limits..    [_ _]"
AU01833 	"12. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01833 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job Sheet.   [_ _]
AU01833 	13. Notify the control room on completion of the job.

AU01867 	   continue until the old grease is purged from grease relief
AU01867 	   port. [_ _]

AU01867 	   maintenance.   [_ _]

AU01713 	
AU01713 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01713 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01713 	"2. Refer to the reference manual, Operating and Maintenance"
AU01713 	   Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne Citylink Tunnels.
AU01713 	   M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01713 	3. Work plan for SF-SS6-1
AU01713 	  Note: The fan duty is changed weekly by the DDC. The procedure
AU01713 	  below assumes SF-SS6-1 is the duty fan.
AU01713 	"   (a) At the switchboard, switch the fan OFF using the circuit"
AU01713 	       breaker in control panel (SUB6 A/C 6 MEB).  Isolate and
AU01713 	"       tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage Safety"
AU01713 	       Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01713 	   (b) Inspect the fan housing and wall penetration flashing for
AU01713 	       damage.    [_ _]
AU01713 	"   (c) Check the fan panels and fixings for damage, corrosion"
AU01713 	       and fixings that may be loose or missing.   [_ _]
AU01713 	   (d) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the
AU01713 	      passage of air.   [_ _]
AU01713 	   (e) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
AU01713 	       blade.   [_ _]
AU01713 	"   (f) Switch the fan ON, using the circuit breaker in control"
AU01713 	       panel (SUB6 A/C 6 MEB).   [_ _]
AU01713 	   (g) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
AU01713 	   (h) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
AU01713 	       vibrations.   [_ _]
AU01713 	"   (i ) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"
AU01713 	SF-SS6-2
AU01713 	   (k) Switch OFF the circuit breaker for the fan SF-SS6-2 and
AU01713 	"       tagout in accordance with TMI-3012-SA-01013, Low Voltage"
AU01713 	       Safety Work Instruction.
AU01713 	   (l) Inspect the fan housing and wall penetration flashing for
AU01713 	"   (m) Check the fan panels and fixings for damage, corrosion"
AU01713 	   (n) Check the fan cowls and grilles for debris blocking the
AU01713 	       passage of air.   [_ _]
AU01713 	   (o) Check the fan for free movement and any damage to the
AU01713 	"   (p) Switch the fan SF-SS6-2 ON, using the circuit breaker in"
AU01713 	       control panel(SUB6 A/C 6 MEB).   [_ _]
AU01713 	"   (q) While fan SF-SS6-1 is running, operate the TRIP switch"
AU01713 	"       mechanism, on the front of the circuit breaker, fan"
AU01713 	       SF-SS6-1 will go off and SF-SS6-2 will start.
AU01713 	   (r) Check the fan for correct rotation.   [_ _]
AU01713 	   (s) Check for fan and motor for unusual noises and
AU01713 	"   (t) Check the motor bearings, lubricate if required.   [_ _]"
AU01713 	"   (u) Switch circuit breaker for fan SF-SS6-1 ON, fan SF-SS6-2"
AU01713 	       will go OFF and SF-SS6-1 will start.
AU01713 	"4. Check the roof nmounted relief vent for damage and blockages,"
AU01713 	   repair or remove debris as required.   [_ _]
AU01713 	"5. Check the fire dampers (3), at the fan inlet vents and the"
AU01713 	"   substaion exhaust vent in back wall, for damage and premature"
AU01713 	   operation.   [_ _]
AU01713 	"6. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01713 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.
AU01713 	7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01834 	12 M Substation 6 Ventilation Inspection
AU01834 	
AU01834 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01834 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01834 	"2. Refer to the reference manual, Operating and Maintenance"
AU01834 	   Manual for Mechanical Services at Melbourne Citylink Tunnels.
AU01834 	   M-STG-ME-27400.
AU01834 	3. Ensure the 3 monthly fan inspection is complete.
AU01834 	4. Work plan for SF-SS6-1
AU01834 	"   (a) At the switchboard, switch the fan AUTO/MANUAL/OFF"
AU01834 	       selector switch to the MANUAL position and the
AU01834 	       LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE selector switch to the LOCAL position.
AU01834 	"       Isolate and tag in accordance TMI-3012-SA-0103, Low"
AU01834 	       Voltage Safety Work Instruction.   [_ _]
AU01834 	    (b) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01834 	        windings.  Record any results in the Work Done area of
AU01834 	        the job sheet that does not meet specifications set out
AU01834 	        in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01834 	    (c) Carry out an Insulation resistance test on the motor
AU01834 	        anti-condensation heater.  Record any results in the
AU01834 	        Work Done area of the job sheet that does not meet
AU01834 	        specifications set out in AS3000.   [_ _]
AU01834 	    (d) Measure and record the motor current and compare with
AU01834 	        the rated current.  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU01834 	"        job sheet, any results out of limits..    [_ _]"
AU01834 	"    (e) At the switchboard, remove the safety tags in accordance"
AU01834 	"        with TMI-3012-SA-0103, then switch the LOCAL/OFF/REMOTE"
AU01834 	        selector switch to the REMOTE position and the
AU01834 	        AUTO/MANUAL/OFF selector switch to the AUTO position.
AU01834 	        Request the Traffic Control room to start the fan.
AU01834 	"   (f ) Check the fan and motor bearings, lubricate where"
AU01834 	        applicable.  [_ _]
AU01834 	5. Repeat step 6 for SF-SS6-2
AU01834 	"6. On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU01834 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.
AU01834 	7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01834 	Record Readings Below
AU01834 	----------------------------------------------------------------

AU01834 	------------------------------------------------------------------------
AU01834 	--------------------------------------------------------
AU01834 	 SF-SS6-1 |                m Ohms    |                  Amps   |
AU01834 	 SF-SS6-2 |                m Ohms    |                  Amps   |

AU01767 	03 M Maint of the Variable Message Sign
AU01767 	
AU01767 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01767 	1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in emergency lane.
AU01767 	"2. Access keys required for Sound Wall Gate, to access VMS 07."
AU01767 	"   Set up lane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic Control,"
AU01767 	"   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059"
AU01767 	   Plan 12 or 13 (Short term and low traffic volume).  Vic Roads
AU01767 	   approval required prior to doing job.
AU01767 	   Access to VMS 6 is from the car park below the elevated road.
AU01767 	"3. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and"
AU01767 	   or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
AU01767 	   equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to Safety
AU01767 	"   Instructions  TMI-3012-SA-0101, Working  on Gantry"
AU01767 	   Structures.
AU01767 	4. Arrange with the TCR for a Test Message to be displayed on
AU01767 	   the VMS.  Monitor operation and repair as required.  Monitor
AU01767 	   the LED Arrays and the Flashers for failed LEDS and
AU01767 	   record in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet if the failed
AU01767 	   LEDs exceed 10% of the array.
AU01767 	"   Arrange a new Job sheet for any outstanding works, recording"
AU01767 	   the appropriate Job numbers in the Related Jobs  field
AU01767 	   and Notify the Team Leader or his representative
AU01767 	   of any outstanding works.  [_ _]
AU01767 	5. Carry out visual inspection externally and internally of the
AU01767 	"   cabinets, sign, external cables and conduits for vandalism,"
AU01767 	"   mechanical damage, water ingress, condensation or insect"
AU01767 	   infestation. Also check inside cabinets for tripped circuit
AU01767 	"   breakers, disconnected wires, burn marks from excessive heat."
AU01767 	   [_ _]
AU01767 	"6. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts, and for"
AU01767 	"   rusted areas, rusted nuts or bolts. Cleans with wire brush"
AU01767 	   and spray with Cold Gal or equivalent. This should be
AU01767 	   done with care and to avoid overspray. [_ _]
AU01767 	7. Inspect the external face of the lenses (for each pixel) for
AU01767 	   dirt and clean with Windex or equivalent  and clean rags
AU01767 	   if required.[_ _]
AU01767 	8. Note any corrective action required in the Work Done area
AU01767 	   of the Job Sheet and raise new Job Sheet if required.
AU01767 	9. Notify control room on departure.

AU01595 	
AU01595 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01595 	1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
AU01595 	   lane.
AU01595 	"2. Set up slane closure as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01595 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure,"
AU01595 	   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12 or 13.
AU01595 	"4. Use caution when working above traffic, ensure equipment and"
AU01595 	   or tools do not fall from the gantry.  Only essential
AU01595 	   equipment is to be taken onto the Gantry.  Adhere to safety
AU01595 	   instructions TMI-3012-SA-0101 Working on Gantry Structures.
AU01595 	5. Visually check for loose or missing nuts and bolts and for
AU01595 	   rusted areas nuts or bolts.
AU01595 	"   Clean with wire brush and spray with """"cold gal"""" or"
AU01595 	   equivalent. This shold be done with care and to avoid
AU01595 	   overspray. [_ _]
AU01595 	6. Carry out preventative maintenance as per Cegelec  Securite &
AU01595 	"   Signalisation O & M manual Volume 4 Maintenance Manual,"
AU01595 	"   ED/BC/MCC/O&M/04, Section 8 [M-MCL-TM-1551]."
AU01595 	   (a) Carry out Luminance test. Traffic Contro Room assistance
AU01595 	       required (Section  8.2.4.2.)  [_ _]
AU01595 	   (b) Test interior lights   (Section  8.2.5.)    [_ _]
AU01595 	   (c) Check  pilot light   (Section  8.2.7.)    [_ _]
AU01595 	   (d) Test heater  (Section  8.2.8.)    [_ _]
AU01595 	   (e) Test ground fault circuit breaker (Section  8.2.9.) [_ _]
AU01595 	   (f) Check lightning arrestor fuses   (Section   8.2.10.)
AU01595 	       [_ _]
AU01595 	   (g) Clean CD501/CD502 board transformers  with brush or
AU01595 	       portable vacuum/blower [_ _]
AU01595 	   (h) Test AC voltages   (Section  8.2.11.)  [_ _]
AU01595 	   (i) Clean controller cabinet with vacuum/ blower.   [_ _]
AU01595 	   (j) Clean external face of lenses for each pixel with
AU01595 	"       """"Windex"""" or equivalent and clean rags. Inspect internal"
AU01595 	       face of lens for accumulation of dust and clean with
AU01595 	       brush or vacuum/blower if required.    [_ _]
AU01595 	   (k) Test (push button) on all character boards  and check if
AU01595 	       all pixel arrays are operational.  [_ _]
AU01595 	7. On completion record anything outside normal parameters in
AU01595 	"   the """"Work Done"""" section of the Job Sheet and raise new"
AU01595 	   corrective action Job Sheet is required.
AU01595 	8. Notify control room on departure.
AU01595 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01595 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01595 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01595 	Note:
AU01595 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01595 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01595 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01595 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01595 	        it's intended function.
AU01595 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01595 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01595 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01595 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01595 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01595 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01595 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01595 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01595 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01595 	        intended function.
AU01595 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01595 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01595 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01847 	03 M Measure & report on DT GW TNL Bay flows in drainage sys
AU01847 	The frequency of this job can be adjusted as history of
AU01847 	groundwater flows are established.
AU01847 	
AU01847 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01847 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01847 	"2. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01847 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01847 	   Plans 25 & 26.
AU01847 	"3. For detail of Job, refer to Work Instruction, DOMAIN TUNNEL"
AU01847 	   DRAINAGE TMI-3012-OP-0025
AU01847 	4. At each groundwater pit:record the Volume/time water flow
AU01847 	   from each agi-pipe into each groundwater  pit (and it's
AU01847 	   direction of flow).
AU01847 	"   At each groundwater pit, to obtain readings;"
AU01847 	"   (a) Readings are carried out by collecting the water, from"
AU01847 	"       the agi-pipe, in a calibrated measuring container for 5"
AU01847 	       to 10 seconds.
AU01847 	       e.g. 800 mls/10 secs
AU01847 	            450 mls/10 secs
AU01847 	           1 litre /8 secs.
AU01847 	       Record the details on the Form DOMAIN TUNNEL - BAY FLOW
AU01847 	       MONITORING TMF-3012-OP-0205.
AU01847 	5. Inspect the pits and pipes using a torch and mirror and or by
AU01847 	"   observation, looking for Calcite deposits or debris that"
AU01847 	   could restrict water flow.  Record the details on the Form
AU01847 	   DOMAIN TUNNEL - BAY FLOW MONITORING  TMF-3012-OP-0205.
AU01847 	6. Ensure the completed copy of the form DOMAIN TUNNEL - BAY
AU01847 	   FLOW MONITORING TMF-3012-OP-0205 is forwarded to the Civil
AU01847 	   Team Leader for evaluation on completion of the job.
AU01847 	   Increased flows could indicate a new or increased source of
AU01847 	"   groundwater entering the tunnel, and would need to be"
AU01847 	   investigated.
AU01847 	6. Record anything outside normal parameters in the Work Done
AU01847 	   area of the job sheet.
AU01847 	7. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01948 	07 W Inspect LHS spoon drain

AU01948 	"   Work Instruction, Traffic Control, TMI-3012-OP-0002 and"
AU01948 	"   Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 21, 24, 26."
AU01948 	4. Inspect spoon drain along the LHS new Jersey Barrier for
AU01948 	"   debris, accumulated silt and or foreign materials that may"
AU01948 	   cause damming or blockages.  Remove any loose items
AU01948 	   that may cause problems in the drainage system.
AU01948 	5. Inspect transitions from spoon drains to down pipes for
AU01948 	   materials liable to cause blockages.  Remove all material
AU01948 	   from transition point.
AU01948 	6. Inspect the Edge Pavement Drain (cut into road pavement) for
AU01948 	"   debris and blockages, remove any loose debris from within the"
AU01948 	   drain.
AU01948 	7. Record in the Work Done area of the job sheet any outstanding
AU01948 	   works requiring further corrective actions.  Raise a new job
AU01948 	   sheet for these works.

AU01948 	    DRAIN INSPECTION is forwarded to the Civil Team or his
AU01948 	    representative on completion of the job.

AU01939 	"06 W Inspect, Meas, Report on DT GW drn pits, V-Notch-pipes"
AU01939 	** Prior to commencement Maintenance Crew to be issued white
AU01939 	   disposable overalls to be worn  whilst carrying out Tunnel
AU01939 	   Drainage tasks.
AU01939 	
AU01939 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01939 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing the job.
AU01939 	"2. Set up the lane closure, as per Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU01939 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01939 	"   Plans 21, 22, 25, 26"
AU01939 	3. Reference:
AU01939 	"   (a) Work Instruction, DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE"
AU01939 	       TMI-3012-OP-0025.
AU01939 	   (b) Operation & Maintenance Manual - Tunnel Drainage Stage 2
AU01939 	       Design Report R-STG-EN-006 Rev 1.
AU01939 	4. Civil Team Leader or representative is to:
AU01939 	   (a) Select groundwater and dirty water pits to be inspected
AU01939 	       on forms DOMAIN TUNNEL GROUND WATER PIT INSPECTIONS
AU01939 	       TMF-3012-OP-0231 and DOMAIN TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT
AU01939 	       INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0255 respectively.  Selection
AU01939 	       should be with the knowledge of past results and a random
AU01939 	       selection including examination of previous inspections
AU01939 	       carried out as part of the V Notch and Bay Flow
AU01939 	       inspections
AU01939 	   (b) Previous inspection forms are to be issued to the
AU01939 	       maintenance crew to compare results when carrying out
AU01939 	       inspections.
AU01939 	"   (c) V-Notch Pits 14A, 66, 204 & 237 shall be inspected on"
AU01939 	       each occasion.
AU01939 	5. (a) Inspect the groundwater pits circled on DOMAIN TUNNEL
AU01939 	       GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION  TMF-3012-OP-0231.
AU01939 	       (i) Use a torch to inspect each pipe and associated pits
AU01939 	           for cleanliness and the accumulation of calcites.
AU01939 	      (ii) Record the build up of calcites in the pipes and pits
AU01939 	           in Millimetres (mm).  When a build up of 50mm occurs
AU01939 	           in a 200mm pipe or a 25mm in a 100mm pipe cleaning is
AU01939 	           required.
AU01939 	"     (iii) Record a description of the calcite. e.g. slimy,"
AU01939 	           milky or hard etc.
AU01939 	      (iv) Record the results on form  DOMAIN TUNNEL GROUNDWATER
AU01939 	           PIT INSPECTIONS TMF-3012-OP-0231.
AU01939 	   (b) Inspect the Dirtywater pits circled on DOMAIN TUNNEL
AU01939 	       DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTION  TMF-3012-OP-0255.
AU01939 	       Use a torch to inspect each pipe and associated pits for
AU01939 	       cleanliness and the accumulation of debris.  Record the
AU01939 	"       related details regarding accumulation of silts, debris,"
AU01939 	       and other foreign materials within pits on the form.
AU01939 	   (c) Ensure pit covers are replaced and seated correctly after
AU01939 	       each pit inspection.
AU01939 	6. V-Notch Readings
AU01939 	   (a) Prior to taking readings of ground water (Right hand side
AU01939 	"       of tunnel) pit numbers 325, 323, 321 & 316  and the dirty"
AU01939 	"       water (Left hand side of tunnel) pit numbers 142, 139,"
AU01939 	"       137 & 124, ensure the V-notch weir is clear of calcites"
AU01939 	       and debris.  Clean thoroughly if required.
AU01939 	   (b) Use a measuring stick obtain the depth of the V-notch
AU01939 	       flow by
AU01939 	      (i) Place the stick in the cup
AU01939 	     (ii) Remove the stick and measure the height of the water
AU01939 	          mark on the stick.
AU01939 	   (c) Record the depth of water flowing over the V-Notch weir
AU01939 	"       in mm on the form DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS,"
AU01939 	       GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & YARRA CROSSING GROUNDWATER PIT
AU01939 	       INFLOW  TMF-3012-OP-0204.
AU01939 	"   (d) If readings differ markedly from previous readings, then"
AU01939 	       take measurement again to confirm  results.
AU01939 	    (e) Note that inspection V-Notch pits is to be carried out
AU01939 	        as per step 5.
AU01939 	"7. (a) Once V-Notch 323 has been read, then proceed to the sump"
AU01939 	       pumping room to take a water inflow reading.
AU01939 	   (b) Proceed up the exit stairs to the pump control room
AU01939 	   (c) Notify the control room that all pumps are to be switched
AU01939 	      OFF.
AU01939 	   (d) Switch OFF all the pumps (Have an electrician perform
AU01939 	       this duty).
AU01939 	   (e) Return back down to the sump pumping room and close all
AU01939 	       three gate valves
AU01939 	   (f) Return back up stairs to the pump control room and start
AU01939 	"       by recording the sump level, then 10 minutes later take"
AU01939 	       another reading of the sump level.
AU01939 	"   (g) Record the sump start and finish level, in millimetres,"
AU01939 	"       on the form DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS,"
AU01939 	   (h) Record on the inspection sheet anything out of the
AU01939 	       ordinary.
AU01939 	   (i) Return all  gate valves to their normal OPEN condition
AU01939 	       and switch the pumps back to automatic operation.  Then
AU01939 	       proceed with the rest of the readings and inspections.
AU01939 	8. Domain Tunnel Groundwater Bore Level (located between fire
AU01939 	   cabinets D16 & D17 LHS).
AU01939 	"   (a) Remove the DT bore-hole cover, then lower a string with a"
AU01939 	       weight attached into the bore-hole until the weight
AU01939 	       touches the bottom of the bore-hole.
AU01939 	"   (b) Mark the string with a marker or pen, ensuring that the"
AU01939 	       weight is just touching the bottom and that there is no
AU01939 	       undue slack in the string.
AU01939 	   (c) Measure and record the total length of the string (Total
AU01939 	       depth of bore-hole in millimetres)
AU01939 	   (d) Measure and record the total length of the string that
AU01939 	       was submerged in the bore-hole water (Depth of
AU01939 	       groundwater in bore-hole in millimetres).
AU01939 	   (e) Record the details on the form DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE -
AU01939 	"       SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE LEVELS & YARRA CROSSING"
AU01939 	       GROUNDWATER PIT INFLOW TMF-3012-OP-0204..
AU01939 	   (f ) Ensure the cover is replaced and seated correctly.
AU01939 	9. Notify the control room on completion of the job.
AU01939 	10. Ensure a completed copy of the forms
AU01939 	"    DOMAIN TUNNEL GROUNDWATER PIT INSPECTION TMF-3012-OP-0231,"
AU01939 	    DOMAIN TUNNEL DIRTY WATER PIT INSPECTIONS  TMF-3012-OP-0255
AU01939 	"    and DOMAIN TUNNEL DRAINAGE - SEGMENT FLOWS, GROUNDWATER BORE"
AU01939 	    LEVELS & YARRA CROSSING GROUNDWATER PIT INFLOW
AU01939 	    TMF-3012-OP-0204. are forwarded to the Civil Team Leader or
AU01939 	    his representative on completion of the job and prior to end
AU01939 	    of shift.  Civil Team Leader or representative is to record
AU01939 	    and sign off each form and raise any actions (job sheets)
AU01939 	    for further inspection or cleaning

AU01981 	12 M Joint Leakage Drain Inspections & Cleaning
AU01981 	
AU01981 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01981 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU01981 	2. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU01981 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU01981 	"   Plans 21, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26."
AU01981 	   In the work done area record:
AU01981 	   a. Any deviations from the plan.
AU01981 	   b. Lane closure start time.
AU01981 	   c. Lane closure finish time.
AU01981 	   d. Weather conditions.
AU01981 	3. Joint Leakage Drains (JLD) are located on the outside of the
AU01981 	   left and right hand lanes of the tanked section of the Domain
AU01981 	   Tunnel.
AU01981 	"4. Inspect JLDrains for water flow, blockages, deposits and"
AU01981 	   conditions.  Record the details for each drain on form Domain
AU01981 	   Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain TMF-3012-OP-0276
AU01981 	5. The JLDs are inspected via an inspection point which is a
AU01981 	   square Gatic plate with a hinged lid. This lid is held secure
AU01981 	   in position by a Philips head screw.
AU01981 	6. Access both ends of drain by unscrewing covers in both the
AU01981 	   LHL and the RHL.
AU01981 	"   (a) To inspect the drain sets, shine the torch down one open"
AU01981 	"       cover, then at the corresponding open cover, using the"
AU01981 	"       extendable mirror, look for the lighted torch."
AU01981 	   (b) Record the condition of the pipe e.g. the cleanliness
AU01981 	       and / or blockage of the drain on form Domain Tunnel
AU01981 	       Joint Leakage Drain TMF-3012-OP-0276
AU01981 	   (c) Record the condition of each drain e.g. build-up of
AU01981 	"       calcite, slim, silt etc and whether or not there is a"
AU01981 	       flow of water present.
AU01981 	"  **Use Condition Words :  WET,  DRY,  CLEAR, OBSTRUCTED and if"
AU01981 	    obstructed record the action that was taken to clear the
AU01981 	    obstruction ( ie:  hydrant flushed or Jet flushed).
AU01981 	"7. If there is water flow present, then at the dirty water pit,"
AU01981 	   inspect the Dirty Water pit where the flow enters (If it does
AU01981 	   enter into a pit).  Measure and record the flow and elapsed
AU01981 	   time for on form  Domain Tunnel Joint Leakage Drain
AU01981 	   TMF-3012-OP-0276.
AU01981 	"8. Record all details on the inspection sheet, as all the"
AU01981 	   information is important.
AU01981 	9. Ensure all the pit covers and Gatic covers are closed and
AU01981 	   secured on completion of each inspection.
AU01981 	10. Ensure a completed copy of the forms Domain Tunnel Joint
AU01981 	    Leakage Drain TMF-3012-OP-0276 are forwarded to the Civil
AU01981 	    Team Leader or representative on completion of the job and
AU01981 	    prior to end of shift.  Civil Team Leader or representative
AU01981 	    is to record and sign off each form and raise any actions
AU01981 	   (job sheets) for further inspection or cleaning
AU02153 	03 M Inspect Clean Cross passages
AU02153

AU02153 	"and inspections of the Building and Electrics, prior to leaving"

AU02153 	"fluorescent, emergency, Exit and external lighting, Brooms,"
AU02153 	"Rubbish bags, Filter material, Ladders, Silicon Lubricant Spray,"
AU02153 	Rodent bait station.
AU02153 	This job is a combined job for the inspection of the electrical
AU02153 	installations and cleaning of the relevant areas.
AU02153 	A  INTRODUCTION
AU02153 	1. Notify the TCRO prior to commencing this job.
AU02153 	"2. This Job is for the inspection and cleaning Cross passages 1,"
AU02153 	   2 and 3.   [_ _]

AU02153 	   his representative of any outstanding works required.  [_ _]

AU02153 	   lighting) and lens of accumulated dust and debris.  [_ _]

AU02153 	   Sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative

AU02153 	   in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet.  [_ _]

AU02153 	   anything abnormal in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02153 	   sheet and Inform the Team Leader or his representative of
AU02153 	   outstanding actions.   Include in the Related Job field of

AU02153 	   job.   [_ _]

AU02153 	   ingress.  Inspect for source of any water.  Record any
AU02153 	   details in the Work Done area of the job sheet and inform the

AU02153 	   obstructed by furnishings and or stored items.  Remove any
AU02153 	   obstruction.  [_ _]

AU02153 	   repair as required and record in the Work Done area of the
AU02153 	   Job Sheet.  Inform the Team Leader or his representative
AU02153 	   of any outstanding works.  [_ _]

AU02153 	"   e.g. raised pit covers, water on floor accumulated debris,"
AU02153 	   sealant dripped from ceiling to floor.   [_ _]

AU02153 	   damage and or fixings  Record in the Work Done area of the
AU02153 	   Job sheet any outstanding works  [_ _].
AU02153 	6. Clean dust and cobwebs from interior walls and
AU02153 	   ceilings.  [_ _]
AU02153 	7. Remove from site all accumulated rubbish and debris.  [_ _]
AU02153 	8. Sweep and vacuum all floor surfaces as well as
AU02153 	   stairways.  [_ _]
AU02153 	9. Clean hand rails (if applicable) of dust and dirt.  [_ _]
AU02153 	10. Visually inspect all metalwork for damage or corrosion.
AU02153 	    Repair and or remove corrosion and clean then cover with
AU02153 	    Cold Gal.  [_ _]
AU02153 	"11. In the Cross passages, check to ensure that there are no"
AU02153 	    blockages in the concealed sections of spoon drains.  [_ _]

AU02153 	"        e.g. Fans, Air Conditioners.  [_ _]"

AU02192 	05 Y inspection of Smoke Duct and Exhaust Fan Bolts
AU02192 	
AU02192 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02192 	1. Inspection to be carried out during tunnel shuts.
AU02192 	"2. This work is to be carried out by a sub-contractor, all"
AU02192 	   necessary Work Permits and HSE documentation to be submitted
AU02192 	   prior to commencement of work.
AU02192 	3. Inspect the bolts anchoring the smoke duct and the jet fans
AU02192 	   throughout the Tunnel as set out in INTICO leter dated
AU02192 	   8 September 2004 and Visual Inspection Report  01135_VT.001A
AU02192 	   dated 19-07-2004.
AU02192 	4. Submit report following completion of the works.
AU02192 	******************************************************
AU02192 	Recommendations for inspection and testing of the smoke
AU02192 	duct anchor bolts
AU02192 	There are two particular circumstances that suggest that the anchors
AU02192 	supporting the smoke duct should be
AU02192 	subject to testing and inspection at a higher level than for general
AU02192 	civil engineering construction:
AU02192 	1. The anchors are critical to keeping the precast concrete segments of
AU02192 	"the smoke duct in place, and if one"
AU02192 	"of these segments fell, the consequences would be very severe."
AU02192 	2. The anchors are drilled-in to the concrete tunnel lining which has
AU02192 	developed cracking over the time since
AU02192 	construction. If a crack in the tunnel lining passes through an anchor
AU02192 	"bolt hole, it will reduce the load"
AU02192 	carrying capacity of the anchor.
AU02192 	"With these circumstances in mind, the following inspection and testing"
AU02192 	program is recommended:
AU02192 	Every five years undertake a visual inspection of the exposed end of
AU02192 	every anchor bolt that supports the smoke
AU02192 	duct. Check the following (responses indicating no defects are shown in
AU02192 	brackets):
AU02192 	1. Is there any corrosion of the anchor bolt assembly? (NO)
AU02192 	2. Are the nut and anchor bolt tight (check for finger tight only)?
AU02192 	(YES)
AU02192 	3. Is there at least one full thread exposed beyond the nut? (YES)
AU02192 	4. Is there any cracking in the tunnel concrete lining that appears to
AU02192 	pass through the anchor bolt hole?
AU02192 	(NO)
AU02192 	5. Is there any evidence of movement (since construction) in the gap
AU02192 	between the precast segment of the
AU02192 	smoke duct and the tunnel concrete lining? (NO)
AU02192 	"In addition to checking these five points, it is necessary to check the"
AU02192 	length of embedment of the anchor bolt. To
AU02192 	"do this, measure the gap between the precast segment of the smoke duct"
AU02192 	"and the tunnel concrete lining, and add"
AU02192 	to this distance the length of anchor bolt that is exposed beyond the
AU02192 	nut. The sum of the two
AU02192 	lengths should be no more than 60mm.
AU02192 	If the visual inspection indicates that the bolt installation may be
AU02192 	"defective, take photographs of the defect for"
AU02192 	"review and assessment of remedial measures. If defects are found, the"
AU02192 	inspection frequency will need to be
AU02192 	reviewed.
AU02192 	For further details of inspections refer
AU02192 	G:\TFM\Operations\Structures Level 2 Inspections\Smoke Duct Anchor
AU02192 	"bolts- Recommendation fo inspection & Testing (Diagram in Page 3, 10"
AU02192 	February 2010)
AU02122 	Carry out a Level 2 inspection of Domain Tunnel Structures
AU02122 	
AU02122 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02122 	1. Perform a level 2 structural inspection on all structural
AU02122 	   components of the Domain Tunnel.
AU02122 	2. Provide a written report setting out
AU02122 	   (a) the condition of each structure
AU02122 	   (b) any outstanding works requiring further corrective
AU02122 	       works.
AU02015 	12 M Monitoring of Pre-stressed Ground Anchors.
AU02015 	
AU02015 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02015 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this
AU02015 	   work.
AU02015 	2. Traffic management as per Work Instruction Traffic Control
AU02015 	   TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059 Plan
AU02015 	"   21, 26, 29 to be provided by Transfield Services."

AU02015 	    a. Any deviations from the plan.
AU02015 	    b. Lane closure start time.
AU02015 	    c. Lane closure finish time.
AU02015 	    d. Weather conditions.

AU02015 	"   Southbank Interchange retaining walls, for residual stresses,"
AU02015 	   tensions and security.

AU02015 	   on Strain Gauges connected to the Anchors at the following
AU02015 	   locations :

AU02015 	        the Power St off ramp bridge -- two (2) gauges beneath
AU02015 	        the capping on tops of walls.

AU02015 	        the Power St off ramp bridge -- three (3) gauges beneath
AU02015 	   (c) Left side wall of the Domain Tunnel exit portal on tops
AU02015 	       of piers behind louvres in Breeze wall.
AU02015 	5. Record the readings  in the Work Done area of the Job Sheet
AU02015 	   and compare with the previous readings provided by the Civil
AU02015 	   Team Leader or his representative.
AU02015 	"6. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU02015 	   of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02015 	   actions required.   Priority High P1.
AU02015 	7. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work.
AU02015 	   Record Readings Below
AU02015 	        the Power St OFF ramp from the WGF -- two (2) gauges
AU02015 	        beneath the capping on top of bridge abutment wall.

AU02010 	01 M Inspect the WL Traffic Management Cabinets
AU02010 	
AU02010 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02010 	1. The Traffic Control Room Officer or his representative are to
AU02010 	   check the contents of the WL Traffic Management Cabinets.
AU02010 	2. WARNING: PERSONS CARRYING OUT INSPECTIONS MUST BE AWARE THAT
AU02010 	   POISONOUS INSECTS MAY BE WITHIN THE CABINETS.
AU02010 	"3. At each Traffic Management Cabinet, listed on form"
AU02010 	   TMF-3012-OP-0314 WL TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT CABINETS an
AU02010 	   inspection and content count is to be carried out.:
AU02010 	   (a) Visually inspect the enclosure for damage and graffiti
AU02010 	"   (b) Visually inspect the enclosure door, hardware and gaskets"
AU02010 	      for damage.
AU02010 	   (c) Check the enclosure for insect infestation AND SPRAY WITH
AU02010 	      A SUITABLE INSECT SPRAY AS REQUIRED.
AU02010 	   (d) Clean the enclosure of accumulated dirt and debris.
AU02010 	   (e) Count and record the number of each item stored in the
AU02010 	      cabinet AND RESTOCK CABINET OF MISSING ITEMS AS REQUIRED
AU02010 	   (f) Record the result of the visual inspections and the count
AU02010 	      of items on the form TMF-3012-OP-0314 - WL Traffic
AU02010 	      Management Cabinets.
AU02010 	4. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work.
AU02010 	5. The completed job sheet and form TMF-3012-OP-0314 WL Traffic
AU02010 	   Management Cabinets are to be returned to the Road  Service
AU02010 	   and Traffic Manager or his representative.  The Road Service
AU02010 	   and Traffic Manager is to be notified of any outstanding
AU02010 	   issues and a copy of  the job sheet to be forwarded to the
AU02010 	   Team Leader - Civil or his representative.

AU01631 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01631 	A Job Start as a minimum must be completed in consultation with
AU01631 	"all participating employees to identify, assess and control the"
AU01631 	hazards prior to work commencing.
AU01631 	The job start should take into account the following hazards as a
AU01631 	minimum:
AU01631 	           Traffic
AU01631 	           Manual Handling
AU01631 	           Sharps & other foreign objects
AU01631 	"           Slips, Trips & Falls"
AU01631 	           Noise
AU01631 	           UV radiation
AU01631 	           Inclement weather
AU01631 	Other hazards particular to the location or conditions should be
AU01631 	"identified, assessed, controlled and noted on the Job Start form prior"
AU01631 	to the work commencing.
AU01631 	1. Inspect and clean the Road Reserve surface and sub-surface
AU01631 	   drainage system as per
AU01631 	"   Work Instruction TMI-3012-OP-0009, in the following WL"
AU01631 	   sectors:

AU01631 	   S4/N4 Tollway Brunswick St to Flemington Road

AU01631 	3. Notify control room prior to commencing work.
AU01631 	4. Use flashing amber beacon light on vehicles and wear
AU01631 	   fluorescent vest when on foot.
AU01631 	"5. Clean surface drainage of any form of debris (Kerb & channel,"
AU01631 	   spoon drains).

AU01631 	   built up debris.

AU01631 	"   covers, lintels and surrounds."

AU01601 	06 M Inspection of ponds
AU01601 	1. Keys to perimeter access gates are required.
AU01601 	2. Inspect the pollution control ponds and record the results on the
AU01601 	form Sediment Ponds Inspection  TMF-3012-OP-0035:
AU01601 	   (a) Remove rubbish and debris from the pond and spillway.
AU01601 	   (b) Inspect the pond embankments for structural integrity
AU01601 	       and erosion.
AU01601 	"   (c) Check pond for excessive weed infestation, odours,"
AU01601 	       breeding insects and sediment accumulation.
AU01601 	   (d) Mow the banks of the pond and remove cuttings as
AU01601 	       necessary.
AU01601 	   (e) Remove excess silt (when silt build-up is higher than
AU01601 	       300 mm below the outlet level).  Do not remove the clay
AU01601 	       lining of the pond.
AU01601 	"   (f) Inspect the spillway for blockages, remove any debris or"
AU01601 	       materials causing a blockage.
AU01601 	"   (g) Inspect the low flow outlets for blockages, remove any"
AU01601 	       accumualted debris or materials capable of causing a
AU01601 	       blockage.
AU01601 	3. On completion of the job report anything outside normal
AU01601 	   parameters in the section of the Job Sheet below and raise
AU01601 	   a new job sheet for any repair works that are required.
AU01601 	"   Report any outstanding works to the Civil Team Leader."""

AU01623 	   Regular Weekly  Inspection Report TMF-3012-OP-0001.  Record
AU01623 	   maintenance requirements. Reference procedure
AU01623 	   TMF-3012-OP-0001.

AU01623 	   otating vehicle hazard light and tape recorder as a minimum
AU01623 	   requirement.  Vehicle hazard light must be operating
AU01623 	   during inspection routine.
AU01623 	3. Notify control room if you are required to stop in emergency
AU01623 	   lane for further inspection.
AU01623 	4. Check by 'drive-by' inspection  using a systematic approach
AU01623 	"   to encompass all inspection targets, these can be carried out"
AU01623 	   on separate days of the week ie;
AU01623 	"   inspect pavement defects one day, signs and road furniture"
AU01623 	"   another day, line markings etc, on main carriageway one day"
AU01623 	"   and ramps on another, etc."
AU01623 	   Pavement defects
AU01623 	   Shoulder defects
AU01623 	   Drainage for blockages or flooding.
AU01623 	   Kerb & channel defects
AU01623 	   Pavement Pits/Culverts for damage or blockage
AU01623 	   Line marking
AU01623 	   Raised pavement markers damaged or missing
AU01623 	   New Jersey Barriers for damage
AU01623 	   Impact Attenuators
AU01623 	   Warning signs
AU01623 	   Road signs
AU01623 	   General signs
AU01623 	   Litter
AU01623 	   Graffiti
AU01623 	   Record any other requirements outside specified maintenance
AU01623 	   levels.
AU01623 	"5. Make temporary repairs to unsafe items if possible,  pick up"
AU01623 	   potential traffic hazards if safe to do so.
AU01623 	"6. Raise new job sheet or add to running jobsheets, any major"
AU01623 	   corrective maintenance action ie; all pot hole and pavement
AU01623 	   defects to be added to the Work Done section running
AU01623 	   Pavement Repairs Jobsheet.
AU01623 	7. Ensure that any minor routine action identified is noted for
AU01623 	   action on the current fortnightly litter and landscape
AU01623 	   jobsheet.

AU02029 	06 M Clean of the in pavement expansion joints (WL 1)
AU02029 	
AU02029 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02029 	A Job Start as a minimum must be completed in consultation with
AU02029 	"all participating employees to identify, assess and control the"
AU02029 	hazards prior to work commencing.
AU02029 	The job start should take into account the following hazards as a
AU02029 	minimum:
AU02029 	           Traffic
AU02029 	           Manual Handling
AU02029 	           Sharps & other foreign objects
AU02029 	"           Slips, Trips & Falls"
AU02029 	           Noise
AU02029 	           UV radiation
AU02029 	           Inclement weather
AU02029 	Other hazards particular to the location or conditions should be
AU02029 	"identified, assessed, controlled and noted on the Job Start form prior"
AU02029 	to the work commencing.
AU02029 	1. Inspect and clean the in-pavement expansion joint systems in
AU02029 	   the following WL 1 sectors:
AU02029 	   S1/N7 Tollway Bulla Road to Bell St
AU02029 	   S2/N6 Tollway Bell Street to Moreland Road
AU02029 	   S3/N5 Tollway Moreland Road to Brunswick St
AU02029 	   S4/N4 Tollway Brunswick St to Flemington Road
AU02029 	2. Notify control room prior to commencing work.
AU02029 	3. Use flashing amber beacon light on vehicles and wear
AU02029 	   fluorescent vest when on foot.
AU02029 	4. Inspect the expansion joints
AU02029 	"   (a) for an accumulation of debris (Nuts, bolts and hard"
AU02029 	       debris) that may cause the expansion joint to not
AU02029 	       function correctly
AU02029 	   (b) for an accumulation of debris that may cause a blockage
AU02029 	       and stop any waterflow.
AU02029 	   (c) for an accumulation of debris that is greater than 20mm
AU02029 	       deep that  will support
AU02029 	       vegetation growth.
AU02029 	5. Clean the expansion joint of debris and blockages that have
AU02029 	   built up.
AU02029 	6. Check the expansion joints for structural damage and loose or
AU02029 	"   missing components including nuts, bolts and surrounds."
AU02029 	7. Record in the Work Done Area of the job sheet any outstanding
AU02029 	   on-going corrective actions and the location of the expansion
AU02029 	   joint.
AU02029 	8. Raise a job sheet for any outstanding corrective actions on
AU02029 	   any expansion joints.

AU01615 	   units in the following
AU01615 	     TSH 01

AU01615 	     TSH 03
AU01615 	     TSH 04
AU01615 	     TSH 05 and
AU01615 	     TSH 06.
AU01615 	5. TSH 01 - UPS Unit.
AU01615 	"   (a) Do not operate the EMERGENCY STOP push button, on the"
AU01615 	"       front of the UPS Panel, unless in an extreme emergency,"
AU01615 	       as damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.
AU01615 	"   (b) Check operation, settings and calibration of all"
AU01615 	       controls.  [_ _]
AU01615 	"   (c) Record from the data display, the input, inverter, load"
AU01615 	       and battery data.   [_ _]
AU01615 	   (d) Check for signs of over heating.  [_ _]
AU01615 	   (e) Check system safety controls. (Bypass operations)  [_ _]
AU01615 	   (f) Clean the inside of the UPS. (Vacuum out)  [_ _]
AU01615 	   (g) Clean the filter on the inside of the door panel.  [_ _]
AU01615 	6. TSH 01 - Battery Panel.
AU01615 	   (a) Wear Safety Glasses when carrying out measurements on the
AU01615 	       Batteries.
AU01615 	   (b) Remove any metal jewellery being worn
AU01615 	   (c) Battery discharge test.  [_ _]
AU01615 	"       Using the discharge tester, measure and record the"
AU01615 	       individual standby and discharge voltages on the
AU01615 	"       """" individual battery check """"  sheet."
AU01615 	       (Cell voltage variation limit + / - 0.05% volts per cell
AU01615 	       from average of all cells in (1) one battery bank.  Any
AU01615 	       variation in excess of this limit should be investigated
AU01615 	"       immediately.) Using the """"Mains failure simulation"""""
AU01615 	"       sheet, perform test and record voltages & currents."
AU01615 	   (d) Check terminals for corrosion.  [_ _]
AU01615 	   (e) Check connections for tightness .  [_ _]
AU01615 	7. TSH 02 - UPS Unit.
AU01615 	8. TSH 02 - Battery Panel.
AU01615 	       immediately.)
AU01615 	"       Using the """"Mains failure simulation"""" sheet, perform"
AU01615 	       test and record voltages & currents.
AU01615 	9. TSH 03 - UPS Unit.
AU01615 	10.TSH 03 - Battery Panel.
AU01615 	11.TSH 04 - UPS Unit.
AU01615 	12.TSH 04 - Battery Panel.
AU01615 	13.TSH 05 - UPS Unit.
AU01615 	"       front of the UPS Panel unless in an extreme emergency, as"
AU01615 	       damage to the UPS electrical equipment can occur.

AU01615 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01615 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01615 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU01615 	Note:
AU01615 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01615 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01615 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01615 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01615 	        it's intended function.
AU01615 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01615 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01615 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01615 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01615 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01615 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01615 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01615 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01615 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01615 	        intended function.
AU01615 	OVERALL CONDITION RATING SCORE FOR THE UPS SYSTEM
AU01615 	",,,,,,  SCORE"
AU01615 	     TSH 01   [_ _]
AU01615 	     TSH 02   [_ _]
AU01615 	     TSH 03   [_ _]
AU01615 	     TSH 04   [_ _]
AU01615 	     TSH 05   [_ _]
AU01615 	     TSH 06   [_ _]
AU01615 	",,Note and comment below any items requiring immediate TSL ,,attention."
AU01615 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01615 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU01604 	   equipment.
AU01604 	"3. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating,"
AU01604 	"   symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones"
AU01604 	"   as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 00002"
AU01604 	"   and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12."
AU01604 	4. Reference Transfield Procedures TMI -3012-OP-0045  WIMS -
AU01604 	   Speed Calibration and TMI-3012-OP-0046  Weigh in Motion
AU01604 	   Calibration.
AU01604 	"5. Re-calibrate the weigh sensor, using both a 6 axle"
AU01604 	   articulated vehicle and the Transfield Services street
AU01604 	   sweeper vehicle.
AU01604 	6. Re-calibrate speeds using a hand held laser gun. Use the
AU01604 	   average of ten runs per lane for each calibration vehicle.
AU01604 	"7. At the counting sites, re-calibrate the speed using a hand"
AU01604 	   held laser gun.  Use the average of ten runs per lane for
AU01604 	   each calibration vehicle.
AU01604 	8. The results of test are to be recorded on forms WIMS Speed
AU01604 	   Calibration TMF-3012-OP-0361 and  Weigh in Motion
AU01604 	   Calibration TMF-OP-3012-0362.  A copy of the results are to
AU01604 	   forwarded to the Electrical Electronics Team Leader on
AU01604 	   completion of the job.
AU01604 	9. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01604 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.  [_ _]
AU01604 	10.Notify the control room  prior to departure from the WIM/TCS
AU01604 	   site.
AU01604 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU01604 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU01604 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU01604 	Note:
AU01604 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU01604 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU01604 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU01604 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU01604 	        it's intended function.
AU01604 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU01604 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU01604 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU01604 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU01604 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU01604 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU01604 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU01604 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU01604 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU01604 	        intended function.
AU01604 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU01604 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU01604 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).
AU01882 	03 M Inspection of WIM & TCS Systems on the SL Tollway
AU01882 	
AU01882 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01882 	1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
AU01882 	   lane.
AU01882 	"2. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating,"
AU01882 	"   symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones"
AU01882 	"   as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 0002"
AU01882 	"   and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12."
AU01882 	"3. Reference: Central Weighing Australasia, Roadside Maintenance"
AU01882 	"   Training Manual, Doc. PL-MCL-TM-1631, Rev 0 and for operation"
AU01882 	"   of laptop computer,  Weigh-in-Motion & Counting Stations,"
AU01882 	"   Operator's  Manual for WIMS Front End Computer,"
AU01882 	"   Doc.   PL-MCL-TM-1630, Rev A, Section 3 Telecom- DOS"
AU01882 	   operator's Manual . (Status Information 6.1.2 page 145)
AU01882 	"4. At SL WIM/TCS Systems 04A control cabinet, check the"
AU01882 	   following;
AU01882 	   (a) Internal and external condition of the cabinet.   [_ _]
AU01882 	   (b) Check wiring for tightness and for any evidence of
AU01882 	       overheating.  [_ _]
AU01882 	   (c) Check that the Tx and Rx LEDs (on the modem) flash at
AU01882 	       least each minute.  [_ _]
AU01882 	   (d) Check that the battery charger LED is ON.  [_ _]
AU01882 	"   (e) Using a vacuum cleaner, clean the cabinet"
AU01882 	       interior.   [_ _]
AU01882 	5. Use laptop computer to carry out the following:
AU01882 	   (a) Plug the 9 pin serial lead from the computer to the
AU01882 	        controller input/output board.
AU01882 	   (b) Switch ON the computer.
AU01882 	   (c) Click on Telecom WIMS Icon
AU01882 	   (d) Select Comms by pressing the 'C' Key
AU01882 	"   (e) Select LOGGER/ONLINE, then press Enter."
AU01882 	   (f) Check that the laptop computer communicates with the
AU01882 	       logger correctly.  [_ _]
AU01882 	"   (g) Confirm the logger parameters, shown in the CURRENT"
AU01882 	"       SITE (MCL) on page no. 1, area match those listed in"
AU01882 	       the document  Site Configuration and Set up Details
AU01882 	      (stored cabinet).  [_ _]
AU01882 	   (h) Press key Page Down to go to screen page 2. [_ _]
AU01882 	   (i) Record on the form attached loop frequencies and weigh
AU01882 	       responses.  [_ _]
AU01882 	   (j) Record value of Power Status on page 2 of the
AU01882 	       computer screen.  The battery should read approx 13
AU01882 	       volts. [_ _]
AU01882 	   (k) When a truck crosses the sensors check on page 2
AU01882 	"      (computer screen) that all sensors, in each lane are"
AU01882 	      operating correctly (an asterisk will appear momentarily
AU01882 	      alongside the appropriate loops as the truck crosses).
AU01882 	      This check should only be done with trucks and not cars
AU01882 	"     (weighing sites only), as all sensors may not be displayed"
AU01882 	     for cars.  [_ _]
AU01882 	"    (l) Select LOGGER/OFFLINE, then press Enter"
AU01882 	"    (m) Select 'Quit', then press Enter"
AU01882 	"    (n) Then select 'Quit' again, press Enter again."
AU01882 	    (o) Select 'Yes' to quit Telecom system.
AU01882 	6. Switch computer OFF and then unplug the 9 pin serial
AU01882 	   lead. [_ _]
AU01882 	"7. From the side of the road, visually check the conditions of"
AU01882 	"   the road sensors, for condition, no (loose bolts) metal"
AU01882 	   vibration or exposed wires visible. [_ _]
AU01882 	8. Repeat steps 4 to 7 for WIM/TCS System 04B   [_ _].
AU01882 	9. Repeat steps 4 to 7 for WIM/TCS System 04C   [_ _].
AU01882 	10. Repeat steps 4 to 7 for WIM/TCS System 05A & B   [_ _].
AU01882 	11. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU01882 	    parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU01882 	"12. Notify the control room  prior to departure."""
