AU02220 	12 M Calibrate and test tunnel PA system
AU02220 	
AU02220 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02220 	1. Notify the control room prior to commencing work.
AU02220 	2. Reference manuals:
AU02220 	   PA-RRB Field Equipment - System Manual
AU02220 	   Vol 1 O&M - M-MCL-TL-100053
AU02220 	   S-STG-CO-22017 Rev 07 - CML Southern Link Comms Services
AU02220 	   PA System Spec.
AU02220 	   Drawing - PA Physical Fibre Path - PAS01-EL-100001.
AU02220 	3. Apparatus required:
AU02220 	   a. CML's - WG OMK-6 Optical test Kit - Optical Power Meter
AU02220 	      set at 850nm.
AU02220 	   b. CML's - Tektronix TDS-3012 Digital Oscilloscope and
AU02220 	      isolation transformer - including appropriate test leads
AU02220 	"      and a BNC ""T"" junction."
AU02220 	   c. Transfield's - Sound Meter
AU02220 	"   d. RRB-PA / CCCS - 1KHz test tone message = ""ZZ_1_KHz_Tone"
AU02220 	"      (137)""."
AU02220 	   e. hearing protection - manadatory during Tunnel Level
AU02220 	      testing.
AU02220 	    WARNING: THE LIGHT EMITTED FROM A FIBRE OPTIC CABLE MAY BE
AU02220 	"    EITHER VISIBLE OR INVISIBLE, DIRECTING THE FIBRE OPTIC CABLE"
AU02220 	    TOWARDS THE EYE OR LOOKING DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF A FIBRE
AU02220 	"    OPTIC CABLE WHICH IS EMITTING LIGHT, WILL CAUSE IRREVERSABLE"
AU02220 	    DAMAGE TO THE EYE.
AU02220 	4. The following needs to be performed at each Tunnel TOA PA
AU02220 	"   Amplifier, which are located in the Tunnel Equipment Rooms."
AU02220 	5. Measure and record the fibre received signal level. This can
AU02220 	   be done by disconnecting the multimode fibre from the OSD363
AU02220 	   fibre receiver and connecting it into the Optical Power Meter
AU02220 	   set at 850nm. Record the dB level and then connect the fibre
AU02220 	   back into the OSD363 fibre receiver. The level is expected to
AU02220 	"   be between -18 to -30 dB, dependant on the distance of the"
AU02220 	   Equipment Room from Technical Shelter 8. Levels greater than
AU02220 	   -40dB indicate a possible fibre fault and should be
AU02220 	   investigated before proceeding.
AU02220 	6. Measure and record the 20KHz tone audio level between the
AU02220 	   OSD363 Fibre receiver and the TOA PA Amplifier. This can be
AU02220 	"   done by connecting a BNC ""T"" connector inline between the"
AU02220 	   OSD363 Fibre receiver and the TOA PA Amplifier and then
AU02220 	   connect the Digital Oscilloscope. Record the signal level in
AU02220 	   milivolts. The level is expected to be 500mV P-P (peak to
AU02220 	   peak).
AU02220 	   Before making any adjustment to the output level of the
AU02220 	"   OSD363, move the slider controls for the PA Amplifier Pre-Amp"
AU02220 	   and Master Volume down to 1. It may be possible to adjust the
AU02220 	   output level of the OSD363 Fibre receiver to produce the
AU02220 	"   expected output. Remove the BNC ""T"" connector and reconnect"
AU02220 	   the OSD363 directly to the TOA PA Amplifier.
AU02220 	7. Adjust the PA Amplifier sliders to produce two green bars on
AU02220 	   the PA Amplifier signal level indicator. Set the Pre-Amp
AU02220 	"   Control (V-1054B) to 8, and then adjust up the Master Volume"
AU02220 	   Control to obtain the two bars of level indication. The
AU02220 	"   Master level is generally 2 to 4 below the Pre-Amp level, if"
AU02220 	"   Pre-Amp is 8, the Master is expected to be between 4 to 6."
AU02220 	"8. Request the TCR, from the CCCS, play a normal"
AU02220 	"   message into the Tunnel, for example ""Left Lane Closed"", like"
AU02220 	"   for the Domain Tunnel = ""DT : Left Lane - D28 Maintenance"
AU02220 	"   (79)"""
AU02220 	"   for the Burnley Tunnel = ""BT : Left Lane - D59 Maintenance"
AU02220 	"   (155)"""
AU02220 	   Request that it ONLY be played to the Tunnel PA System.
AU02220 	9. The next test is performed in the Tunnel using the Transfield
AU02220 	   Sound Meter.
AU02220 	   WARNING: Hearing Protection must be worn during the following
AU02220 	   test.
AU02220 	   Position the sound meter in the centre of the centre running
AU02220 	"   lane, 1500mm above the roadway. Request the TCR, from the"
AU02220 	   CCCS play for 4 to 5 seconds the 1KHz test tone name
AU02220 	"   ""ZZ_1_KHz_Tone (137)"" ONLY to the Tunnel PA and"
AU02220 	   preferably only the zone being tested. Measure and record the
AU02220 	   result on form TMF-3012-OP-0391. The expected level is 94
AU02220 	   dB(A).
AU02220 	10.Repeat the above test for each of the Tunnel PA Zones.
AU02220 	"11.On completion of the job, record anything outside normal"
AU02220 	"   parameters in the """"Work Done"""" area of the job sheet. Raise"
AU02220 	   a new job sheet for any works that require further attention.
AU02220 	12.Notify the control room on completion of the inspection.

AU02225 	   lane or entering the garden bed area.

AU02225 	   (a) Access Vehicle: EWP.
AU02225 	   (b) Position 0 and 1.
AU02225 	   (c) Lane Closure: Emergency Lane or on Garden Bed.
AU02225 	   (d) Electrical Cabinet Location:
AU02225 	       WL Tollway - exception CCAM 526 & 542 are behind the
AU02225 	       noise wall.
AU02225 	       SL Tollway - exception CCAM 914 & 915 are behind the
AU02225 	       Equipment Cabinet for CCTV925 is mounted on LUMS4
AU02225 	       inbound gantry leg.
AU02225 	"3. Set up the lane closure as per  Work Instruction, Traffic"
AU02225 	"   Control, TMI-3012-OP-00002 and Translink  Procedure,"
AU02225 	   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 144.
AU02225 	"4. Reference Manual, Chubb, Operations and Maintenance Manual,"
AU02225 	   Section 4.1 (M-MCL-TM-1511)
AU02225 	5. Camera Junction Box / Controller Cabinet;
AU02225 	"   (a) Check for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of"
AU02225 	"       moisture and any insect infestation, clean if"
AU02225 	       necessary.   [_ _]
AU02225 	   (b) Inspect the cabinet and the equipment mounted in the
AU02225 	       cabinet is secure.  [_ _]
AU02225 	"   (c) Check cables and terminations for signs of degradation,"
AU02225 	       re-terminate if necessary.  [_ _]
AU02225 	   (d) Check fibre patch leads for damage and are securely
AU02225 	       fastened to the PT300.
AU02225 	       WARNING: DO NOT LOOK DIRECTLY INTO THE END OF FIBRE OPTIC
AU02225 	       CABLE AS DAMAGE TO EYE SIGHT CAN RESULT.
AU02225 	"   (e) Check if surge suppressor red LED (on the GPO) is lit, if"
AU02225 	"       not record the fact, for later replacement.  [_ _]"
AU02225 	   (f) Check with TCRO  that picture vision is OK.  If not check
AU02225 	       the signal from the camera using the WFM 90 meter.
AU02225 	       (Connect the WFM90 directly  to the lead from the
AU02225 	       camera).
AU02225 	       Ensure the   co-axial cable is reconnected to the PT300
AU02225 	       module and is secure.  [_ _]
AU02225 	6. Isolate the 240V supply to the PTZ controller and disconnect
AU02225 	   (unplug) the control cable to the PTZ controller prior to
AU02225 	   inspecting the camera housing.  This will prevent movement
AU02225 	   of the PTZ .  [_ _]
AU02225 	7. Camera and Camera Housing;
AU02225 	   WARNING: 240V SUPPLY TO THE CAMERA AND CAMERA HEATER IS STILL
AU02225 	   ALIVE.
AU02225 	"   (a) Check  for vandalism, damage, corrosion, ingress of"
AU02225 	       moisture and any insect infestation.
AU02225 	       Surface insect spray may be applied if necessary to the
AU02225 	       housing exterior but must not be applied to the interior
AU02225 	       of the housing or to the housing glass.  If ingress of
AU02225 	       moisture or insect infestation is evident then carry out
AU02225 	       steps (d) and (e).  [_ _]
AU02225 	   (b) Check that the camera housing is firmly secured to pole
AU02225 	       mounts. [_ _]
AU02225 	   (c) Clean the glass of the environmental enclosure with
AU02225 	       Rain-X  cleaning fluid.  [_ _]
AU02225 	"   (d) Check if camera heaters are operational, ie warm."
AU02225 	       WARNING: HEATERS ARE HOT AND DUE CARE SHOULD BE TAKEN.
AU02225 	"       If the heaters are not warm, spray the heater"
AU02225 	"       thermostat (HTR) with FREEZE IT, then again check the"
AU02225 	       operation of the heater. [_ _]
AU02225 	   (e) Discard the previously used Silica Gel pack and replace
AU02225 	       with a new uncontaminated Silica Gel Pack.
AU02225 	8. Reconnect the PTZ control cable to the PTZ controller and
AU02225 	   re-instate the 240V power supply to the PTZ
AU02225 	   controller.   [_ _]
AU02225 	9. Notify the control room on completion and check the PTZ for
AU02225 	   full movement and pre-programmed positions.  If camera fails
AU02225 	   to respond press the reset button on the PT 300 and wait 2
AU02225 	   minutes then check again.  [_ _]
AU02225 	10.On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU02225 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02225 	   Record Details as Below
AU02225 	   Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU02225 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU02225 	   Plan  _____.
AU02225 	   1. Any deviations from the plan:
AU02225 	   2. Lane closure start time:
AU02225 	   3. Lane closure finish time:
AU02225 	   4. Weather conditions:
AU02225 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02225 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02225 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU02225 	Note:
AU02225 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02225 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02225 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02225 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02225 	        it's intended function.
AU02225 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02225 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02225 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02225 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02225 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02225 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02225 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02225 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02225 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02225 	        intended function.
AU02225 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU02225 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02225 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU02232 	06 M BT Lighting Levels Measurement
AU02232 	
AU02232 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02232 	1. Carry out the six monthly Burnley tunnel lighting levels
AU02232 	   inspection.
AU02232 	2. This job is to be carried out during a tunnel closure.
AU02232 	"3. Check calibration date on light meter and spare battery,"
AU02232 	   thermometer and marker strips prior to carrying out lighting
AU02232 	   levels measurement.
AU02232 	4. Location nominated for carrying out lighting measurement
AU02232 	   includes the following fire box locations:
AU02232 	"   B9, B14, B19, B24, B30, B35, B41, B45, B49"
AU02232 	"   To assist with identifying the exact points of measurement,"
AU02232 	   eight (8) marker strips should be laid out at 4m interval at
AU02232 	"   the location being measured. At each location, the 4m"
AU02232 	   intervals have been marked on site with studs embedded into
AU02232 	   line marking on edge of the carriageway. The marker strips
AU02232 	   should be placed adjacent to the studs.
AU02232 	5. Measurement area should be bollarded off.
AU02232 	6. At each measurement location:
AU02232 	   a. Measure ambient temperature
AU02232 	   b. Check for the following external factor prior to taking
AU02232 	      measurements:
AU02232 	    i.   Car Headlights - should be at least 120m (2 fire boxes)
AU02232 	         from measurement location.
AU02232 	    ii.  Headlights and flashing beacons on the work vehicle
AU02232 	         should be switched off when taking measurement.
AU02232 	    iii. Illuminated arrow sign boards should be used on work
AU02232 	         vehicles and should be facing away from measurement
AU02232 	         location.
AU02232 	    iv.  Shadowing from people - no persons to be within 20m of
AU02232 	"         measurement point, except person taking measurement,"
AU02232 	         who should be in crouched position.
AU02232 	   c. Measure Lighting Levels and record values on Form
AU02232 	      TMF-3012-OP-0392.
AU02232 	7. Record any outstanding works required.
AU02232 	8. Raise a new job sheet for any outstanding works.
AU02232 	06 M DT Lighting Levels Measurement

AU02229 	        it's intended function.

AU02229 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention

AU02233 	"12 M Inspect, test and clean Southern Link VSLS signs"
AU02233 	
AU02233 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02233 	1. Inform Traffic Control Room prior to commencing work.
AU02233 	2. The VSLS on the RHL should be serviced using a RHL Lane
AU02233 	"   closure, VSLS units on the LHL should be serviced using"
AU02233 	   a LHS lane closure.  This excludes the VSLS Sign Message
AU02233 	   Operation and the Sign Test Result which are carried out on
AU02233 	"   the two signs, LHS and RHS simultaneously from the equipment"
AU02233 	   room controller.
AU02233 	"3. Reference Manual Symon Services Operation, Training &"
AU02233 	"   Maintenance Manual for TIMS, VSLS & FES  M-STG-TM-29943"
AU02233 	4. Set up the lane closure as per Work Instruction Traffic
AU02233 	   Control TMI-3012-OP-0002 and Translink Procedure PR-RS-IR-059
AU02233 	"   Plans 20, 23, 24, 25, 26 and 29."
AU02233 	5. Equipment Room Analysers
AU02233 	   (a) Inspect the VSLS analyser for evidence of burnt or
AU02233 	"       damaged connections on plugs, electronic cards and"
AU02233 	       wiring.
AU02233 	   (b) Clean the cabinet interior of any accumulated dirt or
AU02233 	       dust.
AU02233 	   (c) Press the TEST button on the analyser and monitor the
AU02233 	       sign test routine.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in
AU02233 	       Sign Test Result column on the form.
AU02233 	"   (d) Inspect the cabinet for damage, ensuring the door closes"
AU02233 	       and locks securely.
AU02233 	6. VSLS Signs
AU02233 	"   Note: As at 10-05-04 the large VSLS units at Power St,"
AU02233 	         Kingsway On ramp and Westgate Freeway have been
AU02233 	         replaced with new generation VSLS units.  Voltage Test
AU02233 	         levels are different on the old and new generation
AU02233 	         units.
AU02233 	   (a) Isolate sign power at  the sign circuit breaker within
AU02233 	       the VSLS sign enclosure.
AU02233 	   (b) Check the electronic component boards for evidence of
AU02233 	       burning or arcing.
AU02233 	"   (c) Clean the front facia of the sign, using Windex and a"
AU02233 	       soft cloth.
AU02233 	   (d) Turn the sign circuit breaker to ON and check the pixel
AU02233 	       operation.  Record in the comments column of the form
AU02233 	       VSLS Systems Inspections Southern Link TMF-3012-OP-0394
AU02233 	       if more than 10% of the pixels have failed.
AU02233 	   (e) (i) Check and adjust the output of the 12VDC power supply
AU02233 	           and the inputs to the various drivers and
AU02233 	"           controllers, the voltage measured, in each case must"
AU02233 	           fall within the range of (10.2V and 11V old VSLS
AU02233 	           units) and (12.5 to 13VDC and 6.5 to 6.7V for new
AU02233 	           VSLS units) . Record result ( OK or Fail) in the Sign
AU02233 	           inspection column of the form VSLS Systems
AU02233 	           Inspections Southern Link TMF-3012-OP-0394.
AU02233 	"      (ii) On the small VSLS signs (within the tunnel), check"
AU02233 	           and adjust the output of the 24VDC power supply and
AU02233 	"           the inputs to the various drivers and controllers,"
AU02233 	"           the voltage measured, in each case must fall within"
AU02233 	           the range of 23.2V and 24V. Record result ( OK or
AU02233 	           Fail) in the Sign inspection column of the form VSLS
AU02233 	           Systems Inspections Southern Link TMF-3012-OP-0394.
AU02233 	"     (iii) On the LARGE VSLS signs (outside the tunnel), check"
AU02233 	           the range of 12.0 to 12.1 V and 6.5 to 6.7V.
AU02233 	           Record result ( OK or Fail) in the Sign inspection
AU02233 	           column of the form VSLS Systems Inspections Southern
AU02233 	           Link TMF-3012-OP-0299.
AU02233 	"           The 12 V power supply, supplies the VSLS sign Red"
AU02233 	"           LEDs, while the 24V power supply, supplies the White"
AU02233 	           LEDs.  The Small VSLS signs have 4 LEDs per pixel
AU02233 	           while the Large VSLS signs have 3 Leds per  pixel.
AU02233 	   (f) Check the operation and alignment of the Light Dependant
AU02233 	       Resistor (LDR) by
AU02233 	      (i) covering the LDR will cause the display intensity to
AU02233 	          reduce
AU02233 	     (ii) shining a torch onto the LDR will cause the display
AU02233 	          intensity to increase.  (This function cannot be
AU02233 	          tested with the present configuration).
AU02233 	7. Ensure the control room can control the sign via a TEST
AU02233 	"   message change, confirm the sign operation back to the"
AU02233 	   operator.  Record the result (Ok or Fail) in the sign message
AU02233 	   operation column of the form  VSLS Systems Inspections
AU02233 	   Southern Link TMF-3012-OP-0394.
AU02233 	8. Results of inspections and comments are recorded on form
AU02233 	   VSLS Systems Inspections Southern Link TMF-3012-OP-0394 for
AU02233 	"   tests that FAIL, record details in the comments column of the"
AU02233 	   form.
AU02233 	9. On completion of the job record any outstanding corrective
AU02233 	   actions required in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02233 	   Raise a new job sheet for any corrective work required.
AU02233 	10. Notify the control room on completion of work.
AU02233 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02233 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02233 	Rate the Condition of the Assets.
AU02233 	Note:
AU02233 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02233 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02233 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02233 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02233 	        it's intended function.
AU02233 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02233 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02233 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02233 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02233 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02233 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02233 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02233 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02233 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's

AU02239 	"   PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12, 13 & 14 [_ _]"

AU02239 	   Transmitters.   [_ _]
AU02239 	5. Check the operation of the detectors by breaking the detector
AU02239 	   paths in the correct sequence.   The correct sequence is that
AU02239 	   the two beams must be broken in the direction of the traffic
AU02239 	   flow and the second beam must be broken within two seconds
AU02239 	   of the first being broken.  Visually check that the sign
AU02239 	   operates correctly and that the TCR receive an alarm  [___]
AU02239 	6. Inspect the cabinet at the height detector for damage and
AU02239 	   corrosion and insect infestation.  [___]
AU02239 	7. Check the equipment within the cabinet for loose connections
AU02239 	   and evidence of burnt components.  [_ _]
AU02239 	8. Clean the front panel and inspect the OHVD message sign for
AU02239 	   damage & corrosion.  [_ _]
AU02239 	9. Inspect the cabinet and equipment within at the OHVD message
AU02239 	"   sign for damage, loose connections, evidence of burnt"
AU02239 	   components and insect infestation.  [_ _]

AU02239 	    on the CD501 boards.   [___]

AU02239 	    corrosion.  [___]

AU02239 	"    burnt components, insect infestation and loose"
AU02239 	    connections  [___]

AU02239 	[ 2 ] - Good.

AU02239 	        it's intended function.

AU02239 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02239 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02239 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.

AU02255 	24 M Insp of Light Poles on Exhibition Street
AU02255 	
AU02255 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02255 	1. Notify the traffic control room prior to commencing this
AU02255 	   job.
AU02255 	2. Reference:
AU02255 	     MCL Drawings: 0230 to 0239
AU02255 	     Asset register: G:\TFM\Operations\Lighting\
AU02255 	     Light Poles\Light Pole Asset Register.xls
AU02255 	"3. At each Light pole, visually inspect the condition of the"
AU02255 	   light pole as follow:
AU02255 	(a). Check if the pole is obviously leaning or if there is any
AU02255 	     attachments obviously sagging. This is a visual check that
AU02255 	     there are no obvious problems.
AU02255 	(b). Check if any attachments are not securely fixed.
AU02255 	(c). Check if there is any impact damage from vehicles. Poles
AU02255 	     which have been impacted by vehicles should be replaced.
AU02255 	"(d). Check if there are any cracks in the pole, particularly at"
AU02255 	     the corners of any openings in the pole. Fatigue cracks
AU02255 	     often start at the corners of openings
AU02255 	"(e). Check if there are any cracked, bent or broken bolts."
AU02255 	"     Cracked, bent or broken bolts should be replaced."
AU02255 	(f). Check if any welds are cracked or broken. Cracked or broken
AU02255 	"     welds in critical locations, eg pole to base plate welds,"
AU02255 	     should be repaired.
AU02255 	"(g). Check if there are any bolts, covers or other parts"
AU02255 	     missing. The action required will depend on the criticality
AU02255 	     ofthe missing part.
AU02255 	(h). Check if any nuts are loose or missing (visual check).
AU02255 	     Tighten any loose nuts if required.
AU02255 	(i). Check if there are any obvious electrical problems like
AU02255 	     exposed wires. Immediate attention is required if these
AU02255 	     pose a hazard.
AU02255 	(k). Check if the foundation is undermined or exposed to
AU02255 	     standing water. Undermined foundations require a more
AU02255 	     detailed assessment. Standing water should be removed by
AU02255 	     improved drainage.
AU02255 	(l). Check if the grouting between the base plate and the
AU02255 	     foundation is cracked (crack widths greater than 0.5 mm) or
AU02255 	     loose. Cracked grout can hold moisture and accelerate
AU02255 	     corrosion of anchor bolts. Where grout is loose it should
AU02255 	     be replaced.
AU02255 	(m). Clear any clogged drain holes at the base of the pole.
AU02255 	"(n). Remove any debris accumulation at the base of the pole,"
AU02255 	"     around the anchor bolts, or elsewhere on the structure."
AU02255 	(o). Comment on the general condition of the protective coating
AU02255 	"     (note blistering, flaking, rust staining etc). Remedial"
AU02255 	     action will depend upon the extent of deterioration.
AU02255 	(p). Remove cover plates near the base (where appropriate) and
AU02255 	"     check for damage to electrical wiring, internal corrosion,"
AU02255 	"     infestation by insects, water and ponding."
AU02255 	5. Record work completed at each Light pole on
AU02255 	"   attached form TMF-3012-OP-0376 """"Routine Inspection of Light"
AU02255 	"   Poles""""."
AU02255 	"6. Record any corrective action required  in the """"Work Done"""""
AU02255 	   area of  the Job Sheet.
AU02255 	7. Return  the completed jobsheet to the Civil Supervisor
AU02255 	   or his representative.
AU02255 	   File Inspection report in File 119.16
AU02255 	24 M Insp of Light Poles on SL
AU02255 	1. Notify Control Room if stopping in emergency lane.
AU02255 	     MCL Drawings: SPR-C1-2801 to SPR-C1-2802
AU02255 	                   SE1-CI-3801 to SE1-CI-3806
AU02255 	                   SE2-CI-0801 to SE2-CI-0801
AU02255 	                   SBI-CI-1001 to SBI-CI-1003
AU02255 	     missing. The action required will depend on the criticality      of
AU02255 	the missing part.
AU02255 	24 M Inspection of Light Poles on WL 1
AU02255 	     MCL Drawings: WLG-EL-0025 to WLG-EL-0047
AU02255 	                   WLG-EL-7005 to WLG-EL-7006

AU02256 	48 M Insp of Light Poles on Exhibition Street
AU02256 	
AU02256 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02256 	1. Notify the traffic control room prior to commencing this
AU02256 	   job.
AU02256 	2. Reference:
AU02256 	     MCL Drawings: 0230 to 0239
AU02256 	     Asset register: G:\TFM\Operations\Lighting\
AU02256 	     Light Poles\Light Pole Asset Register.xls
AU02256 	"3. At each Light pole, visually inspect the condition of the"
AU02256 	   light pole as follow:
AU02256 	(a). Check if the pole is obviously leaning or if there is any
AU02256 	     attachments obviously sagging. This is a visual check that
AU02256 	     there are no obvious problems.
AU02256 	(b). Check if any attachments are not securely fixed.
AU02256 	(c). Check if there is any impact damage from vehicles. Poles
AU02256 	     which have been impacted by vehicles should be replaced.
AU02256 	"(d). Check if there are any cracks in the pole, particularly at"
AU02256 	     the corners of any openings in the pole. Fatigue cracks
AU02256 	     often start at the corners of openings
AU02256 	"(e). Check if there are any cracked, bent or broken bolts."
AU02256 	"     Cracked, bent or broken bolts should be replaced."
AU02256 	(f). Check if any welds are cracked or broken. Cracked or broken
AU02256 	"     welds in critical locations, eg pole to base plate welds,"
AU02256 	     should be repaired.
AU02256 	"(g). Check if there are any bolts, covers or other parts"
AU02256 	     missing. The action required will depend on the criticality
AU02256 	     ofthe missing part.
AU02256 	(h). Check if any nuts are loose or missing (visual check).
AU02256 	     Tighten any loose nuts if required.
AU02256 	(i). Check if there are any obvious electrical problems like
AU02256 	     exposed wires. Immediate attention is required if these
AU02256 	     pose a hazard.
AU02256 	(k). Check if the foundation is undermined or exposed to
AU02256 	     standing water. Undermined foundations require a more
AU02256 	     detailed assessment. Standing water should be removed by
AU02256 	     improved drainage.
AU02256 	(l). Check if the grouting between the base plate and the
AU02256 	     foundation is cracked (crack widths greater than 0.5 mm) or
AU02256 	     loose. Cracked grout can hold moisture and accelerate
AU02256 	     corrosion of anchor bolts. Where grout is loose it should
AU02256 	     be replaced.
AU02256 	(m). Clear any clogged drain holes at the base of the pole.
AU02256 	"(n). Remove any debris accumulation at the base of the pole,"
AU02256 	"     around the anchor bolts, or elsewhere on the structure."
AU02256 	(o). Comment on the general condition of the protective coating
AU02256 	"     (note blistering, flaking, rust staining etc). Remedial"
AU02256 	     action will depend upon the extent of deterioration.
AU02256 	(p). Remove cover plates near the base (where appropriate) and
AU02256 	"     check for damage to electrical wiring, internal corrosion,"
AU02256 	"     infestation by insects, water and ponding."
AU02256 	5. Record work completed at each Light pole on
AU02256 	"   attached form TMF-3012-OP-0376 """"Routine Inspection of Light"
AU02256 	"   Poles""""."
AU02256 	"6. Record any corrective action required  in the """"Work Done"""""
AU02256 	   area of  the Job Sheet.
AU02256 	7. Return  the completed jobsheet to the Civil Supervisor
AU02256 	   or his representative.
AU02256 	   File Inspection report in File 119.16
AU02256 	48 M Insp of Light Poles on SL
AU02256 	1. Notify Control Room if stopping in emergency lane.
AU02256 	     MCL Drawings: SPR-C1-2801 to SPR-C1-2802
AU02256 	                   SE1-CI-3801 to SE1-CI-3806
AU02256 	                   SE2-CI-0801 to SE2-CI-0801
AU02256 	                   SBI-CI-1001 to SBI-CI-1003
AU02256 	     missing. The action required will depend on the criticality      of
AU02256 	the missing part.

AU02272 	03 M Inspection of WIM & TCS Systems on the SL Tollway
AU02272 	
AU02272 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02272 	1. Notify the control room prior to stopping in the emergency
AU02272 	   lane.
AU02272 	"2. Set up short term emergency lane closure incorporating,"
AU02272 	"   symbolic worker, lateral shift, vehicle arrow board and cones"
AU02272 	"   as per Work Instruction , Traffic Control TMI-3012-OP 0002"
AU02272 	"   and Translink Procedure, PR-RS-IR-059 Plan 12 or Plan 142."
AU02272 	"3. Reference: Central Weighing Australasia, Roadside Maintenance"
AU02272 	"   Training Manual, Doc. PL-MCL-TM-1631, Rev 0 and for operation"
AU02272 	"   of laptop computer, Weigh-in-Motion & Counting Stations,"
AU02272 	"   Operator's  Manual for WIMS Front End Computer,"
AU02272 	"   Doc. PL-MCL-TM-1630, Rev A, Section 3 Telecom- DOS"
AU02272 	   operator's Manual . (Status Information 6.1.2 page 145)
AU02272 	"4. At SL WIM/TCS Systems 2205A control cabinet, check the"
AU02272 	   following;
AU02272 	   (a) Internal and external condition of the cabinet.   [_ _]
AU02272 	   (b) Check wiring for tightness and for any evidence of
AU02272 	       overheating.  [_ _]
AU02272 	   (c) Check that the Tx and Rx LEDs (on the modem) flash at
AU02272 	       least each minute.  [_ _]
AU02272 	   (d) Check that the battery charger LED is ON.  [_ _]
AU02272 	"   (e) Using a vacuum cleaner, clean the cabinet"
AU02272 	       interior.   [_ _]
AU02272 	5. Use laptop computer to carry out the following:
AU02272 	   (a) Plug the 9 pin serial lead from the computer to the
AU02272 	        controller input/output board.
AU02272 	   (b) Switch ON the computer.
AU02272 	   (c) Click on Telecom WIMS Icon
AU02272 	   (d) Select Comms by pressing the 'C' Key
AU02272 	"   (e) Select LOGGER/ONLINE, then press Enter."
AU02272 	   (f) Check that the laptop computer communicates with the
AU02272 	       logger correctly.  [_ _]
AU02272 	"   (g) Confirm the logger parameters, shown in the CURRENT"
AU02272 	"       SITE (MCL) on page no. 1, area match those listed in"
AU02272 	       the document  Site Configuration and Set up Details
AU02272 	      (stored cabinet).  [_ _]
AU02272 	   (h) Press key Page Down to go to screen page 2. [_ _]
AU02272 	   (i) Record on the form attached loop frequencies and weigh
AU02272 	       responses.  [_ _]
AU02272 	   (j) Record value of Power Status on page 2 of the
AU02272 	       computer screen.  The battery should read approx 13
AU02272 	       volts. [_ _]
AU02272 	   (k) When a truck crosses the sensors check on page 2
AU02272 	"      (computer screen) that all sensors, in each lane are"
AU02272 	      operating correctly (an asterisk will appear momentarily
AU02272 	      alongside the appropriate loops as the truck crosses).
AU02272 	      This check should only be done with trucks and not cars
AU02272 	"     (weighing sites only), as all sensors may not be displayed"
AU02272 	     for cars.  [_ _]
AU02272 	"    (l) Select LOGGER/OFFLINE, then press Enter"
AU02272 	"    (m) Select 'Quit', then press Enter"
AU02272 	"    (n) Then select 'Quit' again, press Enter again."
AU02272 	    (o) Select 'Yes' to quit Telecom system.
AU02272 	6. Switch computer OFF and then unplug the 9 pin serial
AU02272 	   lead. [_ _]
AU02272 	"7. From the side of the road, visually check the conditions of"
AU02272 	"   the road sensors, for condition, no (loose bolts) metal"
AU02272 	   vibration or exposed wires visible. [_ _]
AU02272 	8. On completion of job record anything outside normal
AU02272 	   parameters in the Work Done area of the job sheet.
AU02272 	9. Notify the control room  prior to departure.
AU02272 	"4. At SL WIM/TCS Systems 2205B control cabinet, check the"

AU02251 	
AU02251 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02251 	1. Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this
AU02251 	   work.
AU02251 	2. Reference to Manual - Pump Station Operation & Maintenance
AU02251 	   Manual Volume 3   M-STG-ME-20001.
AU02251 	3. The work  is to be carried out by the sub contractor under
AU02251 	   supervision of an electrical/electronics technician.
AU02251 	  WARNING: BOTH THE WET WELLS AND THE VALVE PIT ARE DESIGNATED
AU02251 	  CONFINED SPACES AND  MUST ONLY BE ENTERED UNDER CONFINED SPACE
AU02251 	  CONDITIONS.
AU02251 	"   Refer to Work Instruction, Confined Space Entry"
AU02251 	   TMI-3012-SA-0015.
AU02251 	4. Inspect the condition of electrical cables to the pump for
AU02251 	   damage.
AU02251 	5. Check the Oil Chamber oil level along with the condition and
AU02251 	   quality of the oil.
AU02251 	6. Check the pump body and inspect for cracks or other external
AU02251 	7. Check the condition of the pump impeller and volute for
AU02251 	"   deposits, rust, damage and or wear."
AU02251 	8. Check the motor internals (via inspection plug) for water or
AU02251 	   foreign substances.
AU02251 	"9. Check the pump for operation, provided there is sufficient"
AU02251 	   water available.
AU02251 	"10. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU02251 	    of the job sheet.  Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02251 	"    actions required, record the job number of the new job in"
AU02251 	    the Related Job field of the Job sheets.
AU02251 	"11. Record details of the sub contractors name, report, service"
AU02251 	    number and the date in the Work Done area of the Job sheet.
AU02251 	12. Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work.

AU02274 	****Complete the following CityLink Asset Condition Rating****
AU02274 	ASSET CONDITION RATING
AU02274 	Rate the Condition of the Asset.
AU02274 	Note:
AU02274 	[ 1 ] - Excellent.
AU02274 	        Asset is new or in as new condition
AU02274 	[ 2 ] - Good.
AU02274 	"        Asset is fully operational, well presented, performing"
AU02274 	        it's intended function.
AU02274 	[ 3 ] - Fair.
AU02274 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing signs of
AU02274 	        deterioration that will result is some intervention
AU02274 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02274 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02274 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02274 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02274 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02274 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02274 	        intended function.
AU02274 	CONDITION RATING SCORE [_ _]
AU02274 	"If the condition of asset is 3 or 4, record your observations"
AU02274 	in the Work Done area of the job sheet(photograph if possible).

AU02293 	Storege of Water Filled NJB
AU02293 	
AU02293 	Monthly Payment(Estimate : E1209)to OD Transport for offsite storage of
AU02293 	Water Filled NJB
AU02293 	Scope of Work
AU02293 	.............
AU02293 	a) Storage of temporary water filled NJB to be relocated & stored
AU02293 	offsite.
AU02293 	b) NJB will be store off site in the care of OD Group
AU02293 	"c) They will be empty, hence current procedure for filling them with"
AU02293 	water when placed in position will still apply
AU02293 	d) The storage contractor (OD Group)will be responsible for the
AU02293 	deliveryof these NJB on the incident site & place them on location with
AU02293 	a lead time 1.5 hours during the day & 2 hours during the night
AU02293 	e) OD Group will deliver & remove barrierswith the use of mechanical
AU02293 	equipment eliminating the needs to manually load & unload the NJB from
AU02293 	the transit trailers etc.

AU02297 	3M Maintenance of LUMS9 Electrical Hoist
AU02297 	
AU02297 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02297 	"1.  Notify the Traffic Control Room prior to commencing this ,,work. [_"
AU02297 	_]
AU02297 	"2.,,Inspect control functions for correct operation. [_ _]"
AU02297 	"3.  Inspect for proper limit switch actuation & motor stopping ,,"
AU02297 	when the hook rises at upper limit under no load. [_ _]
AU02297 	4.  While operating check for slipping via braking. [_ _]
AU02297 	"5.  Inspect for damage, cracks & bends or noticeable opening in ,,"
AU02297 	hooks & hook fittings that attach the hook to the chain.
AU02297 	",,[_ _]"
AU02297 	"6.,,Inspect for wear, corrosion, cracks, distortion, etc. of the ,,gear"
AU02297 	",bearing & chain pins. [_ _]"
AU02297 	"7.,,Inspect for damages or excessive wear on the load sheave ,,chain"
AU02297 	"pocket. (If the pocket is too wide or deep, the chain ,,may be lifted"
AU02297 	"upover the pocket or may get caught between ,,the chain guide & load"
AU02297 	"sheave. Also check the chain guide for ,,wear around the opening"
AU02297 	"throughwhich the chain enters the ,,hoist) [_ _]"
AU02297 	"8.,,Inspect for deformations, peeled & cracked cushion rubber."
AU02297 	"9.,,Inspect for damages to the chain spring (option), and minimum ,,"
AU02297 	"freelength, 75mm (130mm), of chain spring. Note: Initial ,,free length"
AU02297 	"of the spring, 75mm (130mm). [_ _]"
AU02297 	"10.,,Inspect for fastening of screws, bolts & nuts. [_ _]"
AU02297 	"11.,,Inspect the damages to the hook or fittings that attach the ,,hook"
AU02297 	to the chain. [_ _]
AU02297 	"12.,,Inspect for contactor contact pitching point deterioration. ,,"
AU02297 	(Operate the push button & check if it sticks at any point.
AU02297 	"13.,,Check for imperfect insulation of cables, cords, & the ,,"
AU02297 	control station. [_ _]
AU02297 	"14. Check the end clamp for damages, cracks or excessive ,,corrosion."
AU02297 	[__]
AU02297 	................................................................
AU02297 	"For the month of August only, perform the following tasks in addition"
AU02297 	tothe above.
AU02297 	...........................
AU02297 	***Warning****
AU02297 	"-,,Never perform maintenance on the hoist while it is supporting ,,a"
AU02297 	load.
AU02297 	"-,,Before performing maintenance, attach the tag: [""DANGER"": DO ,,NOT"
AU02297 	OPERATE EQUIPMENT BEING REPAIRED]
AU02297 	"-,,Only allow qualified personnel to perform maintenance."
AU02297 	"-,,Always lock-out power source before conducting maintenance."
AU02297 	"-,,After performing any maintenance on the hoist, always test ,,to its"
AU02297 	rated capacity before returning to service.
AU02297 	",,Never disassemble & adjust the mechanical brake with the ,,"
AU02297 	friction clutch.
AU02297 	"-,,Always contact your local KITO dealer in case malfunctions of ,,"
AU02297 	mechanical brake with friction clutch.
AU02297 	"15,,Lubricate the gears [To change oil, ALWAYS remove both the ,,oil"
AU02297 	"plug & drain plug to drain contaminated oil completely ,,before"
AU02297 	"supplying the specified gear oil.(SAE 80/90 Gear Oil) ,,[_ _]"
AU02297 	"16,,Lubricate the load chain [Clean the chain with acid free ,,solvent"
AU02297 	"only to remove rust or abrasive dusts build up. After ,,cleaning,"
AU02297 	"lubricate the chain. Lubricate each link of the ,,chain & apply new"
AU02297 	lubricant over existing layer. [_ _]
AU02297 	"17,,Notify the Traffic Control Room on completion of this work."

AU02299 	        works possibly within the next 12 months. May not be
AU02299 	        performing it's intended function to the full degree.
AU02299 	[ 4 ] - Poor.
AU02299 	        Asset is functional and operational but showing major
AU02299 	        signs of deterioration that will require intervention
AU02299 	        works within the next 3 months. Not performing it's
AU02299 	        intended function.

AU01955 	06 M Inspection of personnel safety equipment
AU01955 	
AU01955 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU01955 	1. Collect and or access all safety equipment.
AU01955 	2. Inspection of Harnesses / lanyards  / slings and webbing type
AU01955 	equipment.
AU01955 	   (a) Lay harness / lanyard / slings on a flat surface.
AU01955 	   (b) Visually check each harness / lanyard  / slings for defects.
AU01955 	"      (i) Check the full extent of the webbing for cuts, burns,"
AU01955 	"excessive abrasion, chemical"
AU01955 	"           damage, worn or crushed fibres."
AU01955 	      (ii) Visually check all sewn joints and the stitching for damage
AU01955 	or any evidence of the joint
AU01955 	            effectiveness being reduced.
AU01955 	      (iii) Hold the webbing in one hand and with the other hand
AU01955 	feelingthe total length of the
AU01955 	"             webbing, feeling for worn, crushed fibres or any imbedded"
AU01955 	foreign objects.
AU01955 	      (iv) Hold the webbing with hands 200mm to 300mm apart bend into a
AU01955 	"U"""" in both directions"
AU01955 	            this tensioning will highlight any problem areas.  Look for
AU01955 	sharp or imbedded objects
AU01955 	            or objects stuck to the webbing.
AU01955 	"      (v) Check all buckles, metal adjusters, metal keepers, oval links"
AU01955 	and any other sundry
AU01955 	           hardware attached to the harnesses / lanyards are all in
AU01955 	perfect working condition and
AU01955 	"           have no distortion, rust, cracks or missing components."
AU01955 	     (vi) The  items deemed to be unsafe for use shall have the old
AU01955 	inspection label removed
AU01955 	"            and a CAUTION LABEL affixed then, their repair arranged or"
AU01955 	their disposal.
AU01955 	"     (vi) For items that are found to be of  undamaged, remove old"
AU01955 	inspection label and install
AU01955 	           new label indicating a successful inspection.
AU01955 	3. (a)  For the various singular items of safety hardware which
AU01955 	"includesbuckles, metal"
AU01955 	"           adjusters, metal keepers, oval links and any other sundry"
AU01955 	hardware are all in perfect
AU01955 	"            working condition and have no distortion, rust, cracks or"
AU01955 	missing components.
AU01955 	   (b)  The  items deemed to be unsafe for use shall have the old label
AU01955 	removed and a
AU01955 	           CAUTION LABEL affixed then their repair arranged or their
AU01955 	disposal.
AU01955 	   (c) Remove old label and install new label indicating a successful
AU01955 	inspection.
AU01955 	4. Record the result of each inspection for all inspected on form
AU01955 	SAFETYEQUIPMENT
AU01955 	    INSPECTION  REPORT - TMF-3012-OP-0274.
AU01955 	5. Return all tested items to their place of storage on completion.
AU01955 	"6. If required raise a new job sheet for repair, disposal and or"
AU01955 	re-purchase.  Charging the
AU01955 	   costs to the appropriate stores item number for the item found to be
AU01955 	"damaged. """

AU02209 	   or his representative to
AU02209 	"   File Calibration report in File 27.1 - """"TM025341"""""
AU02209 	Enter recording below

AU02226 	12 M Ladder Inspections
AU02226 	
AU02226 	**COMPLETE JOBSTART BEFORE COMMENCEMENT OF WORK**
AU02226 	1. Carry out ladder inspections using TMF-3012-SA-0020
AU02226 	   Ladder inspection record sheet.
AU02226 	"2. Inspect ladder for stiles that are twisted, bent, kinked and"
AU02226 	   crushed or with cracked welds or damaged feet.
AU02226 	"3. Inspect ladder for any rungs, treads, steps, or top plates"
AU02226 	"   that are missing, damaged, worn or loose."
AU02226 	"4. Inspect ladder for any braces or bracket that are missing,"
AU02226 	   broken or worn.
AU02226 	"5. Record any corrective action required, in the Work Done area"
AU02226 	   of the job sheet. Raise a new job sheet for any corrective
AU02226 	   actions required.
